description: Fruity and juicy, this forward, no-wood wine will develop fast. Tannins await behind the attractive red-berry flavors. Drink this wine from Blaye native Anne Venancy from 2020.
title: Château La Grange d'Orléans 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and structured, this mostly Merlot blend has a dry core of tannins. It also shows a bitter edge of extraction that will be hard to soften.
title: Château Bourdieu 2016 Château Bourdieu N°1  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This smoky wine is hard around the edges. It has concentration but whether the fruit will have a chance amid all this structure is debatable. It seems to have a dry future.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Demoiselles de Chantemerle  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While this biodynamic wine has a juicy element, it also suffers from highly extracted tannins that give a bitter character and hard edge. These could soften, although the wine will likely remain tough.
title: Chateau Peybonhomme-les-Tours 2016 Energies  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This blend of 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon is light, bright and crisp. It has red fruits and perfumed acidity along with a softly tannic aftertaste. It is not a wine for aging long so drink from 2018.
title: Château la Fleur Bellevue 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine from Bruno Martin's 3.3-acre vineyard is going to be a fresh and fruity. Already it has a fine juicy character and plenty of red fruits. Crisp acidity at the end confirms this bright character.
title: Château Sainte-Luce Bellevue 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is juicy with red-fruit flavors. The tannins are firm and concentrated giving a layer of dryness under the fruit. Give this perfumed wine from Luc Schweitzer until 2019.
title: Château Les Clottiers 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The spicy wood is prominent here. It balances the red-berry fruits and bright acidity. That makes for a perfumed, juicy wine that will finish fresh and crisp.
title: Château du Grand Pierre 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Dubois family wine is soft and fruity with attractive blackberry fruits and light tannins. Drink this generous wine from 2018.
title: Château les Bertrands 2014 Nectar des Bertrands  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is juicy with wood and spice flavors. It has plenty of acidity to balance the tannins while the fruit will give it an attractive freshness as it develops. Drink from 2018.
designation: Château La Croix Saint-Pierre Grande Réserve
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château La Croix Saint-Pierre Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a crisp, fresh wine with red-currant fruits and light tannins from the Alliance Bourg co-op. It is juicy and fruity, likely to develop quickly to give a light, bright wine.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine, dense with tannins while also having plenty of rich fruits underneath. Solid and structured, it will become a firm wine with ripe fruit flavors. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château L'Escadre Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While the wine is dry at this young stage, it has fine potential. Generous fruits and firm tannins give it richness and a juicy character. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Château Séguin 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a fresh and juicy organic wine with attractive acidity and just the right balance of tannins. Drink this wine soon, certainly from 2018.
title: Château Roland-La-Garde 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This lightly oaked wine is already balanced with some attractive dusty tannins and red currant fruit flavors. It is bright with acidity and with a fresh, fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2016. This is a Carreau family estate.
title: Château Clairac 2013  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Flavors of bitter extraction spoil this wine, giving an unnecessarily hard character and masking the fruit. It probably will not soften much. The blend is 79% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Cabernet Franc. Produced by Alliance Bourg.
title: Haut Peyrefaure 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While the tannins here are dry, this wine has enough fruit to show its potential. Blackberry flavors are ripe, cut with acidity and a juicy texture. The wine needs time, so drink from 2017. Enologist Sebastien and vineyard manager Nicolas are the latest generation managing the Carreau family estates.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2012 Grand Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Situated two miles north of the castle of Blaye, this estate has produced an obviously wood-aged, heavily extracted wine. At this stage, this wine is all tannins, smoky acidity and structure. It will always be concentrated with wood, although this will soften.
title: Château Haut-Canteloup 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine's color has already passed the young and fruity stage, hinting at the aging that's apparent on the palate. So the bright fruits have diminished, leaving a wine that is round and hinting at the wood aging. It can be drunk now.
title: Château la Baronnerie 2010 Grand Baron  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This Cuvée honors a sailor who, in 1919, docked his boat, La Favorite, at Blaye in the Gironde estuary and bought the property. It is still owned by the l'Amouller family. Juicy and fruity, this wine is immediately attractive and accessible. Red fruits, soft tannins and a bite of acidity all contribute to the ready-to-drink taste.
title: Château Frédignac 2012 Cuvée La Favorite  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This spicy 100% Merlot wine has tangy black fruits as well as dense texture. It is ripe and very juicy, with intense acidity. It needs to relax (25% new oak barrels; 25% one to two years, the rest in tanks), so drink from 2017.
title: Château Gigault 2012 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is ripe and juicy with friendly acidity and tannins from 10 months' wood aging in two- to five-year-old barrels. Black fruits are coupled with minerality to give a wine that is both structured and with plenty of generous fruitiness. The property is run by the seventh generation of the Carreau family.
title: Château Les Petits Arnaud 2012 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Light, fruity and fragrant, this is an attractive, crisp wine that highlights red-berry fruits and soft acidity. It's a wine to drink now.
title: Château Frédignac 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: An attractive, fruity wine with black-currant and red-berry juiciness followed by a lightly tannic character. It's a classic for the vintage-light and fruity.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This balanced, juicy, fruity wine has refreshing red-berry fruit as well as solid tannins to back it up. An already attractive wine, this fruity number is likely to age quickly.
title: Château des Tourtes 2011 Le Duo  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a wine for short-term aging. It is rich and juicy, deliciously fruity right now. Give it 2-3 years to enjoy its black fruits and fresh acidity.
title: Château Haut Colombier 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and dry, this is a tough, extracted wine. It has a hard edge followed by juicy acidity and will probably remain on the dry side.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Although this wine has structure and acidity, it's lean, and the fruit seems to be missing. Spice and a smoky character give some pleasure. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Berthenon 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold with tannins, this spicy wine is dense and dark. It's all structure and dryness at the moment. And, although the fruit is there, it looks as though the tannins will remain.
title: Xavier Flouret 2015 Château Haut-Meneau Quai Lumiére  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A juicy red-berry flavor and bright acidity carry this light-bodied wine. The tannins are delicate and the oak flavor is muted, leaving a wine that will develop quickly. Drink now.
title: Château la Castillonne 2016  Bordeaux

description: This wine is dry, firm and seems to have too much extraction. The fruit glimmesr in the background and needs plenty of time to develop, so wait until 2021.
title: Clarendelle 2016 Inspired by Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux)

description: This firmly structured wine has fine tannins and layers of wood. The fruit is forward, juicy with blackberry flavors and acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Teyssier 2016  Bordeaux

description: This wine has soft tannins and juicy acidity. It is light and fruity, with an open character that means it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château La Rose Montauran 2016  Bordeaux

description: Soft, fruity and open, this wine has attractive red-berry flavors and light tannins. It should develop quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Hartes 2016  Bordeaux

description: While tannins dominate this wine, it also has lots of fruit potential. The richness and structure of the vintage are there, meaning the wine will develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Claouset 2016  Bordeaux

description: Jammy and juicy, this wine is full of fruit. Structure and tannins take a back seat. Blackberry flavors and acidity will give it an attractive, if lightweight, future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lauzanet 2016  Bordeaux

description: This soft, lightly woody blend dominated by Merlot is ready to drink. Easygoing red-berry fruits are lifted by some acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Univitis 2016 Grand Théatre  (Bordeaux)

description: Acidity shows strongly in this wine along with the dry tannins. It has weight, suggesting ripe fruits that need to develop. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2016  Bordeaux

description: From the easternmost vineyards in Bordeaux, this wine is soft and youthfully ripe. Its red fruits, gentle tannins and smooth Merlot texture are lightly lifted by acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2016 Petit Lixandre  (Bordeaux)

description: Despite coming from a universally hailed vintage, this generic Bordeaux is still weedy, herbal and lean. But it also has decent cassis and cherry fruit, some tasty vanilla and cinnamon notes from oak aging, and a tart, dry finish. It's light, but it hasn't been dumbed down for the mass market.
title: Malesan 2000 Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: Most everyone's first Bordeaux is back for another year, with fruity black-cherry aromas spiked with just a touch of vanilla and cedar. Juicy acidity keeps this crowd-pleaser lively through the lightly tannic finish. A good introduction to the genre.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1998 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a structured wine, firm with tannins. Behind the structure, the attractive black-plum fruits are still developing. The wine is dense and solid and will be ready from 2018.
title: Château l'Eglise Saget 2015  Bordeaux

description: This Grandeau wine is tight and firm. The tannins are a serious component of a wine that will have more fruitiness as it develops. It just escapes being over-extracted, leaving a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Lauduc 2015 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a light and juicy wine, with bright black-currant fruits and a layer of balanced, integrated tannins. It has a dry core that should soften quickly, so drink from early 2018.
title: Château Grand-Portail 2015  Bordeaux

description: Firm and dense, this wine has solid tannins as well as the potential of ripe black fruits. It has been firmly extracted, although the fruit is there to give the balance. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Franc Couplet 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is crisp and shot through with acidity. That gives the black-currant fruit great intensity as well as a juicy character. The wine needs to calm down, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Toutigeac 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is soft with a fine touch of tannin and some stalkiness. It has black currants that are ripe while remaining crisp. The wine is easy, accessible and ready to drink.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is tight and dominated by very crisp black currants and considerable acidity. Assuming it can soften and open up, it will be a fruity wine with just a light structure.
title: Château Roquefort 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine has structure along with juicy generous fruits. Bright fruitiness brings acidity from black-currant flavors. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux)

description: Balanced and fruity, this is a crisp wine that has soft tannins. With its bright black-currant fruit, acidity, and touch of spice, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2015  Bordeaux

description: This densely structured wine has firm tannins and concentration. The juicy black fruits are still developing to fill out the wine even further. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Jamin 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine, ruled by tannins. It is firm, the juicy fruit underneath needs time. It will have a juicy future, so wait until late 2018.
title: Château Terres Douces 2015  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine has a balance between the crisp acidity and the juicy black-currant fruitiness. It is just ready to open up, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2015 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all juicy red-currant and berry fruits. With light tannins and a crisp edge the wine is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Lagorce 2015  Bordeaux

description: This perfumed wine, with a dry tannic core, is just beginning to soften. The potential for the black fruits is already there. Drink this solid wine from early 2018.
title: Château Thieuley 2015 Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft and ripe, this young wine is already to drink. Light tannins and a touch of spice give it just the right amount of richness from this good vintage. The wine is filled with red berries and is ready to drink.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2015 Belle Prairie  (Bordeaux)

description: A fruity wine with soft tannins that reflects the crispness of the vintage. The wine, full of blackberry fruit and balanced acidity comes from an estate in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux. Drink now.
title: Château les Terrasses de Bouey 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is soft with a toasty spicy character. That balances with the ripe berry fruits that are just on the stalky side of smooth. Drink this wine, with its fruity 70% Merlot, now.
title: Exem 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is rich and ready to drink. With red fruits and warm tannins, it is a ripe wine that has a light structure and balanced acidity. It is already an easy wine-fruity and soft at the end.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Tuilerie Pagés  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins and attractive red-berry fruits. There is just a touch of dryness that gives this easygoing wine its structure. Drink from early 2017.
title: Château Lanscade 2015  Bordeaux

description: With vines between Fronsac and Bourg, this estate has produced a forward wine with the 2015 vintage. Black currants and acidity are sustained by a youthful tannic structure. It can certainly be drunk now for its fruitiness, although kept until later in 2017 it will be richer.
title: Château la Barotte 2015  Bordeaux

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a crisp lightly structured wine. It has spice and a touch of smokiness along with red fruits and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2014  Bordeaux

description: This wine is fresh and juicy with fine tannins and ripe red berries. Owned by the Baylet family, the estate has produced a full and fruity wine. The aftertaste shows acidity and a light spice.
title: Château Puy Marceau 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is fruity with acidity and just a touch of wood aging. It is bright with red currants and a lively bright character. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Penin 2014 Natur  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine, still young, has spice and tannins as well as toasty flavors. Its fruit is still developing but will become ripe and full of red berries. The acidity and crisp aftertaste are balanced and fruity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Loyasson 2015  Bordeaux

description: There is plenty of red fruit here. The tannins are firm with a dry core and hints of bitterness. That needs to settle down so that the essential fruitiness of the wine can shine.
title: Château Bonnet 2014 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is an open fruity wine with attractive red berries and concentrated tannins. It is developing well into a ripe perfumed wine that will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Pey La Tour 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is fruity with a stalky edge and bright black-currant fruit flavors. It is soft in character, fruity rather than structured, yet its acidity finishes the wine with a fresh lift.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2014 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: A light and fruity wine that has bright black fruits and an edge of tannins. The black currant and acidity give the wine its fruity character, typical of the vintage. Drink now.
title: Château Bellevue 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine relies entirely on its ripe fruit without any oak aging. That gives a fresh and fruity character, typical of the vintage, with red-fruit flavors and a fine line of acidity cutting through the gentle tannins. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced by the Barton family of Château Léoville-Barton, this is a soft and smooth. It has blackberry fruits and gentle tannins, both now at their best. The aftertaste has a lift from acidity. Drink now.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2012 La Croix Barton Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a light, fruity wine that is likely to be drinkable very soon. It does have a rustic edge although that is likely to blow away in the coming months. For the rest, the red fruits, spice and acidity give the wine a soft, rounded aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château les Verriers 2014  Bordeaux

description: From vines in the far east of the Entre-deux-Mers region, this is a wine that is just red fruits, lightly tannic and with plenty of fresh acidity. The wine is surprisingly ready to drink.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2015 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a young wine with still firm tannins and stalky fruit. It has black-currant flavors that are balanced by fresh acidity and a dry core. The wine has all the freshness of the vintage, drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Pingat 2014  Bordeaux

description: Black-currant flavors are right up in the front of this wine. With some youthful stalkiness, it also has the potential for a really juicy character that is bright, almost crisp. A touch of perfume gives the wine a lift. Let it smooth out for a few months, so drink from early 2017.
title: Château Tour le Pin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This wine has some structure, with enough tannins to sustain the red-berry fruits. It's juicy, with stalky acidity and an attractive texture that will allow it to age a few months. Drink from early 2017.
title: Château Mézain 2013  Bordeaux

description: Produced in the Entre-deux-Mers region, this light, fresh wine has young tannins and stalky black-currant flavors. It is crisp with lively acidity and a juicy aftertaste. Give it another few months and drink from late 2016.
title: Château Blouin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is turning into a ripe and fruity wine. The tannins are integrating easily into the black currant flavors. Soon the dry core will open out, supporting the fruit taste. The blend is 50% Merlot, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc. Drink from late 2016.
title: VIgnobles Roux 2014 Château les Tuilleries  (Bordeaux)

description: A Merlot-dominated wine, this is light in texture, with fresh black currants and a stalky background. It is ready to drink.
title: Exem 2013  Bordeaux

description: There is a good balance between fruit and structure in this blend of 71% Merlot and 29% Cabernet Franc. It is not weighty, although it does offer attractive berry fruits and touches of red currants. Acidity is a powerful element in this wine that needs to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2013  Bordeaux

description: Although obviously still young, this fruity wine will develop fast. It benefits from the ripe fruit of the vintage, sweet black currants and berries that are given a crisp edge by the acidity. Already balanced, it will be drinkable from 2016.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Premium  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a light, very young and stalky wine. It has tight black currant flavors and a dry core of tannins that need to soften for a few months. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014  Bordeaux

description: With no oak aging, this wine offers black currants and stalky tannins. Juicy fruitiness and a ripe character reflect the vintage. The aftertaste, with acidity, is fresh and always fruity. Drink from 2016.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: Firmly tannic, this is still a young wine. It has a dry structure with a black currant-skin stalkiness. Acidity and structure are still developing, so wait until 2016.
title: Château de Piote 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a heavily wood-aged wine with a bitter character redeemed by the ripe blackberry fruits from a blend of 65% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc. It is structured, with firm tannins over the fresh and juicy fruitiness. Give the wine another year and the two will come into balance. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2012  Bordeaux

description: With a sense of tannic structure and a dry background, this is a firm wine. It has some weight, although the texture and the black currant fruits are light and stylish rather than dense. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Ancres 2011  Bordeaux

description: Bright, lightly-smoked red currant and berry fruits dominate this juicy, fresh wine. A plum-skin texture leads on to some firm tannins. The aftertaste is fruity and light.
title: Cave de Rauzan 2014 Augey  (Bordeaux)

description: The wood aging is still showing in this young wine that needs time. Dry, firm and toasty, it also has the light, fruity character of the 2013 vintage with raspberry, blueberry and acidity that's still too intense. Drink from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Château de Laborde  (Bordeaux)

description: Packed with fruit, this is a fine, simple Bordeaux. Red fruits leap out of the glass, allied to light tannins. They make for a wine that's ready to drink young and fresh.
title: Grand Bateau 2012  Bordeaux

description: Firm, dry tannins behind this wine give a hard edge that will need time. The wine is powered by its structure, solid and only just fruity. Wait until at least 2017 to allow more fruitiness to come through, although the wine will likely always be tough.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château la Rose Bourdieu  (Bordeaux)

description: A tribute to the year-1935-of the founding of the Monségur cooperative, this wine has structure, dry tannins and ripe, plummy fruits. It's firm, showing fresher black currant flavors and acidity at the end.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2011 1935  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all about fruit with only a passing reference to tannins. Red berry flavors come with just a dash of minerality and a firmer, wood-aged core. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tuilerie Pagés 2012  Bordeaux

description: A ripe and smooth wine that brings out all the fruitiness of the vintage. Just enough structure gives the wine shape, while yielding pride of place to the juicy fruits and attractive berry flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Garrineau 2012  Bordeaux

description: Jammy and fruity, this generous wine is cut with red berry acidity. The soft texture and ripe flavors impart an almost sweet character. It is ready to drink.
title: Château les Arromans 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Rich while still tannic and stalky, this wine from a producer in the Blaye region has the structure and tannins of 2010. A dry texture over the ripe full plum fruits suggests it will still develop. The end of the wine is firm.
title: Château Haut Cormier 2010  Bordeaux

description: The wine is all fruit, red berries and fresh acidity. There is a light touch here, maybe missing out on tannins and structure, but bringing out juicy flavors and a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château de Lisennes 2012  Bordeaux

description: A smooth, lightly wood-aged wine that has soft tannins and good berry fruits. Black currant and a stalky texture show the light and fresh character of this only lightly tannic wine.
title: Château Bellevue 2013  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is soft and full of berries, with a smooth, rounded character that is just toasty. Tannins are there, but only in moderation. Drink now.
title: Prince Rubis 2012  Bordeaux

description: Smoky aromas presage a wine that has too much wood. Although there is fruit, it's hard to find it with all the burnt toast flavors. Perhaps wait before drinking, although that wood will always be there.
title: Château Thieuley 2012 Réserve Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux)

description: Bright and fresh, this fruity wine has the softest tannins and juicy acidity. It's packed with red fruits with a lively character and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Pierrousselle 2012  Bordeaux

description: The fruitiness and structure of the vintage show well in this red berry flavored wine. A dry core of tannin gives a light structure and brings out acidity. It's ready to drink.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: This juicy wine has red berry flavors and a sense of structure. Smoky with a firm tannic aftertaste, it has weight and a dark, dense aftertaste.
title: Château Haut Brande 2012  Bordeaux

description: Earthy aromas lead to a wine that is at a stage of development that suppresses fruit. The wood aging and the extracted structure are still strong. Hints of juicy black fruits emerge, promising a good, if tannic future. Wait until 2017.
title: Château de Sours 2011 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux)

description: The tannins are still dominant in this wine. The fruit seems light and crisp while never likely to leave the tannins behind. The acidity shines through more strongly, giving attractive final freshness.
title: Château de Costis 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is rich, smooth and developing well. Ripe blackberry fruits shows strongly along with a stalky texture and still-young acidity. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Nicot 2011  Bordeaux

description: Black currant fruits dominate this ripe, stalky wine that has young tannins and a smoky cedar character that comes from light wood aging. It's dry, firm and ready to drink.
title: Château Briot 2011  Bordeaux

description: Firm and structured, this wine has strong wood-aging spice and ripe tannins. The fruit is suppressed by the toasty wood flavors, but it holds hints of black currant fruitiness for the future. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fleur la Forge 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and fruity, it does have some weight, structure and a smoky character from wood aging. A wine with a future, drink from 2016.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2011 Tradition  (Bordeaux)

description: This young, fruity wine is almost ready to drink. Attractive black currant acidity and light tannins t bring a bite to the natural smoothness of the wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Chai Neuf 2012  Bordeaux

description: Obviously wood aged, with spice and toast flavors, this is a soft, black currant and berry flavored wine. It has light tannins that are already integrating with the fruit. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Château Loyasson 2012  Bordeaux

description: Very Merlot dominated, this is a ripe and soft wine. It has some dryness that forms the core, but the rich fruit with its balanced acidity dominates. Smooth now, it will age quickly and easily and should be drunk from 2015.
title: Cheval Quancard 2012 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: Simple and fruity, it has attractive red fruits, soft tannins and just the right amount of acidity. It will develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012  Bordeaux

description: This wine shows ripe fruit, sweet tannins and soft acidity. Strawberries are prominent along with a bright, fruity feel. The wine doesn't seem likely to age and will be enjoyable in a year.
title: Château Grand Jean 2011  Bordeaux

description: Very spicy from wood aging, this is a toasty, solid, dark hued wine. It has a dense, dry texture, that doesn't allow much space for the fruit. It's always likely to be austere.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011 Thomas Barton Reserve  (Bordeaux)

description: With considerable acidity, this wine shows as much black currant fruitiness as it does structure. Fruit on the palate is accented with just a touch of toast and light tannins. This is an attractive wine for early drinking.
title: Donjon de Bruignac 2011  Bordeaux

description: Here is a concentrated wine that has dense tannins and acidity. Black currant freshness offers lively pleasure already, but should intensify in fruitiness in two years.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: Crisp acidity dominates this black-currant flavored wine. It's all about fresh fruit, soft tannins and benevolent acidity. It's pepperd with hints of licorice and spice. Likely to be drinkable in the next year.
title: Château Joinin 2011  Bordeaux

description: With good tannins and acidity, this wine has potential for improvement. Sulphur notes still show prominently at present, giving the palate a bitter character. Once it blows off with age, however, this will be an attractive wine. Give it two years.
title: Château Pilet 2011  Bordeaux

description: With bright fruitiness, this is an attractive black-currant flavored wine. It has fine acidity that cuts through the wine's gentle, tannic character and leaves a lively, fresh aftertaste.
title: Maison Sichel 2011 Les Hauts de Bel-Air  (Bordeaux)

description: A branded Bordeaux, this shows the structure of the vintage while also being accessible and ready to drink now. It is dominated by Merlot which gives ripe berry fruits and a full, soft structure. Drink now and until 2018. Screwcap.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: A forward, fruity red, coming through strongly on black currant, red fruits and soft tannins. It shows its wood aging easily, leaving an aftertaste that has light acidity. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Exem 2011  Bordeaux

description: From the far east of the Bordeaux vineyards, this is a soft wine that is already drinkable. It has red berry fruits, fresh acidity and a lightly tannic structure. Drink now and until 2016.
title: Château La Barotte 2011  Bordeaux

description: This dry, firm wine shows a hint of bitter extraction, but the core of the wine is smooth. Give it several years' aging.
title: Château des Judes 2011  Bordeaux

description: Showing the structure of the vintage, while missing some of the flesh. The wine has a dry, firm and tannic core that hides the red fruit flavors. The wine, still on the austere side, will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Château Fonfroide 2010  Bordeaux

description: The aromas are of wood as much as fruit. While the palate also shows plenty of wood aging flavors, there is also a more floral, red berry fruit character that's already attractive. The acidity at the end gives intense freshness.
title: Château Laubés 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity, ready-to-drink wine, with acidity cutting through the juicy black currant fruits. This is attractive and bright, yet structured.
title: Château Acker-Perreau 2010  Bordeaux

description: This wine is mostly comprised of Merlot that was sourced from 30 different parcels. It is smooth and ripe, with red berry fruits, soft tannins and attractive acids. From the hands of top consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt, this simple Bordeaux has character and style.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wood-laden wine has a black currant note and a fragrant, spice-driven character. These elements accompany fine structure and intense acidity. Drink this fruity wine now, or age it for one year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine, with dry tannins and notes of berry and red cherry. The fruit comes through the smoky character, bringing sweet-tasting acidity. Give this wine 3-4 years to age.
title: Château le Moulin de la Jaumarde 2009  Bordeaux
winery: Château le Moulin de la Jaumarde

description: This wine is on the lean side, with a black currant flavor, tight tannins and intense acidity. Although it shows fruitiness, the main thrust is severe.
title: Château Montet 2009  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine has good acidity that accompanies the attractive, seemingly sweet tannins. Concentrated, it needs several years to broaden out.
title: Château Lauduc 2010 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and spicy, this is an attractive package of warm tannins and red berries. This wine has a solid, dry core, but it will develop fast-delicious within a year.
title: Château de Fontenille 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is tight and closed, with bitter tannins. It takes a while for the red berry flavor to surface, offering a wine that has potential for richness in 3-4 years time. It will always have a final, mineral-driven tautness.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2010  Bordeaux

description: Fruity and rather soft, this already shows maturity. It's an attractive, red-fruited wine that's light and fragrant. Not for aging.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2010  Bordeaux

description: Soft, juicy, sweet-tasting fruit produce a ripe and rounded character. This blended Bordeaux, from Bernard Magrez, is rich, offering a blackberry note and gentle tannins that are surrounded by a generous texture.
title: Bernard Magrez 2009 Réserve de la Famille  (Bordeaux)

description: On the lean side, this is a tense, severe wine that offers few flavors at this stage. It's hard, and the wood and tannins dominate the fruit. It's always likely to be firm, although an attractive smokiness will become pleasant in 2-3 years.
title: Château Cinc-Hilhs 2009  Bordeaux

description: Light and fruity, this wine's berry flavor dominates the gentle tannins, while the bright acidity adds lift. Drink this in the next two years.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2011 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: With some structure to go with the blackberry fruit, this is fruity and still light-bodied. With soft tannins and acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This has tannins, black currant fruit and a solid structure. It should soften in two years, resulting in an attractive, juicy and fruity wine.
title: Château Tuilerie Pagés 2010  Bordeaux

description: A black currant-dominated wine, with a stalky, herbal series of flavors along with a positive juicy, fruit-forward character. The tannins are firmly dry with some smoky spice at the end.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: With its considerable acidity and black fruit flavors, this is a wine that is lean, on the austere side, dominated by tannins. It does have some depth of flavor, with a more fruity finish.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Sélection Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Full of spicy wood flavors, this wine also has black currant fruit flavors and considerable acidity. It's well-balanced, fresh while also ripe and fruity. Drink soon.
title: Château Julian 2010  Bordeaux

description: Soft, ripe fruits are layered with licorice, red berry flavors and toast. The wine is fresh while also having ripe fruit, open and ready to drink.
title: Univitis 2009 Mayne Sansac  (Bordeaux)

description: A wine with light tannins and juicy red fruits. Though the acidity is prominent, it has a soft texture and attractive strawberry fruit flavors. Not for aging.
title: De Mour 2009 Duc de Rochebois  (Bordeaux)

description: A lean, too tannic wine that shows black currant acidity, almost austere in its dry character. There is good density as well, that promises a year or two of aging before opening up.
title: Château Bellevue 2008  Bordeaux

description: A rich and soft Merlot-dominated wine with a wood element that broadens the texture and enhances the black plum and berry flavors. Ready to drink now.
title: Caves Fleury 2009 Leo Vinis  (Bordeaux)

description: The fruit is certainly ripe here, but is really very young. It has good berry fruits and some soft tannins, relying on its juiciness to balance the fresh acidity.
title: Lagarde 2009 Le de Lagarde  (Bordeaux)

description: This soft and fruity wine is made for drinking now. Gentle black fruits, pleasant acidity and easy tannins are all conducive to instant accessibility. No aging is needed here.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Mission Saint-Vincent Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is all stalky fruit, with young tannins and tight acidity. It is not a wine for aging, with a light texture and spicy structure. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Haut Roudier 2016  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine, a blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, is stalky with light tannins and plenty of black-currant fruits. Crisp and with acidity to balance the fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
title: Grand Bateau 2016  Bordeaux

description: This soft and fruity wine may be young, but with its bright red fruits, it's ready to drink. Its juicy red berry flavors are filled with spice and a minty character from wood aging. It finishes with ripe fruitiness.
title: Château Lussan 2016  Bordeaux

description: Simple Bordeaux red, showing soft tannins, fresh red berry fruits, just a light layer of smoky tannin, and bright acidity. No point in waiting on this wine, drink now, certainly with food.
title: Château du Lort 2006  Bordeaux

description: The initial impression is of a jammy, almost sweet wine. Later bright berry fruits, some wood and a dense tannin core kick in. With its sweet chocolate and juicy edge, this is a wine ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Showing new wood, this is a straight down the line red Bordeaux. The tannins are firm, maybe the wood gives a burnt character but the fruit comes through strongly, giving fresh, sweet blackberry juice flavors. A good, dry, but lively finish.
title: Barriére Fréres 2006 Grand Bâteau  (Bordeaux)

description: A fresh style, showing crisp black currant flavors, acidity, a touch of licorice and a layer of dry tannin. Attractive, spicy finish.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2006 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine offers juicy flavors and soft tannins with an edge of licorice, which is almost astringent, giving a tight, firm finish. Screwcap.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Black currants and spice provide the backbone to this classic Bordeaux red. There are dry tannins, some attractive smoky flavors, topped with acidity and a final, lightly wooded close.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006  Bordeaux

description: A smooth, rich wine that wears its lightness and freshness with grace. There are plenty of crisp black currant and plum skin flavors, along with wood tannins that add spice and dryness. Not hugely rich, but attractively fresh.
title: Château Fongrave 2005 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine has certainly been wood aged, the easy fruit well balanced with the layers of wood tannin, which come through in the aftertaste. Ripe, ready to drink.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2005  Bordeaux

description: Firmly dry, with mineral austerity from the core of classic Bordeaux tannins. The acidity, the black currant fruits and the flavor of licorice and bitter chocolate are all there.
title: Chamarré 2005 Réserve Bordeaux Tradition  (Bordeaux)

description: Mainly Merlot, this is a dusty, cassis-scented wine that picks up hints of raisin and chocolate. Shows decent length and soft tannins, making it immediately approachable.
title: Chamarré 2003 Tradition  (Bordeaux)

description: Lightly structured, this is a dry wine that has a rich red-fruit character. There are tannins as well as spice plus a firm edge to this characterful wine. Drink now.
title: Château Maison Noble 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: A ripe wine that is almost off dry, this has a ripe cherry character, rich in the mouth and with a full texture. The aftertaste brings out spice and tannins. Bordeaux Clairet lies between Rosé and red in color and in taste.
title: Château Timberlay 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Pink in color, this strawberry-flavored Rosé is fresh, crisp, with some caramel. The acidity of 2007 works to the benefit of a summer-drinking Rosé like this.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007  Bordeaux Rosé

description: Intensely toasty and with strong burnt-wood flavors, this is a tough wine. It has weight so fruit may await, but the balance is not there yet.
title: Château Timberlay 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This fruity wine has good acidity and a light structure. Easy and fresh, it offers light, well-integrated tannins. The wine should be ready from 2021.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe, juicy wine with attractive berry flavors and acidity, this is likely to develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Lauduc 2016 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fruity and ripe, this wine is developing fast. Its tannins are already soft, giving an attractive red-fruit-flavored wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Gabachot 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Caramel and spice flavors give a curious edge to this wine. Dense tannins leave little sign of any fruit. It has too much structure.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A juicy wine, full of red fruit flavors. It is soft, with only a touch of tannin, and the fruit is open and immediately attractive. A definitely drinkable, easy style of wine.
title: Château de Seguin 1999  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fruity wine, packed with acidity, red fruits and a soft texture. With its crisp open character it is not a wine for long aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lacombe Cadiot 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is lean, with acidity rather than ripe fruit. It is also tough with tannins. It could come round, although it will always be tough and extracted.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is packed with fruit (including red berries) and attractive acidity. It has tannins that are still very present, although they are now supporting the bright fruitiness of the wine. It's almost ready to drink; just wait until 2018.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red cherries give this wine a soft open feel. It is light on structure, more about crisp acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Jean Faux 2015 Les Sources  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While this wine shows its wood aging strongly, it is likely that the fruit will be able to push through the spice and heavy toast as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Peuy Saincrit 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is structured with both wood and tannin flavors. It has a juicy core that will develop, so give this wine until 2019.
title: Château des Moines Menodin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a spicy wine with juicy crisp acidity and a core of tannins. It is bright, lively and, with its red-fruit flavors, likely to be attractive from 2018.
title: Château la France 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Already a balanced wine, it has black-currant fruit, fine acidity and a juicy perfumed aftertaste. It is likely to be drinkable young.
title: Château Plaisance 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a juicy red-fruit-flavored wine. It has attractive tannins and plenty of acidity. With a fresh crisp aftertaste, it is light and will develop quickly.
title: Château de Seguin 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This soft spicy wine comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region. It has blackberry fruits and balanced acidity, typical of the vintage. The wine is fruity, just backed up by tannins and is ready to drink.
title: Château Toudenac 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: On an eminence above the river Garonne, this estate is in the Entre-deux-Mers. The wine ,with its juicy red fruits, has just a touch of tannins along with crisp acidity and a mineral aftertaste. Produced from organically grown grapes, this is clean, bright and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Lauretan 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fresh wine, full of crisp red fruits and acidity. It needs a few months to calm down its exuberant fruitiness and it should be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château le Peuy Saincrit 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is spicy and with toasty wood flavors. It has acidity and red fruits that are still developing. As the wood becomes better integrated, it will become rich and fruity.
title: Château Roc de Levraut 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firmly tannic and with smoky flavors, this is potentially a rich wine with attractive acidity and red-fruit flavors. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Pabus 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has plenty of ripe fruit, raspberry flavors and light spice. With a crisp streak of acidity, it is beginning to show a good balance. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Queyssard 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a wine with light spice and perfumed red fruits. It is juicy, fresh, lightly tannic and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maréchaux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a dry wine, its fruit lost in the tannic structure. It has some fine acidity and could well open up as the young fruit matures. Try again from 2017.
title: Château Larroque 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With some firm tannins as well as solid structure, this is a dry wine that needs time to fill out. The fruit is there and will develop well over the next two years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grossombre de Saint-Joseph 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe and smooth wine, this has balanced tannins, bright red fruit and acidity. It is fruity, rounded and with a fresh aftertaste. An easy wine, it is ready now.
title: Château Fleur de Charme 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red-currant fruit flavors shine through this light fresh wine. Although there are tannins, it is more about the crisp fruits and acidity. Drink this from 2018.
title: Château de Lisennes 2014 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine has red fruits and tannins along with acidity. The 25-year old vines have produced a rich wine that is all about fruit and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Motte Maucourt 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: It's the smoky flavors and acidity that dominate this fresh wine. It has hints of black-currant flavors that may develop although the wine is light and shows more dry tannins than fruit at this stage. Think about waiting until 2018.
title: Château Recougne 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From vines in the Entre-deux-Mers, this is a cool wine although with fresh black-currant fruits and balanced tannins. Dominated by Merlot blended with Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, it has a juicy character that leaves a fresh taste as well as lively acidity. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2013 La Fleur de Ribeyrolles  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has ripe red fruit flavors, a dry core, balanced tannins and plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now. The Maurin family's organic vineyards have all permitted grapes in Bordeaux, which is a good thing In a difficult vintage. This blend is Merlot (60%), Carmenére (15%), Petit Verdot (15%) and Malbec (10%).
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With plenty of weight to support the ripe fruits, this is a balanced, perfumed wine. It has structure and tannins, along with fresh black currant flavors in the 80/20 Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roc Montalon 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This has a firm structure and dry tannins. Behind this wall lie stirrings of black currant fruits and acidity. The extraction and the hard edge need to soften, so drink from mid-2016. This is a Boissonneau family wine.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Packed with red fruits and soft tannins, this is fresh, crisp and with bright acidity. The tannins at the back offer a firm aftertaste, along with juicy red currant fruits. Thierry Lurton bought the 14th-century Château in 2007.
title: Château Camarsac 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Smoky flavors go with dry tannins to give this wine a solid structure. It is dry at the back, allowing room for the acidity and black currant fruits to come forward. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Faviére 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Juicy black currant acidity dominates this light, bright wine that's 100% Merlot. It has a fresh feel and is structured with light tannins. Drink now.
title: Château de Seguin 2013 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Red currant and red berry fruits show strongly in this wine from Virginie Aubrion's biodynamic vineyards. The tannins are strong, although leaving space for the fruitiness. It needs to develop, with good acidity likely to come through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Piote 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While there are certainly tannins here, this wine is essentially about fruit. Stalky black currants and berries dominate this perfumed wine with its fresh acidity and crisp, clean aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Haut-Sorillon 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine comes from Château le Gardera on the slopes above the Garonne river in the Entre-deux-Mers region. It's a big, wood-aged and spicy wine that's full of attractive red berry fruits. There is a dry core of tannin, so the wine could age although it is quite ready to drink now.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is fruity and juicy with tannins that are still hard. It will come together because the fruit is ripe enough. Red berry flavors are developing well, so wait until 2016 for the wine to come round.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A fruity wine that is soft and round, it's light and bright with its acidity and berry fruits. It's not for aging and will be attractive from 2015.
title: Château Roquefort 2012 Château Domi-Cours  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Black fruits and tannins are dominant in this tough, reticent wine. With a solid structure, it's balanced, with good acidity at the end.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This soft wine offers black fruits as much as tannins. It has a rich feel, generous and rounded. Developing fast it will be ready from 2015.
title: Château de Reignac 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm and dense, the wine is dominated by its tannic structure. It has a lean and austere character that will probably always remain, although there are hints of juicy fruits at the end.
title: Château Julian 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Chocolate and bitter coffee show the way this wine has been extracted, leaving a hard edge that currently dominates the red berry fruits. It needs time to soften, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Mougneaux 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is all about juiciness and ripe fruit. It has a good balance between this fruitiness and the tannins, giving a wine that is open and generous. It is developing fast, so drink from 2016.
title: Château la Faviére 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a spicy, ripe wine with some firm tannins. Black currant flavors and good acidity give a rich feel, and a jammy element comes from the ripe fruits. The wine is developing fast, so drink from 2016.
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Round, fruity and soft, this juicy wine will be ready to drink soon. A stalky structure is filled out with red berry fruits and fine acidity. Light texture and juicy fruitiness mark the end. Drink now-2018.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Produced close to Fronsac, this Merlot-based wine has rich fruits and a warm, rounded character. A touch of bitterness and dark chocolate from extraction mar this otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dry and tannic, this totally structured wine has weight. However the fruit element has vanished leaving a dense wine, very firm and just given brightness by acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Thuron 2005 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink now. It has juicy fruitiness from black currant and strawberry notes, along with soft tannins.
title: Château la France 2011 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is an austere wine that's tough on the palate and with high acidity. The black currant fruitiness is still developing, so the wine shouldn't be drunk before 2016.
title: Château Recougne 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Strong mint aromas hint to the wood aging in this wine. Currently, they tend to dominate, accompained by bitter wood notes and dark-edged tannins. The wine is firm and needs time express its fruit.
title: Château Bois Redon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a hard edged wine, solid and firm, with dry tannins and only a hint of fruity acidity. It does have weight, so it could soften with age.
title: Château Haut Bessac 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Very dense and extracted, this wine has bitter chocolate as well as dark plum-skin flavors. It is hard-edged, demanding time to escape the dominating clutches of toasty wood. The firmness continues to the finish.
title: Château de Riberon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A tight, stalky wine, showing black currant and dark plum fruits, intense acidity and a dry, tannic character. It feels light, without great density, very up front and fruity.
title: Château de Cornemps 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe fruit suggests a wine that is soft, juicy and unlikely to age for long. It has red berry flavors, attractive tannins and fine finishing acidity.
title: Château Gamage 2011 Selection Exceptionelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe fruit dominates this forward, fruity wine. Caramel and blackberry flavors and firm tannins combine to make a wine that is almost ready to drink.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This concentrated wine is heavy on the tannins and too light on the fruit. It has power, wood-aging richness and perhaps the potential to soften and round out after 4-5 years.
title: Château la France 2011 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Structured wine with 30% of Cabernet to give shape to the very ripe Merlot. The wine has both acidity, some firm tannins and a concentrated, dry core. It's likely to age well over 3-4 years.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Wood-laden, spicy wine with some ripe black currant fruit and soft tannins. This is a warm, open wine that is likely to age over the next year.
title: Château Allégret 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe and fruity wine, very typical of the vintage. There's a strong stalky black currant character, with some dry tannins and wood flavors. The aftertaste, though, comes right back to fruit and juicy acidity.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While there is probably plenty of ripe fruit somewhere in this wine, it is all too much dominated by high toast wood flavors which will likely always give a tough character. It only just hints at a more generous side.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Showing plenty of the warmth and openness of the vintage, this is a rounded, red-fruited wine. It has an edge of tannins and a rich, soft texture. Very ready to drink now.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From an estate in the Entre-Deux-Mers region, this wine is firm and concentrated, packed with ripe tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. Dense, with dusty tannins, it is smooth and polished in texture.
title: Château Marac 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: An attractive, caramel- and red-fruit-flavored wine, this has soft tannins and ripe berry notes that are lined with acidity. Not for long aging, it's ready to drink now.
title: Château de Parenchére 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Perfumed and fragrant, this shows wood and fruity perfumes in harmony. It's attractive, forward and ready to drink.
title: Château l'Escart 2010 Cuvée Eden  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Here's a wine that, while expressing the structure of the vintage, brings warmth and a rich blackberry flavor as well. It has a fine texture and a firm, upright feel. Ready for drinking in a year.
title: Kirkland Signature 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big and fruity, this shows its red fruits immediately. It is perfumed, juicy and fragrant, and the tannins offer structure, though the fruit trumps it somewhat. It's likely to develop quickly over the next year.
title: Cru Monplaisir 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Soft and ripe, this wine is all fruit and sweet acidity. There is a light yet generous mouthfeel, with its tannins following its open fruitiness.
title: Château de Brague 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Initially austere, this wine is driven by notes of bitter chocolate and lean fruit. The fruit weight promises some attractive aging, but for the present, it is firm, dry and solidly tannic.
title: Château Bois Redon 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Lean and rather severe, this is now showing maturity. It has a leathery texture, with just a hint of juicy fruit in the background.
title: Château Plaisance 2007  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Structure, acidity and mineral-tinged fruits star in this wine. It has a fresh, fruity black currant character with tannins and a dense core of dry fruit skins. Age another year, but it's also ready to drink now.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A Bordeaux saved from its high alcohol by its acidity. There is power and superripe fruit yet parallel to these is the black currant acidity that cuts right through. Age for 1-2 years.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe, fruity wine, it has sweet tannins, blackberry fruit, laced with acidity. The wine is all fruit, with only the lightest hint of wood.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Close to Fronsac, this is a Merlot-dominated wine that has soft, ripe fruit. It shows sweetness and open berry flavors touched by chocolate and licorice. To be   opened over the next 2-3 years.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A touch of wood helps the wine's light fruit to deepen and become richer. The wine is well balanced, with fresh acidity giving a good lift.
title: Château Grand Jean 2009 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: From a vineyard planted on the island of Margaux in the Gironde estuary, this soft wine has stalky fruits, very berry, burnished with wood and given a spicy character. It is ready to drink now, the acidity and juicy finale dominant.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Château Biré  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This ripe blend with 60% Merlot is jammy, soft and full of red berries. Its light structure and generally crisp and fresh texture make it an easy, fruity wine ready to drink now.
title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With the lightness and freshness of 2007 to the fore, this is a pleasing, acid black currant juice flavored wine, slightly rustic at the edges, with some tight fruit skin tannins. Drink soon.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007 Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A lean, fresh style of Bordeaux, with red fruits balancing on dry tannins and a top layer of acidity. It is almost austere, but it's rescued by the freshness of the fruit and underlying structure.
title: Château Trocard 2005  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Juicy cherry fruit flavors with some fine tannins, pepper, spice and dry wood edges. This is a friendly, easy Bordeaux with plenty of fruit.
title: Pezat 2005  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Licorice and smoky wood flavors suggest a wine that has a bitter, extracted character. While there is fruit, it is buried in this hard edge. The wine will probably stay firm.
title: Château Les Guyonnets 2016 Héritage  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine although the fruit does show potential. It is concentrated and firm, tannins foremost. Drink from 2019.
title: Maison Hebrard 2014 Premium  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Red-jelly fruit flavors suggest the fruit for this wine was superripe. That gives an unbalanced character between the tannins and the fruit. Acidity at the end is a more hopeful sign.
title: Château La Rame 2014 La Charmille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While there is plenty of wood around in this Gonfrier family wine, the Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blend also has good black currant and berry fruits. At the moment it is smoky and toasty, so it needs to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Tanesse 2013  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Harvested from a six-acre parcel, this Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon wine is ripe and fruity. It is very developed for a 2012. This means it is soft, smooth, showing mature fruits and finishing with attractive acidity. Definitely to be drunk now.
title: Château La Caussade 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Obviously wood aged, this wine's dryness comes from the attenuating character of the barrels. That leaves little room for lean fruit flavors. Maybe it will soften, but the wood is always going to be dominant.
title: Château de Ricaud 2011 Réserve des Côteaux  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A fragrant, fruity wine, with fruit tannins, just a hint of wood and tight black-currant fruit. This is a dry wine, firm at the center and needing a year to round out.
title: Château de Marsan 2011  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bright and juicy, this is a fresh, red-fruited wine, ripe and fragrant. The tannic element is almost an afterthought.
title: Château de Ricaud 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bitter chocolate aromas and woody flavors are the hallmarks of this smoky, burnt toast-inflected wine. That bitter quality probably won't go away, leaving the fruit behind.
title: Château de Fontenille 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is dry, structured and heavily extracted. That leaves a bitter note behind the fruit and acidity. It could have benefited from more gentle winemaking, and although it will soften with age, it will always be tough.
title: Château Brethous 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is an enormous wine, maybe too much. With its layers of rich black fruits and dark tannins, it is a powerful, juicy, jammy and super-ripe wine. It all seems excessive and out of balance. It's fun for a moment, but not for drinking with food.
title: Château Roullet 2010  Canon-Fronsac

description: This is a bold rich wine-perhaps too rich. It has dense black fruits that go with the dark chocolate and licorice flavors. It still has young tannins and acidity and these need to soften. Drink this rich wine from late 2017.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: High spice and toast flavors dominate this wine. The wood use is masking the fruit, probably too enthusiastically. It should soften, although not enough.
title: Château La Bourrée 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With some attractive tannins and strawberry fruits, this wine has kept its light character. It is developing well into an attractively fruity wine that will be ready from the end of 2016. This is part of a larger estate, Château Haut Rocher, across the line from Castillon in Saint-Émilion. It has been in the family since the 17th century. Jérôme et Béatrice de Monteil took over both properties for the family in 2010.
title: Château Bréhat 2013  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is light, juicy and with attractive red fruits brightened with acidity. The tannins suggest a little aging, but there is no need to wait. This Beynat property has been in the family since 1917.
title: Château Beynat 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fresh and juicy wine is marked by berry fruits and acidity. It's bright and crisp in character, while also having weight and richness. With its soft tannins, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Hyot 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A softly juicy wine, this is missing structure while it has plenty of fruit. It's ripe, rich and juicy; a pleasure to drink in 2-3 years.
title: Château Langrange Monbadon 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Minty aromas go along with firm, barely bitter tannins. They dominate the wine, smothering the fruit and lending a burnt quality to the palate.
title: Château Bréhat 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A strongly wood-aged wine, very dark and brooding. It has high extract and concentration, with a flash of black pepper on the palate. Tough and finishing hard.
title: Château Ampélia 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense tannins and a solid, chunky character suggest a wine with richness. The black fruits are concentrated, with juiciness coming through over time. It has the ripe power of the 2009 vintage.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2009  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Made without any wood aging, this wine is all about bright cherry fruit. It shows some stalkiness from the fruit along with plenty of juicy acidity, soft tannins and an easy, open character. Drink now.
title: Château les Mauriniéres 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is structured although it does have plenty of ripe and full of berry fruits. Drink from 2017. The blend includes 50% Merlot, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is bright and fruity, with acidity and some fresh red berry fruits. The background tannins do have a dryness but will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2017. This property, east of Saint-Émilion, is run by Florent Dubard.
title: Château Nardou 2013 Bois Meyney du Château Nardou  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There is high acidity on this black currant-flavored wine. It is light and fruity, with a cool feel and taut texture.
title: Château Lamothe 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is dry and smoky, with serious tannins. It is concentrated, with bitter chocolate flavors from the wood aging.
title: Château Sainte-Marie 2015 Alios  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This firm, structured wine is lean and austere. Spice and toast notes dominate, leaving little room for fruit. It's a tough wine to like.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 Château Jeandebout  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine, closed and very firm. Its tannins come from the ripe Merlot fruits that were extracted too much. It should soften to bring out the blackberry flavors, but it is likely to remain austere.
title: Domaine de la Terrasse 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: Fresh and fruity, it has ripe blackberries, soft tannins and a fresh aftertaste. It presents an attractive smoky character along with vanilla and a rich aftertaste.
title: Bailli de Bourg 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This light wine offers attractive black currant fruitiness. Burnt tannins from the wood aging give it a bitter edge, although the aftertaste does bring back the freshness of the vintage.
title: Château Le Prieuré de Bellegarde 2011 Sélection  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This fruity wine is full of juicy red berries that are laced with acidity. Hints of wood aging stay in the background of this essentially fresh and bright wine.
title: Château les Mottes Pradier 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: For the vintage, this is a surprisingly lean wine. Some juicy fruit is still struggling out of the very dry tannic shell. Acidity is a dominant character of this firm, dry wine.
title: Château Blanchereau 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Firm and dry, dark and dense, this wine has intense concentration and hard tannins. It feels heavily extracted, giving a bitter, burnt edge. The aftertaste just hints at potential juiciness.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: The spicy wood aroma that shows strongly on the nose of this wine is confirmed on the palate, as it seems to have spent too much time in barrels. The fruit has been neglected and is dry. It will open up with time, although the dryness will probably remain.
title: Château le Piat 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: With much of the freshness of 2006 now evolved into more mature flavors, this balanced if somewhat stalky wine has fine perfumed black currant fruit flavors, with a firm core of tannins and wood aging.
title: Château Hyot 2006 Cuvée la Fleur Tabenot  (Cotes de Castillon)

description: This tightly stalky wine offers fresh red fruits and aromatic acidity. With tannins right up front, it is still young and needing to develop. The wine's name comes from the shirt numbers of the two French rugby players who feature on the label. Drink from 2016.
title: Union de Producteurs de Lugon 2012 No 2 et No 5 de Francarney  (Fronsac)

description: An unusual find of an old vintage currently available, this is certainly a mature wine. In fact, it is beginning to dry out-focused on old tannins rather than on the wonderful secondary flavors of a well-aged Bordeaux. For lovers of older wines, this is a bargain curiosity.
title: Château Hervé-Laroque 2006  Fronsac

description: A fresh style of wine, this is all about acidity and crisp red-currant fruits. It has a light feel, bright and fresh at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Bergeron 2016 Château La Fleur des Pins  (Graves)

description: This is a light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has spice and a layer of dry tannins that are acting as a support to the red fruits and acidity.
title: Château Doms 2014  Graves

description: With 12 months in wood, this is a firm wine, with a rustic, funky character that masks the black-currant fruit. The smoky wood contrasts with the acidity while leaving a dry aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Nicolas Idiart 2012 Château Caillivet  (Graves)

description: This light wine has red berry flavors and lots of acidity. With only the lightest texture, it's all about fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château Lapinesse 2013 Les Terrasses de Colas  (Graves)

description: While it is light for the structured 2010s, this wine has attractive red fruit flavors and soft tannins. With its gentle structure and good fruity acidity, it's ready soon. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Cérons 2010  Graves

description: A delicate wine that is completely ready to drink and needs to be consumed now before it ages further. The fruit has developed a secondary, animal character, the tannins starting to dominate with their dryness.
title: Château du Grand Bos 2007  Graves

description: The wine seems lean, austere and minerally in character. It has stalky black-currant fruits, firm tannins and forward acids. It should age over 2-3 years, but it will always be on the severe side.
title: Château de Janicon 2010  Graves

description: Relatively lightweight, showing freshness rather than density, this is a fruity, red currant- and red plum-flavored wine that is lifted by a good use of wood aging, spice, and enclosed by vibrant acidity.
title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2007  Graves

description: From a large 177-acre estate in the southern Graves, this wine shows plenty of stalky, black currant fruits, fresh acidity and spice from wood. It has just the right characters for a food Bordeaux, dry core of tannins and vivid fruit around.
title: Château Pavillon de Boyrein 2006  Graves

description: For a 2003, this seems rather lean. The red fruits are turning mature now, and leaving some astringency behind. The wine is becoming herbal, with green pepper acidity. It's pleasant to drink, but is unlikely to develop.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2003 Benjamin  (Graves)

description: Fruit from old vines go into this freshly fruity, black currant-flavored wine. There is some wood, but the tannins in this Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine come mainly from the fruit, leaving a wine which is light but with a dry core.
title: Château Toumilon 2005  Graves

description: This is a ripe, well-integrated wine that shows the charming, elegant side of Graves wine. Without great depth of flavor, it has attractive black berry fruits and soft tannins.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2005 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Graves)

description: One of the group of estates owned by Jean-Michel Lapalu (the others include Liversan), this is a relatively soft wine, but one with good ripe fruits. This means that it is ready to drink now, an easy wine, with pleasant stalky tannins. Imported by Wine Frog.
title: Château Lieujean 2003  Haut-Médoc

description: Under the same ownership as Château de Malleret in the southern Médoc, this neighboring estate is firm and tannic with a dry hard core. That dryness and structure will probably remain even as the fruit fills out to give blackberry flavors. Less extraction would have helped.
title: Château Barthez 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The 65% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend has produced a wine that is tight with as much acidity as fruit. It does have a juicy edge that is attractive although overall the wine seems thin and dry.
title: Château Aney 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: High-toast aromas are followed on the palate by flavors that are more about wood than fruit. That gives the wine a tough, extracted character that probably will not go away.
title: Château Troupian 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: One of the estates in the Lapalu family stable, Liversan is to the west of Pauillac. In 2013 it has produced a light, fruity wine with attractive acidity and some dry tannins. Unfocused at this stage, it hopefully will develop a richer character as it matures. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Liversan 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated outside Listrac, this estate has produced a soft, unfocused wine. It has tannins and gentle fruitiness and acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Lauzette 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is full of black currants and acidity that is structured by a core of dark tannins. While it is firm at the moment it's likely to fill out, with the fresh fruitiness emerging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is already developing attractively. The wood aging gives some toasty character although the black currant fruitiness makes the wine accessible and bright. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Laride 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This fruity wine is already easy to drink. It is soft with a layer of wood-aging flavors that don't take much away from the open fruitiness. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a simple, fruity wine without great tannic structure. It has attractive berry fruits and a dry core. With its fresh acidity, it will be ready to drink soon.
title: Château Aney 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Attractive and balanced, this has light tannins and fresh black currant fruitiness. Everything is in the right place, correct if not more. The aftertaste has a good, food-friendly acidity.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: A juicy, fruity, soft wine, it has a gentle tannic character. Red berry flavors, soft acidity and fresh texture combine to give a light wine that will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Taillan 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Light and fruity, this is a fresh, rounded wine with attractive berry fruits. It is already smooth, although the tannins are in the background. It's fragrant with a medium-term potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Château d'Arcins 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Jammy with soft fruits and ripe tannins, this is an attractive, forward wine that doesn't need much time to age. So enjoy the red fruits and acidity from 2016.
title: Château Corconnac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: There seems to be too much wood here which is smothering the fruit. Given that, the wine does have weight and as the wood softens, the juicy fruit flavors should come through. Wait to drink until 2016. But it will always be austere.
title: Château la Croix Margautot 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This richly fruity wine is attractively balanced, showing ample acidity, black currant fruit and a general forward fruitiness. It's not a wine of great depth. Ready to drink now.
title: Château Fonséche 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The headquarters of Bordeaux négociant Barton & Guestier has produced a soft, ready-to-drink wine. It's attractive, ripe and rich, and it's full of juicy blackberry fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Magnol 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: With red berry fruitiness, this is an attractive wine. It has a light texture, some juicy acidity and it's ready to drink.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: Structured and fruity, this has black currant flavors, dry tannins and a definite wood-aged feel. It is elegant, not powerful, opening slowly to reveal its fine fruit and acidity.
