title: Château Landat 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: On the austere side, the tannins dry and firm. The fruit flavors echo the severe character, with red currant flavors and a slight vegetal edge.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine has some weight, dominated by dry tannins and a dark edge of black currants. For a 2005, it is surprisingly light, but the elements of ripe fruit and balancing acidity are there, even if the tannins and wood still dominate.
title: Château d'Esteau 2005  Haut-Médoc

description: Toasty and woody, this wine is currently dominated by the wood aging, leaving little space for the juicy red fruits in the background. It will soften and should be less aggressive from 2019.
title: Château le Monge 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: The full whammy of bacon and sweet smokiness on the nose announces that this wine was heavily oaked. And the tannins and lemony nuances that penetrate the palate and finish confirm that. In between there's ripe, blasting cherry fruit and acids that create a sweet-tart candy impression.
title: Château Clarke 1999  Listrac-Médoc

description: The wine is lean with austere tannins and plenty of structure. What is seems to be missing is the fruit potential. It will soften over time, although probably not enough.
title: Château Sémeillan Mazeau 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: Firmly tannic, this wine is solid, firm and traditional in its dry structure. Black currant fruitiness shows briefly before the tannins and dark extract take over. It's a tough wine at this stage and could well remain hard. Try drinking from 2017.
title: Château des Landes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Mature already, displaying leather, earth and tobacco nuances on the nose, followed by flavors of black cherry and tobacco. Light-bodied, with a juicy, mouthwatering finish. Drink over the next 2-3 years.
title: Château Tricot d'Arsac 1999  Margaux

description: Animal and bell pepper aromas mask a soft, relatively lightweight wine, which has fine acidity and fresh red fruit flavors.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2000  Margaux

description: A wine that offers plenty of the charm of Margaux, with its soft tannins, layers of chocolate, smooth texture and juicy fruit. The wood at this stage is prominent, and needs to settle down.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: This is a disappointment. The wine is tart, stalky and, at the same time, light. It has an edge of green that suggests underripe fruit. Developing fast.
title: Château Siran 2007  Margaux

description: Tight and tannic, this is a wine with as much structure as fruit. It has a dusty, austere quality, the fruit a light layer underneath. The high proportion of Petit Verdot in the blend gives color as well as those tannins.
title: Château la Bessane 2007  Margaux

description: This wine brings out the soft side of Margaux with its easy and friendly fruits. Although there are definite tannins, they are well below the surface of the red berries and fresh acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006  Margaux

description: A blend of equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this fresh, open wine is made to drink young. The red-fruit flavors, soft tannins and layer of ripe acidity are balanced and integrated. The wine is ready now.
title: Member's Mark 2016  Médoc

description: A soft wine that has easy but attractively ripe fruit. This is not a wine for aging, but in 2003, the estate has made a very drinkable wine. Patache stands for an ancient coaching inn, recollected on the wine's label by a coach and horses. Imported by Grands Chais de France.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2003  Médoc

description: A usually reliable performer, Patache d'Aux produced a solid wine in the difficult 2002 vintage. A whiff of mint carries through on the palate, which blends herbs, berries and vanilla in a straightforward claret. Fruit shows through the firm tannins on the finish, suggesting this will improve over the next few years. Drink 2008-2012.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2002  Médoc

description: Owned by the Francisco family since 1870, this wine is juicy and just lightly stalky, with fine crisp acidity. Needing to develop and soften its firm texture, it will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château de la Croix 2014  Médoc

description: This fresh, stalky wine has hints of wood. The fruit is light and only just ripe, giving it a tight character, with plenty of acidity and a dry core of tannins. It will be ready to drink in a crisp way from 2017.
title: Château Poitevin 2013  Médoc

description: This stalky, firmly tannic wine is still developing. Dominated by Merlot, it has black currant fruits in the background with acidity and crispness. Give this structured wine another few years and drink from 2016.
title: Château Andron 2010  Médoc

description: Heavy wood aromas are mitigated on the palate by the ripe fruit, making for a rich wine with black plum flavors as well as a core of tannins. It's going to develop well and quickly, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Carcanieux 2012  Médoc

description: Strong wood aromas mark this wine that's shot through with wood-aging flavors. Spice and smoky toast are evident, but the ripe blackberry flavors are big enough to balance this Merlot-dominated wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Barrail 2012  Médoc

description: Marked by red berry fruits and soft tannins, this has a juicy character, with touches of wood aging that are already integrated. The aftertaste, with its fresh currant acidity and rounded fruit, shows that this will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2012  Médoc

description: This is a smooth, velvet-textured wine. Its tannins are totally integrated into the ripe berry flavors. With its soft texture and open structure, it is almost ready to drink now. Wait until late 2015.
title: Château Laujac 2012  Médoc

description: This stalky wine shows wood aging as much as fruit. Toast and some bitter extraction are contrasted with tight black currant fruits. It will soften and turn into an approachable fruity wine.
title: Château Amour 2012  Médoc

description: This wine is layered with wood that has softened the young fruitiness, adding spice and toast. The wine just keeps the right, juicy side of being too woody. It should be drunk now-2015.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2011 L de Laffitte Laujac  (Médoc)

description: With black currant fruits dominant, this is an inherently fruity wine. The juicy feel makes the wine seem light, not yet quite connecting between fruit and a very dry tannic texture. Give it until 2016.
title: Château des Lattes 2011  Médoc

description: Bold and juicy, this is a ripe, forward wine. With red berry fruits prominent, it conveys attractive fruitiness. Tannins in the background suggest medium-term aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mazails 2011  Médoc

description: A full and ripe wine, it is richly layered with black fruits, soft tannins and a juicy, warm aftertaste. The acidity at the end adds a little freshness. It's made to be drunk now.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011  Médoc

description: With considerable spicy, smoky wood, this is a rich, while extracted, wine. It does have some juicy fruit that shows potential so it should soften and become less bitter. Drink from 2017.
title: Château l'Argenteyre 2011  Médoc

description: Smoky wood aromas are confirmed on the palate by a tough, wood-laden character. It's all spice and toast, leaving little room at this stage for fruit. That should come because the wine has weight and suggestions of rich berry fruits in the background.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2011  Médoc

description: This is a stalky, black currant and spice flavored wine. It has relatively soft tannins while showing a meaty, juicy character. The wine is for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château d'Escurac 2011  Médoc

description: With layers of new wood and spice flavors, this wine is highly structured without much fruit to balance. It will develop into a dry, firm wine, showing light black fruit flavors surrounded by textured tannins.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2011  Médoc

description: Firm, dark and finely tannic, this has weight and richness, with a severity that dominates the fruitiness. It's dry and tough, and it's aging potential is questionable.
title: Château Castera 2010  Médoc

description: This is a smoky, wood-aged wine, with a bitter toast flavor that smothers the fruit. It does have the fruit weight, so that toast flavor will certainly soften. But to judge by the intense wood character, this bottling will likely always have a severe edge.
title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2010  Médoc

description: The wood influence in this wine is almost too much for the fruit, even in the future. It has a severe, burnt character that shows an herb flavor and a tight texture.
title: Château La Grange de Bessan 2010  Médoc

description: On the lean side, this is a tannic and structured wine. The fruit is stalky, with a black currant note and tight acidity, creating a wine that needs 1-2 years to really soften.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Médoc)

description: Soft and ripe, this is an easy, fruity wine. It has red berries, gentle tannins and attractive acidity. It is just as enjoyable as an apéritif as with food and ready to drink now.
title: Château Cru de Verdun 2009  Médoc

description: Spicy wood thrusts this wine forward. It does have enough weight of blackberry fruit to compensate.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2010 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: A soft wine, with some light wood aging while the fruit gives black currant stalkiness, dry tannins and fresh, juicy, smoky acidity. The wine needs no aging, but could develop for 2-3 years.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2010 Famille Lapalu  (Médoc)

description: On the austere side, this shows more tannin than fruit, based around a dry core that has spread through the wine. There is some black plum skin and black currant fruit, but it is hard to find.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2008  Médoc

description: Tight wine, its black currant flavors layered with dry tannins. It's finely structured, although the stalky element tends to dominate. Not for aging.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Médoc

description: Confusingly, the wine has no connection with Château Magnol, also owned by Barton & Guestier. It's a soft Médoc wine, light and gentle in character, the tannins soft, merging with the red berry fruits.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Médoc)

description: Smooth, open, fruity wine, with good black berry flavors, rounded by wood. The tannins offer a bite to go with the acidity. Age for a year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Médoc)

description: The second wine of Médoc Château La Cardonne is a light, fruity wine with red berry fruits, acidity and a fresh tannin character. It is pleasingly ready to drink now.
title: Château La Cardonne 2007 Cardus de la Cardonne  (Médoc)

description: A wine that is perfumed with new wood. The fruit has the freshness of 2007, high acids, cranberry juice, not weighty. Needs to age for another year.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2007  Médoc

description: Balanced but very firm, with dominant tannins, here is a wine with an angular feel to it. The tannins give a meaty character as well as laying alongside the plum skin flavors. It is dry, with some definite acidity.
title: Château le Vivier 2007  Médoc

description: Soft and fruity, this is a light wine with gentle tannins and acidity. Black-currant fruits go with the crisp texture to make a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Vieux Cassan 2015  Médoc

description: At this stage, the wood-aging component of this wine dominates the gentle black fruits. An element of high toast and black-chocolate extraction flavors give bitterness. It seems this wine will always have a hard edge.
title: Château Clos du Moulin 2015  Médoc

description: A light, rather diffuse wine, with the fruit soft and ripe. The flavor of red plum juice and tomato give some sweetness, the tannins only a minor element in this ready-to-drink wine.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2006  Médoc

description: This is big and dense. There seems to be too much structure and not enough fruit for the weight of the tannins. That said, there is also a good smoky character that gives spice and lifts the final black currant fruit flavor.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Médoc)

description: A dense wine, with black fruits that go in one direction, and tannins that go in another. Maybe this is because it's young. There is some good, ripe acidity and blackberry flavors, so in six months, this may well integrate.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2005 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Médoc)

description: This is a spicy wine with some attractive red fruits. There is a rustic barnyard character that is less pleasing. The juicy acidity at the end does give a lift to what is a disappointing wine.
title: Château Plaisance 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: The wine has red fruits and spice from wood aging. It suffers from the lean character of the vintage, giving a wine that shows tannins while not having enough fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Montaiguillon 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Dominated by 80% Merlot with licorice and dark chocolate, the wine has strong flavors of new wood that give a vanilla and caramel character. It is solid, with a strong tannic presence. Put all this together and this is a wine that is likely always to be firm.
title: Château Haut-Plaisance 2012  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This is a soft wine, with attractive red-currant fruit and open, smoky tannins. It's well balanced between the fruit, tannins and acidity, which lends a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Piron 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is soft, juicy and light. It has only the slightest texture, leaving its flavors entirely with blackberry fruitiness. That makes it an attractive, open wine with a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Lalaudey 2013  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This wine is packed with tannins, less packed with fruit. That gives it a tough character, very dry and not fruity enough. The estate is owned by the Perrin family of Château Carbonnieux.
title: Château Lafont Menaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Wood aromas are repeated on the palate with a dry bitterness. This wine should soften as it develops, although that over-enthusiastic use of wood could remain. This is one of several Bordeaux estates owned by André Lurton.
title: Château la Louviére 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a curiously juicy wine that is not fully integrated with the dry tannins. It has a hard-edged texture, a dry character that sits uneasily with the crisp black currant fruitiness.
title: Château Hannetot 2011  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a dense, dry wine, full of concentrated tannins and somewhat hard-edged. While it does have acidity, it misses out on the fruitiness and ends up being tough and tannic.
title: Château Lafont Menaut 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is lean, more about structure than tannins. Some juicy fruitiness is overwhelmed by the dry core of the wine that seems over-extracted.
title: Château de Rochemorin 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: With tight acidity and intense black currant fruits, this wine has a raw edge. It presents a full, fresh, crisp texture that's bright, with layers of acidity at the end.
title: Château Ferran 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: A very youthful wine that needs time. It has coffee bean aromas and accents of wood and black currants. Needs time for the acidity to develop and soften. Give it 4-5 years. Imported by William Grant & Sons.
title: Château la Rose Bellevue 2002 Cuvée Prestige  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: Still fresh, this shows red currant and red berry fruit flavors over a smoky layer of wood, licorice and spice. It has some warmth, a smoothly textured wine that only has a glimpse of rustic tannin beneath the flavors.
title: Château des Mille Anges 2003  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine offers plenty of black-currant fruits with a structured edge. The bitter aftertaste needs to soften before the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Carbonneau 2016 Sequoia  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine. Its burnt toast character doesn't chime with the light fruitiness of the vintage and so gives a wine that is bitter and extracted. Less overworking would have produced a better wine.
title: Château Pindefleurs 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Dominated by its 86% Merlot, this is a fruity wine that is surprisingly light for the vintage. It comes from the plain between Saint-Émilion and the Dordogne River, giving a soft style with just a touch of tannin. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Joly 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This 90-acre vineyard has produced an attractive, light wine. Fruity with red-berry flavors, it is already soft and fresh. Acidity and touches of tannin are balanced enough for the wine to be ready to drink.
title: Vieux Château des Combes 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: A light and rather stalky wine from the flat plain close to the Dordogne river. It has some black currant flavors that are firmed out by dry tannins. The aftertaste is fresh and juicy.
title: Château Joly 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Tannins and structure bring out the character of the 2010 vintage in this open, generally soft wine. It is already attractive, drinkable and fresh. Black currants dominate the natural fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 Fleur de Roc  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This very ripe wine is structured with considerable new-wood flavors. It's hard, tannic and extracted, missing a sense of fruitiness.
title: Château Fombrauge 2009 Magrez Fombrauge  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Stalky in character, this has black currant fruits on a lean structure. The wood is not yet fully integrated and the wine could well flesh out in a couple of years.
title: Château Béard la Chapelle 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Heavy bottles and heavy extract seem to go together; proving the point is this wine. Heavy toast dominates the berry fruit. The normal wine from Cheval Noir is much more attractive.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château Cheval Noir Le Fer  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A top Cuvée from Château Cheval Noir, with wood dominating the plum juice fruits. It is tough, the tannins giving considerable dryness, while the fruit behind seems lightweight.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Château Cheval Noir Le Fer  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Very fresh, with well-judged wood and very juicy fruit, a wine that is almost shocking in its youthful acidity. It bursts in the mouth, fruit and bright.
title: Château de Fonbel 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: Barrel aged for 12 months, this 95% Merlot wine (with a dash of Cabernet Franc) is very dominated by its wood. That gives it a seriously toasty character that dominates the fruit. At five years old, it should be more balanced.
title: Château Valade 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: It is fascinating how some wines from this vintage have gone from youth to old age without passing maturity. That's the case here: this wine is showing age, with tannins that have become dry, leaving the secondary flavors, let alone the fruit, behind.
title: Château Montlisse 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: There's good density here. This wine shows plenty of ripe Merlot fruit flavors, jammy, lifted with dried fruits and blackberries. It's a rounded, ripe wine, but shot through with a curious, unbalanced, very dry wood element.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2005 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Ripe, sweet and easy, with dried fruit flavors, some ripe fruit and light tannins. Perfumed and attractive; there's just a touch of bitterness from the wood.
title: Jean-Pierre Moueix 2003  Saint-Émilion

description: A much less dense wine than either '95 or '96, reflecting the vintage. Red berry fruit aromas with dusty tobacco notes. Lighter, juicy mouthfeel with chocolate and leather notes. Mildly drying finish. Well-made but light, with a definite herbaceous quality.
title: Château Haut-Beauséjour 1997 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: This is a dark and probably too-tannic wine. A very dry, extracted character gives bitterness more than fruit. It's still young and has the Saint-Estéphe tannins in abundance, although its future with this dryness is uncertain.
title: Château Tour des Termes 2012  Saint-Estéphe

description: A core of dry tannins and an austere edge give a wine that is hard to like. There is some attractive berry fruit, but it is caught up in the hard character.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château Picard  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: Highly juicy wine, packed with tannins as well as black currants and red berries. Green pepper, spice and high acidity are strongly present.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Château Picard  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: A second label of the famous second growth, Chateau Gruaud Larose, this wine offers charming scents of cherries, cedar and herb, but clamps down on the palate with dusty, slightly drying tannins that don't appear to have the depth of fruit to support them for long-term aging. Drink over the next few years with rare beef or lamb to help rein in the tannins.
title: Chevalier de Gruaud 2000  Saint-Julien

description: The wine's stalky character, acidity and black-currants are lit by light tannins. It is likely to age quickly, and be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Penin 2015 Cabernet Franc by Château Penin  (Bordeaux)

description: The branded wine from Domaines Lapalu (owner of Château Patache d'Aux) is a soft, clean, black currant-flavored Cabernet. The tannins show a mineral, tight edge, but the wine is on the light side.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2007 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: A fresh, fruity branded Bordeaux from the producers of Château Patache d'Aux. It has friendly, approachable fruit, with light wood, good ripe plums and berries and a firm, but juicy finish.
title: La Patache 2006  Médoc

description: This young wine is full of black currant fruit and balanced tannins. It has the richness of high alcohol, which brings out a touch of pepper. But juicy fruit dominates. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand Meynau 2016  Bordeaux

description: Soft and bright with red berry fruit, this is a warm, open and easy wine. It has a gentle texture and just enough tannins to give it shape. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Florian 2016  Bordeaux

description: Juicy fruits and soft tannins give a light wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Châteaul le Lion d'or 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine shows the richness of the vintage while also showing some firm extracted tannins. At this stage, the wine is too dry and firm. Give it until 2018 for a little softening.
title: Château des Arnauds 2015  Bordeaux

description: Despite its heavy bottle, this is not a wine for aging. It's been made deliberately soft and fruity without any wood aging. Red berry fruits have a light acidity and only hints of a structure. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013 Cuvée SL  (Bordeaux)

description: This solidly tannic wine is largely balanced by ample fruit. Perfumed and smoky, but with its dry wood and firm, extracted tannins, it is likely always to be a dry wine.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

description: Firmly structured, this has a dry core that's solidly based on smoky tannins. The fruit is holding back, although in a few months the blackberry flavor should surface. The finish retains the dry, firm character of the wine.
title: Duval & Blanchet 2010 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

description: Solid, chunky and dense, this shows a rich character based around dark tannins. It has a ripe black-plum flavor and juicy acidity on the finish.
title: Duval & Blanchet 2009 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

description: This estate, in the center of the Entre-deux-Mers region, has produced a successful wine in this warm vintage. The 100% Merlot delivers great fruit while allowing a place for dry tannins. The wine has a lightness to it and is ready to drink.
title: Château de Jad 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine's smooth texture is soft, velvety, needing tannins to give it a sense of shape. As it tastes in the mouth now, it shows pleasant sweet berry flavors and a dense mouthfeel. In the end, it is an easy-drinking, early maturing wine.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2005 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Called authentic because there is no added sulphur, this wine is all fruit, without any wood aging. On the palate, it is juicy, packed with acidity and red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out a metallic, tight edge to the wine.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2016 L'Authentique  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A ripe, very smooth second wine of Château Siaurac, rich while still full of fresh fruit that already shows elegance and a light touch. The wine is likely to age well and soon, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Siaurac 2011 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Bordeaux wine should not have high alcohol; it detracts from the play between fruit and tannins, as in this wine. It is powered by its extracted structure, with flavors of bitter chocolate that leave the fruit behind.
title: Château des Landes 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Light, fresh, fruity wine, with a smoky complexity. The acidity and red currants are more intense than the dry structure. The whole wine is tight, stalky, finishing with toughness.
title: Château Tour Robert 2006  Pomerol

description: Tight red currants and soft tannins give a wine that is bright and packed with fruitiness. The blend of 80% Merlot with Cabernet Sauvignon is lightly oaked, but mainly fruity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Maroutine 2015  Bordeaux

description: Firm, tannic and dry, this wine has some flashes of fresh black currant flavors, and a lift of acidity. It needs time to aerate before drinking, when it will have some freshness and lightness.
title: Ginestet 2004 French Roots Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: Fruity and lightly spicy from wood aging, this wine has black fruit aromas. It's lightly tannic, with just enough structure to make it an early-drinking wine. Drink now.
title: Château Haut Peyruguet 2016  Bordeaux

description: This ripe, rich wine has solid tannins and still-young blackberry fruit. Although a basic Bordeaux, it is extra rich and extracted and, surprisingly, needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Calvet 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine comes from a southfacing hillside vineyard not far from Pomerol. An unusual blend for Bordeaux, with 80% Merlot and 20% Malbec, it is fresh and perfumed, with firm tannins and black-currant flavors. Although it comes from the poorly rated 1999 vintage, it has good, ripe fruit. Like so many Bordeaux, this is a food wine, great with steaks.
title: Domaine du Bouscat 1999 Cuvée Gargone  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Dark in color, with a bit of lemony oak to the nose as well as chocolate and black plum. The palate is a basic Bordeaux mix of cassis, earth, plum and tree bark. The clean, smooth finish confirms the wine's ripeness. A good middle-of-the-road red for everyday affairs.
title: Château d'Agassac 2000 Mis en bouteille au Chateau  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Firm tannins are the hallmark of this wine that has weight as well as ripe black fruits. Made with 91% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc, it has a dry core although the ample fruit will balance the wine as it ages. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Gigault 2016 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This spicy wine shows a considerable amount of wood aging that has dried up the fruit. The richness might redeem it. Wait until 2022.
title: Château Haut Canteloup 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine has attractive red berry flavors and soft tannins. It is ripe, with plenty of fresh acidity to brighten up the warm texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Strawberry fruits and sweet tannins are all of a piece in this jammy wine. The tannins are a soft hint in the background as this bottling develops into a wine for drinking early, certainly from 2020.
title: Château Jussas 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and dry, this wine still has plenty of hints of the fruit to come. Juicy blackberry flavors are developing to balance the dense structure. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2016 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A ripe and juicy wood-aged wine, this is rich in berry fruits as well as solid tannins. The balance of the wine is coming together well, offering the potential of generous structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Cabut 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe berry fruits dominate this richly tannic wine. It has richness, concentration and a structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Grand Mazerolles 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Stored for six months in tanks, this wine is fruity and juicy, with soft tannins. Already attractive and developing well, it has weight and boasts the ripeness of the vintage, delivering a juicy aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château Ségonzac 2016 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: As with so many wines from Blaye, this is dominated by Merlot. That gives a ripe full wine that is spicy and full of black-plum fruits. Firm tannins still show through the fruits that are balanced by acidity. The wine still needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château des Tourtes 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a wine full of red currant and blackberry flavors. It does have a tannic structure that will allow the wine to develop along with the acidity. In the family for three-generations, the estate is now run by Denis Hazane. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Roseraie 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is firm, with dense fruits and ripe tannins. It has concentration as well as plenty of red fruits. Drink this potentially rich wine from Alliance Bourg from 2018.
title: Château Saint Urbain 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Fresh and fruity, Jacques Chardat's wine is packed with red-berry fruit along with a dry core. The tannins and acidity will develop well as the wine ages to produce a ripe, fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Labrousse 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is structured with firm tannins as well as ripe fruit. Juicy and concentrated, it has a spicy character that comes from the wood aging. In the Mayé Eymery family since 1854, the wine is from six parcels on the estate. Give this fresh as well as rich wine until 2019.
title: Château la Voie 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Winemaker Madeleine Jautard has produced a soft, juicy wine, packed with ripe fruits. There is a touch of spice as well to give the wine its structure. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine from 96% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon that has plenty of fruit. With some firm tannins as well as concentrated blackberry fruit, it is going to be a fine wine. It was created under the direction of consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt's team. Start drinking from 2019.
title: Château Gigault 2014 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is dry, dense although with a fine fruity potential. Underneath the dry texture, the wine is full of black-currant fruitiness. The vineyard is managed by Jacques Chardat and winemaking by Grégory Dalla Longa. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is structured with concentrated tannins and dense fruit. It has spice, wood-aging flavors and a firm aftertaste. That means the wine needs time, so wait until 2019.
title: Haut Peyrefaure 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is ripe and potentially rich, but is firm at this stage. With its dark tannins and dense structure, it will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château Crusquet Sabourin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a soft, fruity 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon wine. With gentle tannins and red fruit flavors, it is developing well, becoming a juicy and fruity wine.
title: Maison Bouey 2014 Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is packed with toasty wood flavors that give it a bitter character. The wood masks the fruit although there are hints of black-currant freshness. The wine needs time to come together, so wait until 2019.
title: Château Monconseil Gazin 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bernard Larrat's wine is dry at this stage, although with hints of ripe black-currant fruit and acidity. The potential is there with juicy flavors and fruitiness already developing well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Larrat 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Still dominated by its tannins, this is a full, structured wine. Dense and with fragrant acidity and black currant flavors, it has a way to go before it is ready to drink. Wait until 2017. The estate is an Alliance Bourg co-operative member.
title: Grand Bourgeau 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Darkly tannic, this wine has a dense structure that needs time. It is firm, dry and concentrated. The fruit potential is still developing so keep this wine until 2017. Enologist Sebastien and vineyard manager Nicolas are the latest generation managing the Carreau family estates.
title: Château Clairac 2012 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full of delicious fruits, this is a bright, red berry blend of Merlot (90%) and Malbec (10%). It has lively acidity allied to a more formal tannic structure that gives a firm, age-worthy feel to the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Belle Coline 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Night harvesting on the highest hill in Blaye is tricky but the Chety family pulls it off. Ripe and juicy, this is a ready-to-drink wine. It has berry fruits cut with acidity and with a firm line in spicy wood from barrels one- to three-years-old. The tannins give a solid foundation and aging potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Colombier 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has a hard extracted edge, with bitter tannins that are dominating the fruitiness. It needs to soften and bring out the berry fruits, although the wine will always have a tough character.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2012 Elegance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: An attractively aromatic wine, full of open fruitiness. It has layers of black currant fruit that go with the fresh acidity, plus a touch of herbs that are followed by firm tannins. Juicy and ready to drink from 2015.
title: Château Crusquet de Lagarcie 2009  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A dry, tannic wine that is firmly structured. A sense of extraction masks the light and fresh black currant fruitiness. Give it until 2017 to soften.
title: Château la Valade 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big, fruity and juicy, this is a wine for drinking soon. It has lively acidity, a strong black-currant fruit character and light tannins. Already well integrated, it's a wine that accentuates freshness.
title: Château Cantinot 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Possibly too rich, this is a full, sumptuous wine. It has great weight, density, a smooth, wood-aged character that shows through the sweet plums. For what it is, a very rich wine that shows some pepper alcohol-it offers a juicy character and ageability. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Canteloup 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With ample acidity and juicy black fruit, this is a light, refreshing, already fragrant wine. It's bright and lively, just hinting at black chocolate and blackberry fruit.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This mint- and new-wood-flavored wine boasts ripe tannins and lush fruit. It feels weighty, perhaps almost too rich, while the tannins have a bitter-chocolate edge to them.
title: Château du Bailli 2010 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dusty tannins push to the front, resulting in a firm, wood-aged wine that shows smokiness, ripe blackberry flavors and a firm core. This should be at its best in 2-3 years.
title: Château Maison Neuve 2010 Clotilde  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine has a smoky character and a subtle touch of wood, along with firm tannins and red fruits. Age this for 1-2 years.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Initially dominated by wood, then the ripe jammy fruit comes through to give a soft, rich wine, with bitter chocolate as well as red fruit flavors.
title: Château Bel Enclos 2009 Cuvée Evidence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Smoky, toasty aromas set the scene for a wine that has obviously seen plenty of wood aging. At this stage, it's all spice and wood, which will probably inhibit its development. Wait until 2020.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This blend includes 70% Merlot and a small (2%) amount of Malbec. Ripe blackberry fruit dominates, but it also has structure. It's likely to develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Fleur de Plaisance 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is smoky and juicy, with swathes of attractive black currant fruit. It's lightly structured, crisp and likely to age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine, with its blackberry fruit, is ripe, generous and developing fast. A fine juicy character bursts through its firm structure to give a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Canteloup 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: One of a range of wines produced by the Château Lafite-Rothschild winemaking team, this bottling is generous, ripe and juicy. Its black-currant fruits, soft tannins and open texture mean it is almost ready to enjoy. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2016 Légende  (Bordeaux)

description: Eighteen months in wood was perhaps too much for this wine. It is now dominated by toasty wood flavors and dense tannins. Spice, pepper and a bitter edge come before the fruitiness. It will soften, but it seems that woodiness will always be there.
title: Château la Faviére 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine has potential, bringing together ripe fruits and soft tannins. Its acidity and dry core will allow it to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Bouchet 2016 La Rentiére  (Bordeaux)

description: This juicy, fruity wine from the André Lurton group offers attractive red fruits and plenty of acidity. It has a poised, light feel, crisp and lightly textured at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour de Bonnet 2016  Bordeaux

description: An attractive smoky aroma is followed by ripe tannins and juicy black-currant fruit. The wine is fresh and fruity, with gentle tannins that will soften soon. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Moulin de Vignolle 2016  Bordeaux

description: This fresh, fruity wine has good acidity and soft tannins. The attractive juicy character partners with a backbone of tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux)

description: This smoky, meaty wine offers solid tannins and high-toast, burnt flavors. Luckily the fruit is there and should shine through the structure as the wine develops. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Le Bonalguet 2016  Bordeaux

description: This wine is structured and firm, with dark tannins and a core of smoky, bitter flavors. Let this wine rest for the potential of its black fruits to shine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Bel Air La Perriére 2016  Bordeaux

description: One of several Bordeaux chateaus that are followed by the Univitis cooperative, this wine has the generosity to be expected from this ripe vintage. Firm tannins will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2019.
title: Univitis 2015 Château les Vergnes  (Bordeaux)

description: Some grower members of this cooperative have vines in Bordeaux and this wine comes from those vineyards. It is soft, dominated by the red fruits of Merlot and set to be drinkable in 2019.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2016 La Loge  (Bordeaux)

description: The smart presentation-split label, fancy lettering-gives a good first impression to this well-made, easy-drinking Bordeaux. It has soft, ripe fruit, light tannins and flavors of mulberries. It is already mature.
title: Chateau Lacombe 2000 Bordeaux Haut-Benauge  (Bordeaux)

description: When Jean-Luc Thunevin, master garagiste and creator of Saint-Emilion Château Valandraud, gets his hands on making a branded Bordeaux wine, it's worth taking notice. And this Merlot-dominated wine, distributed jointly with Bordeaux négociant Calvet, is the sort of wine that simple Bordeaux should taste like. It is smooth, ripe, concentrated, packed with red berries and attractive, forward fruit flavors, and yet with just the right layer of tannin to make a fine food partner. There is nothing complicated-leave that to the grand Châteaux. This is just a great drink.
title: Domaine Calvet-Thunevin 2004 Présidial  (Bordeaux)

description: Branded Bordeaux has a deservedly spotty reputation, but this year's Mouton Cadet aims to start turning that around. Cherries and chocolate on the nose, followed by smoky, earthy tobacco and black-cherry flavors. A silky texture makes it ready to drink now.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2002 Mouton Cadet Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: A soft wine, with ripe fruit and sweet wood aromas. The fruit is ripe, with a rich, juicy character and sweet fruit flavors. This is a wine that's already ready to drink.
title: Château Bonnet 1999 Reserve Bordeaux Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: "Old vines" means different things to different people. In this case, the fruit comes from vines that average 25-30 years old in the Cotes du Bourg and the Cotes du Blaye. The wine is fruit-focused (black cherries and cassis) but relatively light-bodied, finishing with lemony acids.
title: Malesan 1999 Vielles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: A négociant bottling from the ubiquitous Yvon Mau, this wine proudly boasts élevé en futs du chene on the label. You can certainly notice it in the cedary aromas and flavors, but it's adequately balanced by cassis and tobacco flavors. The fruit tastes a touch overripe, but it seems to work well here.
title: Premius 1998  Bordeaux

description: A Merlot-Cabernet blend that starts out a little awkward and then really finds its legs. This is a perfect "beginner's" Bordeaux, in that it's fruity, clean and precise. The lack of complexity and high-end nuances doesn't hurt it at all. A little overoaked, but with airing out it tastes quite good. And it has the stuffing to match with hearty foods. Best Buy.
title: Marquis de Chasse 1997 Bordeaux Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: Puts to shame a lot of California wines in the same price category. It has earthy, mushroomy and dried black-cherry aromas, with the same flavors. Soft and drinking well now, and will hold over the next three to four years.
title: LaCour Pavillon 1996  Bordeaux

description: This is a balanced wine with fine young tannins and plenty of blackberry and black-plum fruits. It is ripe while keeping plenty of acidity. The wine is going to develop well and should be ready from 2019.
title: Château Bel Orme Martial 2015  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and structured, this is a concentrated wine. Its blackberry fruits are powerful and dense with tannins as well as acidity. It will take some time for the juiciness to really show, so wait until late 2018.
title: Château Lauzanet 2015  Bordeaux

description: A fruity, perfumed wine that has attractive acidity as well as spice. The black currant fruit gives the wine a crisp edge as well as an easy approachability. Drink now.
title: Château Haut Pougnan 2015  Bordeaux

description: A bright and juicy wine, this has good potential. Its red-berry fruits are right up front along with some light tannins. Drink this fruity wine from 2018.
title: Château Lamothe Castera 2015  Bordeaux

description: This dense wine has ripe tannins and generous fruits. Its black-fruit flavors are full of spice and acidity with a crisp texture. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Lary 2015  Bordeaux

description: While this wine is firm at the moment, it does have fine black fruits. The acidity from the blackberry fruitiness is going to balance with the tannins shortly to give a ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Briot 2015  Bordeaux

description: Lightly stalky because it is still young, this wine otherwise promises rich black-currant fruitiness as it matures. It is balanced, ripe and with a gentle set of tannins in the background. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Tour Chapoux 2015  Bordeaux

description: This attractive fruity wine is full of young black-currant and red-berry fruits. The tannins mingle with spice to give a contrast to the aura of fruitiness surrounding the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Pasquet 2015  Bordeaux

description: This juicy, wood-aged Pierre Lurton wine has very ripe fruit. That gives it richness with black-plum fruits and a dense texture. A bitter coffee flavor shows through the fruit. It needs time, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Marjosse 2015  Bordeaux

description: Fruity and with fine tannins, this wine is already tasting good. It has juicy acidity, lots of ripe tannins and black-currant fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Haut Pingat 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine with generous black fruits and crisp acidity. It is balanced-fruity with a core of tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is firm with tannins as well as black-currant fruit. It does have a juicy edge that will develop well as it matures. Drink this potentially attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Jarr 2015  Bordeaux

description: Solidly structured, this is a dense wine. Its black fruits add to the density, giving a concentrated, fruity wine. Drink this starting from mid-2018.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux

description: This young wine is so full of fruit. Blackberry and delicious acidity combine with some light tannins to bring out the charm of this fine vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Taussin 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a light wine with bright acidity and red fruit flavors. It has a mere touch of tannin to give structure to the crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Vieux Porier 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine that is almost mature. With generous black fruits and tannins that are integrated into the texture, the wine is ripe and fruity. The acidity is still there, giving a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Laubés 2010  Bordeaux

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, easy and fruity wine. It has light tannins, juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is still young, showing off its fruitiness and will be ready to drink soon, from early 2017.
title: Château Champ du Moulin 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is full of bright fruit and acidity. It does still have a dry tannic core that gives it a firm character. The juicy acidity and crisp texture show it is still young. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Tour Chapoux 2014  Bordeaux

description: Situated at the highest point of the Entre-deux-Mers region, the estate is dominated by the ripe Merlot in this wine. It is fruity and soft with lively acidity and gentle tannins. There is a touch of wood from the aging, although the fruitiness is what this wine is about. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe bold Merlot creates a wine that has spice, juicy black-plum flavors and a core of tannin. It is a young wine, full of fruit, with a soft aftertaste. It was made to be drunk from early 2017.
title: Maison Givas 2015 Vin No. 03  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a fresh wine that has just the right balance between spicy wood and red-currant fruits. With its acidity and crisp character, it is going to be a bright, fruity wine from 2017.
title: Chateau la Rame 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is fruity with just the right amount of tannic structure. It has spice and some firm toasty wood flavors in the background. Let the wine open up and drink from 2017.
title: Château Laubes 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and juicy with some smoky tannins in support. It has a finely perfumed character although the touches of extraction give it a bitter edge. That should blow by, leaving an attractive, fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2014  Bordeaux

description: Fruity while also structured, this is a solid wine. It has juicy acidity, ripe red fruit and layers of spicy toasty wood. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2014 Les Hauts de Sainte Marie  (Bordeaux)

description: Fresh and juicy, this is a spicy lightly tannic wine. It has a rich ripe character that boost the red-berry fruits and acidity. The structure is still a little young, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2014  Bordeaux

description: Spice and some firm tannins mark this wine. It has a red-fruit character as well as a more earthy backdrop. With its structure it will need to sit until 2017.
title: Château Malbat 2014 Optimus  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all fruit with just the lightest tannins. It has great acidity, a lively red -ruit character and intense freshness. Drink this wine now.
title: Château les Arromans 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a fresh wine that has been aged in tanks, retaining its bright red fruits and lively acidity. It is still young although it will develop quickly to give a soft fruit-driven wine.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2015  Bordeaux

description: With almost four years of aging, this has become a smooth fruity wine. It still has tannins that are filled out by the blackberry fruits and velvet texture of the 85% Merlot in the blend. The wine is ready to drink from now and until 2020.
title: Château les Grands Thibauds 2012  Bordeaux

description: Produced by the family that owns Château la Gaffeliére in Saint-Émilion, this is a fruity, smoky and lightly stalky wine. It is red and blackberry fruits that are structured with easy tannins that just give shape to the wine. Drink now.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2012 Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére  (Bordeaux)

description: From vineyards in the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux, this Fontana family wine has a dry core surrounded by ripe, fresh fruit. It is still young and should age, certainly until 2017.
title: Château Haut Clairbes 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A little aging has given this ripe wine a smooth character and warm berry flavors. Smoky character from the wood aging adds complexity, while the acidity keeps the wine fresh and fruity at the end. Drink now.
title: Château Nicot 2012  Bordeaux

description: In this broad wine, the grapes have been harvested ripe and juicy. It has a fresh acidity typical of the vintage. The red berry and black currant fruit flavors are forward and well balanced, with a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Pierrousselle 2013  Bordeaux

description: Still young, this rich wine has a stalky character that contrasts with the ripe black currant flavors and good acidity. With a few months aging, this will fill out and be an attractive and fruity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2014  Bordeaux

description: While this wine does have firm tannins, it also offers a ripe, fruity backdrop that will develop. At the moment, the wine is dry and dense. Give it a few months for the red fruits to broaden out. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine has structure, with ripe red fruits and a good layer of tannin. Despite a difficult year in Bordeaux, the Queyrens family created a balanced wine with the acidity showing brightly through the firm, still-young texture. It could do with a few more months of aging so drink from 2016.
designation: Les Hauts de Massonne du Château Pilet
title: Château Pilet 2013 Les Hauts de Massonne du Château Pilet  (Bordeaux)

description: The layer of tannins verges on too much. It is saved by ripe fruit that cuts through to give a warm, red currant and berry freshness. Acidity is well in balance in this wine that needs a few months to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Ballan-Larquette 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine is soft and fruity. A core of drier tannins is surrounded by attractive, fleshy, smoky black plums that are lifted with acidity. Red fruit at the end adds a fresh aftertaste.
title: Château les Pasquets 2014  Bordeaux

description: An exceptional value for a Bordeaux, this is ripe, full and fruity. Smoky tannins and juicy black currant flavors are bright and generous. It will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: Calling a wine romantic is perhaps a new approach for Bordeaux. The wine itself is ripe and jammy, with wood tannins that will be softer in a year. Drink from 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Romantique  (Bordeaux)

description: In the south of the Entre deux Mers region, this old property has produced a fruity, wood-aged wine. It has spice, smoky tannins and attractive, balanced black currant fruits. It's likely to age over the medium-term, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2012  Bordeaux

description: This offers soft, ripe fruit with acidity, delicious forward tannins and cherry flavors. Bright and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Pezat 2012  Bordeaux

description: A red blend from the eastern end of the Entre deux Mers region, this is a smooth and already accessible wine. Attractive black fruits and soft tannins accompany touches of vanilla. It's ready to drink.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Luna B  (Bordeaux)

description: This solid, wood-aged wine is a step up from the standard Mouton Cadet blend. Dense and tannic, it offers a good core of black and red fruits and acidity. Made to be drunk young, it could still age until 2016.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Réserve Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: There is plenty of fruit here, juicy red berries and acidity. The tannins still need time to soften to give the wine a sense of fruit and character. Wait until 2016.
title: Domaine du Cheval Blanc 2012  Bordeaux

description: Juicy and very fruity, the wine is packed with red berry flavors and acidity. A touch of spice adds interest. The end is all about the crisp fruits and the lively, fresh character.
title: Dourthe 2012 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux)

description: This fruity wine also has some structure. Balanced with touches of wood as well as red berry and damson fruits, it has acidity and a firm texture in the background. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: A forward, fruity wine that just hints at spice and toast. It is broad and ripe, with plenty of berry fruits and acidity well in balance. It's developing fast and will be ready to drink from late 2015.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine is rich, full of berry fruits that are also touched by damsons. It has spice, some toast and a smooth texture. Plenty of jammy fruit indicate good potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Penin 2012 Natur  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is rich with generous red berry fruit flavors and balanced acidity. The tannins have been smoothed and given a round character, full of both fruit and a ripe structure.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a juicy, fruity wine with a touch of spice. The wood aging is still showing strongly, imparting a smoky character. Black currant fruits are just as important and they give the wine its bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Bonnet 2011  Bordeaux

description: Showing firm tannins and structure this is currently a tough wine. It has a solid character although plenty of hints of juicy red berry fruits are ready to come out as the wine ages. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Bellevue 2012  Bordeaux

description: Still young and fruity, this is a bright, crisp wine packed with red berry fruit flavors. A smoky character underlies the fruit, allowing some toast and spice to come through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mazetier 2012 Tradition  (Bordeaux)

description: This fruity wine is laden with red berries and acidity. The structure is ancillary to the fruit thrust, giving a base for the attractive fresh character and the freshness of the aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Mémoires 2012  Bordeaux

description: This dense, wood-laden wine has ripe spice and dark tannins. It's heavy with wood as well as black currant fruits and acidity. It is young and needs time to integrate, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2013  Bordeaux

description: This is ready to drink with its ripe black fruits and soft structure. A tannic edge keeps the berry fruits in order, allowing the juicy acidity also to shine. At the end, the wood aging shows along with the black currant fruit.
title: Château des Combes 2011  Bordeaux

description: This fruity, light and fresh wine offers easy tannins and red berry fruits. It's rounded and juicy, smoothed by wood aging that gives it a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 Prestige de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: Obviously young and still showing the brief wood aging, this is an attractive and juicy wine with ripe red berry fruits, spice from the wood and a soft texture. It should be ready to drink by 2015.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2012 Cuvée Michael  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with rich strawberry flavor. Light tannins and just the right amount of acidity make it fresh, juicy and already attractive.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

description: Firm and solid, this wine is more tannin than fruit at this stage. It does have some weight and acidity to it, showing potential for blackberry fruitiness with age.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2011  Bordeaux

description: Very fruity and fragrant, this is an attractive wine that shows potential. It has good acidity, firm tannins and fresh black-currant flavor. Drink this wine after two more years.
title: Château Saint-Sulpice 2011  Bordeaux

description: A very dry, firm wine, with some chocolate extract flavors and signs of wood aging, both balanced by stalky black currant fruits. It is hard at present, so give it until 2014.
title: Château le Breton 2012 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This firm wine has black-currant and red-plum fruit, nicely integrated with the dry core. Ready to drink, although capable of aging a year or two.
title: Château Grand Marchand 2011  Bordeaux

description: Firm and closed, young and tannic, this is a wine that definitely needs time. For the moment, the fruit is still waiting underneath the dry exterior. Give it 3-4 years.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2011  Bordeaux

description: One of the labels from the Bonnet vineyard of André Lurton, this red follows the approachable, fruity style of these wines. Red berry fruits and soft tannins make it already drinkable.
title: Château Tour de Bonnet 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is the blended Bordeaux from Calvet, one of the oldest wine names in the city. It's full and ripe, a rounded wine that has good berry fruits as well as a drier, firmer core. At the end, a more smoky character appears.
title: Calvet 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This fruity, ready-to-drink selection is packed with black currant and berry flavors that are ripe and structured. The wine has some firm tannins, though its perfumed character makes it ready to drink now.
title: Exem 2010  Bordeaux

description: With its strong tannins, the dark and dry side of this wine dominates. But the weight of the blackberry fruit follows behind, promising a richer, rounder future after 2-3 years of aging.
title: Château les Vergnes 2009  Bordeaux

description: Firm wood and mint flavors push through the ripe black-currant note, producing a wine that has both structure and fruit. It's ready to drink, although it could age a year.
title: Dourthe 2010  Bordeaux

description: Fruity and lightweight, this is softly tannic, with red fruit flavors. It's open and juicy, confirming that this is not a wine for more than medium-term aging.
title: Château Briot 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a solidly structured wine, with dry tannins that power through the acidity and black currant flavor. There is a sense of concentration, and the juicy acidity layers over the dark, dense character.
title: Château les Ancres 2009  Bordeaux

description: A soft and ripe wine, this is dominated by round, juicy Merlot. It's a fruity selection, with soft tannins that add just enough structure to the open and drinkable character. Ready now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: In this soft, ripe wine, the structure is comfortably buried in the rich black fruits. It's warm, ripe and spicy, with a line of acidity coming through on the finish.
title: Château Tour Chapoux 2010  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine is attractive, soft and ready to drink. It has lifted acidity, a black currant flavor, and a fine spicy character. Ready to drink.
title: Château Portillon 2010  Bordeaux

description: This has ripe red fruits, with a fine line of acidity cutting through its rich texture. It is full and fruity, and the tannins act as good support for the forward fruit flavors.
title: Château Nicot 2009  Bordeaux

description: Fragrant and fruity, this has red berry notes that bond easily with the soft tannins. A mere touch of wood spice gives the wine an extra edge. Fruity and ripe, ready to drink soon.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2010  Bordeaux

description: A finely tannic and structured wine, this brings out the firm edge of 2010 while also offering a generous black-currant note. It is well balanced, and the vibrant acidity on the finish lends lift.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Le Bordeaux de Bernard Magrez  (Bordeaux)

description: A wine from the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux, this is light, fruity and fresh in character. Its red berry flavors dominate, with acidity providing a fine counter-balance to the ripe fruitiness.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2010  Bordeaux

description: With wood and black currant aromas, this is a soft, ripe and ready to drink wine. It has a rich texture, with a smokiness and black fruits that are smoothed by wood and lifted by acidity.
title: Château Grand Bireau 2010  Bordeaux

description: Perfumed wine, full of up-front red berry fruits, soft tannins and juicy, smoky acidity. It lacks depth, but is rich from the vintage, with an attractive, smooth aftertaste.
title: Château de Fontenille 2009  Bordeaux

description: An attractive wine with black currant fruit. It walks a tight balance between fresh fruit and dry structure. Just right for the red meats in its name.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 The Pairing Collection Chops & Burgers  (Bordeaux)

description: Balanced, ready-to-drink wine with attractive, ripe red fruits and good acidity. It is fresh, the tannins giving an enjoyable firmness to an otherwise fruity wine.
title: La Croix de Renaud 2009  Bordeaux

description: Benefiting from the ripe 2009 fruit, this shows the attractive character of many value Bordeaux wines in this year. It has red plum fruits, touched with raisins along with toast, acidity and a balance of tannins.
title: Château des Combes 2009  Bordeaux

description: Attractively fruity, with plenty of red berry and black cherry flavors. Along with the fruit, the tannins and spice round out the texture, giving a final velvet feel.
title: Château de Fontenille 2008  Bordeaux

description: A well-made, fresh wine, wearing its black currant and berry fruit easily, to give good depth of flavor. The structure is muted, but the whole wine is well balanced, and ready to drink.
title: Château de Fontenille 2006  Bordeaux

description: A soft, smooth wine, light on tannins and rich in berry fruits, this immediately approachable. With its generous texture and final acidity, it is ready to drink now.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2016 Estey  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine offers flavors of black currants and fresh berries, with a slightly stalky undertone. It has the juicy, jammy fruit of the vintage as well as plenty of acidity. Spice and vanilla come through to balance the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Catherine 2015 Château de Foucaud  (Bordeaux)

description: With bright red fruits and crisp acidity, this wine sums up the fruitiness of this vintage. A dry edge balances the red-currant fruit and acidity. Attractive now, it will be better from 2018.
title: Château Guillebot Plaisance 2014  Bordeaux

description: This ripe organic wine has benefited from the fine 2016 vintage to give rich black fruit and plenty of firm tannins. At its heart are berry flavors and acidity. It will age well over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lagarde 2016 Les Hauts de Lagarde  (Bordeaux)

description: This soft and fruity wine was produced from vines between Bourg and Blaye. A perfumed, floral aroma makes it bright and fruity. Its black currant flavors are twisted by tannins and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Fleur la Forge 2015  Bordeaux

description: Produced from organic grapes, this lightly structured wine is full of black currant fruitiness. With a touch of spice from wood aging, it's soft and easy to drink now.
title: Château la Guillaumette 2015  Bordeaux

description: From a 34-acre property in the Entre-deux-Mers region, this wine shows how successful even the lesser lights of Bordeaux have been in 2005. It has richness, full cassis and ripe tannins. It is simple, relying on its fruit and its approachability, and succeeding admirably.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Château Paradis-Casseuil  (Bordeaux)

description: Fresh wine, with a layer of wood that smoothes out the crisp black currant fruits and stalky tannins. The acidity is certainly very present, but the wine does have some richness and depth of juicy flavor.
title: Château Larroque 2005  Bordeaux

description: A solid, structured Bordeaux. It shows black berry fruit flavors, lifted by acidity and rounded with dark plum, dry spice and firm tannins. There's a fine, juicy richness to the finish, which leaves fruit and dry tannins firmly in place.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is overpowering, almost too much. The fruit is so rich it feels overextracted, superjuicy and then hit with tannins and new wood. For those who like superconcentrated wines, this will be a big hit, but not with food.
title: L'Egrégoire 2004  Bordeaux

description: This is the second wine of Château Balestard, and there are suggestions of high extraction and very ripe fruit. It does have balance, however, the black fruits need time to calm down. The acidity is all here, offering freshness to this rich wine.
title: Château Lalande Balestard 2003  Bordeaux

description: A ripe, smooth, velvet-textured wine with great red berry fruit flavors aided by soft tannins.
title: Christian Moueix 2003 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Clairet means clear, and the resulting wine-a favorite of Eleanor of Aquitaine in the 13th century-is just lighter in color than a red. Crisp with a dry texture, this is a spicy wine. Its structure and tannins are balanced with acidity to give a rich wine that could age a few months. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château de Parenchére 2017  Bordeaux Clairet

description: With an edge of tannin and with sweet strawberry fruits, this Doublet family clairet is an attractive wine. Dark pink in color, it appears and tastes rich. With its peppery aftertaste, this has to be a wine designed for food.
title: Château Vignol 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This Clairet wine smells like a smoky red Bordeaux. It is woody in character with spice as well as red plum flavors. Think of this as a pale red wine and it makes sense. Drink from early 2016.
title: Château Guichot 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This ripe wine has attractively soft tannins and juicy, jammy red-berry flavors. It does have a dry core but the fruit is dominant. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This aromatic wine with fine fruits and rich tannins is still at an early stage in its development. It shows dryness as well as richness and needs a few years. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm and closed, this wine has a way to go. Solid tannins dominate and there is a strong sense of extraction and bitterness. The wine should soften, although the tannins will remain. Don't drink before 2022.
title: Château Maison Noble 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is beginning to brown at the edges, indicating its age. This Cuvée is mature although, typically for this vintage, it has not lost its tannins. Drink now, although it will have a tough edge.
title: Château Lagrave Paran 2011 Cuvée Geraldine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Bright red cherries and raspberries shine out of this attractive, light and jammy wine. Its tannins are well behaved behind all this fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château La Gabarre 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The vineyard for this wine lies in the far east of the Entre-Deux-Mers. It has produced a soft, fruity wine with gentle tannins and open fruitiness. The wine has attractive black-currant flavors and acidity along with a dry core that keeps everything together. Drink now.
title: Château Bois de Favereau 2015 Cuvée Jean Jules  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The fairy-tale castle of Camarsac, all turrets and grey stone, dominates its vineyard. The wine has a bright purple color. Aromas of black currants and herbs follow through to flavors that have a woody, stalky element along with the soft fruit. This is traditional red Bordeaux, and in a ripe year like 2000 it works.
title: Château de Camarsac 2000  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe smoky wine has fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruits. With its acidity, dusty texture and crisp aftertaste, it is not made for long aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Croix Mouton 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Structured and at the same time fruity, this is a wine with good potential. Its tannins and its acidity are balanced to give a warm wine that will be fine to drink from 2019.
title: Château Timberlay 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is balanced, structured and with some fine ripe black fruits. It is dense in its fruitiness and tannins. Give it until 2019 before drinking.
title: Château Haut Bessac 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is young, tight with tannins and with layers of intense acidity. Behind that, however, there is some smoky fruitiness that will come through. Drink from 2018.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château du Peuil  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Dusty tannins show the ripeness of the fruit in this wine. With its black-currant fruits and acidity, it is balanced and almost ready to drink.
title: Château Penin 2015 Grande Sélection  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Owned by Xavier Chassagnoux, who also has vineyards in Fronsac, this estate has produced a rich wine. It has the typical fruity character of the vintage with its soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berries are lightly supported by the open structure. Drink the wine now.
title: Château de Virecourt 2014 Cuvée Pillebourse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With 60% Merlot in the blend, this wine is packed with red fruits and crisp acidity as well as richer fruitcake flavors. It has some structure as well as its red-berry flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Named after the fortress at Blaye on the banks of the Gironde, the wine is easygoing and approachable. It has generous black-currant fruits, shot through with acidity, and is given structure by some dense tannins. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: A. de Luze et Fils 2015 La Belle Citadelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is firm with a dry core of tannins and a dark structure. With a juicy edge of black-currant fruit, it also has good potential and richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Montcabrier 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dry and smoky initially, this wine then fills out with ripe red-berry fruit and fine balanced acidity. Give this until 2018 to fully develop.
title: Château Floreal Laguens 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is tight, tannic and with spice and a red-fruit character. The wine is still very young with the fruit of the year masked by the tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is concentrated and structured. It has blackberry fruits that give weight as well as firm tannins both from fruit and from wood. As it develops, the wine will fill out with rich berry fruits and the tannins will soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is full of juicy acidity along with some attractive spice and light wood flavors. It is still developing and the fruit is too young, so give it until 2018.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2014 Costes du Château Feret Lambert  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is firm and structured although with enough fruit weight to give the wine a good potential for aging. Still full of young energy, it is going to develop balance.
title: Château Lajarre 2014 Cuvée Eléonore  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Spicy from the wood aging, this wine is rich, fruity and ready to drink. It has red fruit and acidity along with a smooth texture that gives it an attractive and ripe aftertaste.
title: Cap Royal 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is spicy and smoky. Its tannins and structure are likely to be well balanced with the fruit as they integrate. Give this wine until 2018.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2014 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Bright red-fruit aromas give this wine its signature fruitiness. Red currant and spice come together to give a crisp texture. The wine should be ready from 2018.
title: Château Panchille 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is bright and fruity with a youthful character of red-berry flavors. As this all calms down, the ripe fruit will show well, balanced by some firm tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This second red wine from the estate was aged in wood for six months. That shows in the smooth character of the ripe Merlot that dominates the blend. The wine is ripe with black-currant jelly fruits that are lifted by the acidity. Drink the wine young, from 2018.
title: Château Alta Gaïa 2012 No. 2  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a young wine that is ready to drink. It has just enough in the way of soft tannins to balance the juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is a fine example of the fruity side of the vintage.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a heavily Merlot dominated wine, hence the high alcohol. The effect, though, is of a wine that is fruity and with a crisp edge of black currant juice. It is young, spicy from wood aging and finishes with a stalky aftertaste.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Almost black in color, this is an equally dense wine in the mouth. At this stage, the wood aging and dry tannins are very present, so it does need time to bring out the juicy potential of the black currant flavors and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2014 Château de Monrecueil  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is ripe with black-currant flavors and a stalky texture. The dominant Merlot gives it rich character, while Cabernet Franc adds a perfumed, smoky flavor. Still structured, it will be ready from late 2016.
title: Château Macalan 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Produced mainly from Merlot with only 10% of Cabernet Sauvignon, this fat, juicy wine has red-berry flavors that are supported by dry tannins that are in the process of softening. Notes from the wood-aging also need to integrate. Drink from late 2016.
title: Domaine du Claouset 2012 Réserve du Claouset  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Tannins and a firm structure give this wine a firm character, but some smoky fruit offers a juicy alternative vision. With a ripe aftertaste, this wine will develop over the next few months. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Faviére 2013 Muse de la Faviére  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has a strongly tannic, dry character from the Malbec-inspired blend of 52% Merlot, 31% Malbec and 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. However the ripe blackberry fruits are match enough, giving ripe flavors with a squeeze of acidity and richness at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la France 2013 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has potential, with ripe berry fruits and soft tannins that are already well integrated. It is dense, showing a structure that will broaden out as the wine ages. Drink this juicy, fruity wine from Vignobles Dulon from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Petit Verdot blend has a tannic character, smoky flavors and a solid structure. It is also perfumed with ripe berry fruits and a juicy taste that is developing behind the firm tannins. It's made by the same team as the Médoc Cru Bourgeois Haut Breton Larigaudiére. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tayet 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Behind the tannins, the fruit is beginning to broaden out and become rich. An attractive juicy character comes from the fresh black currant and berry fruits. Give this wine until 2016 and it will be ready to drink. Consulting oenologue Claude Gaudin manages this Médoc region estate.
title: Château Lescalle 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur
