description: Blended by Jean-René Matignon, technical director of Château Pichon Baron, this is a smooth, ripe wine with balanced wood and spice flavors. They give weight to berry fruits, rich plums and fragrant acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Cap Royal 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has a smoky character and is full of spice as well as jammy fruits. An unusual Bordeaux blend of 53% Petit Verdot, 40% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, it is full, ripe and warm, with crushed strawberry flavors. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Bolaire 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With some good concentration and hints of the wood aging, this ripe, full wine has both fruit and tannins. A stalky, black currant element adds texture as well as a fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Piote 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Still toasty, this is a fruity, spicy wine. Firm tannins form the backdrop to the red berry fruits and fresh acidity. It will develop attractively over the next few years, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Maison Noble 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Strong wood and ripe black plum fruits dominate this attractive wine. With its dry tannins both from wood and from the black currant fruits, it's balanced with fresh acidity and a dry, dark core that will soften by 2017-2018.
title: Château Grand Jean 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Big, ripe and fruity, this is an attractive wine for drinking soon. With its black currant fruitiness, smoky tannins and juicy acidity, it's fresh while still rich and dense.
title: Clos Monicord 2011 Carmine de Monicord  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This solid wine is full of tannins while also having fruit potential. Red berries and acidity are beginning to assert themselves with the tougher tannic edge. Drink from 2017.
title: Vignerons de Puisseguin Saint-Emilion 2012 Champ de Fleuret  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With acidity and black fruits, this is a wine with potential. For now, it is layered with tough tannins that are suppressing the fruit. Wait and allow the wine to show its juicy black flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Saint Martin 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has a tough exterior, firmly wedded to tannins at this stage. With suggestions of Merlot and juicy berry flavors, it will balance out.
title: Château Tayet 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe berry fruits shine through this wine. Supported by the tannins, they give a solid and rich character that is beginning to develop. With a dark aftertaste, this wine has potential and will be best from 2017.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is ripe and juicy with attractive soft tannins. It is generous and warm in the mouth, a full burst of red berries. It does have a structure, so it will be better in time. Best to give it until 2016.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is perfumed, full of red berry flavor and attractively soft tannins. The wine feels broad and rich, ready to drink from 2015.
title: Château de Bel 2012 La Capitane  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy black fruits give a great start, supported by the tannins that kick in. Ripe, full of flavor and generous, this is a broad, full-bodied wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Brande-Bergére 2012 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While the wood aging and toast do show, this is also a rich-enough wine. Black fruits give a juicy, flavorsome character, an opulence that is finished with some acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Maucaillou 2012 Château de Beaurivage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Across the river Dordogne from Castillon, the vineyard of Lajarre is on the first slope. This soft and ripe wine has black currant fruitiness, fresh acidity and a judicious use of wood aging. It still shows the structure of 2010, so will be better from 2015.
title: Château Lajarre 2010 Cuvée Eléonore  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firm and hard-edged this wine is currently tough. The fruit-black currant and berry-will bring out the potential richness. It's structured for the moment, but wait until 2017.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Château de Marsan  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This smooth, rich blend is dominated by ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. Wood aging has smoothed out the tannic character of the fruits and added an attractive smoky element. It is soft, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Avant-Garde 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A seriously rich and spicy wine, heavily structured and dense. It has gone from generous to over the top, giving a powerhouse of fruit and tannins that stretches the boundaries of its structure. It's for those who like super-rich Bordeaux.
title: Cru Lagaillarde 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and fruity, this rounded, open wine reveals its fruit quickly. Red berries and soft tannins complete the character to give a bright wine that will be ready to drink mid-2015.
title: Château Julian 2012 Alter Ego  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Red berry fruits are attractive against the backdrop of tannins. The wine has a good juicy element and acidity. The tannins, a little tough at the moment, will provide a bold and firm structure from 2017.
title: Château Ouvrard 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and juicy, this offers bright acidity and ripe, soft tannins. It's a generous wine, full of black currant fruits and conveying a sweet character. It's to drink soon.
title: Château de Bel 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is full of ripe berries, red and black fruit flavors. Soft tannins are a subtext to the main fruitiness. Although the tannins are still dry, they will soften to give a fresh wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Tannic while also fruity, it shows the structure of 2010. It has a fragrant character with its black currant and berry fruits, laced with acidity. A wine that could age, it will be better drunk from 2016.
title: Château Thuron 2010 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This powerful and ripe wine is a blend of juicy Merlot, perfumed Cabernet Franc and fruity Petit Verdot. It has weight, richness, layers of spice and peppered black plums. There are some tannins, but the wine is really ready to drink now until 2018.
title: Clos Monicord 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rich and fruity, this wine has a warm feel to it. With ripe blackberries and a dense texture, it is full bodied, but with a firm tannic edge. The freshness of the year comes through with the acidity on the finish.
title: Chateau Couronneau 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is an attractively fruity wine that has just the right tannic structure, solid berry fruits and good acidity. It's a wine that is developing well and is ready to drink now.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is quite closed at this stage with dark tannins and a firm texture. The dry edge obscures attractive fruitiness, finishing with acidity and freshness.
title: Château la Tourbeille 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and fruity, this is an attractive wine. It has a rich, spicy character from wood aging. It has a friendly, open character, making it ready to drink now.
title: Château Bois de Favereau 2011 Cuvée Jean-Jules  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is concentrated and shows hints of bitter extraction as well as ripe fruit. There is a tough dryness that will soften given time, yielding a palate that's rich and fulfilling. Wait until 2016.
title: Château Croix Mouton 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is bready and yeasty with notes of vanilla and spice from wood. Big and bold on the palate, it could intensify in fruitiness in the future.
title: Château Mirefleurs 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and full in the mouth, this is a forward, fruity wine. It has fragrant tobacco and spice notes followed by flavors of luscious blackberries. Softly tannic in structure, it will age, so drink now and until 2019.
title: Château l'Escart 2011 Cuvée Eden  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a bright and fruity red-currant and berry-fruited wine. It has some richness along with a more stalky edge. Wood aging shows subtly along with the firm tannins of the vintage. Drink from 2014.
title: Château la Rose Belair 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A firm and tannic wine, solidly built around a dry core. The blackberry juice fruit is fresh with layers of acidity to give the wine a more taut character. There is the possibility of aging over the short term, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Bois Redon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A dark, extracted wine, taking its time to reveal the fruit that is lurking at the back, promising rich black fruit in 3-4 years.
title: Château Ducla 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A firm wine, full of solid tannins and powerful fruit. There's just a touch of smokiness here, giving complexity to a wine that has weight and richness as well as blackberry fruit. It needs 3-5 years.
title: Château Laronde Désormes 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This firmly tannic wine boasts a solid structure and bitter-chocolate extraction. The wine has plenty of weight and juiciness from fruit, it just needs several years to come together.
title: Château Darzac 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This rich but tannic wine shows ripe fruitiness as well as dense structure. There is a good balance between juiciness and dryness in this wine, which is already developing well.
title: Château Moncabrier 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Although the wood aging shows strongly at the moment, there is enough weight of ripe black currant fruits to integrate as the wine matures. Then, it will be a firm-though-fruity wine, solid and chunky.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Soft, round and balanced, this ripe wine is ready to drink. It's led by the cherry and black currant flavors, with dryness that comes from the soft tannins.
title: Château Moulin de Beauséjour 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a full-bodied wine, with tannins that have melded into the ripe character. Red and black fruits push through the warm, open structure. This is meant for drinking soon.
title: Château de Brondeau 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big, ripe and fruity, this has tannins that are well integrated into the complex, dense fruit texture. Wood flavors offer a counterpoint to the berry notes and final acidity.
title: Château Haut Mallet 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A very closed wine, this buries its ripe fruits beneath a solid structure of tannins. There is weight, so the wine is likely to develop well, developing richness and firmness.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2010 Costes du Château Feret Lambert  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Packed with dry tannins and a dense structure, here is a wine that has weight and potential richness. There is some good weight of blackberry fruits. If drinking now, it needs to open out in a decanter or glass.
title: Château de Parenchére 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Attractive, ripe fruit, concentrated spice and black berry flavors. The fresh acidity gives the wine a delicious juicy finish.
title: Pezat 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is ripe, bright with black-currant fruit and crisp acidity. It is simple, easy and fruity. Oak aging gives a smooth character to the soft, warm wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château Mayne de Valence 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe but balanced wine has ripe wood aromas and a solid tannic structure. Its black currant fruitiness is still developing, promising future juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Cormier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A fine, slightly mineral wine, packed with tight tannins, but also with the rich fruits of the vintage. It is well balanced, the acidity sitting easily with the sweet, jammy fruit flavors. Dryness and some austerity mark this wine as a fine partner for food.
title: Christian Moueix 2005  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big, powerful, dominated by dark tannins and dense fruit. The alcohol is apparent in the burnt rubber edge, although the richness of the fruit, with its bitter chocolate edge, does help to mask it. The acidity at the end gives freshness.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2005 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There's a great burst of ripe fruitiness with only a hint of dry Bordeaux tannins. There are great peppery red cherry flavors, berry acidity and spice from wood.
title: Château Ducla 2005  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is firm and still structured. With wood, dense tannins and just the hint of juicy black-currant fruit, it needs time. From 2019, it should be a richer fruitier wine, always with a tannic core.
title: Château Cayla 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is tight, firm and tannic. It has a dry core giving it a hard edge while the black-currant fruits are stalky. It will soften, although the toughness is likely to remain.
title: Château Léon 2013  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Black-currant aromas lead to a wine that has plenty of fruit even though it is masked by tannins at this stage. It's just in bottle after a year in oak barrels. So it is dry for now and will broaden out and bring in the black fruits as it develops. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Ricaud 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The second wine of Château Carignan is ripe and fruity. It has red fruits and layers of tannin and acidity. It is a young attractive wine that will be ready to drink soon, certainly from 2017.
title: Château Carignan 2014 L'Orangerie de Carignan  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The organic wine has tight tannins and acidity. The structure is balanced by red-currant fruit flavors. The wine is vinified under the direction of Michel Rolland and one of several family wineries under Bacchus Investments. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Suau 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is firm and tannic with strong wood-aging spice and toast. That makes it seem austere at this stage. It is perhaps too dry, too extracted. The future should soften this dryness and allow the fruit to speak. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Réaut 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and richly smooth, this displays all the fruit and generous texture of a 2009. It's now maturing well with its blackberry fruitiness, sweet tannins and light acidity. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château du Tasta 2009 Grande Réserve  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There's heavy wood here, a powerhouse of toast. The fruit is subdued at this young stage, but is here, so give this ripe and potentially juicy wine time to integrate.
title: Château de Lestiac 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is the fruity side of Carignan, a wine with black currants and bright fruit flavors. It has structure from the 40% Cabernets in the blend and a smoky finish that adds some spice.
title: Château Carignan 2010 L'Orangerie de Carignan  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The producer obviously likes wood aging, because this is a strongly toasty wine. It has dark coffee and licorice flavors as well as a strong tannic character. It will need time to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Château du Vallier 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A light, fruity and fresh wine, it shows attractive black currant fruits. With just a touch of Cabernet Franc to give perfume, it is well balanced with tannins underlying the juicy fruit and acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Canon 2011  Canon-Fronsac

description: Open, ripe and friendly, this wine's fruity nature gives an immediate attractiveness. Its spice and well-structured tannins promise aging over the medium term. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Clariére Laithwaite 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Crisp, juicy and full of red fruits, this wine also has strong acidity. Contrasting with the touches of spice from wood aging, the lean texture suggests fruit was only just ripe. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Grand Mayne 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine from the Saint-Emilion co-op, dominated by tight tannins. It is concentrated and tough for now although there are also plenty of ripe berry fruits to come through. Wait for this wine to soften somewhat and drink from 2019.
title: Château Rouzerol 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity wine from Bordeaux Vineam, this is ripe and full of red-berry fruits. It has tannins that are softening already to give an accessible wine that is rich and full. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Rocher Bellevue 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The second wine of Château de Belcier, this is still young, showing dense and dusty tannins over dark wood aging. It is dry, stalky with black currant acidity and a tight, firm aftertaste.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 B de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The second wine of Château Belcier is a firm proposition in its own right, with dark tannins and juicy black currant acidity. It's tight with some austerity that needs to round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2011 B de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This very rich, wood-aged wine is dense and powerful. The power takes away from the natural balance of a Bordeaux, giving dark tannins that dominate. Spice from the wood is also a strong element. It will round out, but will remain very ripe.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2011 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full bodied, structured and tannic while also fruity, this is fine example of the 2010 vintage. It's all structure at this stage, but it's going to be a full and ripe wine, although the alcohol does show through at the end in a pepper-driven moment.
title: Château la Brande 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a big, weighty tannin- and wood-dominated wine, with a structure that is firm, dry and concentrated. It shows the firm structure of the year, and the juicy black fruits are still waiting to show. Give it 2-3 years.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux
Château La Croix de Guillot 2000 Premieres  (Cotes de Blaye)

description: As with other wines produced by the Dulon family, this suffers from too much oak. Here it shows in the wood acidity, the burnt character and the bitter coffee flavors. It's a shame because somewhere under there is fruit. A year or two more will help, so wait until 2018.
title: Château du Vallier 2014  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Situated on the slopes above the Garonne river, this vineyard has produced a rich and soft wine that is full, ripe and already very drinkable. A tarry character leads into dark berry fruits and a full aftertaste.
title: Château Plaisance 2011 Cuvée Alix  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is very juicy with fruit, but also exhibits a strong mineral element that adds texture and tightness. With acidity prominent, it seems to be a wine that will always be taut and firm.
title: Château Réaut 2011  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm, solid and strongly tannic in nature. Juiciness is there, along with wood aging, spice and some concentration. The acidity is very present and needs to soften over the next year. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Valentin 2011  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From what used to be known as the Premiéres Cotes de Bordeaux, this Merlot-dominated wine offers soft fruits laced with acidity and gentle tannins. It is not a wine for aging.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2008  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine, at nearly five years, is still dry and firm with tannins. It has a touch of juicy black-currant fruit as well as acidity. It needs to age further to soften and get away from the firm, extracted character.
title: Château de Potiron 2013 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is heavily oaked, which smothers the fruit and leaves a palate with flavors of smoke and bitter coffee. Hints of fruitiness give it a little bit of lift.
title: Château de Potiron 2014 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From an 88-acre vineyard in the heart of the Bourg appellation, this is a bold, spicy wine. Its wood aging tends to dominate the fruit and the touch of pepper from the alcohol gives the wine a bite on the palate. Some of this character will soften over time, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Peychaud 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: Full of young fruit in its 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon blend, this wine is just starting out. It's bright with black-currant flavors and attractive acidity, with the fruit just supported by tannins. Drink from 2017. A member of Alliance Bourg.
title: Château Noblet 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: As this wine shows, what marks out 2014 is the great fruitiness. This is full of rich black currants from a 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon blend. A smoky background from tannins gives shape to the fruit and acidity. It will mature quickly; drink from late 2016. An Alliance Bourg member.
title: Château Peugeais 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This structured wine is firm with tannins and a solid structure. It does have fruit behind this dry facade, allowing the potential for aging and balancing out. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Garreau 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: The wine is solid, firm and rich. Ripe black plum and berry fruits are supported by a structure of firm tannins and wood flavors. This is a wine for aging, wait until 2017.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2011 Cuvée Sélection  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: The young tannins are keeping the wine dry at the moment. But the flavors of black currant fruitiness and fresh acidity promise a bright and fruity future. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Noblet 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: A firmly tannic wine packed with both toast and blackberry fruits. It needs to soften to bring out the ripe fruitiness and jammy texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Grand Bourgeau 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: This 20-acre estate has produced a firm but already attractively ripe wine. It is still young and juicy, with black currant flavors dominating. The tannins are solid and need a while to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Château le Piat 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: Ripe and jammy, this is a rich wine from a fine vintage. The tannins are well-integrated into the black fruits, soft texture and juicy plum flavors. Drink now.
title: Bailli de Bourg 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Mint and new wood aromas are followed by a wine that shows plenty of oak. The juiciness comes from the wood tannins as much as the fruit, which is overwhelmed at this young stage. Keep for at least four years.
title: Château Haut-Pradier 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: Firm, closed wine that exhibits a strong tannin character. The wine is powerful and dense, its black plum fruits lying under the dry structure. There is a touch of alcohol burn-a shame in an otherwise well-made wine.
title: Château Laroche Joubert 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This heavily wood-dominated wine features a dry and tannic texture. It seems lean for the vintage, giving the impression of severity. The fruit shows only in the acidity at the end.
title: Château Noblet 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: Dry and firm, this has tannins and an austere structure. It will remain severe, though as the tannins soften, the wine will become more round and develop into a true, food-friendly selection.
title: Château Perthus 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: This is one of a range of branded wines produced by the Alliance Bourg. It is ripe with red berry fruit and spicy tannins that are beginning to soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Mévret 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: The spicy aroma and burnt toast character of this young wine reflects its strong wood aging. The black fruit is right behind though, likely to break through the dry surface over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Luc 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: A simple wine that tastes of black currants, plum stones and throws in very dry tannins. The wood element shows with the smoky, meaty character, but mainly this is about fruit and acidity.
title: Château de Bousquet 2004  Cotes de Bourg

description: Fairly nice complexity of fruit. A mouthful of herbal berry flavors topped off with a heavy whack of wood. There's a lot of taste, and it goes easy on the body and tannins. Light in the glass, it makes for a wonderful everyday red. Best Buy.
title: Château de Pitray 1997  Cotes de Castillon

description: Ripe, juicy and with attractive red fruits, this is a perfumed, structured wine. It shows richness and a fresher side that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Francs 2016  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Full of acidity and red-currant flavors, this is a wine that is light and fruity. It is crisp along with touches of wood. This is one of several Nicolas Thienpont properties, run by son Cyrille. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Prade 2014  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Fruity and perfumed, this is an attractive, juicy wine. Red berry and red currant fruits from the 27-acre estate give the wine freshness, gently underlined by the tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château les Charmes Godard 2012  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a perfumed, strawberry-flavored wine, ripe with jammy fruits and gently cut with tannins and acidity. It is developing well, with juicy freshness at the end. Drink from late 2016. The Richard family's 37-acre vineyard-70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon-is certified organic.
title: Château Cru Godard 2012  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This stalky and fruity wine has fresh red-currant flavors that are backed up by dry tannins. It is a light wine, as much fruit as texture, and is likely to age quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Hauchat 2013  Fronsac

description: Now reaching its maturity, this is a wine that shows tannins that have softened into spicy acidity, meaty flavors and a suggestion of wood. It is a dry wine, now ready to drink.
title: Château Tour Rozier 2007  Fronsac

description: Firm tannins and juicy fruit partner in this balanced wine. The structure does show signs of over-extraction although the fruits should soften that as they develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Rieufret 2016  Graves

description: Juicy red berries show strongly in this crisp wine. Alongside the fruit, darker smoky tannins are firmly in place. The wine needs time. Wait until 2022.
title: Château Doms 2016  Graves

description: This concentrated, dense wine has a dark character. Freshness comes from the crisp black-currant acidity although the tannins and wood flavors are prominent. Drink from 2022
title: Château Ferrande 2016  Graves

description: This juicy wine comes from the highest point in the Graves, at 367 feet. It offers soft tannins and warm red fruits. The texture and structure along with the acidity and freshness suggest a wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Ducasse 2016  Graves

description: A supple, easy-drinking claret, with cedar, vanilla and cherry notes all sweeping across the palate and finishing with dusty, soft tannins. Drink now.
title: Château Belon 2000  Graves

description: A romantic name for an easy fruity wine. Spice from wood gives the black-currant fruit richness and some complexity. With its acidity and dry core, this is a wine to keep for another year. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Venus 2014  Graves

description: This Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon blend is all fruit, black currants with fresh acidity. The tannins are still young and firm, and need to soften. Fresh and fruity, the wine will develop quickly and can be drunk from late 2016.
title: Nicolas Idiart 2012 Château Caillivet Cuvée In  (Graves)

description: Black currant fruits dust the aromas of this wine. The palate shows a stalky character, with dusty tannins and a dry core. It's old school Bordeaux, tough when young and needing time. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Arzac 2012  Graves

description: Rough around the edges, this is a dry and tannic wine. It has mint, red currant fruit and a dry center. It needs a year or two, but is likely to remain rustic.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2011 Benjamin de Vieux Château Gaubert  (Graves)

description: Mushroom aromas indicate a wine that is now mature. It's light, textured with hints of green herbs as well as tannins that are now dry. Not for aging, drink now.
title: Château du Grand Bos 2005  Graves

description: Attractive fruity wine, its acidity leading to ripe red berry fruits and soft tannins. It is deliciously fresh, with stalky black currant and herbs throughout.
title: De Mour 2009 Turgot des Graves  (Graves)

description: Rich, probably too rich, this is a smooth, concentrated wine. Its tannins are already embedded in the cushion of superripe fruit offering flavors of black plums and dark chocolate. The wine will age quickly; drink from 2019.
title: Château Bel Air Gallier 2015  Graves

description: Classically structured, which means dry tannins mixed with fresh black currant juice, and set over a bed of tight wood. This is a firm wine, perhaps lean for the vintage, but with a sense of balance and structure.
title: Château l'Avocat 2006  Graves

description: An attractively balanced, fruity wine that shows to advantage the crisp lightness of 2007. There are red fruits, berries, raspberries, given structure by a core of dry tannins. The acidity and spice roll together in the final taste, with just an edge of green.
title: Château de Carolle 2007  Graves

description: Soft, lightweight, juicy, well-made wine, exhibiting some wood, spice, fresh black currant juice, and a tight core of tannins. There is no mistaking the cool vintage origins of this wine.
title: Château Perron 2007  Graves

description: Fresh aromas of red fruits are immediately attractive, but the wine also has weight, with some rich, smoky fruits, edges of tobacco and dried fruits. The tannins give a definite firm structure, but are well padded by wood and ripe fruits.
title: Château Respide-Médeville 2006  Graves

description: A stalky, lean wine with austere fruits. The tannins are dry and washed in acidity. It's firm, structured, hinting at some juicy black currants. There's some spice and smokiness from the wood.
title: Château Ferrande 2004  Graves

description: The Nony-Borie family is one group of families at the heart of the Bordeaux wine trade, and with this chateau they show a belief in the classic characters of Bordeaux. The wine is firm, tannic, with true black currant flavors and some solid layers of wood. A very good benchmark Bordeaux. Imported by Bayfield Importing Ltd.
title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2003  Haut-Médoc

description: From a small estate of only 10 acres, this wine with its 60% Merlot is fruity with just the right amount of tannins. It has red fruit and crisp acidity along with a dry edge. The wine is likely to age quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine is smooth and ripe. Generous and already balanced between tannins and black fruits, it is a rich wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Victoria 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is firm with dry tannins and a concentrated dense texture. It is more about structure than fruit and it is likely to remain dry. The acidity at the end does give a final lift.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine is fresh, stalky and showing its wood aging. It has a hard edge of tannins that are not quite ripe. Balancing with that is the black currant fruit and acidity that are crisp and showing a mineral texture. The wine needs to age a while, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: From an estate just to the west of Saint-Estéphe, this wine is structured and firm. A dry core of solid tannins balances the black-currant fruitiness. The wine is firm now although it will develop quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: With 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, this is an unusual blend for a Haut-Médoc wine. The result is a wine that's light and already soft. Fresh red-berry flavors are lightly underlined by tannins. It will develop fast, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Reysson 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: From one of the estates belonging to the Lapalu family, this wine is structured with dusty tannins and a dry core. There is fruit, fresh with black-currant acidity and spice. It needs time to lose the edge of toasty wood-aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lieujean 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: A considerable layer of tannins is dominating the fruit in this wine. It's still firm, structured and dry in character with just a hint of juiciness behind. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Semonlon 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Smoky wood aromas are repeated on the palate. Although prominent, they do not suppress the juicy blackberry flavors and crisp acidity. Already balanced, the wine is likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Charmail 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: A high proportion (65%) of Cabernet Sauvignon has given this wine a structured character. It's also brought out black-currant flavors that are allied to juicy acidity. The wood-aging was almost too much, giving the wine a bitter edge that needs to soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Aney 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: The second wine of Château Ramage la Batisse, this is a soft blend of half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It has mild tannins encased by juicy black currant fruits and acidity. It is for drinking soon, from 2016.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2012 R de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: In this full-bodied wine, the tannins are still to the fore. Its weight promises a chance to age and bring out the underlying red fruits. A smoky element from the wood aging gives complexity. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
title: Château Lieujean 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine is ripe, juicy with a body of tannins that add structure while not dominating. It's the second wine of Ramage la Batisse, with light wood aging and juicy black currant acidity. It needs to age, but not for long, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2011 R de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Firm tannins are supported by rich fruitiness to give a wine that is ripe and developing well. It has weight, spicy black fruits and integrated tannins. It's will mature quickly, so drink from 2015.
title: Cheval Quancard 2011 Château Tour Saint-Joseph  (Haut-Médoc)

description: A soft, juicy wine, it is fresh with attractive red berry fruits. It has a crisp, light feel, with the tannins giving the possibility of medium-term aging.
title: Château de Villambis 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is dark and firm, with sufficient fruit to promise a rich future. The wine has ample weight, a solid, dense core and a juicy outer layer. Good for 3-5 years.
title: Château Landat 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This bright wine offers black-currant flavors and firm tannins. It is more fruit than structure, giving a generous wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Fonpiqueyre 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Produced in a light style, this fresh, mint- and berry-flavored wine is Merlot-dominated from younger vines at Château Haut Beyzac. It is poised, with fine acidity, blackberry jam flavors and soft tannins.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2005 Haut-Médoc du Haut Beyzac  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Structurally firm, this wine shows dry tannins over tight berry fruits. It is initially tough, but the firmness does open out to give fresh black currant flavors and a spicy wood aftertaste.
title: Château Lieujean 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: and fruity, this packs good, ripe flavors of blackberries, leather, herbs and sweet acidity. The tannins remain firmly dry, structured, leaving fine, black fruits and acidity.
title: Château le Grand Paroissien 2003  Haut-Médoc

description: Hints of fresh mint leaves highlight the brooding black currant and dark fruit aromas. The balance of Cabernet and Merlot has been successfully achieved, as the wine is beautifully structured with a firm backbone of ample tannins and a rich, supple mouthfeel.
title: Barons Edmund Benjamin de Rothschild 2003 Kosher  (Haut-Médoc)

description: The wine has simple red-berry flavors and a light layer of tannins. The acidity is probably too intense-a product of the vintage. But it is an attractive wine to drink now, finishing with its crisp aftertaste.
title: Château de Chambrun 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Soft and rounded, this wine is finely tuned with acidity and blackberry fruits. It has some firm tannins, although these are well-integrated with the fruit and acidity. This is a wine for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Tournefeuille 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Soft and round, this young wine is all about fruit and a light tannic structure. Fresh berry fruits abound along with acidity and a drier core. It's not for long aging and will be ready to drink in 2015.
title: Château Siaurac 2012 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: A light, fruity wine, dominated by salty, mineral flavors as well as black currant fruit. It is firmly structured, showing some spiciness. Keep this wine, and drink from 2016.
title: Château Siaurac 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: A ripe, full-in-the-mouth wine, densely packed with open, rich fruits. Dominated by juicy Merlot, it's a wine for medium-term aging.
title: Château Garraud 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: An easy, soft style of Merlot, with spicy red berry fruits topped by wood. The tannins are light, the fruit deliciously fresh, finishing with refreshing acidity.
title: Château Siaurac 2007 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: New wood dominates this wine at this stage. But the solid, chunky fruit that is lingering underneath the wood promises well for the future. This is certainly one of the top growths in Listrac.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2000  Listrac

description: Situated to the north of the village of Listrac, this estate is one of several that carries the name Dupré. The wine is dominated by Merlot (60%). That explains the wine's high alcohol and lush character. It also shows signs of firm extraction that has left a tough dry core. It will soften, but it will not lose its overwhelming richness.
title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: Smooth, rich and rounded, this is produced by the Listrac cooperative. Full of ripe, blackberry fruits, open tannins and a full, dense character, it's likely to be ready soon, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Capdet 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: This is a dense wine, rather rough round the edges with some firm, tough tannins and bitter extraction. It does have good fruit weight underneath, suggesting that its black currant flavors will emerge. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Capdet 2011  Listrac-Médoc

description: This wine is dry, with some firm extraction that is masking the fruit. It is fruity and juicy but the bitter, dry edge is not helping the wine's natural fruitiness.
title: Château la Claymore 2016 Château Moulin de Fontmurée  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Fruity while still solidly tannic, this is a ripe Merlot-dominated wine. It has a touch of bitterness, but the main flavors are of black currant, fresh berries and a strong line in acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Fleur Poitou 2011  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has pleasant, fresh fruit, some good tannins and ripe fruit. It is soft, with forward fruits, and a simplicity that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Château Mongravey 2001  Margaux

description: A well-made, fresh, fruity wine, straightforward but ready to drink. Light, forward fruits and sweet spice layer over dusty, woody tannins. The wine is ripe and developing well.
title: Château les Barraillots 2001  Margaux

description: This is traditional winemaking, but done well. It is a pleasant, easy wine, one that shows good structure. Ready to drink, but should develop over 5 years.
title: Château Tour de Mons 2001  Margaux

description: A soft, ready-to-drink Margaux, with scents of damp clay and leather followed by black cherry and vanilla flavors. Boasts a plesant creaminess on the palate and complicating hints of leather and earth on the finish.
title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudiére 1999  Margaux

description: This wine has an austere character that comes from the tight structure. There are only hints of possible fruit. It is likely to remain severe even as it matures.
title: Château Siran 2013  Margaux

description: From the north of the Margaux appellation, this is a wine that has tense, acidic, black berry fruits, soft tannins and a light, juicy character. Not for long-term aging.
title: Château Grand Tayac 2008  Margaux

description: Built along traditional lines, this claret features soft plummy Merlot fruit accented by leafy tobacco and cassis. Its cedary leanness makes it an ideal foil for rich meat dishes.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1995 Réserve Mouton Cadet  (Médoc)

description: Sound but a little thin in the middle, with drying tannins. A touch too much sweet oak for the light fruit. The red-fruit core holds together fairly well, and the finish is strong and solid. Time probably isn't on its side. Drink now with food for a pleasant experience.
title: Château Loudenne 1995  Médoc

description: This is tight, juicy wine produced by the local cooperative. It has intense black-currant acidity and spice and toast from the wood aging. With its tannins it will age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Ladignac 2014  Médoc

description: A blend with 67% Cabernet Sauvignon produces this black currant and crisply fruity wine. The wood aging and the fruit tannins are integrating well, giving a wine that is bright, packed with fruit and likely to age well over the medium term. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Grignon 2014  Médoc

description: A blend created for Schröder & Schí¿ler, a Bordeaux wine merchant founded in 1739, this is soft, ripe with plenty of red berry fruits. It has some firm tannins still although these are rounded out with the juicy fruits and final acidity. It's an attractive wine to drink now.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2012 Private Réserve  (Médoc)

description: This is a stalky wine, full of black-currant fruits and with just enough weight to balance tannins and the dry structure. It has the potential to become an attractive, fruity wine, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Griviére 2013  Médoc

description: Produced in one of the estates belonging to the Lapalu family, this wine is soft, rounded and ready to drink now. Gentle tannins give shape and structure to the black currant-fruits that finish on a fresh, crisp note.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2013  Médoc

description: Almost ready to drink now, this is a rounded, smooth wine with only light tannins but plenty of fruitiness. It's not a big wine, balanced and juicy with attractive fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Barrail 2013  Médoc

description: This smoky wine offers some attractive ripe fruits and stalky tannins. It is fresh, showing black currant acidity, a rounded wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château d'Escurac 2012  Médoc

description: While this wine has plenty of ripe fruit, it also has a smoky character from the wood aging. Red berry fruits give a fresh feel, balanced already with the soft tannins. It's going to develop quickly, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Saint-Vincent 2012  Médoc

description: This structured wine still has a youthful fruity character, juicy with black currant flavors. The contrast is with the leaner, smoky side that comes from the tannins. It needs to age; drink from 2017.
title: Château Ramafort 2012  Médoc

description: Fresh and fruity, this has light tannins and a stalky black currant character that will produce a smooth and juicy wine as it ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Poitevin 2012  Médoc

description: With 70% Cabernet in the blend, this structured wine still shows signs of its new-wood aging along with eucalyptus flavors. The black currant fruits are developing well alongside the wood, bringing out the concentration and acidity from the old vines. It will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Château le Reysse 2011  Médoc

description: Layers of new wood show through as a perfumed, minty character. Tannins are firm and dry over the juicy black fruits. The wine is light, fresh and balanced, ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château les Lattes 2012  Médoc

description: Cos d'Estournel's Médoc venture is still not quite in its place. This wine has ripe blackberry fruits, but an earthy character gives it a rough edge. Drink from 2017.
title: Goulée 2012  Médoc

description: This Cabernet-dominated wine is elegant, structured with plenty of black currant and berry fruits that give a fresher element. With firm tannins that need to soften, it will age. Drink from 2016.
title: Monfort-Bellevue 2011  Médoc

description: This is a smooth, attractively ripe and aromatic wine. It has soft black fruits, and full tannins. Developing quickly, it already shows attractive fruitiness Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2011  Médoc

description: While the wine is light, it has a good balance between its dry tannins and attractive black currant fruitiness. With good structure, it will age over the medium term, so drink from 2016.
title: Château du Perier 2011  Médoc

description: This is a soft wine, with rounded tannins that emerge from the ripe black plum fruitiness. The structure is well integrated into the fruit, giving a wine that is for short-term aging. Drink now.
title: Château Vieux Robin 2011  Médoc

description: A juicy wine, it is full of black currant fruits and vanilla wood flavors. It is generous, rounded with fine acidity and a fresh, open feel. Dry tannins will help the wine age for the medium-term. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Cabans 2011  Médoc

description: Named after the stagecoaches that used to travel through the Médoc, this Château has produced an attractive, fruity wine in 2011. It has some tannins and firm wood-aging flavors, while the fruit is light and fresh. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2011  Médoc

description: Firmly tannic, the wine shows the structure of the vintage well. It also brings out red berry fruits, with a herbal character that cuts the richness. The wine needs time, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2010 L de Laffitte Laujac  (Médoc)

description: The aromas and flavors of new wood are dominant in this soft, ripe wine. It has opulent black-plum fruit that shows through the wood influence. A touch of smokiness adds spice.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2009  Médoc

description: This is initially a serious and structured wine, which subsequently rounds out but always keeps the firm structure of its vintage. It hints at wood aging, plus black currant freshness and tight acidity on the finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010  Médoc

description: This rich, fruity wine has tannins that are well submerged by the ripe, juicy black-plum flavor and acidity. It's delicious now and is not for long-term aging.
title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2010 Cuvée Lucie  (Médoc)

description: The tendency for some wines produced by Bernard Magrez to show too much hard wood is very pronounced here. After four years, this should be softening, but it still has a hard edge of smoky tannins. The red fruit flavor is chafing to come out, so try waiting for a few more years.
title: Bernard Magrez 2008 Château Tour Blanche  (Médoc)

description: Ripe, fruity wine with soft tannins in smooth black fruit. There is some spice, a core of dryness, but the dominant character is a full, gentle, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2009 Famille Lapalu  (Médoc)

description: Stalky black currant fruit dominates this wood-aged wine. The black fruits are fresh, although with a stern structure of Cabernet Sauvignon. It need a year to develop.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2010  Médoc

description: Wood and smoke aromas precede ripe and dusty tannins lacing this red plum flavored wine. It has a rich texture, as well as being fruity, juicy, finished with taut acidity.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2008 Famille Lapalu  (Médoc)

description: A tight wine, the tannins almost too much for the fresh but lightweight fruits. The wood element is poised to soften the edges of the acidity and black currant fruits, but it needs another six months. The aftertaste is dominated by soft Merlot.
title: Château Griviére 2007  Médoc

description: A wood-dominated wine, all the dryness coming from barrels rather than fruit. Will it broaden out? It's hard to find the fruit at the moment, but there is weight under the wood, so perhaps.
title: Château Leboscq 2007  Médoc

description: With more Cabernet Sauvignon than Merlot, this wine has delicious black-currant flavors as well as a dry edge to the tannins from 12 months in wood. It leaves a bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de la Croix 2015  Médoc

description: This wine treads a fine line between serious wood aging and ripe fruit. At this young stage, both characteristics are in play, giving a wine that is both full of black fruits and toasty, dry flavors. Give it time and drink from 2023.
title: Château Saint-Aubin 2015  Médoc

description: Although initially austere, this wine then opens out well, giving a firm and structured character. There are spice, solid dry tannins and a fine layer of berry fruits, finishing off with lively acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006  Médoc

description: A firm, rather lean, stalky wine, dominated by black currant flavors. The tannins are dry, dense. This will show best with food, its firmness and tannic character cutting well with rich meat.
title: Bernard Magrez 2004 Château Tour Blanche  (Médoc)

description: This is a young, structured wine that needs some time to develop. It has stalky tannins over black-currant fruits that give the wine both structure and freshness. With its dusty texture and spice flavors from the wood aging, it will be best drunk from 2018.
title: Château la Fleur 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Heavy extraction has given the wine a dark, bitter-chocolate character along with a serious amount of toast flavors. The result is a wine that is tough and only hinting at the fruit. It will probably soften as it develops although that firm wood character will likely remain. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Faizeau 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is fruity, fresh with a underlying tannic character. The fruit and the dryness combine to produce a wine that is firm while rich, showing juicy Merlot and some medium-term potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Château La Fleur Plaisance 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This structured wine also has attractive layers of ripe fruits. Black-currant freshness balances with a dry tannic core and a rich juicy texture. It's going to be ready to drink soon, so only wait until 2017.
title: Château Pomeys 2013  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Initially this wine is dry and very firm, dominated by extracted tannins. Gradually the black fruits assert themselves and give a more juicy view. Probably the 14 months in wood was too long and the wine needs time to recover. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Myon de l'Enclos 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: A dark, dry and firm wine, this is developing slowly. Its fruits show the influence of Cabernet in the blend with a strong tannic and black currant element. It will need several more years aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Pomeys 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This wine comes from a small 12-acre vineyard. Black-currant fruits and firm tannins keep the wine structured while maintaining a crisp character. The wine is simple, fruity and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Myon de l'Enclos 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: A small parcel of vines belonging to Château Peyrabon are in Pauillac and these are vinified separately as Fleur Peyrabon. This 2002 is piled with wood, dense tannins and dryness. What is missing at this stage is fruit, which is submerged by the dryness and tannins.
title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2002  Pauillac

description: Attractive mint aromas lead to a wine that is now mature. It's black currant fruit is layered with spice, herb and a dry structure that is not going to soften. Ready to drink now in a firm, austere way.
title: Château Haut de la Bécade 2007  Pauillac

description: Lean and austere, this is a tannic wine, with medicinal aromas, spice, stalky currant fruit flavors and tight texture.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2007  Pauillac

description: The winemaking team of Château Lafite makes one of the better branded Bordeaux. This 2006 has tobacco aromas followed by flavors of fresh black currants with an attractive smoky character and a fine line of balancing acidity.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2006 Réserve Spéciale  (Pauillac)

description: Ripe and fleshy, this wine is firm and dry, but has extra-ripe fruit. Perhaps the fruit is too rich, leaving the wine unbalanced. In the future, it will show fewer tannins and more fruit. Corinne and Charles-Henri Gonet of the Gonet Champagne family bought Bacalan with the intent of restructuring the vineyards, some of which had not been planted for 70 years. The first red vintage was 2001; first white vintage was 2014.
title: Château Haut-Bacalan 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is fresh with acidity, rather than fruit. The dry core shows up in wood flavors that still need to integrate with fruit. Give this wine a few years and it will come together while always being on the lean side. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Hannetot 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is dry, dominated by the new-wood flavors and toasty character that hide any fruit. The lean structure will probably remain. The property is owned by the Kressmann family.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: With attractive acidity, this perfumed wine has a bright character and plenty of black-currant flavors. It's not a concentrated wine however it does have an attractive fruitiness. Bordeaux Sciences Agro school uses this 55-acre vineyard for training and experiments.
title: Château Luchey-Halde 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: A series of tannins washes over bright cherry fruits. The wine is all about berries and fresh acidity that are lightly textured. It finishes with acidity and a crisp, fruity aftertaste.
title: Château Roche-Lalande 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Soft wine that is now maturing. It is attractive with its red fruits and light tannins. The end is easy and fresh. Not for aging.
title: Château le Pape 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Soft and fresh, this fruity wine comes from sandy soil that gives it lightness, especially in this vintage. Fresh fruits and soft tannins make this wine ready to drink now.
title: Château la Croix du Casse 2013  Pomerol

description: Already the color of this 2011 Merlot-dominated wine is beginning to change from its brilliant red. The palate also shows signs of maturing with fresh fruit giving way to more leathery, spicy flavors. That suggest this will not age long, so drink from 2016.
title: Clos Sainte-Anne 2011  Pomerol

description: Fresh, juicy wine, with a smoky wood character, light black currant flavors and soft tannins. It is bright, just a little green, ready to drink.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château Alfa la Bernarde  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: The weight of the structure is almost overpowering for the fresh blackberry fruits in the wine. Its presence is big, powerful, with bitter fruits and black figs, finishing with a final punch of richness.
title: Bernard Magrez 2005 Château Pérenne  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: A full and ripe texture, wood aging giving good definition. The wine has a tannic element, but this is well balanced with the juicy black currant fruit and the lightly refreshing acidity.
title: Château du Vallier 2008  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A firm, tight wine that is showing black currants, some bitter chocolate and a pronounced element of acidity. The tannins are well-defined, giving a firm, rich underlay to the final, fresh burst of juicy black fruits.
title: Château des Mille Anges 2003 Cuvée Mozart  (Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: One of two reds from the Chombart family's 209-acre estate. This simpler one emphasizes fresh black currant fruit flavors rather than complexity. There is a good balance between fruit, acidity and some smooth tannins. It's a wine for a good piece of grilled chicken.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2004  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: There's plenty of classic Bordeaux black currant here, freshening up this fruity, fragrantly fresh wine. The tannins are a whisper under all this great fruit.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2004  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is softening already, bringing out ripe red berry fruits that have taken over from the tannic structure. It makes for a delicious, gently structured wine that will age relatively quickly. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Lanbersac 2011  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Produced from organically grown grapes and bottled without sulfur, this wine is young, crisp and full of black fruits. Its tannins and juicy acidity suggest the wine needs to age and fill out. Wait and drink from 2020.
title: Château Beauséjour 2016  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: This second wine of this estate is aged in tank, making it all bright, ripe berry fruit and juicy acidity. The tannins are still there as it's still aging. Give this attractive, fruity wine until late 2018 before opening.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2014 La Millerie  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: Dry, certainly not softened by the rich 2003 vintage, but showing fresh fruit, black currants and dry tannins. It's restrained, finely balanced, drinkable now, leaving a soft final impression.
title: Château Guillotin 2003  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Produced in a vineyard at the base of the hill of Saint-Émilion, this accessible wine is soft, ripe and fruity. It has a generous texture from the vintage and bold black fruits spiced with wood aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2015 Château Hautes Versannes  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A small property bought by Jean-Louis Trocard in 1995. This 2004 is dominated, perhaps too much, by new wood. It is difficult to taste the fruit through the wood, and it tastes too light for the amount of wood present. It could come around, but for now, it is for those who like toast and vanilla flavors.
title: Château Franc la Rose 2004  Saint-Émilion

description: Already showing some bricking at the rim, this St.-Emilion from the owner of Château Pavie is altogether different from that storied wine. Starts with scents of raisins, smoke and leather, and continues in that vein on the palate, where the flavors run toward dried fruit and vanilla. Supple, soft tannins on the finish suggest early drinkability.
title: Château Tour Simard 1999  Saint-Émilion

description: A surprisingly lean style, with bell pepper aromas and green pepper flavors. There is certainly fruit, and a tannic structure, but the wine seems too lightweight for a 2000 and for this property is a disappointment.
title: Château Figeac 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: Dark earth and tobacco spice the aromas of this grand cru, followed by flavors of black cherries and herbs. The Cabernet Franc portion shines clearly through as a distinctive weediness, but it's somewhat balanced by roasted black cherries and only a hint of espresso-like oak.
title: Château Trimoulet 1996  Saint-Émilion

description: A solid claret, with cherry and plum fruit accented by dried herbs and a touch of vanilla. This is a basic Saint-Emilion that stays true to its appellation and doesn't try to be more than it is: a user-friendly wine that goes down easy.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1998  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a structured wine, juicy with black-currant fruit and acidity. It will develop quickly, softening its tannins and filling out with ripe fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Fleur du Roc  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Considering the relatively light nature of the vintage, this wine has been overmanipulated. Hard tannins and a bitter chocolate flavor are all too much for the fruit. A gentler approach would have been better.
title: Château du Parc 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: This ripe Saint-Émilion is generous with its rounded perfumed Merlot. It gives the wine richness, juicy acidity and an open texture. Touches of tannin do bring in some structure, but the emphasis is on the fruitiness and fresh aftertaste. Drink from late 2017.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Fortin Plaisance  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This ripe and fruity wine has an edge of tannins to give it structure. It's full of juicy black fruits, rich berry flavors and fresh acidity. The wine will age as the tannins round out further, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Fortin Plaisance 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: From an estate to the east of the town of Saint-Émilion, this rich wine shows its alcohol in the pepper edge that cuts through the fruit. It tastes firm still and has extracted bitter flavors. The acidity does give the wine a lift and lets the black currant fruit come through. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Puy Mouton 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has great fruit with soft tannins and accessible soft black currant fruitiness. A slight earthiness at the end needs to become better integrated. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Fonbel 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Young, fruity and structured, this is all about red fruits and firm tannins that are quickly coming together. Ripe berries and a smoky character give extra interest. Drink now, but it will be better from 2016.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The second wine of Clos Cantenac is already accessible. With spice, black currant fruits and ripe tannins, it's both juicy and firmly structured. The wine is balanced, with great acidity at the end contrasting with the tannins. Drink now.
title: Clos Cantenac 2011 Petit Cantenac  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Tannic and dry, this wine is beginning to show its age. It still has some juicy red fruits but they are covered by the firm structure and dusty character of the wine. It needs to be drunk now.
title: Château Franc le Maine 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: A fruity and stalky classic Bordeaux that has firm tannins, black currant fruits and a very dry feel. It is a food wine, developing well already and likely to be ready to drink in 2015.
title: Château Bonfort 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Soft and juicy, here is a wine with a generous and fruity nature. It has attractive acidity, soft fruitiness and some spice. Fruity, it should be ready to drink in 2-3 years.
title: Château Dubourg 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Dry and firm, this is smothered with hard-edged tannins that give the wine a tough character. It will soften a little bit, but not completely.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2009 Château Grand Martinet  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a well-balanced wine from the flat lands of Saint-Émilion, close to the Dordogne river. It is fruity and already approachable, with soft tannins and black currant fruit. Ready to drink in a year.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2009 Château Joly  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With light fruits and a dry texture, this mature wine is very ready to drink. It is light in texture and the bitter chocolate tannins are just starting to dominate. Drink now.
title: Château Cadet-Bon 2004  Saint-Émilion

description: The wine is soft, rounded, showing attractive perfumes with spice, blackberry and sweet plum fruits. That gives it a rich feel while preserving structure and dry tannins.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Fortin Plaisance  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A fresh, lightweight wine with good black berry fruits, a juicy character and balancing spice. The tannins are certainly dry, but the fruit is well in balance.
title: Château Jacques Noir 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: Still very firm, this wine shows the tannic structure of the vintage. Because it's beginning to mature, it also shows it's not likely to open up much more. Big and hard to like.
title: Château Tour Grand Faurie 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a style of wine that offers a blockbuster view of Bordeaux. It is full of dark extracted fruits, brooding tannins, dark plum juice and a burnt feeling that comes from alcohol. In its style, it goes for excess.
title: Château de Candale 2006 Roc de Candale  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Aromas of smoky new wood and blackberries set the scene for a wine that brings out a soft, supple texture, followed by fresh black fruits and light structure. The second wine of Château Corbin Michotte is attractively fresh, smoky and ready to drink.
title: Château Corbin Michotte 2006 Les Abeilles  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A ripe, spicy wine, with a good blend of black fruits, spice and tannins from wood aging, and a layer of dry plum skins. It has plenty of Merlot tobacco aromas and dark fruit cake flavors.
title: Caves Fleury 2001 Grand-Portail Cuvée Réservée  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Oak influence shows strongly on this wine, giving a smooth texture and soft tannins. It has a light texture, fresh with black currant fruitiness attractively balanced with acidity. For the medium term, the wine should be drunk from 2015.
title: Château de Côme 2011  Saint-Estéphe

description: From grapes grown at this estate and vinified by the Tutiac cooperative in Blaye on the north bank of the Gironde Estuary, this wine is easy, soft and fruity. With black-currant fruit and acidity, it reflects the fruitiness of the vintage and is likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from late 2017.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Fine fruits, red-berry flavors and crisp acidity give this wine a fine balance and immediate attraction. It is lively with its bright texture and finishing acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2014 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: A rich but well balanced wine, this features ripe flavors and integrated tannins. A juicy black-currant note sits with the dusty structure, with fragrant acidity on the finish. The Château Sainte-Barbe is at the end of the promontory that lies between the Dordogne and Garonne Rivers just before they meet.
title: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010  Bordeaux

description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is a powerful wine. It is jammy in its character, although acidity and wood also play a part. At the end, the acidity comes to dominate.
title: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Smooth and round, this modern, polished wine is fresh while ripe at the end. Lush berry fruits and tannins provide broad support for the fruitiness. It's very ready to drink now.
title: Château de Monrecueil 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe, full wine that has almost too much weight, it offers a very rich texture and firm tannins. The blackberry jelly fruits are dense and powered by a fruity feel. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Larteau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Using fruit that was sourced from a 12-acre property planted to Merlot, this wine is laden with wood. A burnt edge covers what will inevitably be attractive, ripe plum fruit. It has acidity on the finish, and its juicy element promises good things in 2-3 years.
title: Château Lamour 2010 Réserve  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A big, ripe and jammy wine made from old vines. There are black plum fruits but the wine is dominated by licorice, black coffee and wood. It is powerful and very solid. Drink from 2017.
title: Château des Landes 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Bacon aromas and very dense tannins give this a lean, rather than fruity, character. It does have some density along with a more juicy black-fruit finish, although high amounts of toast also show strongly.
title: Duval & Blanchet 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Smooth and rounded, this wine picks up on the ripe fruit of the vintage and adds plenty of acidity and light spice. It is an immediately attractive wine, with fruitiness that makes it ready to drink.
title: Château Grand Jean 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a soft and easy wine from a ripe vintage. With black currant fruit, plenty of acidity and a light touch of tannin, it's made to be drunk young.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015 Passeport  (Bordeaux)

description: Fresh, fruity and with crisp acidity, this wine is already approachable. It is bright with black-currant flavors that lift tannins that are giving a dry core. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2016 Château Mayne Mazerolles  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Black fruits give this wine a good shape and richness. Backed by dark licorice and coffee flavors from 12 months in new French oak, the wine offers both structure and ripe spice. Drink from 2022.
title: Château la Baronnerie 2016 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Blackberry fruits dominate this ripe, lightly structured wine. Fine tannins contribute their rich texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Les Gatines 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe red-berry flavors and gentle tannins set up a warm, rich wine dominated by Merlot. It has generous fruitiness, cut with acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine shows plenty of wood, with the 30% Malbec aged in French oak and the 70% Merlot in vat. The wine also has attractive dark fruits. Balance is coming as the smoky character of the wine softens to give generous tannins and bold black late-harvest fruits. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2016 Clos Mansio Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Hints of blackberry fruits and good acidity suggest this wine has potential. The tannins are very present at this stage but are balanced by the acidity and the fruits that are developing. Drink from 2022.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 La Garenne  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich and dense, this is a concentrated wine dominated by 90% Merlot. New-wood flavors play around the black currants and ripe tannins. The structure and the ripeness promise good aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château les Jonqueyres 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Black-currant fruits shine in this wine from an estate run by women for several generations. The fruits contrast with the firm tannic core. Freshness gives the wine a juicy, fruity character that will develop over the medium term. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine, with dark-hued tannins masking the potential of the ripe fruit. The licorice and black-coffee tastes suggest considerable extraction that needs time to soften. Wait until 2021.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2016 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Closed and firm at this young stage, this 95% Merlot wine has the potential for rich fruit and tannins. It shows weight and hints of the ripe flavors to come. Drink from 2022.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Lalande Bellevue  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Produced by Jean-Michel Baudet, this polished wine is smooth with ripe tannins and rich berry fruits. It is concentrated and already balanced. The fruitiness suggests the wine will age quickly, so drink from 2021.
title: Château Ricaud 2016 Quartet  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a smoky wine with licorice and red-fruit flavors. It is obviously still young, its ripe fruits showing alongside some firm tannins. Let it settle for a few months and drink from 2019.
title: Château Maison Neuve 2016 Clotilde  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Packed with tannins at this stage, this wine has a long-term future. The blackberry fruit weight is still developing and needs time. Wait until 2021.
title: Château Bertinerie 2016 Grande Cuvée  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is soft, ripe and fruity, with good acidity and gentle tannins. Balanced and bright, it will develop quickly and should be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Already almost drinkable, this ripe, generously tannic wine is packed with bold black fruits that follow through to acidity and a juicy aftertaste. Full but not too heavy, drink from 2020.
title: Château la Gamaye 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has some maturity although its tannins are still very present. It has some juicy black-currant flavor that is shot through with the dry core. The aftertaste brings out more acidity and a more juicy character. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Crusquet de Lagarcie 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity, tank-aged wine that has spice, stalky black-currant fruit and some dry tannins. It is juicy and lightly perfumed with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. It takes its name from the beehive shaped wells (puit) typical of the north of the Gironde. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Vieux Puit 2014 Cuvée Croizet  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wood flavors are still prominent in this spicy wine. Heavily influenced by rich Merlot, the wine is lightly structured and more about juicy red fruits. Tannins in the back give enough shape, although it will be ready to drink from early 2017.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a fragrant, spicy wine that is shot through with red fruits and fine acidity. The 95% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blend is still firm with its tannins although the acidity and bright fruit are well in balance. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cap Saint-Martin 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Still dry, the wine is structured with dense tannins and a concentrated structure. That means that it needs time to develop and allow the fruit to speak. Give it until 2019.
title: Château Haut Seguin 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From a estate in the Marmet family since 1990, the wine has ripe Merlot flavors that give a generous character. Big, bold fruitiness dominates this wine whose structure is firm while smooth. Drink starting from 2019.
title: Château Ségonzac 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Closed and firm at this early stage, the wine from Jean-Michel Bergeron has good potential. It is rich with plenty of black-currant fruit as well as dry tannins. Give this wine its time and wait until 2019.
title: Château Les Martins 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The Vignobles Bourdillas brothers' wine is fruity with black currant fruits and bright acidity. Fresh with a crisp texture and light tannins, it will be ready to drink by 2017.
title: Château Jussas 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe wine from Haure Jany, this is dense with wood and tannins. The black-currant fruit is masked at this stage with a powerful dry core. Let this soften before drinking, so wait until 2019.
title: Château du Seguinier 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is dry and structured with firm tannins that are masking the fruit. It is a concentrated wine, firm and dense. Let this wine develop and wait to drink until 2019.
title: Château Ségonzac 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A perfumed fruity wine, this has a light structure along with its forward red fruits. Acidity and juicy fruitiness complete this attractive, ready to drink wine.
title: Château l'Escadre 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Still with its young tannins intact, the wine is firm and structured. It has spice, mint and black-currant fruits under the tight texture. It will still age so wait, if you want, for another year.
title: Château l'Espérance 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is an attractive, soft and fruity wine. With gentle tannins and a touch of spice to balance the red fruits, it is developing into a juicy wine. Lightly smoky at the end, it will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château la Valade 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fruity, black-currant-flavored wine comes from a blend of Merlot and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc. A strong, smoky tannin character lies under the fruit and makes the wine both structured and fresh, with blackberry acidity at the end. This promises some aging; drink from 2017. An Alliance Bourg member.
title: Château Saint-Urban 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Powerfully structured, this is a dense wine, with layers of ripe fruit as well as tannins. It is concentrated, firm and showing its structure. The black plum fruit flavors from the 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon blend give weight and a broad character to the aftertaste. Drink from 2017. Produced by Alliance Bourg.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, this red-berry flavored wine has good acidity and a crisp, bright texture. The tannins are now well integrated into the fruit, giving a structured, yet fresh, aftertaste. Drink now. In the Chéty family for eight generations, the vineyards were changed to organic in 2011 by sons Olivier and Emmanuel (enologist), who also made major renovations to the winery.
title: Château du Grand Pierre 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and still dry with young tannins, this concentrated wine has the potential of fresh black currant fruits. For the moment, it is dark, showing some bitter chocolate flavors that need to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château les Aubiers 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Alain and Céline Vidal's second brand (they also own Château Dubraud) is a fruity blend of Merlot (60%), Cabernet Sauvignon (25%) and Cabernet Franc (15%) although the smoky wood flavors also have an important place.
