Red berries and black currants partner with acidity and firm tannins. The wine is still developing so drink from 2016.
title: Château de Trousse 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The mix of spice and fruit gives a ripe feel and shows good potential. With 75% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc, it has a juicy backdrop boosted by wood-aging flavors. It needs to age, so drink from 2018. The estate has been in the Dop family for 150 years.
title: Château Haut Cabut 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A year's barrel aging has given this firm and very rich wine a spicy character. That marries with the licorice and bitter chocolate to give a ripe, extracted and dense wine. It needs a few years to bring out more of the juicy plum fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Manon la Lagune 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine has very ripe fruit, layers of juicy berries and black plums and a broad brush of acidity and tannins. It may not be subtle, but it is likely to be a full-bodied, enjoyable wine from 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2011 Château Pérenne  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: With some years under its belt, this has become a ripe, full and smooth wine. It shows attractive acidity as well as some firm tannins, but these fit well into the juicy black plum fruits and fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Haut-Mévret 2010 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Bright and fruity, it has soft tannins layered with black currant fruitiness and a dry core. It's juicy, ripe and developing well. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Chantemerle 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wood-laden wine shows more toast than fruit at this stage. It does have plenty of blackberry flavors for the future, giving texture to the firm structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Seguin 2012 Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft for the vintage, here is a wine that has a ripe, opulent feel. Its tannins are fully integrated into the rich, forward blackberry fruits that are ripe and generous. The wine is not for long-term aging. Drink until 2019.
title: Xavier Flouret 2010 Quai Lumiére  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm and tannic, but it promises a ripe, fruity future. It's dense and concentrated, with blackberry fruit giving it a full, ripe character. Age 4-6 years.
title: Château Seguin 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and spicy, this is a rich, full-bodied wine packed with sweet blackberry fruit as well as bitter licorice. It shows very good potential for the next 4-5 years.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2011 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A dry, very firm wine, currently dominated by hard tannins. Woody flavors and a dense texture are present characteristics, with the fruit less in evidence. It could soften, because there is a hint of juiciness at the end.
title: Château Maison Neuve 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: For such a young wine, this is surprisingly mature. Its tannins have softened and rounded, becoming well integrated with the black currant flavor and bright acidity. It's an attractive choice to drink now or over the next few years, but not for long-term aging.
title: Château Bel Enclos 2010 Cuvée Evidence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm, tannic and dominated by dense black fruits, this has a serious layer of wood that shows through in a smoky, burnt character which needs time to soften. Solid, foursquare and showing the great ripeness of Merlot in 2009.
title: Bernard Magrez 2009 Château Pérenne  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is one of three Cuvées from Bel Ormeau. It is full of red-berry fruits and gentle tannins. Balanced and rounded, it is already generous and certainly ripe. Drink from 2021.
title: Bel Ormeau 2015 Boisvert  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is firm, dense and packed with tannins. Juicy acidity lends a crisp character to its dominant black currant fruit. It will take time to soften, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Red berry aromas signal an attractive wine that is fragrant and fruity yet has enough tannins to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château l'Espérance 2015 Cuvée Trois Fréres  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Juicy with fine berry fruit, this is an open wine that will develop quickly. With its attractive acidity and smoky character from wood aging, it has the potential to be a delicious wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Cuvée Amiral  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Blackberry jam aromas in this wine are followed by a lean palate and ample tannins. It's tough at this stage, but as it opens, the fruit will come through to give damson jelly flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Clos Mansio 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe young wine, with its blueberry aroma and spicy palate, is dense and concentrated. It shows the richness of the vintage yet also offers juicy acidity to balance its black plum fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Merlot-dominated blend is full of dense fruit, with a soft black currant flavor. A bite of tannin at the back gives structure and aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Haut Peyrefaure 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this Merlot-dominated wine is bright with red fruit and lined with tight tannins. It has the crisp edge of youth that will fill out with time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Aubiers 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is packed with blackberry and damson flavors. The firm tannins at the back are balanced, giving an attractive character that will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Gigault 2015 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spice and damson flavors give this wine a fruity character. Add its smoky tannins and toasty layers, and it is a wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Saint Germain 2015 Cuvée Moulin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Bright and fruity, this wine is attractive in black currant flavors. With its juicy balance of acidity and open fruit, it is developing quickly and will be ready from 2019.
title: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2015 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with black currant aromas and delicious, perfumed juicy blackberry fruit. It has all the ripeness of the vintage and the potential to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Millet 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This estate in the Entre-Deux-Mers region has produced a rich wine, a generous reflection of the vintage. It is just moving from young red fruits to mature flavors while still showing spice and wood accents. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles André Lurton 2015 Château Goumin  (Bordeaux)

description: While this wine is closed up, it is possible to see its potential of juicy red fruits and fine tannins. Give the wine time to open and fill out. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Reynier 2016  Bordeaux

description: It takes time to get through the dense tannins of this Yvon Mau wine. As they soften, they bring out the ripe berry flavors and good acidity that are also important elements in this wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Biraud 2016  Bordeaux

description: From one of the largest estates in Bordeaux, owned by André Lurton, this ripe, easy and fruity wine is made for early drinking. A half-and-half blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it offers soft tannins plus jammy blackberry flavors that give it an open character. Drink now.
title: Château Bonnet 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins and strong signs of wood aging mark out this young wine from the Despagne family's flagship property. With intense acidity and black currant fruits, it needs to soften and fill out. Give this structured wine until 2021.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2016 Tour de Mirambeau  (Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins are the hallmark of this wine. Although its solid structure and dry core still dominate, the wine's weight shows there is plenty of fruit to develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Cru de la Maqueline 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe and spicy wine with attractive black fruits and soft tannins. It has good acidity and juicy blackberry fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château les Granges 2016  Bordeaux

description: This ripe and fruity wine is lightly structured and offers appealing berry flavors. Acidity and juiciness come through the tannins strongly, giving a wine that will be delicious. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2016  Bordeaux

description: A structured wine, still on the young side, this has the potential of rich black fruits and ripe tannins. Made with nearly 60% Merlot, this jammy, generous wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Univitis 2016 Château le Clairiot  (Bordeaux)

description: Juicy red-berry fruits are evident in this softly textured wine. Juicy acidity and tannins give it both structure and aging potential. Drink this generous wine from 2021.
title: Michel Lynch 2016  Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm with tannins and also packed with rich fruits. It has concentration, ripe berry flavors and layers of juicy acidity. Give this wine some time and don't drink before 2021.
title: Château Magnol 2016 M de Magnol  (Bordeaux)

description: Jammy red fruits come through strongly in this wine with its ripe tannins and rich potential. The wine has plenty of structure as well as juicy acidity and berry flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lauduc 2016 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a fresh wine, juicy with acidity and gentle tannins. The red fruits are matched by a core of dryness as well as balanced acidity. Drink the wine from 2021.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2016 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Rich and jammy, this wine lays bold red fruits over some firm tannins. Its structure and density are a product of this fine vintage. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Cormier 2016  Bordeaux

description: Black fruits are dominated by the spicy, extracted character of this wine. Licorice and dark coffee flavors from the wood aging need to soften. Wait for the potential of this wine to be released and drink from 2021.
title: Château de Fontenille 2016  Bordeaux

description: This soft, lightly toasty wine is smooth and ready to drink. Dusty tannins are well integrated into the black-currant fruits and acidity, giving a rich wine. The estate has been owned by the Barthe family since 1789.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: Balanced and structured, this wine has some richness as well as an excellent tannin core. Along with the berry fruits and acidity, all the elements are coming into place. It shows good potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Jamin 2017  Bordeaux

description: This young wine is already smooth. Vibrant red-berry flavors and acidity come through the gentle tannins and soft, ripe texture. The wine is young, but its fruitiness makes it drinkable now.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2016 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: This structured wine comes from a chateau in the the eastern Entre-deux-Mers. Firm tannins and acidity combine well with juicy black-currant flavors. A dry core indicates that the wine will age. and be ready from 2020.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2016  Bordeaux

description: Pale in color, this herbal-flavored wine is crisp, packed with fruit and refreshing to drink. A fine line in acidity balances the ripe strawberry flavors. Drink now.
title: Chateau Malbat 2017 L'Authentique  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a branded Bordeaux from the negociant firm that owns Château Kirwan in Margaux. This wine is certainly not as grand as those from that estate, but it has plenty of ripe blackberry flavors that are now maturing and a touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2015 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux)

description: With a soft texture and open red fruits, this is a ripe wine. Its tannins intergrate well into the perfumed fruitiness and juicy aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2015 Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence  (Bordeaux)

description: From Jean-Paul and Virginie Bougés' small organic estate 30 miles southeast of Bordeaux, this wine is ripe and softly fruity. Just enough acidity and tannins give the berry fruits some aging potential but not too long. This wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Château la Maragane 2015  Bordeaux

description: Relatively rich for a Bordeaux from the 2003 vintage, this wine has flavors of prunes, vanilla, and red fruit, with good acidity. There is a hint of wood both in tannins and the flavor, but it relies for its success on the attractive, layered fruits. "Mascaron" refers to the seal engraved in the glass of the bottle.
title: Ginestet 2003 Mascaron  (Bordeaux)

description: Black cherries and chocolate combine on the palate, but there's also a certain weediness to the aromas. This blend of approximately 60% Merlot, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon finishes strong, with tart fruit and a dose of chocolate.
title: Malesan 1999 Reserve de Malesan  (Bordeaux)

description: This opens with a mature, even big bouquet displaying berry, leather, tobacco and bell pepper notes. It shows red-currant fruit, an earthy, briary character on the palate and a spicy, nicely complex finish. A taste of decent Bordeaux from a good vintage, with a touch of age. Drink now.
title: Calvet 1996 Reserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A ripe, balanced and structured wine, this is dense and full of blackberry and damson fruits. It has spice from the wood aging, along with a dry core of tannins. With its potential, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Haurets 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is spicy with strong wood flavors. That contrasts with the blackberry fruitiness and fine acidity. It should be well integrated and ready to drink from early 2018.
title: Château Tour de Bigorre 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe with rounded black-plum fruits over the toasty flavor. It has structure certainly, although this is already integrated into the juicy character of this attractive wine. Drink now.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2015 Cuvée Michael  (Bordeaux)

description: Still showing its wood aging, the wine is rich with spice and blackberry fruit. It is structured and with swathes of juicy fruitiness. The acidity at the end gives this wine its final lift.
title: Château des Judes 2016  Bordeaux

description: Dense and well structured, this is going to be an attractive wine. It has blackberry fruit, plenty of crisp acidity and a structured aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Costis 2015  Bordeaux

description: While the wine is dry, it does have the potential to shine. That's because there are also plenty of ripe berry fruits and a dense texture. This is a potentially juicy wine to drink from 2018.
title: Maison Hebrard 2015 Château les Graves de Barrau  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is packed with fruit: blackberry and damson flavors that are given a great lift by the acidity. It has a spicy side to it, adding complexity and filling out the tannins. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Laubes 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a concentrated wine with fine tannins and juicy black-plum fruits. It is densely textured, packed with great fruit and developing well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Jalgue 2015  Bordeaux

description: From vines in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this 85% Merlot wine is rich with layers of young black fruit and spicy wood flavors. It is still a young, structured wine and needs time for the powerful tannins to soften. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Jean de Bel Air 2015  Bordeaux

description: Ripe fruit, firm tannins and acidity are showing the potential of this wine. With its blackberry flavors and attractive light tannins, this one should be ready to drink soon, certainly by early 2018.
title: Château de Lisennes 2015  Bordeaux

description: This ripe fruity wine has soft tannins and generous berry fruit flavors. It is perfumed with mint and spice aromas that fill the glass. It's an attractive wine, juicy at the end and ready to drink.
title: Château de Bel 2015 Echappée Bel  (Bordeaux)

description: With attractive red fruits and soft acidity, this is a fruity wine. It is ripe with a lively crisp texture. Produced by the daughter of Jean-Luc Thunevin of Saint-Emilion's Château Valandraud, the wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Domaine Virginie Thunevin  (Bordeaux)

description: The top of the range wine from this estate is ripe and full of vivid black currant fruits. It does have tannins although these are subordinate to the juicy jammy fruit. The wine is almost ready to drink. Just wait until mid-2017.
title: Château Haut-Mouleyre 2014 Grand Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a bright, ripe and fruity wine. With its red fruits, gentle tannins and juicy acidity, everything is in place for an early drinking and food friendly wine. Ready from late 2017.
title: Petite Siréne 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a crisp juicy wine showing the bright red fruits of the vintage. It still has its tannins intact along with plenty of black-currant acidity and a dry aftertaste that will soften over the next few months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is still firmly structured and dark. Tannins dominate what will become attractive red-berry fruits. With the acidity and concentration, this will be a fine wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Freynelle 2015 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: Touches of wood meet with ripe tannins and acidity. Black-currant flavors, spice and toast are balanced with acidity and a finish that brings in black-cherry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lamothe 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a smooth wine whose tannins have been already integrated into the blackberry fruits. It is ripe, still young of course, and with a stalky texture in the background. With acidity and fruitiness, the wine needs to age. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château la Barotte 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe fruit and balanced acidity allow this wine to make room for touches of wood aging. It has spice, a smoky character and attractive finishing freshness. Drink from 2017 when the wine will be fully balanced.
title: Château Saintongey 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a fine, juicy and fruity wine. It has some firm, smoky tannins that are in the background. With its fruitiness, it is likely to be a wine that is ready to drink soon, certainly by 2017.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is going to be a fine fruity wine once its firm tannins have calmed down. It has enough black-fruit flavors and acidity to ensure that it will be perfumed, ripe and fresh at the same time. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Château Tassin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe juicy wine with fine red fruits and acidity. The smoky tannins are a fine support to the berry flavors. It is developing well and should be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Légende 2014  Bordeaux

description: A bright juicy wine, this has acidity, red-berry fruits and a touch of black currants. This is an attractive wine already, just needing a few months to settle down. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lauduc 2014 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: This fresh and bright wine shows all the fruitiness of the vintage. It has touches of wood along with smoky flavors. The acidity and the juicy aftertaste add to the Bordeaux's attractiveness. Drink from 2017.
title: Michel Lynch 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity wine, full of red-berry flavors and with some smoky tannins in the background. It is balanced between the wood aging and the berry and red-cherry fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Terres Douces 2014  Bordeaux

description: An attractive, fruity wine full of black currants and acidity. The tannins are still dry and need to soften a little before the wine is ready to drink. It does have all the bright character of this early developing vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2014  Bordeaux

description: A rich, spicy wine that is full of black-currant fruits. It does have a lighter touch of acidity that is nicely integrated into the smoky texture and fine tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château du Juge 2014  Bordeaux

description: Attractive structured tannins and red fruits give this wine a good start in life. With the acidity, the dusty structure and the perfumed aftertaste, the wine will develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2015  Bordeaux

description: A blend with 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a wine that has juicy fruit, red-berry flavors and only the lightest tannin. It is rounded, soft and generous. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Réserve Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine, produced by négociant Riviére in Saint-Émilion, is a fruity, red-berry and black-currant flavored wine. It has tannins as well as a good structure that points up the fruitiness. The wine is ripe, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Clos des Menuts 2012 Menuts  (Bordeaux)

description: This is an incredibly young wine with its spice and red-berry fruits right up there and still almost just fruit juice. That means that it has the potential to be an attractive, easy, spicy wine and will need to age. It will be best from 2017.
title: Château Grand Jean 2015  Bordeaux

description: This soft, ripe wine is a blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. With black-currant fruit and bright acidity, the wine is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2012 Chartron la Fleur Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)

description: A bold and fruity wine from the Fontana family, this is full of ripe tannins and berry fruits. It has structure and also a cut of acidity to keep it fresh as it ages. The youthful stalky character will soften. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château Le Bédat 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Young and fruity, this is an attractive red- and black-currant-flavored wine. Its youthful stalky character will soften quickly to highlight the fruit. Drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Grand Billard  (Bordeaux)

description: One of the properties owned by the Fontana family, this estate has produced a firm, tannic wine with flavors of ripe black fruits, spice and dark chocolate. It is still young and showing its stalky, fruity side. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château le Breton 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Although light, this well-balanced wine has good depth. A dry core of tannins backs up the bright red berry and black currant fruits. Acidity and the tannins promise some aging, although the wine is drinkable now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Mission St Vincent Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is smooth, softly textured and round. A more stalky element comes from the black currant skin flavors and integrates with the light tannins. It gives a gentle structure to this ready-to-drink wine.
title: Roche Darjac 2012  Bordeaux

description: New wood shows strongly in this smoky wine with burnt wood overtones. Fruit weight behind it holds hints of black currants and acidity. Allow this solid offering time to soften and mold itself into a structured wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Sours 2012 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux)

description: While the wine is defined by its tannins at this stage, it does have good fruitiness. Blackberry flavors are developing well, giving a strong future and bringing the wine into balance. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Lamothe 2012  Bordeaux

description: This wine that comes from 62 acres of vines has a dry undertow. It has a strongly tannic base over which the fruits are blossoming. Good acidity gives the necessary freshness. The balance at the end is excellent, promising reasonable aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2012  Bordeaux

description: Structured and firm, it also has ripe, jammy fruitiness pushing through the structure. Fragrant red fruits are already shining well. It needs time to develop more, so wait until 2016.
title: Château Fonfroide 2012  Bordeaux

description: A smoky, wood-aged wine with both structure and good fruitiness. Red currants and attractive berry fruits are developing well to give both fresh acidity and a ripe feel. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Bonnet 2012  Bordeaux

description: Rich and smooth, this solid, ripe wine offers a good sense of structure. It has weight, dense tannins and a creamy texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2012  Bordeaux

description: Spicy wood adds to the fresh berry fruits that show strongly. With acidity balanced by the smoky flavors, it's a light, bright wine that will be ready to drink soon. Think about late 2015.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2012  Bordeaux

description: Strong wood aromas are more than compensated for by the ripe fruits and generous character of the wine. It is a solid effort, full of both fruit and rich texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Sainte-Barbe 2012 Merlot de Sainte-Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: With firm tannins allied to smooth wood flavors, this young wine is going to develop its fruitiness over the next year. It has a ripe body, black fruits in the back waiting to come forward. Wait to drink until 2016.
title: Exem 2012  Bordeaux

description: This ripe and smoky wine has some firm tannins while bringing out bright berry fruits. It's smooth and balanced, the structure enough to sustain the polished surface. Acidity at the end, along with the tannins, promise aging. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château de Sours 2012  Bordeaux

description: With big tannins and dark fruits, this powerful wine has weight, a rich character and solid structure. For the moment, it is dry and tough. From 2016, it will show its black fruits as well as its tannins.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2012  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, this has the right amount of structure to hold everything together. It's a bold, rounded wine, acidity layering red fruits and a darker tannic aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château du Barry 2012  Bordeaux

description: Wood aromas feed through to the taste of the wine. Still young, it is more about wooden planks than about fruit at this stage. It does have enough weight of fruit under the wood to balance out. Keep at least until 2016.
title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Structured while also fruity, this gives immediate pleasure. Berry fruits gleam through the drier tannic structure while the acidity is comfortably in balance with the rest of the wine. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2012  Bordeaux

description: This fruity, attractive wine has plenty of black currant and fresh berry flavors. Gentle tannins give a core of dryness, although it's the bright fruit that sings in this immediately drinkable wine. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Château les Arromans 2012  Bordeaux

description: While the tannins are still powerful and dense, the wine has rich berry fruits and juicy acidity that give freshness. It's ripe, well balanced, and full bodied, with a dark, concentrated character at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Reuilles 2011  Bordeaux

description: Very ripe, with a solid structure, this is dense and tannic. Its black plum and berry fruits are rich, jammy and likely to show well with the tannins in a few years. Drink from 2016.
title: Château le Joyeux 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a rich, ripe wine that is full of black fruits and fine, dusty tannins. It's full-bodied, the fruitiness rounded out with some light wood aging. Juicy and fruity at the end, this could age for a year or two, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Belvue 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a dense wine that has plenty of fresh fruit to support its weight. It's quite tannic though, so enjoy with food. It could also do with time, so wait two years.
title: Château Rivensan 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine that shows both solid tannins and juicy red-fruit acidity. It's a rich but balanced wine with a ripe aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves de Rauzan 2011 Château Charron  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a perfumed wine with eucalyptus aromas and new wood flavors. The wood element is held in balance by flavors of ripe berry fruits and delicate acidity. Keep this wine until 2015.
designation: Les Hauts de Palette Vieilles Vignes
title: Château Saintongey 2011 Les Hauts de Palette Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a wine that is fully ripe, perhaps too ripe. Rich with strawberry flavor, it shows more fruitiness than structure. It's quite juicy in style, and could show some balance in a year.
title: Château Saint-Germain 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a very obviously wood-aged wine that also shows enough ripe blackberry fruit to give a fine balance. Structured, with dry tannins, acidity and a firm core, it needs a little time to age. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fontana 2012  Bordeaux

description: With a well-balanced but firm tannic structure, this is a wine that reflects the freshness of the vintage and also gives a feeling of richness. Berry fruits dominate, supported by a dry core that promises aging. Drink from 2014.
title: Château La Barotte 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A rich, smooth wine, all ripe black fruit and soft tannins. It has weight and depth, but is ready to drink now.
title: Château Arnaucosse 2011  Bordeaux

description: A firm wine, solid with tannins and lean fruit. It has medium concentration, a dry core and potential that will be revealed over the next two years. Good, juicy acidity comes through at the end.
title: Croix de Marsan 2011  Bordeaux

description: This solid, structured wine has black currant fruit, balanced acidity and firm tannins. The wine has a solid texture, a core of dryness and the potential to age 3-4 years.
title: Château Belrose 2011  Bordeaux

description: This new-wood-dominated wine is ripe, but full of caramel and mint flavors. The fruit is more discreet, just hinting at blackberry richness. The potential to achieve balance in six months is all here.
title: Château Maison Noble 2011  Bordeaux

description: Balanced by ample acidity and bright black-currant fruit, this is a wine with some spice and firm tannins. Drink in the next 3-4 years.
title: Château de Camarsac 2011 Classique  (Bordeaux)

description: Fine, rich black-fruit flavors give this wine a sense of ripeness, openness and generosity. The wood and fruit balance is already fine, showing that it will be ready to drink this year.
title: Château Grand Billard 2011  Bordeaux

description: A soft, rich wine, spiced with light wood. Fine blackberry fruit, soft tannins and attractive acidity are all well in balance. The wine has a fresh, juicy finish.
title: Château de Fontenille 2011  Bordeaux

description: There is obvious wood here, a toasty, dry character that shows through the fruit. The wine is young and with the sufficient weight of juicy black currant fruit, it should integrate well to give a solid, chunky wine in two years.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2011  Bordeaux

description: A juicy, fruity wine with attractive, bright red-berry fruit flavors. The wine is fresh, touched nicely by some wood and tannins.
title: Pezat 2010  Bordeaux

description: Smoky and structured, this is a wine that has both firm tannins and balanced, juicy fruits. It's a fine wine to drink now, especially with rich meats, and it can age for a year or two.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: In this warm and ripe effort, the flavors of red currants and plums work with the underlying tannins and acidity. This has just the right weight, making for a wine that has attractive fruitiness and light tannins.
title: Château Roquefort 2009  Bordeaux

description: Powerful and rich, this wine tastes of black and red berries. The ripeness of the vintage is evident, with a dense character that lends weight and concentration, while adding fresh black-currant-like acidity.
title: Château La Maroutine 2009  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this shows red fruits and soft, broad tannins. The fruity concentration gives it a generous feel. Keep for 2-3 years, or drink sooner.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2010  Bordeaux

description: Initially, the acidity cuts through this structured effort. Then the ripe fruits surface, creating a wine that is both rich and firmly textured. It is full in the mouth, rich and age worthy.
title: Château Malbec 2009  Bordeaux

description: In this toasty, wood-dominated wine, the fruit is buried beneath dark, dry tannins. It has enough weight to promise a future when the elements fall into balance, so give it 4-5 years.
title: Château Joinin 2009  Bordeaux

description: Smooth, wood-aged, polished and juicy, this is an attractive, fruity Bordeaux, with red berry notes and a light tannic structure. It has some of the richness of the vintage and is ready to drink.
title: Baron la Rose 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: With its forward acidity, this shows its fresh side before revealing its ripe red-berry flavors. Tannins form a firm, solid base that dominates the finish.
title: Château Moulin de Mallet 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity wine, and its black currant flavor emerging right away. Next comes the bright acidity, while the tannins form a solid, dark and dry contrast. The wine needs at least two years to soften into something rich.
title: Château de la Bouyére 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity effort, with a blackberry note that is laced with attractive tannins and acids. With its smooth, ripe texture and full mouthfeel, this is already approachable.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: Fruit and spice come together in this young wine. It is structured with a core of dry tannins along with black currant fruit and a flavor of new wood. Finely made, this should be ready to drink in six months.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2010 Château Bellevue  (Bordeaux)

description: With soft tannins, this wine has a full, fleshy character that's laced with acidity. Black currant fruits and only hints of dryness suggest it is ready to drink.
title: Château du Prieur 2010 Cuvée Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This branded wine produced by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages is ripe and rounded with dense tannins and sweet fruit. It has weight, spice from wood and a fine ready-to-drink balance.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2009 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

description: Structured wine, with black currant and red plum fruits and a significant tannic structure. It has some richness to give density. Age for another year.
title: Château les Arromans 2010  Bordeaux

description: With its strong wood aromas, this is a wine that seems to have spent too much time in barrel. The weight of black fruits does give it a chance to balance out. Keep for 2-3 years.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2008  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine with good, dense and red fruit, a touch of wood and a firm structure. There is a sense of elegance backed up by some weight. The aftertaste brings in spice and balancing acidity.
title: Château des Combes 2008  Bordeaux

description: Attractive, simple Bordeaux, its acidity kept nicely in check by bright black berry fruits, some sweet tannins and a well- judged amount of wood. For drinking now.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Arte  (Bordeaux)

description: From an estate in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this wine is soft, lightly tannic and rich with blackberry fruits. Smoky Merlot dominates this blend with Cabernet Sauvignon, giving a ripe and satisfying wine that will be ready to drink by the end of 2018.
title: Château Tour de Goupin 2016  Bordeaux

description: A ripe wine full of juicy, jammy blackberry fruit, this is soft and generous. It is an easy, accessible wine with its great fruit and final acidity in balance. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Ballue-Mondon 2015  Bordeaux

description: Set in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, this estate has produced a fruity, crisp wine, typical of the vintage. Ripe black currants with a layer of acidity and a juicy aftertaste make for an attractive wine that will develop quickly. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Pouroutou 2014  Bordeaux

description: Benefiting from the warm 2016 vintage, this wine has generous black fruits, soft tannins and just the right amount of balanced acidity. Fruity and with a hint of stalkiness from the young black-currant flavors, the wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2016 Château Grand Billard  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, this wine is rich, young and fruity. And that's the way it should be, because this is not a wine for aging but for enjoying with its black fruits and ripe texture. Drink from mid-2018.
title: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine, fruity with blackberries and black plums. Juicy acidity and tannins work just right as a core of structure. Belonging to the same family for six generations, the estate is in the Entre-deux-Mers region. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Guillebot Plaisance 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine is a joint venture between négociant Schröder & Schí¿ler and the Barton family of Château Léoville-Barton. It's fruity in style, with light tannins and attractive spice from wood aging. Its black currant fruitiness, typical of the vintage, has softened and filled out so the wine is ready to drink.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2014 La Croix Barton  (Bordeaux)

description: Yes, there is some Malbec (20%) in this wine, which comes from vineyards just on the edge of the Bordeaux suburbs, in the Entre-deux-Mers. The wine is soft, ripe, the tannins light, but well in balance. There are red plum and licorice with an attractive jammy edge, the final acidity giving the wine a lift.
title: Château Malbec 2006  Bordeaux

description: There is plenty of ripe fruit here, the richness of 2005 evident. The flavors are of ripe blackberry jam, red plums and a strong structure of sweet tannins. There is a fresh, acidity-driven juicy lift on the finish.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2005  Bordeaux

description: A structured, firm wine showing a great balance of red fruits, dry Bordeaux-style tannins and a freshly jammy texture. For a branded Bordeaux, it has both quality and elegance.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: As befits its provenance from the hands of the winemaking team of Château Haut-Brion, this is a solid, finely crafted wine, flavored with mint and layers of wood as well as red plums. With these tannins, it could even age a year or 2.
title: Clarendelle 2003  Bordeaux

description: Magrez calls wines like this 75% Merlot, "the future of midpriced Bordeaux." It's lush and ripe, with black cherry and mocha shadings, and only a hint of herbaceousness. Not overly rich or tannic, it should drink well for the next 5-8 years. Imported by Bernard Magrez.
title: Bernard Magrez 2004 Château Bois Pertuis  (Bordeaux)

description: A Clairet is darker than Rosé and offers more fruit. Ripe strawberry flavors and a touch of tannin give this wine richness and attractive spiciness. A juicy, fruity wine, it's bright with acidity and has a rich aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château de Lisennes 2017  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This is a structured and balanced wine. It has spice along with tannins that are built on ripe red-fruits. This is a full-bodied wine that is made for food. Drink now.
title: Château Turcaud 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Ripe red fruits dominate this fruity wine. Its tannins are well integrated into this freshness giving a balanced wine that will develop relatively quickly. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe fruits and soft tannins give this wine an attractive character. Richness comes from its layers of red fruits and good acidity. Drink this bright wine from 2021.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2016 Le Grand Rossignol  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This ripe, smoky wine has wood tannins and already delicious black fruits. It is still dry with tannins although there is plenty of room for the bold fruitiness that is developing. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Barreyre 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Solid with tannins but also ripe with fruits, this fragrant wine is developing quickly. It is attractive, with acidity and berry flavors in balance. Drink from 2021.
title: Château le Noble 2016 Cuvée Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is still young and shows its wood aging. That will soften, giving the black currant fruits the chance to shine with their stalky edge and light tannins. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe wine is still very young. Spice, toast and dark coffee flavors still dominate, although there is plenty of fruit weight behind this dry facade. Wait to drink this wine until 2022
title: Château de Macard 2015 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This well-balanced, ripe wine offers big tannins and layers of bright acidity. Black fruits and freshness give the wine a perfumed start in life, the tannins coming in behind. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Goëlane 2016 Cuvée CÅ“ur de l'Aube  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a juicy wine, with intense acidity that shows through the structure strongly. Richness comes from the bright fruits with the tannins playing a supporting role. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Lescalle 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has fine tannins, rich berry flavors and a juicy aftertaste, an indication of the vintage. Structured and with some good potential, the wine will be ready from 2021.
title: Château Grand Français 2016 Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Full of blackberry flavors, this strong, firm wine is just setting out on its development. Big spice, plenty of smoky wood-aging flavors and a juicy aftertaste all point to a good future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cateau Lagrange 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Bold tannins are the dominant character of this wine. Its weight comes as much from its structure as from the fruit that is still suppressed and needs time. Drink from 2022.
title: Producta Vignobles 2016 Château Timbau  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Wood aging shows strongly here with toasty flavors and spice. At the same time, the wine also has hints of its fruity potential. Put the two together and the wine will be ready from 2023.
title: Château Picon 2016 Cuvée Louis  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firmly tannic with a dusty texture, this wine is also rich in spicy black fruits and balanced with acidity. It has plenty of potential, with rich tannins and good acidity at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Larroque 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich, ripe wine offers fine tannins and, just as important, plenty of juicy black-currant flavors. The structure of the wine will allow it to age, although it is already attractive and fruity. Drink ideally from 2022.
title: Château Grand Pascaud 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This firm wine has plenty of juicy red berry fruits to give it balance and the potential of a rich future. It is concentrated with dark fruits and tannins. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Saint-Léon 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This estate in the eastern Entre-Deux-Mers dates to 1346. A selection of the best fruit, this wine is dominated by Merlot, with ripe tannins and a rich structure. The wood still shows strongly but so does the fruit, balancing blackberry flavors with spice and toastiness. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Rouquette 2014 Cru Mérigot  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This soft, fruity wine has rich berry flavors and ripe, simple tannins. It is an open, full-bodied wine, rich in blackberry and black-plum flavors and lifted, warm acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This really smoky wine is also perfumed and offers great fruitiness. It is a balanced, although still young, wine. Lively acidity at the end keeps everything fresh. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Laville 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wood aging is still strong in this wine. It also has weight and perfumed fruits, so it should develop well. Black-currant flavors give freshness and acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Lisennes 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This perfumed wine has ripe red fruits as well as plenty of firm tannins. It is coming together well, rich, full and structured. The aftertaste has a fresher side that is already attractive. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Bel 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A soft and rich example of this excellent vintage, this wine is spicy and juicy, with layers of blackberry fruits and generous tannins. An open, accessible and ripe wine, it will be ready to drink from early 2019.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fruity wine, full of both red-berry and cherry flavors and some dry tannins that will certainly soften and integrate. It has the potential to be balanced, full and deliciously fruity. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Tayet 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is a toughness to this young wine that will take time to soften. On the other hand, there is plenty going for it with the smoky black fruits and acidity and the warm aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Majureau Sercillan 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Crisp and full of red fruits, this is a balanced wine. With its tannins well tamed and integrated with the fruit, this is going to be a fruity easy wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Le Bocage 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is plenty of fruit to find in this generous wine. Its tannins and dense structure are just part of its ripe future. The berry fruits and acidity promise a delicious wine from 2018.
title: Château de Parenchére 2015 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe both with the generous tannins and the juicy fruit, this is a wine with good potential. There is plenty of acidity to bring out the crisp character of this attractive wine. It will be ready from 2019.
title: Château de Garros 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fine fruity wine with young tannins that will soon integrate. Ripe with berry flavors and with attractive acidity, it will develop quickly and should be ready by 2018.
title: Château Jean Faux 2015 Sainte Radegonde  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a perfumed juicy wine with attractive acidity and plenty of ripe berry fruits. It has light tannins, just enough to give the wine its shape and tannic edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-La-Péreyre 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With a fine spicy character, the wine from this estate is richly endowed with blackberry fruits as well as a firmly tannic core. There is no wood aging but the fruit gives the wine an approachable character. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Gaudin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has some extraction that leaves a bitter edge. That needs to blow off to allow the underlying ripe blackberry fruit to come through. So wait until 2018.
title: Château Labatut 2015 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a fruity wine, light and bright in character. It has acidity and black-currant crispness. The light tannins are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Château des Arras 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With firm tannins as well as juicy black-currants, this is an attractive wine. It has plenty of acidity which is balanced by the ripe fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Laronde Desormes 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This branded Bordeaux is packed both with fruit and with a firm structure. It has a dense texture and solid tannins although the generous fruit will allow it to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Fleur de Charme 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A crisp and juicy wine, this also has plenty of ripe berry fruits. It is already all about fruit, with a core of dusty tannins that brings the fruitiness to life. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Gillet 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is crisp with black currants and plenty of acidity. There is a smoky character to this wine that is still young and stalky. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Garros 2015 L'Excellium de Château de Garros  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This fruity wine is full of cherry and blackberry flavors. It has a soft texture, lightly spiced and with an attractive balance of acidity and firmer tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Barreyre 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This Dulon wine is full of wood flavors that are currently dominating the fruit. That will change as the blackberry fruitiness emerges from the background. So give this wine until 2019 to bring out its inherent juiciness.
title: Château Grand Jean 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A strong wood component at the moment doesn't mask the juicy ripe fruits. They give the wine its ripe character and potential. As it matures, it will be an attractive, ripe wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Floreal Laguens 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is fruity and also textured. The acidity and dry tannin and wood flavors reveal a wine that will need to develop. It has weight and potential richness that will come out over the next couple of years. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2014 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Some wood aging has given this wine its smooth texture and light eucalyptus character. It has also give the fruit extra richness and depth. The black-currant flavors are rich, lifted by balanced acidity. This is going to be a delicious wine from early 2017.
title: Château Meillier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe blackberry-flavored wine is deliciously ready to drink. It has soft tannins and a smooth texture that is now just right. The acidity and the jammy aftertaste make the wine attractive.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine, now mature, is ripe with jammy black fruits. It has soft balanced tannins as well as juicy acidity and a rich aftertaste. It is totally ready to drink.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a bright wine, full of almost shocking acidity and red-currant fruits. Its tannins are there, although more of an afterthought to the fruit. Drink this light fresh wine from 2017.
title: Château Jean Faux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While the wine is firm and tannic at this early stage, it does have the potential to bring out a more fruity character. The red-berry fruits and acidity are there, promising a fresh wine from 2018.
title: Château Mougneaux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe wine and full of fruit. It has structure as well with its firm tannins and smoky backdrop. It will broaden out well and give a rich wine from 2018.
title: Château de Bel 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe fruit aromas give this wine its full-bodied feel. It has acidity and spicy tannins while the rich fruit theme continues. It should develop well and be ready from 2018.
title: Château le Gardera 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is structured, still very dry with tannins. It has concentration, smoky flavors along with acidity. Still young, it will integrate better. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Rose du Pin 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is rich and soft with some fine tannins. It has red fruit and blackberry flavors along with juicy acidity. Lightly structured, it will develop quickly and should be ready starting from 2017.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red fruits and soft tannins give this rounded wine a generous feel. It has spice and rich berry fruits that are lifted with a touch of acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château de Seguin 2014 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a potentially juicy wine with acidity and red fruits coming through the structure. It has the weight for the tannins and a rich background feel. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château Labatut 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a ripe toasty wine. With its red-berry fruits and acidity along with some dry, smoky tannins it is a wine in progress. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a wine with fine tannins and plenty of ripe fruit. It has good potential with fruit and structure working well together. Spice and a rich aftertaste suggest a wine that will be fine from 2018.
title: Château Montlau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This fruity wine is full of strawberry flavors. It already has a fine balance between the tannins and the fruits. With a crisp aftertaste and final juicy acidity, this will be a bright wine to drink from 2018.
title: Producta Vignobles 2014 Château Arnozan  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine has good ripe red fruits as well as layers of tannin. It has some concentration and weight behind juicy acidity. It will develop well and should be ready from 2017.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a rich juicy wine. It has red berry fruits and jammy acidity that integrates well with the soft tannic structure. It's a wine to drink soon, so just wait until early 2017.
title: Château des Antonins 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe, juicy wine offers blackberry flavors and young acidity. It is developing balance, fresh fruits and supporting tannins. The structure is integrating into the fruit, which will dominate if you wait to drink until 2017. The blend is 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: VIgnobles Roux 2014 Château La Fôret  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is ripe with attractive blackberry fruits and jammy acidity. The tannins play a fine supporting role, allowing the fruits to develop a warm, rich character. The wine could age, so drink from 2016. The Le Grix de la Salle family's sons have worked in Napa Valley, New Zealand and Spain before making wine at home. The Château is a historical monument.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2013 Grand Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: As the tannins soften, this wine will become rich with generous fruitiness. Blackberry flavors and acidity are developing well to give a wine that is full and will be well balanced. Drink this Ducourt family wine from 2016.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this structured and firm wine is still young. Solid tannins are cut by the black currant fruit and fresh acidity. Give this wine until 2017 to be at its best. The vineyard is in the eastern end of the Entre-deux-Mers.
title: Château Castenet 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is ripe, full of blackberry fruits as well as layers of wood aging. It has spice, juicy fruitiness and fresh acidity at the end. Balanced and ripe, it merits waiting to drink from 2017.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and smoky, this has attractive acidity to balance the warm, red fruits, with a layer of supportive tannins. It is light, fruity and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wood aging shows in this wine, giving a smoky, spicy character. It has softened the crisp fruits and allowed the wine to broaden out with ripe berry fruits. Solid and dense, it will need to age so drink from 2017.
title: Château Peuy Saincrit 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With fine tannins, ripe berry fruits and a good cut of acidity, this is an attractive wine that deserves some aging. It has weight along with its strawberry and red currant flavors. Drink from 2016. Made by UNIVITIS Producers.
title: Château Bellevue 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With ripe berry fruits, this smooth wine has a layer of balanced tannins. It is structured, jammy in character, full of black currant flavors and final acidity. Drink from 2016. The Château's history goes back to the 14th century and became a ruin after the 1789 Revolution. It was completely restored after World War II.
title: Château Timberlay 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Solid tannins still dominate this potentially ripe and full-bodied wine. It has the richness and structure of the vintage, giving ripe red fruits from the Merlot as well as tight tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Dourthe 2010 Réserve du Château  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fresh and juicy, this full-bodied while structured wine comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, which gives the fruitiness and blackberry fruit flavors. It will develop quickly and can be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Peyfaures 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Hugely ripe Merlot is at the core of this rich wine. It is opulent, rounded and packed with dark plum-juice flavors. It verges on too much, too rich and too generous. What redeems it is the Bordeaux structure and final dry aftertaste.
title: Château Peyfaures 2010 Dame de Coeur  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is rich, full of black currant fruitiness and ripe tannins. It's solid, structured and balanced. Produced from 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernets, it is slow in developing, still full of tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The tannins are solid here, a dark, dense and smoky layer that gives a tough feel while still allowing room for the weight of fruit that is developing. A spicy character at the end adds interest. Drink from 2016.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This structured wine is slow to show its fruity side, although it has a layer of acidity with hints of black fruits. At the moment it is firm and dry, with dense tannins and a dark aftertaste. Wait until 2017.
title: Château de Lisennes 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Warm and fruity, this is just what this style of wine should be. Red fruits, soft tannins and a generous, juicy character are already giving pleasure. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Parenchére 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and full in the mouth, this rich wine features juicy black fruits and aromatic acidity. Piled high with berry flavors, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Bessac 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is closed up and tough. That's no bad thing because the fruit weight is all there. The tannins are dense at the moment, showing signs of hard extraction, not enough to take away from the potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Producta Vignobles 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm and dense, the wine is dominated by its tannic structure. The lean and austere character will probably always remain although hints of juicy fruits appear at the end.
title: Château Pas de Rauzan 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm and complex, it manages both acidity and concentrated tannins and brings out really black fruits.
title: Cap Royal 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With firm tannins and a solid texture, this rich wine has delicious juicy black fruits and dry tannins. It's delicious now, but it will also improve and evolve with time. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2011 Cuvée Sarah  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A full-bodied, spicy wine, it shows concentrated tannins and a dense texture. The dry core, very firm and tough at this stage, is supported by ripe plum fruits and acidity that indicate the potential of this rich wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Moines Menodin 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is some extraction here, giving a dry character to this wine, but it also has enough berry flavor to act as a balance. This wine has a promising future but demands a few years to age. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a firm wine that will take time to show its best. When it does, it should reveals a solid texture, juicy fruitiness and attractive acidity. Wait until 2015.
title: Château de Goëlane 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With its fresh black-currant fruits and ever-present acidity, this is a wine that sums up the vintage. The tannins are there, giving a sense of dryness to this fragrant wine. On the finish, there is also an attractive juiciness.
title: Château Gromel Bel Air 2011 Cuvée Eva  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This intensely juicy, fruity wine is high in acidity. It's dominated by fresh black currants as well as spice from wood aging. It has fruit concentration, but needs time to round out and soften. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm, but balanced, this is a wine with many of the virtues of the vintage. It has weight and richness, but also fresh, juicy, fruity acidity all packaged nicely in tannins. Drink this wine from 2015.
title: Château Trocard Monrepos 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fine tannins push this wine forward. It has weight and richness, red plum and berry fruit flavors and a tight, acid texture. It can age for several years, so drink from 2014.
title: Château la Faviére 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dark in color, this wine from the Entre-deux-Mers shows structure, firm black fruits and rich tannins. Berry fruits, black currants, smokiness and fresh acidity are well integrated and balanced with the firmer texture. It will certainly age, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Fourchou 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A Merlot-dominated wine, structured with stalky black currant fruits, solid tannins and attractive spiciness. With its firm, serious character, it does need to age a few years. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Very soft and rich, this wine offers dusty tannins now well integrated into the ripe fruits, It is full of red fruit and some herbal flavors, along with a light level of acidity. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Château la Faviére 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dark tannins are balanced by pleasant black currant flavors. The wine has ample weight, while preserving freshness and bright acidity. Give it 2-3 years, when this structured and fruity wine will be ready.
title: Château Lescalle 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A firm wine with enough fruitiness to suggest potential. It has pleasurable red-berry fruit, ample acidity and tannin, with the promise of medium-term aging
title: Château Jalousie Beaulieu 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dense planting for this vineyard has resulted in a wine that has greater concentration than in the past. The wine has firm tannins, while showing already delicious black-currant fruit. For drinking over the next 2-4 years.
title: Pezat 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Austere and firm, this is still many years from being ready to drink. For now, its potential is apparent in the juicy black fruits, dark tannins and solid structure. It has much of the structure of the vintage, well clothed in fuller fruits.
title: Château Lavergne-Dulong 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A firm and solid wine, tightly packed with tannins, black berry fruits and a dense structure. Laurence is Laurence Helfrich whose family owns the chateau. The wine could age for several years, but will be ready to drink in 2014.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2010 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine. Its juicy red fruits are balanced with tannins, offering a dry contrast. The finish is dark, structured and suggestive of the wine's potential for aging.
title: Château Lézin 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dark and brooding, this is characterized by a plum skin note, plus firm tannins and a solid structure. It's concentrated and dense, a wine that is serious and needs to age for 4-5 years. The finish has a firm feel.
title: Château Montet 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy fruit is present in this wine, with firm, extracted tannins. It needs time to show its potential black-currant and berry notes. Give it 3-4 years.
title: Château Turcaud 2010 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a generous, full-bodied wine that shows the ripe fruit of the vintage. The fruit appears upfront, offering a warm mouthfeel, and the tannic structure is likely to allow it to age.
title: Château Laronde Désormes 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is balanced, with tannins and red fruits in harmony. It has weight and richness without being overpowerful. Ready to drink in six months.
title: Château Montlau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smoky, ripe and juicy, this wine's weight and tannins are secondary to the plum note and balancing acidity. The wine is open, generous and delicious already.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2009 Réserve du Château  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe red fruits give this wine a juicy feel. The fruit is balanced, with new wood and caramel flavors offering a smooth contrast to each other. The smoky aftertaste is warm and ripe.
title: Château Haut-Mongeat 2009 Cuvée Isabelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich and structured, this features tannins that pack the same weight as its ripe black fruits. A wood element shows in the background. The balance is likely to come together in the next year.
title: Château Darzac 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This big, bold wine is full of ripe fruit. It has a dense structure, with wood-aged flavors and firm tannins. The black fruits are showy and likely to develop quickly.
title: Chateau Couronneau 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe, round, soft and juicy, this is already attractive and drinkable. It has firm tannins, yet these are cushioned by the sweet black fruits and the lift from the acids. Drink now, or hold this for another year.
title: Abbaye de Saint-Ferme 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is rounded, with its ripe fruit dominating the new wood influence. It is dense and smoothly rich, with blackberry and bitter coffee flavors. Age for three to four years.
title: Château de Cornemps 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A firm, dry textured wine, with tannins that are now losing more fruity character. It needs at least an hour in a decanter to show its more balanced nature. Ready to drink.
title: Château Plaisance 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: . Recent vintages have left Bordeaux with an alcohol problem, as seen in this wine. The saving grace is the essential Cabernet Sauvignon structure and acidity that keeps the ripe Merlot in balance.
title: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With stalky fruit and black currant acidity, the wine starts out lean. Then a richer, smoky wood character gives weight and sweeter flavors. Give the wine a year.
title: Château le Gardera 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rich, full-bodied wine, with plum fruits and sweet tannins. It is warm and ripe, with a touch of alcohol burn. The structure remains Bordeaux-dry and with good final acidity.
title: Château Lagrave Paran 2009 Cuvée Geraldine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Black currant-dominated wine, all fresh juicy fruit along with balanced dry tannins. The wood is there, with subtle hints of black fruits and acidity.
title: Château de Parenchére 2008 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and fruity, touched by mint with some good balancing tannins and acidity. A fine, firm and also juicy wine, with a warm texture.
title: Yvon Mau 2006 Château Ducla  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The dry tannins are firmly in charge in this young wine, its fruit fresh rather than rich. The flavors are red plum juice, acidity and a dry core that needs another year to soften.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With some good, ripe fruit and a core of dry tannins, this wine benefits from wood aging and rich berry flavors. It is solid and chunky, with a fine edge of black currant acidity. It could well age for 2-3 years, but can be drunk now.
title: Château Soussac 2006 Liberty du Château Soussac  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Soft, ripe and juicy, this is an attractive wine, with red berry flavors and a light structure. Not for the long term. Drink now for its fruity character.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2007  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Aromas of new wood follow through with rich toast, balanced with black currant fruits. The wine is fresh, the acidity a strong presence along with a layer of dried fruit flavors and tannins.
title: Château Grand Jean 2006 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A soft, ripe and fruity wine, this is made to be drunk young. It has gentle tannins, with jammy red Merlot fruits that are structured with the firmer tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Producta Vignobles 2014 Arnozan Réserve des Chartrons  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is the top of the range for this wine brand. With spice from wood aging and with rich black fruits, it has concentration and generous tannins. It's drinkable now, although it will be even better from late 2018.
title: Monsieur de Bordeaux 2014 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This warm, fruity wine has spice from light oak aging. More importantly, it offers ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. The acidity and the crisp texture suggest this wine will be ready to drink soon. Try from late 2018.
title: Château Argadens 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Well structured and with ripe berry fruits and gentle tannins, this wine is spicy and rounded. The red-berry fruits, layers of tannin and acidity are coming together well in a wine that will be ready to drink from late 2018.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This young wine is packed with ripe fruit and generous tannins. It's full of spice, black plum flavors and general richness. Drink from 2019.
title: Calvet 2016 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This fine estate has produced a ripe, fruity wine in 2014. It has spice from wood aging as well as juicy black currant fruit flavors. Generously textured, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Landereau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A smooth, wood-aged wine that shows ripe black berry fruits, already maturing. The soft tannins give a cushion of support, but the dominant factor in this wine is the easy, ready-to-drink maturity. The wine is named after the Irish 18 century founder of the property.
title: Château Brande-Bergére 2004 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fresh ripe black currant fruits are the delicious hallmark of this wine. It is full, rich, juicy, its core of tannins and oak a foil to the freshness and mouthfilling character of the fruit.
title: Pezat 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a great example of what more inexpensive Bordeaux could be like with proper care in the vineyards and winery. Scents of chocolate, dried herbs and cassis ease into similar flavors, carried on a medium-weight, slightly creamy palate. Turns spicy and firmer on the finish, suggesting it will last until 2010 or so.
designation: L'Abbaye de Saint Ferme Les Vignes du Soir
title: Domaines Arnaud de Raignac 2003 L'Abbaye de Saint Ferme Les Vignes du Soir  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Warm, soft-fruited wine, with fine ripe red berry fruits as well as a gentle tannic structure. There is an earthy Merlot edge to the blend, along with the more dry texture of Cabernet. For drinking next year.
title: Château Suau 2009  Cadillac

description: Juicy black fruits and acidity partner with firm tannins to produce a wine that is fully integrated, rich and worth aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Courreges 2016 Cap de Fer  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark and structured, this is a rich wine with bold tannins. The wine has ripe, juicy potential, with rich tannins and good acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Ricaud 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a fresh wine, full of red-berry fruits that are underpinned by acidity and tannins. It has a bright feel while the spice and dry core are a contrast that will smooth out. The vienyard has been in the Médeville family for generations, the 2014 was their 188th harvest. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Fayau 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: An attractive blend that includes 20% Cabernet Franc, this is a soft perfumed wine. It has spice and toast from the wood aging which will integrate better in the coming months. The black fruits and acidity are already well in place. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Léon 2014 La Ferme du Château Léon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big tannins dominate this still young wine. It has spice and a dry toast character that will need to soften. With acidity and hints of red fruits that should happen, so drink this wine from 2019 when its potential should be realized.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a firmly tannic wine although with ripe potential. It has a dense character that is good, allowing the fruit to develop. For now, it is dry so give that fruit plenty of time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tanesse 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a perfumed wine with mint flavors from the wood aging. It has black-currant fruitiness that brings out acidity as well as tannins. The aftertaste is still young and fruity and the wine needs to age until 2017.
title: Château Carignan 2013  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has plenty of black-currant fruit. At the moment, the fruit is developing while still dominated by lean dry tannins. The two will balance out, giving a structured wine that will need to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Chatard 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Still lean and structured, this is a cool-feeling, young wine. It has dry tannins and a chewy texture that needs to soften. At the back, juicy black currant fruits show promise for the future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Vignobles Dourthe wine is ripe and richly textured. Full and blackberry flavored, it is 84% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. An attractive interplay between the fruit and the tannins gives a balanced wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Ricaud 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: There is a ripe and smoky character to this wine aged 12 months in French oak. A rich background of plums and berry fruits steadies the tannins. The wine is balanced and will be ready to drink from 2017. The Gonfrier brothers' 94 acres are certified "Haute Valeur Environmentale" (High Environmental Value).
title: Château de Marsan 2013  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With spice and new wood balancing the generous black fruits (40% Merlot and 25% each Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon), this rich wine has good potential. It is warm and generous, packed with both acidity and a solid structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Laville 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is ripe and soft with attractive acidity and juicy red berry flavors. While there are tannins, they are subservient to the fruit, which suggests that the wine will develop quickly. The wine appeared in volumes 1 and 27 of Tadashi Agi's manga series, Les Gouttes de Dieu (Drops of God). Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: On the slopes above the river Garonne, this vineyard has produced a fresh and fruity wine. Firm tannins are balanced by the intensely young and juicy berry fruit. Wood aging rounds the corners of this wine that will be drinkable from 2015.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2011  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solid and dry, this is a tightly structured wine. Layered acidity and berry fruits lend a powerful, concentrated feel. It does need time to bring out its inherent fruitiness. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Ricaud 2011 Grand Vin  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A solid and fully tannic wine that also has a bright, fruity side. The combination, with its ripe fruit, is already a pleasure to drink fresh, textured and juicy. The wine also has a future with a smoky character that will allow it to age. So drink until 2021.
title: Château de Sadran 2010 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Under the serious amount of wood, this wine feels rich and concentrated. Wood spice, a touch burnt, along with chocolate and black currant fruit show both extraction and the need for 2-3 years' aging.
title: Château de Lestiac 2011  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Heavily dominated by wood at this stage, a wine that will always be firm, laying tannins over the red berry fruit stalkiness. The wine needs two years.
title: Château de Lestiac 2009  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Aged in wood for 12 months, this blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon is already balanced and stylish. Its wood aging has added spice without masking any of the black-currant fruit. Drink this wine from 2019
title: Château Cayla 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This structured, smoky wine is also full of ripe berry fruit. It has a generous texture and a fine balance between fruit and tannins but is likely to age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Brethous 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)
