description: Juicy fruit tones are fully supported by firm tannins in this wine. They need time to integrate, though, so wait until 2020 before opening.
title: Château Courréges 2015 Cap de Fer  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is dry and extracted, with firm, almost bitter tannins. Licorice and black chocolate flavors dominate. It will take several years for the fruit potential to show. Drink from 2021.
title: Château les Conseillans 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and tannic, this has a juicy fruit flavor buried under the dry top layer. It has a strong structure that will soften over several years of aging, yielding a richly juicy wine.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2010 Château Tour Canon  (Canon-Fronsac)

description: Alain Tourenne's wine has plenty of organic red fruits cut with acidity. Its structure is still developing but promises firm support for the fruitiness. The wine needs time to come together, so drink from 2022.
title: Château Beynat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine from the Valade family is packed with tannins. Plenty of black fruit acts as a balance, giving the wine an excellent future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Peyrat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich, juicy wine is full of black fruits and good acidity. Ripe tannins support the delicious fruitiness. It's a wine for the medium term; drink from 2020.
title: Château la Brande 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a full-bodied wine with generous black-fruit flavors. It has enough acidity to sustain the rich black-currant and blackberry fruits. With its soft tannins and fruity aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Château du Roc 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a generous and fruity wine that has soft tannins. It is dominated by bright acidity, black-currant fruits and a light structure. With its fresh character, it will be ready soon, so drink from 2018.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Mint aromas speak of new wood as part of the aging process in this wine from Bordeaux Vineam. It has plenty of spice, while also having fine red-fruit flavors and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Rocher Bellevue 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe and perfumed wine from Vignobles Marcel Petit. It has good aging potential-full of tannins and also of bold black fruits. Structure and fruitiness are a good sign. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Pillebois 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Now fully integrated, this is a firm black-fruit flavored wine. It has dark tannins that are dry and solid, contrasted with blackberry fruit flavors and fresh acidity. There is a touch of spice giving a peppery edge to the wine. It will age further, so drink from 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2011 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a bold, fruity wine with ripe tannins and a touch of toast. This toastiness needs to soften to fill out the palate with the red-berry fruits and acidity. The tannic core is dry, firm and solid, offering aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Monbadon 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, deliciously fruity wine has red plum and black currant fruits along with fragrant acidity and a gently tannic structure. It will be ready to drink from 2017. Canadian David Curl purchased Moya in 2008; Damien Landouar is the winery director. The vineyard was certified organic in 2013.
title: Château Moya 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firmly tannic, this tough wine shows signs of over-enthusiastic extraction. That gives a bitter character that will always leave the wine with a dry core. The black fruits skins give acidity and some final freshness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 Les Armoiries de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe and fruity wine has attractive blackberry flavors along with a smoothness that comes from wood aging. The tannins give just the right amount of structure, balancing this juicy wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Picoron 2012 Sélection Prestige  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Very fruity, very juicy, this wine is all about crisp, fresh fruitiness, starting with hand-picked biodynamic vineyard plots and gravity-flow into the winery. Red currants dominate, with considerable acidity right at the fore. At the back, the tannins are developing, but fruit will be the hallmark for the long future. Owner Thierry Valette's family also owns Château Troplong-Mondot in Saint-Émilion.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Fresh and fruity, this is already very drinkable. Tannins could soften further, but the bright red fruits and acidity are juicy enough already. The mineral texture and fragrant aftertaste form a balanced combination. This Cuvée is selected from plots on the Beynat property.
title: Château Beynat 2012 Cuvée Léonard  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While there are plenty of tannins, this Merlot/Cabernet Franc/Cabernet Sauvignon blend also has a delicious, fruity character. The fresh acidity of the vintage is right there, balanced by black currant fruits and a dry core. It is developing well, and will be drinkable from 2016.
title: Château Bréhat 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a balanced wine that is quite ready to drink now. It has black fruits, soft tannins and a deliciously juicy character. It's full bodied, but has a lively, fresh acidity on the finish.
title: Château Mangot 2011 La Brande  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Owned by the Barons of Montfort, its vineyard has produced a much less rugged wine than the formidable fortress suggests. The black currant flavors are present, along with stalky tannins. There is a smoky, wood element that comes through strongly at the end, so age this wine for 3-4 years.
title: Château de Monbadon 2009  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Fruity and juicy, this is an approachable wine for short-term drinking. There are hints of new wood, along with bright black currant flavors. It's crisp and juicy, packed with fresh fruits and a balanced structure.
title: Château Aiguilhe Querre 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Soft, warm and smoky wine, this has a finely layered wood flavor to go with the black currant and red berry fruits. It's dry, yet warm and ripe, finishing with freshness.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2009  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe wine is attractively fruity. It has generous tannins that are balanced by black fruit. While not very powerful or dense, it's easy and will be ready to open from 2019.
title: Château Pillebois 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This dense wine is dominated by tannins. However, rich fruit is also there beneath the structure, suggesting excellent potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2015 Réserve de Famille  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Because this wine is still very young, it's tough and dry. While it certainly has weight and a smoky character, it only hints at ripe fruit and will need time to unwind. Don't drink it before 2021.
title: Château de Monrecueil 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This juicy wine, with its black fruit, is finely balanced between ripe fruit and tannin. It has concentration without too much toughness, suggesting it will age quickly and be very drinkable from 2019.
title: Château la Mondette 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fresh, fruity wine from organic grapes offers attractive red fruits and a backing of tannins. The dry core and the attractive fruits are coming together well, leaving a lively wine that will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Suau 2016  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With just the right amount of wood aging, this is soft, rich and smooth. Tannins are already well integrated into the blackberry fruits, giving a wine that is fruity, juicy and good for medium-term aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Terrefort Bibonne 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has weight and the potential for ripe black fruits. At this stage, it is closed up, full of suggestions without realization. Wait until 2017 for the rich character to be fully revealed.
title: Château de Potiron 2012 Cuvée Privilége  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon blend is ripe with attractive vanilla flavors from the wood aging that complement the red berry fruits. It is spicy, toasty and has a soft structure. Give it time for the wood to allow the fruit more space, but it will be a generous wine.
title: Château des Augustins 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and tannic, a firmly wood- and stalky-fruit based wine. Black currant fruits and dry tannins are the prominent characteristics. On the finish, the fruit shows a juicier feel.
title: Château Lamothe 2010 Premiére Cuvée  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm and structured, this is a textured wine, its tannins currently showing strongly. The blueberry fruit flavors offer a juicy, friendly contrast, resulting in a balanced wine that will benefit from a year or two of aging.
title: Château Arnaud Jouan 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This bold wine has all the richness and weight of this great vintage. It has also kept too many of the tannins, leaving a powerful wine that is dry and shows hints of maturity at the same time. The aftertaste keeps the dryness right up front.
title: Château de Potiron 2010 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big and rich, this wine has the dry tannins that seem to mark many wines from this estate. It is firm, dark and dense with black-plum-skin flavors. The dry character of the wine shows through in the wood-aging flavor as much as in the fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Potiron 2010 Cuvée Excellence  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full of fruit as well as some firm tannins, this wine is developing quickly. Its black-currant flavors and stalky texture bring both acidity and a dry core to the mix. The wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Château de Potiron 2014 Cuvée Privilége  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, juicy wine is packed with red fruit. Its tannins are already soft, suggesting it will age quickly. With its crisp aftertaste and plenty of fruitiness, it will be best from 2019.
title: Château Peneau 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This juicy, fruity wine has red berry fruit and gentle tannins. Although ripe, it's not rich but attractive and likely to age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Pilet 2015 Alt. 120 Metres  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: With its strong aromatic character, this wine layers firm tannins and intense acidity. Underneath all this, there is some fine fruit potential, evoking ripe blackberries. Drink from 2020.
title: Château le Doyenne 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Seriously wood-aged, this wine's fruit has nevertheless withstood the assault from the barrels. The result is a wine that is still dry and toasty, but also offers layers of black-currant flavors. A wine like this needs to calm down. It is likely to be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Mercier 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: There was probably too much new-wood aging for the fruit of this wine. It is still very dry, masking the potential of the rich blackberry flavors. Maybe things will come together, in which case wait until 2021.
title: Château Castel la Rose 2015 Cuvée Rosissime  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This rich wine has some firm tannins as well as generous black fruits. It is balanced, with the crisp acidity coming through strongly. Pepper and pure fruit flavors finish this attractive wine.
title: Château Guibonnet 2017  Cotes de Bourg

description: Based on aromas alone, this wine would easily merit 90+ points. Seductive toast, cassis, tobacco and chocolate scents leave your mouth watering. On the palate, the flavors are correct and straightforward, but don't quite match the expansiveness of the nose.
title: Château Tayac 1995 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This wine, with its gentle wood aging and ripe fruits, is the more accessible early of the two wines made at the estate. It is full of ripe berry fruits, while having a background of firm tannins and a dusty texture. The wine should be ready from 2018.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2012 Cuvée Sélection  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine is structured with firm tannins and an austere character. The sixth generation of the Hubert family at the estate has made a wine that will need time for the acidity and the structure to soften. From 2019, it will have richness and a more full-bodied character.
title: Château la Grolet 2014 Tête de Cuvée  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Smooth and balanced, this wine brings together generous red fruits and fresh acidity. Underneath, attractive, dry tannins give shape to this otherwise ready-to-drink, fruity wine. It's is a generous blend of 60% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Malbec.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2014 Tradition  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This 61-acre estate has been in the same family for five generations. Rich, luscious and fruity, this wine shows plenty of ripe, blackberry-flavored Merlot that is full in the mouth and will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Château Sauman 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: Young, fresh and fruity, this wine is bright and attractive. It has a strong juicy element along with red-currant liveliness and only a touch of tannins. It will mature early, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château Fleur de Plaisance 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: Attractively juicy fruit is fresh and full of black currant flavors. This wine still has firm tannins although they are beginning to fill out with fresh fruitiness and smoky acidity. It should still age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Vieux Ligat 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is packed with the richness of 2010 along with its structure. It has weight, juicy black and red berry fruits and a tense structure that still needs time. Acidity at the end provides a fresh lift to the essentially firm wine.
title: Château Maine d'Arman 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: With an unusually high amount (30%) of Malbec in the blend, this is a structured, firm wine. A light wood aging has helped to smooth it out, bringing out the blackberry fruit flavors. Made from organically grown grapes, it is dense and needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lion Noir 2012 Lion des Aubrots  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: The wine is stalky, driven by minerality and a tight texture. Its black currant fruit is riven with acidity, layered with wood and still very young. It does have weight, potential richness and a promising medium-term future. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine is heavily spiced from its wood aging. Fresher fruit flavors do come through to give black currants, bright acidity as well as firmer fruit structure. The wine still needs time, so drink from 2016.
title: Etienne de Tauriac 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This well-balanced wine is both fruity and structured. It has good acidity, blackberry juice flavors and a bright aftertaste. It can be drunk now-2018.
title: Château Noblet 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This perfumed wine, with ripe soft fruits, is full in the mouth. The black fruit flavors are sustained by the firm tannins and juiciness. A wine for the medium-term: 2-4 years.
title: Clos des Moiselles 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: Solid and tannic, very firm from the opening to the finish. It is based around a dark core of wood and spice as well as more juicy fruit flavors. The wine needs time to round out and bring more of the juiciness to the fore.
title: Château les Mottes Pradier 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: Full and fruity, this wine shows a dominance of Merlot, with a rich dried fruit flavor and sweet tannins. It has an attractive, juicy character on the finish.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Structured and firm with balancing red berry fruit, this is a solid, chunky wine that reflects the concentration of the vintage. It has weight, solid tannins and hints of pepper and spice. Age for 2-3 years.
title: Château Tertre de Viaud 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This crisp, red-berry-flavored wine has a firm structure as well as restrained fruitiness. Dominated by Merlot, the wine is juicy, still full of young acidity and needing time. Its tannins and final crispness suggest the wine will be ready from late 2019.
title: Château Moulin Eyquem 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine brings out the fruitiness of the vintage. Its bright red berry aromas presage the attractive fruit and juicy acidity. Wood aging gives it a dry core, although it is developing quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Piat 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: The young, berry fruit in this wine is bright, scintillating with acidity and black currant crispness. It's structured and young, but the fruitiness will allow it to age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Mévret 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wood-aged wine is seriously rich and powerful, with some bitterness from extraction. Dark chocolate flavors and firm tannins dominate it now; the fruit is there, but submerged. Give it until 2020 before opening.
title: Château Peychaud 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: The ripe fruit of the vintage is really apparent in this firm wine. Its tannins and spicy character are contrasted with balanced black currant fruit and acidity. It will need some time, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: Red fruit aromas dominate this youthful wine. On the palate, it's still tight, with fine red berry fruit flavors interlaced with tannins. The structure and acidity suggest it will age, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Noblet 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: Ripe with smooth fruit, this is a finely structured wine with black currant and licorice flavors, layered with creamy wood and ripe, vibrant acidity. The tannins are dusty, well-integrated.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2005 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This wine has attractive red fruits and firm tannins that give it the potential of richness as it ages. Acidity, spice and a juicy aftertaste complete a wine that will be ready from 2020.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2016 Château Puyanché  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe while also juicy, this is a fruity wine that is full of red fruits and a spicy texture from wood aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Arno 2014 Château Godard Bellevue  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: While the tannins are still young, enough fruit gives balance and potential to the wine. It has structure and a dry texture sustained by the black currant fruitiness in the background. Drink from 2017. Joseph Arbo bought the property in 1988 and installed a new winery in 2011.
title: Château Godard Bellevue 2013  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A rich but structured wine, this shows dark fruits and a strong tannic core. There is fine acidity and a taut, mineral texture.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2010  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine is young and full of black-currant flavors. The wine still has a stalky character that will soften. This is going to be a crisp while also structured wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beauséjour 2014  Fronsac

description: The tannins of the vintage are very apparent in this dry wine. That gives it a dry structure that was enhanced by wood aging. It needs to develop longer and become a wine that is balanced while always austere. Drink from 2017.
title: Chateau Faure Beauséjour 2011  Fronsac

description: This blend of hand-picked 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc is still tough with dark tannins and a black plum-skin texture. It has a lean side, with a severe character that seems likely to remain part of the wine. Drink from 2016. The d'Arfeuille family is now in its fifth century on Bordeaux's Right Bank.
title: Château Tessendey 2011  Fronsac

description: Intensely tannic, this structured wine has layers of wood aging, along with juicy fruits and bright acidity. There's a strongly smoky element, the wine's fruitiness balanced by a dark, toasty aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lalande Mausse 2012  Fronsac

description: Strongly woody at this stage, this wine does have the potential to reveal ripe fruits and a generous structure. Smoky flavors are beginning to balance with broad red fruits and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Union de Producteurs de Lugon 2012 Château Jeanrousse  (Fronsac)

description: A tight, stalky wine, with acidity, fresh black currant buoyed up by the dry taut tannic structure. It is on the light side, almost ready to drink, finishing with a light jamminess.
title: Château la Longua 2007  Fronsac

description: This smoky, ripe wine from the seventh generation of Medevilles is full of red fruits and balanced tannins. It conveys a juicy character from the open fruitiness and acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.
title: Château Puy Boyrein 2016  Graves

description: This rich, smoky wine comes from vines surrounding the early 14th-century castle of Landiras. At this stage, it has too much wood flavor but the bold red-berry fruits should come through strongly. Drink this ripe wine from 2020.
title: Château de Landiras 2015  Graves

description: Mint and spice come through strongly in this wine. Packed with tannins and full of black fruits, this Bérengére Quellien de Granvilliers wine has a good future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Lusseau 2016  Graves

description: This ripe, smoky wine from Xavier and Caroline Perromat is full of tannins and acidity. Juicy black-currant flavors shine through the structure, promising richness and freshness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Calvimont 2016  Graves

description: This is still a young wine, with its youthful structure of dark, stalky tannins still in place. It offers juicy black-currant flavors as well as fresh acidity and a dry aftertaste. The wine comes from a vineyard named after the 17th-century French philosopher Montesquieu. Drink from 2017.
title: Château des Fougéres 2012 Clos Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: A blend of 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is balanced and firm. The solid, dry core is developing and integrating with the black currant fruits. It's concentrated and still young, with tannins that need to soften. Give this wine until 2017.
title: Château les Clauzots 2011  Graves

description: Bright fruit is allied to a more mineral structure to give a wine that shows the freshness of the vintage plus a more long-term view. It is cool with red fruits and some firm tannins that act as a background. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Beauregard Lagupeau 2012  Graves

description: Packed with dark tannins, this complex wine shows a powerful structure allied with very fresh acidity and red berry fruits. It is still feeling its way, heavy on the texture and still waiting for the fruit. Drink from 2014.
title: Château le Bonnat 2010  Graves

description: This is a maturing, wood-aged wine, with smooth plum fruit and tannins, now maturing well. Through aging, a more tarry character is revealed, with some smokiness, while maintaining a ripe, wood-laden feel. Ready to drink now.
title: Château du Barrailh 2008 Cuvée Collection Prestige  (Graves)

description: Well balanced wine, perhaps with the wood revealing too much, otherwise with fine red berry and currant fruits and dry fruit tannins. It has structure and great juicy acidity on the finish.
title: Château le Bonnat 2008  Graves

description: Superripe Merlot, 60% in this blend, gives this wine power and density, with full-bodied black fruit and firm tannins. Wood aging, partially in new wood, has brought in spice as well as a dry core that indicates the potential of this wine as it matures. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Callac 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Graves)

description: A firm, solid wine, with a red berry fruit core, sweet flavors, some bright acidity and dark, tight tannins. In other words, it's all there in a wine that could age for 2-3 years.
title: Château Ferrande 2006  Graves

description: A rich wine that shows plenty of berry fruits, supported by some dry but dusty tannins. This is a wine that is going to develop with its firm powerhouse of ripe fruit that is emerging from a tight period in its development.
title: Château Haut Selve 2003  Graves

description: Firmly structured, full of juicy red fruits and fresh currants. The tannins are dry, but dusty, floating in the blueberry fruity character. Good acidity, structure and smoky elements from the wood. This is well-made Bordeaux at a good price.
title: Château de Carolle 2005  Graves

description: The vineyard, just north of Saint-Estéphe, has produced a structured while also fruity wine. The tannins support black-currant fruits, juicy acidity and a spicy, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château les Hauts de Gadet 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: An easy, attractive wine that shows some of the very ripe, small berry flavors of 2003. Dense but sweet tannins balance the black fruits and the solid structure which lies underneath this rich wine. One of the three Lurton properties owned by Marie-Laure Lurton.
title: Château de Villegeorge 2003  Haut-Médoc

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is fruity, lightly structured and developing quickly. It has generous black currants and black plums that are already attractive and crisp. There is a firm back drop of tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Meyre 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine has bright red fruits and lively acidity. It tastes light with only an edge of tannin to give the wine its shape. With a juicy aftertaste, it will mature quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Raux 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: The 65% of Merlot in the blend gives a wine that is soft and rounded. With its acidity and fine tannins, it is fresh and fruity. Black currants and berries dominate a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a smooth and soft wine that will develop quickly. It has a light tannin structure behind the easy blackberry fruit. The chateau is owned by Castel, the largest drinks producer in France. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Barreyres 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A ripe and fruity wine that has black fruits and intense youthful acidity. It is structured as well, the tannins from the 25% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend are showing firmly. Black currants and blackberries balance with the firm dry core. It will develop and will be ready from 2018.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014 Classic  (Haut-Médoc)

description: The vines of this estate are in the Médoc village of Lamarque in the Moulis area between Margaux and Saint-Julien. This second wine of Chateau du Cartillon is light and fruity with some black currant flavors along with acidity and a smoky touch. It is a juicy wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Cap l'Ousteau 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The second wine of Ramage la Batisse, this wine had six months in wood. It is a ripe, early developing wine that is now ready. Spice from the wood mingles easily with the smoky tannins and black currant fruit. Drink now and until 2022.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2009 L'Enclos de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: In the southern section of the Haut-Médoc, close to Margaux, this estate has produced a fresh, fruity wine. A high proportion (11%) of Petit Verdot gives it color and also a ripe juicy character. Blackberries and young tannins dominate at the moment. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Meyre 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Brightly colored, this wine is full both of fruit and smoky tannins. It is structured now, firm with its dry core. Around it, fresh blackberry and red-berry fruits are beginning to show well. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château du Cartillon 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This smooth wine has a good balance between a dry core and black currant fruit. It has a fresh character, typical of the vintage, along with acidity and smokiness from the wood aging. It will not age long, drink from 2017.
title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the Cruse family, one of the Bordeaux wine aristocracy, this rich wine is dominated by Merlot, giving it ample weight. The 18 months of wood aging shows in the smoky edge to the wine, although this will soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Taillan 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a smoky, obviously wood-aged wine. The burnt toast character is still dominant, waiting for the attractive black currant fruits to catch up. It will develop into a bright, fruity wine, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Magnol 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Ripe and fruity, this is packed with black currant juiciness supported by a strong tannic element. Vineyards close to the Gironde estuary give this property a fine location. The smokiness of the wood combines with bright acidity at the end.
title: Château du Cartillon 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the same family as Château Talbot in Saint-Julien, this vintage of Sénéjac is now mature, showing signs of leather and a firm structure rather than fruit. It's unlikely to develop further, so drink now.
title: Château Sénéjac 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: A firm and structured wine, it has solid tannins to partner the black currant fruits. A bitter flavor comes from extraction, giving a burnt character that spoils this big wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maucamps 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Very classic in style, it has firm tannins that come before black currant fruits. Its structure is dry, lightly smoky from wood aging and with a crisper fruit character underneath. The tannins need to soften before the wine can be drunk with pleasure, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: With a majority of Merlot in the blend, this is a smooth and ripely rich wine. It has sweet berry fruits, soft tannins and good juicy acidity. At this stage, the wood shows strongly, but the fruit will soon develop. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Bellevue 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a dry, structured wine, with dry tannins and stalky fruit characteristics. However, it will develop into a fruity wine without great depth but with attractive berry flavors and acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Barreyres 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Rich already, this wine is darkly tannic and powered by solid tannins. The weight of fruit behind the tannins also brings out acidity and black currant flavors. It will remain dry but well structured and with good fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Reysson 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Ripe, juicy and relatively soft, it's a great wine for early drinking. The black currant fruits are rich, soft, just cut by the acidity and with smoky tannins that lie comfortably underneath. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Gironville 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A spicy wine, with nutmeg and allspice as well as peppered plums. Against this exotic background, the tannins are solid and concentrated, suggesting good aging potential.
title: Château Laride 2011 L'Iris de Laride  Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: With the delicious black-currant aroma of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a stylish, fruity wine that also has a firmly tannic side. One of a range of wines produced by consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt, this wine exudes the attractive acidity and the forward fruitiness of the vintage.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Rich and dense, ripe and juicy, this is full of black fruits. It is smooth on the surface while solidly tannic underneath. This is an opulent wine, with a dry, wood-driven finish. Keep it for at least six years.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Much of the sweet-tasting fruit of 2009 is present in this wine, while it simultaneously features a firm core of tannins. The bright acidity is reminiscent of fresh black currants. Juicy, fruity and likely to age quickly.
title: Château Fonséche 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: This rich and dense wine is packed with dark tannins. Its wood and juicy fruit show signs of firm extraction, giving it a bitter edge. At the same time, its dense structure promises medium-term aging.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: While on the lean side, this does show juicy acidity from the black currant fruit. The tannins are integrated into the fruit while still keeping their dry character.
title: Château Mille-Roses 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: With the structured influence of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a wine that brings out the freshness of 2008, along with its firm tannins. It is still a young wine with acidity and tannins dominating the fruit.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: There are very firm, dry tannins here, and they will likely always be with the wine. That said, it has a certain weight of fruit, fresh currant skins and a final cranberry acidity. It really needs food.
title: Château Verdignan 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: Aging this wine in 100% new wood has left it very dry, the fruit tight and black but oddly drained of richness. There is sweetness along with prune flavors. But the tannins may never soften enough.
title: Château Landat 2003 Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: A firmly tannic wine that has a core of dryness surrounded by blackberry juice fruits. The acidity is tamed but present, fitting well with the solid center. For possible aging over 2-3 years.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: A soft wine, with tannins over easy, fresh fruits. The structure is light, rounded with flavors of rhubarb, black currant and red cherries to give freshness. Not a wine for aging.
title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is spicy from wood aging, giving a toasty character that needs to soften into the black-currant fruit. The structure of the wine will allow it to age well. Don't drink before 2023.
title: Château Tour du Mayne 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is produced by the same team as neighboring Lestage Simon. With its solid tannins and black-currant fruit, and with a high proportion of Merlot in the blend, it is firm and still young. It will age well, giving a rich, fruity wine from 2023.
title: Château Troupian 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: A fine, ripe wine, creamy toast coming through the red fruits and light tannins. It is already well developed, not a wine for aging, but it is delicious to drink now, very fresh, juicy.
title: Château d'Arcins 2005  Haut-Médoc

description: A firm, structured wine, tempered with some smoky wood flavors. The tannins are dry and dominant, leaving the black cherry fruit element behind. Give it 2-3 years.
title: Château Barreyres 2004  Haut-Médoc

description: From a vineyard that is split between Pomerol and Lalande de Pomerol, this wine is still firm and tannic-typical of the vintage. It seems more structure than fruit and will probably remain somewhat tough. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Altimar 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: The wine, a blend of 90% Merlot with 10% Cabernet Franc, is structured, showing plenty of tannins. The fruit is bright with some attractive acidity coming from the black-currant flavors. The wine needs a little time, so drink from 2018.
title: Vignobles K 2014 Enclos de Viaud  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: With 24 acres, this is a small estate planted to 90% Merlot. In this vintage, while the structure is all there, the wine also has a big, ripe luscious, blackberry character that will come out over the next months. The aftertaste is ripe and full in the mouth.
title: Château les Hauts-Conseillants 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Just like this wine has lost its initial red color, so too has its flavor changed. Now maturing fast, it conveys flavors of leather and acidity along with a dry edge that may be a sign of age. It's delicious, but drink the wine now.
title: Château des Annereaux 2008  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This ripe, rich and Merlot-dominated wine comes from the western section of Lalande de Pomerol. Juicy black-fruit flavors are lifted by acidity and given structure by the firm wood-aging texture. The wood needs to integrate with the fruit, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Sergant 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Ripe and fruity, this is an obviously wood-aged wine. The spice and toast need to calm down and integrate better into the rounded, generous black fruit flavors. With all the elements in place, it just needs time. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tournefeuille 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This is a very dark wine, rich in dried fruits, plums and dense tannins. The wood aging is an important element here, giving a firm and dry character. With its richness comes weight and concentration. A bitter edge suggests overextraction.
title: Château Haut-Goujon 2009  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This blend dominated by Merlot is still firm and solid, with bitter tannins and and dark chocolate flavors from hard extraction. From a selection of old vines, it's concentrated and will need aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Chambrun 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: With 44% of Cabernet Sauvignon and an equal amount of Merlot, this wine perfectly expresses the relatively cool vineyards of Listrac. It has structure, tautness and fine, violet perfumes and layers of spicy wood. Fine, clean acidity suggests good aging potential. Imported by Carolina Wine Co.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2003  Listrac-Médoc

description: There is plenty of Merlot in this ripe wine which is produced in the Listrac cooperative. Spice and attractive tannins give the wine structure and perfume. They contrast with the juicy blackberry fruits and fine crisp acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Capdet 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: Named after the outcropping of gravel on which the vines are planted, this second wine of Fourcas-Dupré is Merlot-based. With its smoky tannins and strong flavors of wood, it needs to fill out with the blackberry fruits that lie in the background. That won't take long and the wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2012 Cuvée Hautes Terres  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: One of Bordeaux's more memorable labels (orange nymphs supporting a picture of the chateau), Saransot-Dupré is one of a number of chateaus in Listrac with the Dupré suffix. This is a solid wine, chunky in a typical way for the appellation with plenty of black fruits and balanced tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: This concentrated, structured wine has an earthy quality, typical of some Listracs, along with a more juicy, fruity character that's boosted by acidity. Balanced, it will age over the medium-term. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Vieux Moulin 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: Here's a big, smooth, round wine, with tannins that are packed into the superripe fruit flavors. It is powerful and concentrated, and the wood influence is still prominent along with a touch of bitterness from overextraction. It needs time to fully integrate.
title: Château Reverdi 2009  Listrac-Médoc

description: With the rough edges and firm tannins of Listrac, this is a wine that will likely always be firm. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, it has a black currant skin flavor, some wood influence and a dry texture. It may not age further, always staying tannic and solid.
title: Château Jandel 2006  Listrac-Médoc

description: The hot, overweight 2003 vintage has not been kind to this licorice- and dark chocolate-flavored wine. It is dry, firm, while still garishly rich. If you have it, drink it now.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2003  Listrac-Médoc

description: The entry-level wine from this estate, this is soft and full of ripe strawberry flavors. Its light tannins and fruitiness go with a succulent texture to make a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château de Lussac 2015 Cuvée Bellevue  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: With its aromas and flavors of plum and leather and subtle hints of vanila, this is a supple, medium-weight Bordeaux that's ready to drink. No, it's not that intense or complex, it's just a pleasing mouthful of claret.
title: Chateau de Lussac 2000 Le Libertin de Lussac  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Dominated by 80% Merlot, this ripe and firm wine is full of red berry fruits with a solid, dry core that comes from the fruit tannins. The tannins are still young, still solid, so the wine even with its fruitiness needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Landes 2012 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine is maturing well, giving a firm, structure and some stalkiness. It's dry and will remain that way, showing some mineral texture as well as black currant flavors. The wine will be at its best in 2015.
title: Château de la Greniére 2008  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: A big rich, well-made wine that comes from Soussans in the north of Margaux appellation. It is solid, with some new wood flavors, black fruits and tarry tannins that leave a firm, dry aftertaste.
title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudiére 2001  Margaux

description: A well-flavored, well-structured wine, which emphasizes Margaux elegance. Flavors of black currant, Mediterranean herbs and spices are all harmonious. It may not be a big wine, but it has richness, light tannins and good intensity.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2001  Margaux

description: A ripe, juicy and forward wine, this is all fruit-but it's delicious fruit. The tannins are restrained behind the exuberant fruitiness. It may not be classic Bordeaux, but it is likely to be very drinkable in 2-3 years.
title: Château Mongravey 2010  Margaux

description: This Margaux is full of firm tannins that parallel the fragrant blackberry and black plum touches. It has a dense structure, very much in line with the year, while the finish is juicy and fruity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010  Margaux

description: A soft juicy wine, with mid-weight. The berry fruits, the black currant juice and the fresh acidity are enjoyable. It's developing fast, and not likely to age.
title: Château Ferriére 2007  Margaux

description: As sometimes with Angludet, there is a rusticity to the tannins that brings down the fruit. The freshness, though, is there, an attractive bright berry character, spiced with cinnamon.
title: Château d'Angludet 2007  Margaux

description: This wine is a selection from the Castera estate. The high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon gives it black-currant fruits and fine tannins. Rich and still young, the wine will age well and should be drunk from 2022.
title: Château Castera 2016 Château Bourbon la Chapelle  (Médoc)

description: A small, 17-acre property near Saint-Laurent in the north of Medoc, this is a classic Bordeaux, with its tight tannins, layers of dryness and acidity. But these are not negatives because this is a delicious food wine, one that also has great black fruits. Imported by Victoire Imports.
title: Château Périer 2003  Médoc

description: From the great 2000 vintage, this is suitably deep, impressive wine. Wood and vanilla aromas show through to taste with sweet blackcurrants, some sweet jelly flavors, balanced with a big, long-term aging structure. Magnol is a property in the southern Médoc, owned by Barton & Guestier.
title: Barton & Guestier 2000  Médoc

description: Named after the stagecoach stop just outside the chateau, this is a crisp wine, still underlined with wood, although with plenty of attractive black-currant acidity and fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2014  Médoc

description: This is a soft ripe wine. It has already delicious red fruits and gentle tannins. With a generous rich palate, it is full bodied and packed with jammy Merlot flavors. The wine will be ready to drink soon, certainly by late 2017.
title: Château de Tourteyron 2014  Médoc

description: A half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has yielded a plush wine that also has firm tannins. With its juicy blackberries, acidity and wood aging, the wine is set for slow aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2014  Médoc

description: This is a bright and fruity wine from a blend of 50-50 Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Black-currant fruit and a touch of spice from wood aging leave a wine that is juicy, packed with fruitiness and likely to be ready to drink soon. D0rink from 2019.
title: Château Taffard de Blaignan 2014  Médoc

description: The wine is ripe, weighty and full of fruit. Its tannins are already softening into the blackberry flavors. The sole question about this wine is the excessive wood aging that has given a burnt edge. Hopefully, this blend of 50-50 Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot will assert its natural fruitiness. Don't drink before 2020.
title: Château Ramafort 2014  Médoc

description: This wine with its tight black-currant character, is still also firm with tannins. It has a juicy edge that will develop well as the wine matures. With crisp acidity and structure, it should age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Méric 2014  Médoc

description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine. It has tannins and layers of spice and toast from the wood aging. Happily, the fruit is also there, giving well-balanced black currants and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Trois Manoirs 2014  Médoc

description: Equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot give this wine a ripe character. The wood aging shows in the smoky flavors that underline the juicy black-currant fruits. The wine is attractive and will soon show its fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Laujac 2014  Médoc

description: A fruity wine full of red-berry flavors. This fruitiness is balanced by the light tannins and juicy acidity, producing a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château Labadie 2013  Médoc

description: Produced from 40-year-old vines with Merlot dominant in the blend, this is a dark wine showing tight black-currant fruits and crisp acidity. With its texture and dry tannins still prominent in its youth, the wine needs to age so drink from 2018.
title: Château Hourbanon 2012  Médoc

description: This ready-to-drink wine offers fresh black-currant flavors and a streak of tannins. It has spice, fresh acidity and a bright aspect. The wood-aging has smoothed out the stalky fruits and given the wine some extra richness. Drink now.
title: Château les Tresquots 2012  Médoc

description: A hint of stalkiness to the black-currant fruit in this wine contrasts with the fresh acidity and light tannins. It's a wine with plenty of fruit that will mature quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château La Cardonne 2013  Médoc

description: Produced by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages and Michel Lynch, this wine delivers quite a success from a difficult vintage. It is fresh and with plenty of acidity, balanced by the rounded red fruits and soft tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Kirkland Signature 2013  Médoc

description: This structured, tight and still-young wine comes from vineyards in the northern Médoc. With enough weight to promise aging, it is layered with stalky black-currant flavors and firm tannins that need to soften. Underneath, there is the potential for juicy fruitiness and balanced structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château les Trois Manoirs 2013  Médoc

description: Consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt has helped this light wine to have a good balance and soft, generous fruitiness. The tannins are kind, rounded and already well integrated with the fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Maison Bouey 2013 Château Lestruelle  (Médoc)

description: This wine is ripe with dense blackberry fruits and some firm, dry smoky tannins. It has the fruitiness and acidity typical of the vintage, along with some depth of flavor and a smooth aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2013  Médoc

description: Made from 30-year-old vines, this dense wine has considerable acidity that gives a fresh edge along with spice and a juicy black-currant character. It will age quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2013 Cuvée Lucie  (Médoc)

description: Well made and balanced, this wine is full of red-currant and berry fruits plus layers of tannins. Structured and with a smoky character, it is fresh, fruity and will develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2013  Médoc

description: Under the same ownership as Château de Panigon, this property (which has a heart on its cork) has produced a wine offering layers of smoky wood as well as ripe fruit. That solid structure suggests the wine will need time to develop. The aftertaste boosts a more juicy fruitiness.
title: Château Amour 2013  Médoc

description: It's a shame so much high-toast wood was used in aging this wine. Under those flavors of smoky wood, some black fruit wants to come out. The wine does have the weight, and it will be worth waiting until 2018 before drinking.
title: Château Tour Saint Vincent 2013  Médoc

description: Fifty-year-old vines are the backbone to this firm wine. Mint and smoky wood-aging flavors give a dry, dense character. Underneath the Cabernet tannins and black currant fruit are developing well. This is a wine for the medium-term, drink from 2017.
title: Château le Reysse 2012  Médoc

description: Fruity, soft and ripe, this is almost ready to drink. Attractive berry fruits are touched by a smoky character from the wood aging. Balancing Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot equally, the wine has ripe tannins and a gentle, juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Roque de By 2012  Médoc

description: While the wood aging of this wine still shows, it's already balancing out with the ripe black fruits and rich structure. An attractive smoky character is followed by juicy berry flavors and acidity. This is a wine to age, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Noaillac 2012  Médoc

description: This is well-balanced and ripe, with plenty of room for both the attractive black fruits and the firm tannic structure. Wood aging shows, although it will integrate well. The wine is fruity, likely to be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château Courbian  (Médoc)

description: Ripe Cabernet gives this wine a great start in life. Juicy black currant is underpinned by the wood aging and tannins, giving a wine that is fruity while still structured. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Chantemerle 2012  Médoc

description: This ripe, now soft wine has gentle red fruits and soft acidity. It's ready to drink with its rich texture and smooth structure. The end is rounded, only just hinting at tannins.
title: Château Roc Taillade 2010  Médoc

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time to develop, although it will give the wine density and ripe berries in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2012  Médoc

description: An elegant wine, it has both fine structure and dense red berry fruits. The ensemble is balanced, rich while not overpowering. Drink this wine from 2016.
title: Château Haut Bana 2011  Médoc

description: Blended by top sommelier Andreas Larsson, this is a smooth, plush wine, attractively balancing acidity and black currant fruits with a core of smoky tannins. The wine has a fruity character, finished with acidity and a light structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Seran 2011  Médoc

description: Still showing its wood aging, this is a complex and ripe wine. It has weight, ripe berry fruits and juicy acidity, all supported by a firm, dry tannic structure. It's a wine for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Saint-Vincent 2011  Médoc

description: This perfumed wine is split equally between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Its tannins, already softening, support a juicy, black currant flavor, with fine acidity and a texture that only needs medium-term aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Ramafort 2011  Médoc

description: A gently perfumed wine, it has ripe, juicy black-fruit flavors and a backing of tannins. It's balanced with the dry core surrounded by rich fruitiness and a burst of final acidity. It could be drunk now, but will be better from 2016.
title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2011  Médoc

description: This is a bold, ripe and fruity wine. It has rich black currant fruits, solid tannins and a dense texture. Very aromatic, it is powered by its dry core that is showing signs of softening and rounding out. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Poitevin 2011  Médoc

description: A fruity and juicy wine, it also has a stalky, herbal element. That gives a fresh character to the wine while also showing lightness. The black currant fruits are strong and forward, with a hint of maturity that suggests this is for medium-term aging.
title: Château les Anguilleys 2011  Médoc

description: Showing considerable wood flavor, this wine has some tough tannins to overcome before it really shows its best. The fruit is ripe, full and packed with blackberry flavors. Once fully integrated, the wine should reveal more of a luscious side. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Greysac 2011  Médoc

description: Big, bold and very fruity, this is a black-currant-dominated wine. It's full of broad brush strokes of acidity and spice from wood aging. Still young, it needs to be aged. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Leboscq 2011  Médoc

description: Showing the richness and structure of the 2010 vintage, this is an opulent wine, full of black fruits. It has a dark structure, smoky bacon flavors and powerful tannins. Ripe and generous, the fruit can cope with this structure. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Beauvillage 2010  Médoc

description: Already an easy, ripe wine, this is fruity, rich and developing well. Its black currant and berry fruits give a sense of freshness, while smoky tannins suggest structure. It's not powerful, but will be very enjoyable. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Blaignan 2011  Médoc

description: This has firm tannins certainly, but also a fine underlying fruitiness, showing the potential of black currant and red berry fruit. It feels solid, concentrated and possesses very good potential.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2011 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: Mint and herb aromas are followed by a structured and tannic palate. It has balancing acidity, with a juicy black-currant flavor and a dark, dry edge. Like nearly all of the 2010s, it needs to age.
title: Château Lousteauneuf 2010  Médoc

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is finely balanced, with juicy black-plum fruit and acidity. The Merlot gives it a smoky character and a ripe, fleshy texture. Age this for 3-4 years.
title: Château Haut Barrail 2010  Médoc

description: This is a mint- and licorice-flavored wine, with its wood aging prominent at this stage. Full bodied, rich and concentrated, it shows strong signs of extraction that give it a bitter finish. Age this tannic wine for 2-3 years or more.
title: Château Lestruelle 2010  Médoc

description: This is a juicy black-currant flavored wine that's ripe in tannin and in fruitiness. It has a hint of bitter extraction and an edge of dark wood aging, which need to soften and become round, so age it for at least five years.
title: Château Carcanieux 2010  Médoc

description: New wood aromas and flavors make this selection seem dominated by toast, giving it a dry, tannic character. The ripe plum fruit is submerged and is likely to surface only after 3-4 years of aging when a powerful, upfront wine will emerge.
title: Château l'Argenteyre 2010  Médoc

description: An ancient staging post for the coaches that plied the Médoc, Patache d'Aux is now producing some fine rich wines with a sense of structure as well as fruit. This 2010 has full, sweet-tasting red fruit flavors, with firm tannins that promise to age over the next 3-4 years.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2010  Médoc

description: A blend of equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is already a well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine. It has dusty tannins suspended easily in the black currant flavor, while the dry core brings weight. Drink now or age for two years.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2009 L de Laffitte Laujac  (Médoc)

description: While the aromas speak of wood aging, the fruit comes through on the palate. It is firm, full and dry, and the fruity acidity and fresh black currant flavor backs up the structure.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Thomas Barton Réserve Privé  (Médoc)

description: Pushing forward the acidity of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured and freshly fruity wine, full of black currant flavors as well as red berry fruits. There is a dry core here from wood aging. The fruit gives a delicious buoyancy to the aftertaste.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Monfort Bellevue  (Médoc)

description: Densely tannic, this is a wine that shows some initial austerity, although the black currant fruit and toasty wood then comes through. With its structure and chewy texture, it is always likely to be a firm wine.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2009  Médoc

description: Wood-dominated wine, very structured. It is spicy, firmly dry, with juicy black currant fruit behind the wood. Give a year or two for the wood to soften out and the fruit to come forward.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2009 Les Traverses la Franque  (Médoc)

description: A rich wine laden with juicy blackberry fruits and wood tannins, lapping up the ripe vintage. Soft and ready to drink.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2009 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: Although initially austere, the wine opens up to give firm, dry tannins and black berry juice fruits, balanced with tobacco. It is restrained at this stage, the fruit not quite bursting into life. Wait for 2-3 years.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2008  Médoc

description: Finely dense wine, its tannins floating in the ripe black currant and plum fruits, leavened by roasted coffee. It is well structured, with plenty of acidity and juiciness as a contrast, leaving a mouthwatering aftertaste.
title: Château Leboscq 2008  Médoc

description: Pierced with acidity, this has intense black currant fruits and some smoky bacon flavors from the wood aging. It is firm, dry, concentrated, although not yet fully expressive.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2008  Médoc

description: At first taste, the tannins dominate. Then fresher fruit shows through. The wine is firmly dry, the texture linear, the fruit showing some black currant character.
title: Château Ramafort 2008  Médoc

description: Dusty tannins gives the wine some weight and richness. Juicy blackberry flavors combine with the fresh acidity of the vintage, but with an extra burst of power. There is a fine, crisply acidic aftertaste.
title: Château Malaire 2007  Médoc

description: Offering attractive black-currant fruit, this wine is crisp as well as structured. Layers of tannins, berries and acidity are coming together well as the wine matures. Drink from 2022.
title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2015 Cuvée Lucie  (Médoc)

description: From a chateau owned by the Bouey Bordeaux negociant family, this wine is ripe, rich and soft. Its tannic structure gives just-enough support to the attractive red-currant and berry fruits. Drink this forward, fruity wine from 2020.
title: Maison Bouey 2015 Château Maison Blanche  (Médoc)

description: This small 12-acre property has a high proportion of Merlot in its blends. Still packed with high-toast wood flavors, this wine has a future, with plenty of ripe red-berry fruits and a generous texture. Wait for the wood to dissipate and for the fruit to come forward.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2015  Médoc

description: This wine is rich, with superripe tannins and a barnyard character. It has structure but it mainly focuses on fruit and acidity. Made by the team at Cos d'Estournel, the wine has a rich structure and will be ready to drink soon, from 2019.
title: Goulée 2015  Médoc

description: Named after the stagecoach that used to stop here on its way up the Médoc, this wine is light, with soft blackberry fruits and acidity. An easy wine that's likely to mature quickly, it should be ready from 2019.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2015  Médoc

description: The 67% of Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it both richness and a firm structure. It is a solid wine, still showing its oak aging but with juicy fruit and acidity. It will develop as it softens, so drink from 2022.
title: Château Haut Grignon 2015  Médoc

description: This soft, juicy wine has ripe black-currant fruits and some smoky tannins. It is warm, generous and likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tourteyron 2015  Médoc

description: Firm, tense and dryly tannic, this is a solid wine, foursquare, its edges a little rough at present. The berry fruits are black, spicy from wood, creating a rich feel. In the end, black currant acidity and freshness finish the wine with a lift.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2006  Médoc

description: Strong aromas of new wood are confirmed by the palate, where wood flavors dominate. This is a structured wine, showing fruit acidity under the wood and sufficient weight of red berry fruits to come through in another six months.
title: Château Leboscq 2006  Médoc

description: A structured wine that gives pleasure from its ripe blackberry fruits as well as from its firm, food-friendly, spicy tannins. It has vibrant, vivid acidity that lifts the dense structure and gives an elegant feel to the close.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2006  Médoc

description: A wood-laden bottling, produced from a selection of wines at Patache d'Aux. If the wood weren't currently so dominant, the blackberry fruits would have more of a chance. It obviously needs a year or two to smooth out and come into balance.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2006 Cuvée Flora  (Médoc)

description: This wine comes from an estate owned by the same family for four generations. Dark in color and rich with generous fruit and spicy tannins, the wine is open, smoothly textured and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Gachon 2015 Cuvée Les Petites Ranga  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

description: The wine is tight with considerable tannins over the black-currant fruit. That makes for a structured dark wine with black-plum skins giving a firm texture. The wine will need time. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Marquisat de Binet 2012 Cuvée Abel  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

description: With 20% of Cabernet Franc in the blend, this is a finely perfumed wine. It has a firm texture along with juicy black fruit and some lively acidity. The 70-acre vineyard faces Saint-Émilion across a small valley. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Montaiguillon 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: The wine, with 70% Merlot in the blend, is soft with gentle open tannins. It has an attractive perfumed edge. It's a light wine, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Croix de Mission 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: A fruit-dominated wine, full of sweet, ripe, juicy flavors. It is not complex, but its richness in this vintage is going to make it very drinkable in five years.
title: Château Poujeaux 2000  Moulis

description: Powerful and structured, this has dense tannins that will always be an important part of the wine. The juicy, fresh fruit gives a perfumed character to the wine and brings out acidity as well as the dry texture. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lalaudey 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Spicy and soft, this is an easy wine, fruity and showing the freshness of the vintage. It does have a background of smoky tannins that balance the fruitiness of the wine.
title: Château Biston 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Fresh and juicy, with bright acidity and some solid tannins. Flavors of spice accompany an edge of green fruit. The aftertaste is tannins and wood.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2007 Les Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: While this wine has pleasant fruit, there are also some dark edges of black berries and rough tannins. The focus is shaded, still developing.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2007  Pauillac

description: Showing, coffee and sweet juicy fruit, the wine has a light touch, freshened with acidity and strengthened lightly with tannins. There is a meaty character, but the wine does finish a little hollow.
designation: Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2007 Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild  (Pauillac)

description: Big, fruity and softly structured, this is a fresh, juicy wine with a fine tannic element. The  black currants, black plum skin tannins and vibrant acidity pair with a dry center that gives balance.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Réserve Spéciale  (Pauillac)

description: José and Brigitte Rodrigues-Lalande are gung-ho on Pessac-Léognan. This ripe wine is ready-to-drink, full of black-currant fruit, spice and well-integrated tannins. With its balanced acidity, it is ripe and smoky with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Les Hauts de Martillac du Château Rodrigues-Lalande
title: Domaines Rodrigues-Lalande 2015 Les Hauts de Martillac du Château Rodrigues-Lalande  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: A well-balanced wine with dry fruits, flavors of black currants and fine, fresh fruit. It is not a big wine, but benefits from elegance and freshness. It is ready to drink now.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2002  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is full of tannins that are typical of the vintage. Although there are flavors of black currants, the wine is firm and still dry around the edges. It will soften while remaining tannic. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2011 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Produced from young vines, this is the third wine of Larrivet Haut-Brion. As such, it is very accessible with its ripe, red exuberant fruits. The tannins are in the background, giving the necessary structure to a wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2011 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: A wine on the lean side, relatively light, with tannins tight and firm. It has some initial easy berry flavors, but they are followed by a dry aftertaste.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: This small, 17-acre Pomerol vineyard is the only biodynamic one in the appellation. With this 2001, the Laval family has produced an intense, chocolaty Merlot (with 25% Cabernet Franc), full of smoky coffee, dark red fruits and plum flavors. Expect this wine to age over 5-10 years. Imported by Robert Chadderdon Selections.
title: Chateau Gombaude-Guillot 2001  Pomerol

description: This wine is tight and stalky with strong Merlot tannins and a feeling of firm extraction. The acidity is very present as is the dry, tight character. Still young, the wine needs to age and perhaps soften over the next five years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Patache 2013  Pomerol

description: A ripe, fruity wine, dominated by sweet Merlot with a complex layer of high spice wood flavors. The wine is rich and generous, but certainly needs to integrate its wood. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2011 L'Enchanteur  (Pomerol)

description: Dry tannins from the old wood give this wine a hard edge at first. Fresh, juicy red fruits offer an enticing character. On the finish, the tannins are tough and will need several years to soften
title: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2009  Pomerol

description: New wood influence and extraction give the wine a bitter edge, and a dark chocolate flavor dominates. It has a core of ripe black fruit that will round out as it develops. Solid, chunky, firm and dense.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2009  Pomerol

description: A dark, dense wine, still very young, but already supple. Merlot was ripe in 2004 and this wine shows it in its opulence and richness. Yet there are tannins here, so drink now, and age over the next 5 years. A great value for a Pomerol.
title: Château Grand Moulinet 2004  Pomerol

description: This has pure, black currant fruit aromas and flavors, and wood and acidity on the palate. It is packed with fresh, vibrant fruit. Imported by William Grant & Sons.
title: Château la Rose Bellevue 2000 Cuvée Prestige  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: It's rare to find a 10-year old Bordeaux just arrived in this country. This now mature wine is full and rich, its weight coming from spice and textured tannins that are laced with acidity. It is initially dry, but does open out to give a juicy, if mature, character but is unlikely to age.
title: Château Moulin de Grillet 2003 Les Ailes du Moulin  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: Soft wine, dominated by wood spice and tannins. It has weight, which suggests the juicy fruit will show through after a year. Age for 3-4 years.
title: Château l'Espérance 2008 Cuvée Carole  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: Very smooth and soft, this is an interpretation of Bordeaux that left out the tannins. But the pleasure in this easy, ripe wine is there, the blackberry fruit rich and right up front.
title: Xavier Flouret 2006 Château Haut-Meneau La Victoire  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: Big fruited wine, its wood element just a support for the ripe black berry and cranberry flavors. The tannins are a big element here, firm and very dry, but with the fruit freshness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Cantinot 2005 Haut Boutet du Château Cantinot  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: A firm, ripe wine, with good sweet black currant fruit flavors. It is structured, but mainly showing fruit rather than tannins. There is a fine, fresh finish, hinting at wood.
title: Xavier Flouret 2005 Château Haut-Meneau La Victoire  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: Smooth, rounded, with an obvious layer of wood to soften the red fruits and dry tannins. This is a balanced wine, offering some good juicy fruits and a bright red berry finish.
title: Château la Rose Bellevue 2006 Prestige  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: A Merlot-dominated wine from the east bank of the Gironde estuary. It's big, possibly too powerful, with meaty, smoky flavors and spice. Solid, chunky, it gives freshness and liveliness right at the end, as the acidity comes through.
title: Bernard Magrez 2004 Château Pérenne  (Premieres Cotes de Blaye)

description: While there is a mineral austerity to this wine, it has the potential for richness. It offers dark berries and sweet plums under the dense layer of tannins. Give it 2-3 years at least.
title: Château Suau 2006  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A wood-polished wine, smoothed by mint, black currant and black plum fruits. It has a core of dry, dense tannins, but the fruit and wood around are accessible, giving a wine that has developed fast, and is certainly ready to drink now.
title: Château Clos Bourbon 2005  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A Merlot-dominated wine, but with enough tannin from Cabernet Sauvignon to give structure. It is balanced, fresh, moving towards fruitiness, taking in red berries, plums and bright final acidity along the way.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2006  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Huge, rich, flaunting its opulence and ripeness, this super Cuvée from Château Lagarosse, powers with black stewed plums, heavy tannins, layers of wood and spice. The acidity saves it from going over the top, but only just.
title: Château Lagarosse 2005 Les Comtes  (Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: High toast and burnt wood are initially off-putting. The tannins in the wine are also on the smoky side. However, there is fruit here, offering some balance in this powerful, dry wine, and giving some blackberry juiciness, which gives relief from the intensity of the wood.
title: Château Lagarosse 2006 Les Comtes  (Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Under the ownership of American Stephen Adams, this estate is showing promise. The wine is finely structured, a smoky bacon element mingling well with fresh red plum and firm tannins. The core is dry, solid, showing wood, finishing with vivid minerality and acidity.
title: Château Lagarosse 2006  Premieres Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This firm, structured wine conveys a certain austerity. There is fruit but the skeleton of the wine is very present, emphasized by the tannins. The dry core needs to soften to allow the black-currant fruit to come through. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Bel Air 2015  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: The Dupuy family can survey their vineyards from a 16th-century castle. This wine is firm, with tannins still very much in place. At the same time, the ripe black-currant and berry fruits give the wine ripeness as well as the delicious freshness of the vintage. Drink from late 2016. This vineyard and the family's Beauséjour were certified organic in 1996, early in Bordeaux terms, and are managed by Gérard Dupuy.
title: Château Langlais 2012  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: A field blend of the Enclos vineyard has given a superrich wine, densely packed with juicy black plum fruits and sweet tannins. Ripe, full-bodied with a slight alcohol burn.
title: Château l'Enclos 2009 Triple A  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

description: From the far eastern edge of Bordeaux, this wine offers delicious, fresh fruits structured by light tannins. Its black currant flavors are right up front, pleasure without complications.
title: Château le Pré de la Lande 2004 Réserve de la Famille  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)
winery: Château le Pré de la Lande

description: Grown on the plain below Saint-Émilion, this open, gently fruity wine is young. Its blackberry flavors still show the wood aging, giving spice as well as attractive fruitiness that will soften and integrate. Drink from 2020.
title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2015 Château Billerond  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A branded Saint-Emilion from the local cooperative, one of the best in Bordeaux. The label is designed to please-bright yellow with a smiling face, so different from the average Bordeaux label. And the wine is also designed to be a crowd puller-soft, open Merlot with very ripe tannins and richness rather than dryness.
title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Emilion 2005 Emilio  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Shows a fair amount of toasty, vanilla-scented oak, but its well balanced by cassis and tobacco notes. Medium-to-full-bodied, with a supple mouthfeel and dusty earth and tobacco flavors. Ripe cherry fruit comes through on the finish, suggesting that better things may emerge in another couple of years.
title: Château Berliquet 2002  Saint-Émilion

description: There is plenty of fine fruit in this wine. It has fresh, lively blackcurrant flavors as well as generous, soft, sweet tannins. It seems rather one-dimensional at this stage, leaving a question-mark over its development.
title: Château Fombrauge 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: The wine, with its juicy red fruits, has fine acidity as well as a core that has a dry tannin and mineral texture. It is structured and firm with the fruit still developing. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Magnan-Figeac 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Grown on the flat plain beneath the ridge of Saint-Émilion, this wine comes from light sand and gravel soil. That is reflected in the balance of the wine. Its firm tannins are comfortably embedded in the ripe berry fruits and the wine will soon be ready to drink. Just wait until the end of 2017.
title: Château Beauséjour les Maurins 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Still full of tannins, this is a tight strongly textured wine. It is dry, just hinting at black fruits and juicy acidity. It is probably already aged and so will remain a firm wine with fruit flavors in the background.
title: Château Corbin 2011 Divin de Corbin  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Hugely dense and dark, the wine is over the top in all respects. From the heavy bottle to the much too concentrated fruit and wood flavors, it is a statement wine. Its saving grace is the quality of the vintage that inevitably has produced a wine that will balance out the tannins as it matures. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Vieux-Guinot 2010 Osage  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Named after the patron saint of wine producers, this wine is properly balanced, structured and dense. It is not a wine for long aging with its soft tannins and juicy black-fruit acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Clos Saint-Vincent 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: A large (for Saint-Émilion) estate of 93 acres has produced a dark wine that is layered with tight, dry tannins. The fruit is still buried under this tough exterior, although there are strong hints of the juicy black currant future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cantin 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Juicy and fruity with acidity and black currant fruits, this wine comes from a vineyard on slopes at the entrance to Saint-Émilion. It's bright and fresh with lively, easy fruits and soft tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Simard 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: One of the many chateaus with vines on the wide valley floor of the Dordogne, this estate has made a lightly extracted wine that has chocolate as well as blackberry stalkiness. There's freshness as well, with fruit acidity that cuts through the mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Chapelle Despagnet 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: A rounded, mint and wood-flavored wine from the plain of Saint-Émilion between the city and the river Dordogne. It's balanced and fruity, with just the right amount of tannin to sustain the black currant flavors. It is maturing and will certainly be ready to drink in 2015.
title: Château Joly 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Young vines have gone into this fruity wine. It is full and rich in the mouth, with juicy black currant fruits and smoky tannins. The attractive perfume from Cabernet Franc moves easily into final acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Les Hauts de Croix de Labrie 2012  Saint-Émilion
winery: Les Hauts de Croix de Labrie

description: This rich and rounded wine comes from the flat lands of Saint-Émilion, giving it a soft and gentle feel. Acidity and ripe black fruits dominate the light structure. It's a wine for medium-term aging, ripe and ready to drink from 2016.
