title: Château Jacques Noir 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: A classically firm wine, it gains weight and richness from the juicy black plum fruits. The firm, dry structure underlies the natural ripe fruitiness. It needs to soften out, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Château Haut Boutisse 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Very soft and ripe, this is a juicy wine. It has only the lightest structure, its texture a generous mix of rich fruits and fresh acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Clos Junet 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a richly structured and deliciously juicy wine. The tannins are fully integrated into the fruit. The downside of the wine is a touch of greenness, particularly in the acidity.
title: Château La Serre 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: The wood, with its heavy toast and licorice flavors, is dominant. That element makes for a wine that has weight but loses its fruit amid the firm extraction.
title: Château Fombrauge 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This tough, tannic wine is all structure and wood flavor, which results in a firm, solid feel, with a black-currant-driven fruit character. The toast adds a burnt edge.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: New wood flavors go over the structured fruit and give currant flavors. It is already coming into balance and is for medium-term aging. The vineyard is on the plain beneath the hill of Saint-Émilion.
title: Château de la Cour 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A wine that shows firm tannins, fruit and wood acidity. It is now ready to drink, a wine that will remain firm and dry.
title: Château Bellerose Figeac 2007 Prestige  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A full, rich wine, with tobacco aromas and fine juiciness that is showing a more licorice, chocolate character while retaining red berry flavors. Acidity cuts through the wine along with toast notes.
title: Château Rocher-Figeac 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: With good density, this is a success for the vintage. It has ripe, smooth fruit, flavors of black berry, the tannins well integrated. Age for a year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A rich, smoky wine, full of bitter chocolate flavors as well as plum jam. The tannins give structure to this well-balanced wine, which will age over the next 1-2 years.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of Château Fonplégade is fresh and bright with good fruits, berry flavors and some richness. It has good poise; ready to drink in 2-3 years.
title: Château Fonplégade 2007 Fleur de Fonplégade  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A firm but fresh wine, the black currant fruit flavors right to the fore. Tannins are solid, dry, but fit well with the fruit profile. There is final fresh acidity.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Château la Couronne  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Very toasty wood aromas, the wine itself packed with new wood, fresh spice, the fruit lost somewhere at this stage. But it does have some weight and underlying hints of concentration.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: From vines on the flat outcrop of Saint-Émilion near the Dordogne river, this soft wine is smooth and will age quickly. Its blackberry fruit is ripe, with a lift by acidity, while the tannins are gentle with just a touch of dryness. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Château Jupille Carillon 2016 Cuvée Amélie  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine is soft and juicy, with attractive red berry fruit. Reflecting the vintage, it's a light with a dry core that will soften soon. The aftertaste is dry. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Coutet 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: From vines to the east of Saint-Émilion city, this wine is structured and firm. It will take time for the black fruit to come through, so drink from 2019.
title: Château des Laudes 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: From vines on the plateau to the west of the village of Saint-Émilion, this is a light, fruity wine. Its acidity and tannic structure lend a crisp texture to its black currant fruit. It will probably broaden as it matures, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Truquet 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: The 100% new oak used in the aging of this wine was not a good idea. It has given too much woodiness and not enough fruit. Still young, it may soften enough to allow the generous blackberry flavors to come through.
title: Château Valade 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of Fonplégade is soft, gentle, the tannins firmly surprised behind a velvet texture and ripe fruit. There is a jammy, sweet quality to the wine, and it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Fonplégade 2006 Fleur de Fonplégade Grand Cru  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Black plums fresh acidity combine with a good weight from dusty tannins and a good juicy undertow. The wine suggests a property on the way up, a marked improvement on previous vintages, with balance ripeness and aging potential.
title: Château Trimoulet 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: A ripe, smooth, smoky wine, in which the fruit is dense, almost sweetly rich. Spicy wood is a strong component, going right above the berry fruit flavors. This is an immediate, fruity, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Soft, ripe and rounded, this shows a gentle side of Bordeaux. The tannins are sweet, just hinting at wood, but this is more about blackberries and a finishing sweetness.
title: Château Teyssier 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Smoke and tobacco aromas go with dry, dusty tannins, dried fruits, strong spice and Cabernet Franc perfumes. This is all about dried flavors, the black fruits a supporting element, with a generous, full aftertaste over acidity.
title: Calvet 2005 Réserve des Remparts  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is young, dominated by some spicy wood and quite densely textured fruit and tannin. Impressive for a branded wine, all vibrant fruit, balanced by a firm, dry structure, and with a rich aftertaste. Age this for at least 1 year.
title: Jean-Pierre Moueix 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: A fairly forward wine with a strong nose of cassis, earth, herbs and tobacco. Spicy plum and roasted red berry flavors on the open, fairly supple palate. Has good fruit and a full finish with moderate tannins that dispalys licorice and dark fruit flavors. Good now, better in two years.
title: Château de Pez 1995  Saint-Estéphe

description: An open and easy wine, and very nicely done for this tough year. Red-fruit aromas, with cedar and herb accents. Lighter cabernet flavors. Shows good balance and a creamy mouthfeel. Finish is medium-length and pleasant. Drink now.
title: Château de Pez 1997 Grand Vin  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: While this wine has plenty of tannins, the generous blackberry fruits dominate. It is balanced with a fresh character that brings out just the right amount of acidity. The dry core will allow the wine to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tour des Termes 2013  Saint-Estéphe

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time develop, although it will provide density and ripe berry fruits in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s, is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2012  Saint-Estéphe

description: The smoky aroma and toasty wood character smothers the fruit. It is a tough wine at this stage although it does hint at some of the 2012 juicy fruit flavors. Drink this firm, solid wine from 2018.
title: Château la Haye 2012  Saint-Estéphe

description: Produced from young vines at Château Phélan-Ségur, this is a rich, spicy and open wine. It is bursting with fruitiness, packed with blackberries and with a rounded texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2011 La Croix Bonis  (Saint-Estéphe)

description: From a tiny, seven-acre property in Saint-Estéphe, this is a Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine with black currant fruit and good, firm fruit tannins. There is a smoky wood element to balance the lively, youthful acidity.
title: Château Graves de Pez 2009  Saint-Estéphe

description: Produced by the Saint-Estéphe cooperative, this wine has a good sense of richness along with a soft texture and generous black fruits. It is a confident wine, ripe and fruity, while also having enough tannins to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Léo de Prades 2015  Saint-Estéphe

description: Ripe fruit, sweet tannins and soft texture mark this wine. It's full, ripe and lightly structured. An attractive wine for its black fruit and forward character. Drink in 2-4 years.
title: Château Macquin 2011  Saint-Georges-Saint-Émilion

description: Untypical of Saint-Julien, this wine is solid, chunky, quite foursquare. But it has good punch, richness and depth, along with concentrated black fruits.
title: Château Gloria 2000  Saint-Julien

description: Made using single-variety vats in the early stages, this is a big, ripe and fruity wine with weight and attractive acidity. Its smoky edge and licorice flavors don't mask the black-currant fruit and acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Vallier 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine, unusually 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, is ripe and juicy with some smoky tannins in support. It has a finely perfumed character although touches of extraction give it a bitter edge. That should blow by, leaving an attractive fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2014  Bordeaux

description: This finely balanced wine is poised between spicy wood notes and black currant fruit. It's lightly structured with fine tannins and plenty of juicy acidity. Although young, it has been made to drink now.
title: Ignatus 2016  Bordeaux

description: While this wine has a dry core, berry flavors accompany the dry tannins. From a 45-acre estate, this ripe, juicy wine shows the structure of the vintage and the rich fruits. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Les Grands Maréchaux 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a wine on the cusp of being mature. The red-berry flavors are dissipating into a secondary aromatic character. The tannins, though, are still there-very firm and showing no sign of budging. Wait and see, or decant before drinking. This is part of a single-parcel (lieu-dit)single-varietal range.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2012 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Pure Merlot, ripe and fruity, this wine has only the lightest of tannic structure. That makes for a soft rounded wine from the area close to Lussac Saint-Émilion. Black plum and berry flavors are laced with acidity and finish with a smooth aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château des Arnauds 2014  Bordeaux

description: With vines close to the Garonne river south of Bordeaux, this small vineyard has produced a light and fruity wine with red berry flavors. It's soft, just lightly tannic and ready to drink now.
title: Clos des Justices 2014  Bordeaux

description: Soft, ripe, red fruit-flavored Merlot gives a round character to this rich wine. It has plenty of spice, juicy acidity and gentle tannins that make it drinkable young.
title: Grand Bateau 2016 Sécret de Grand Bateau  (Bordeaux)

description: From the same stable as Château Lynch-Bages, this is superior branded Bordeaux. It is fruity, ripe, full-bodied with solid dense tannins. An impressively powered wine, with some fresh black currant flavor and acidity.
title: Michel Lynch 2005  Bordeaux

description: This Jean-Pierre and Philippe Riviére label benefits from the ripeness of the vintage to bring out red plum and a rich structure. The acidity and tannins perfectly emphasize the generous fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Garros 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Balanced spice and ripe black fruits give this wine a smooth fruity character. Of course, it has tannins but they are there in a supporting role, lending weight to the fruitiness and the nutmeg spiciness. Drink now.
title: Château Moulin de Beauséjour 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Good flavor and feel, with some elegance to boot. Aromas of spices and earth, with a mild bell-pepper element. Positive fruit, with plum, blackberry and cocoa on the medium palate. Even some complexity and structure on the medium-length finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 1998 Founder's Collection  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

description: This is a bold and ripe wine from the gravel soil of Lalande de Pomerol. It is now reaching maturity. It has rich blackberry fruits, layered with acidity. The tannic core is still firm giving the wine the chance to age further. Drink until 2022.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2012 Château la Croix  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: The vineyards of this estate take their name from their hillside (Puy) position. The wine is still very young with its generous black fruits and acidity still bubbling with energy. With tannins in the background, it will be a wine that develops relatively quickly, certainly ready to drink by 2019.
title: Château Puy Rigaud 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: In its antique bottle, this wine (one of a limited series) is laden with more wood than fruit. It will certainly soften, allowing the black fruits to come through, but this amount of wood will be hard to balance out. Drink from 2020.
title: Belliard Vins Selections 2014 Excellence de Belliard  (Pomerol)

description: Ripe while still firmly tannic, this wine is still very young. It has a tough character from the dry extraction and new-wood aging, leaving a bitter edge that needs to soften. Made from organically grown grapes, the wine will likely be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Château Moulin de Lagnet 2015 Merlot  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Initially a fresh, fruity wine that only shows a streak of tannins and dryness. Pure Merlot, it has generosity, even if remaining light and fresh. There is a final pure line of acidity and berry fruits.
title: Château le Prieuré 2007 Délice du Prieuré Grand Cru  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This ripe, fruity wine is full of red fruit flavors. It has spice, attractive tannic structure and ample acidity. With its balance coming together, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Barton & Guestier 2014 Passeport  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, smoky and filled with black fruits, this wine has all the elements for aging. Not for the long-term, but over the next few years, its tannins will develop to support to the full berry flavors. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Baron d'Estey  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This richly fruity wine offers great tannins and layers of black-currant and berry flavors from the Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Cabernet Franc blend. With no apparent wood flavors, the freshness of the fruit is palpable, partnered by the supporting tannins behind. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Château Dubraud 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is an immediately attractive, ready-to-drink wine. Its soft tannins and bright fruit are already open. With berry flavors, ripe acidity and a generous, rich aftertaste, it is balanced, with great fruitiness at the end.
title: Château Crusquet de Lagarcie 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Now fully mature, this attractively perfumed wine is full of jammy berry fruits, mint and spice from wood aging. The wine is a blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, full in the mouth without being heavy. It is delicious to drink now.
title: Château Crusquet de Lagarcie 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This richly perfumed wine is ripe with both tannins and concentrated blackberry fruits. From a 24-acre estate, it has weight, density and a good future. Drink this structured, juicy wine from 2021.
title: Château Le Cap 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Vignobles Ardoin's Merlot-dominated wine is well structured and full of fruits. The tannins and blackberry flavors are full bodied and integrated, giving richness and a fine future. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Cap Saint-Martin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe, rich and juicy, this is a full, warm and rounded wine. Fine tannins are layered with plenty of acidity and berry flavors. Spice comes through to fill out this ripe wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Grand Bourgeau  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured and firm, this wine has weight and dense tannins. Black- coffee flavors hint at extraction although the ripe berry fruits act as a balance and contrast. This wine will take a while to develop, so wait until 2022.
title: Château Ségonzac 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This dense Denis Lafon wine is packed with tannins and also with juicy, ripe Merlot fruit, offering the potential for aging. Black-currant flavors are laced through the firm structure and the serious tannins. It has a good future after 12 months in wood, some of it new. The wine's structure is still firm and the wine will gradually open out. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Aged in tank, this ripe, fruity wine is packed with red-berry flavors. Ripe tannins support the fruitiness and acidity. It's an attractive wine that will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bellerives Dubois 2016 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jean-Michel Bergeron's wine is developing well, showing ripe fruits, wood flavors and some tannins. It offers red-berry flavors, spice and a core of dryness that will allow it to age further. Drink this wine from Vignobles Gabriel from 2021.
title: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2016 Château Haut La Valette  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe strawberry flavors come through strongly in this wine. Its berry fruits, generous sweetness and balanced acidity are all in place to offer a full-bodied, fruity wine from 2021.
title: Château la Gamaye 2016 Distinction  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: An attractive, fruity wine with good acidity and firm tannins, this bottling is designed to be drunk soon. Juicy black-currant flavors are right up front, supported by ripe tannins. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016 Cuvée Traditionnelle  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This dense Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon blend offers ripe black fruits, rich tannins and good concentration. Aged for 18 months, the blackberry flavors are generous, backed by acidity and a smoky aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Berthenon 2016 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Produced by Vignobles Carreau, this is a delicious, ripe and fruity wine. It also has layers of new wood and some firm tannins. The result is a balanced, generous wine powered by tannins but with generous swathes of black fruits. Drink from 2021.
title: Amiral 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This 90% Merlot wine reflects the generous texture and ripe red-berry fruits of the vintage. It is already showing signs of maturing, softening the fruit and moving towards some secondary flavors. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château la Gamaye 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Vines situated close to the fortified citadel of Blaye have produced this bright and shiny 2014. With its clear red-berry fruits, black currants and acidity, it is immediately attractive. The tannins, a great support to the fruit, promise some aging. Drink now, or, better yet, wait until 2018.
title: Château Haut Colombier 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A wine that has layers of new wood as well as blackberry fruits. With firm, young tannins at this stage and also plenty of fruit, this Noël family wine is likely to develop into a rich wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Saint Germain 2014 Elégance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dry wine, packed with tannins at this stage. With concentrated fruits and spice in the background, it will become a rich structured wine. This Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon wine was vinified for 12 months in French oak and six months in underground cement vats-aiming for drinkability for at least 10 years. But go ahead and drink the wine starting from 2019.
title: Château Berthenon 2014 Cuvée Henri  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is both dense and fruity. It has fine tannins that are dark and concentrated. The berry flavors are balanced with acidity and touches of wood-aging spice. Give it until 2018 and consider opening for an hour before tasting.
title: Château Berthenon 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Perfumed with wood flavors, this is a dry wine at this stage. Let the black-currant fruitiness from the organic Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon grapes come through before drinking. Acidity and a fresh character promise well. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Frédignac 2014 F de Frédignac  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Stephane Heurlier makes a generous yet structured wine that's full of fruit. It has plenty of spice and black currant layered with a touch of chocolate and coffee. Let the wine mature and drink from 2019.
title: Château la Bretonniére 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe and spicy wine, this is structured with black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It is still very young: its exuberant fruitiness likely to calm as it matures. Give this ripe wine until 2019.
title: Château Haut le Valette 2015 Cuvée Caractéres  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is soft, ripe and fruity with fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruit flavors. Structured and spicy, it will develop well into a concentrated ripe wine. Jean-Michel Baudet's Blaye estate vineyards were the first to be certified sustainable by Terra Vitis. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ricaud 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity wine with fresh acidity and light tannins, this is going to be ripe with a juicy character and bright tannins. After four years of conversion by Vincent and Ludivine l'Amouller, the estate's fourth generation, the 2014 vintage is now certified organic.
title: Château Frédignac 2014 Terroir  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This 10-acre vineyard in the Carreau portfolio is surrounded by a stone wall (which is unusual for Bordeaux). The wine with its firm tannins is still very young. But with a structure and with balanced fruitiness it will develop well. There is plenty of fine, juicy acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château Cône-Taillasson Sabourin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dating back to the 16th century, this estate's 52-acre vineyard faces the Gironde estuary. The wine is dark, firm and concentrated. The tannins are firm, and hard edged. The acidity and the smoky character of the wine make a fine balance with its tough, young side. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Peyredoulle 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine showing the fruit and freshness of the vintage. That black-currant fruit character is filled out with spicy red fruits, balanced tannins and a jammy, red-berry texture. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château l'Espérance 2012 Espérance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A blend with over half Merlot, this has developed into a ripe, smooth wine from a fine vintage. It has just the right amount of dusty structure to sustain the rich blackberry fruits and smoky wood flavors. It has a juicy, ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Cantinot 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe wine has light tannins to go with its red currant and blackberry fruits. The blend is 70% Merlot, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Cabernet Franc. It is developing fast. With its acidity and gentle tannins it will be ready from 2017.
title: Château Chantemerle 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and luscious, this reflects the fruitiness of the vintage very well. It has tannins that will develop, although the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity dominate at the moment. Drink from 2018.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Château Pérenne  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big, full-bodied and very much a product of the 2010 vintage, this structured, generous wine needs time. The dry tannins are still prominent, giving a tough edge to the more generous, concentrated fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Château des Tourtes 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wood-aging flavors are strong although not too dominant. They ride well with the solid fruit tannins, flavorsome blackberry fruits and firm, smoky aftertaste. This balanced wine will need some aging; drink from 2016.
title: Château la Valade 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Attractive and smooth, this is a ripe, broad wine with its soft, juicy red berry fruits and supporting firm tannins. Balanced and fruity, it is ready to drink, finishing with a crisp texture of acidity.
title: Château Bertinerie 2011 Grande Cuvée  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A wine that is well balanced with attractive ripe berry fruits and generous tannins. It has weight and richness, allowing room for the development of both the structure and the fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Château La Roche Bazin 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold and fruity, this blend is ripe, full of juicy black fruits, with a core of dry tannin. It is going to be a delicious wine with great fruitiness and attractive acidity. A mineral element at the end will allow it to develop well. This is a second wine of Jean-Michel Baudet, fifth-generation winemaker. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2012 Mon Rouge  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Situated on limestone and clay (peyredoulle means hard rock in an old dialect), the wine offers spice and sweet fruit flavors, balancing wood and fruitiness. The classic Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot blend has considerable potential, allowing plenty of room for the fruit and the wood tannin flavors to integrate. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Peyredoulle 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Smoky and toasty, this is a structured wine. It has layers of black currant fruits, fresh acidity as well as firm tannins that overlay the juicy fruitiness. It needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Chantemerle 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and dry, it's packed with as much tannin as fruit. It has a dark, structured character that's shot through with mint and black currant flavors. The aftertaste is dense and solid. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Gauthier 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Very firm tannins dominate this potentially ripe, juicy wine. So while it is structured with some bitter chocolate flavors from extraction, it also has red berry fruits and fresh acidity at the end. It will mature quickly, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A rich wine that has weight, solid tannins and ripe black currant flavors. It conveys a strong sense of structure without losing sight of a stylish fruitiness and firm texture. With acidity cutting through the richness, it will age well. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Bertinerie 2011 Merlot-Cabernet  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Showing the rich fruit of the vintage, it has warm red berry juiciness and an added smoky flavor. The wine is round yet still structured enough to balance its ripe surface. Drink this wine soon, best from 2015.
title: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2009 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A smooth, rich wine, it is full of opulent black fruits. It has weight, solid tannins and a great juicy swather of fruitiness. Aromatic and ripe, it is already developing well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2011 Elegance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Serious and tannic, this wine is slow to show its virtues. It does have black currant and plum juice flavors that are coming through the dense, dry structure. It needs to age, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Château Ricaud 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This big, ripe, Merlot-dominated wine has great black fruits that envelop the firmer, smoky tannins. Generous and rich, it's already an attractive wine but one which will age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, fruity, juicy wine shows both the richness as well as the freshness of the vintage. Forward and fruity with black currants and red berries, it's already a delicious wine with dry tannins lending some structure . Drink now.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: There is rich, warm fruitiness here from ripe blackberries and plums. The wine has weight and concentration, but is framed with dry tannins. The wine should develop well, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Bellevue 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a solid and structured wine that is lightened by its juicy acidity. Black currant fruits dominate, giving a fresh character to the wine. The tannins that show through do promise medium-term aging. Drink from 2014.
title: Château Haut Mazerolles 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and sweetly fruity, this is a black-currant and berry-flavored wine, with balanced juiciness and a judicious use of wood. Full-bodied, it's likely to age well over the medium term.
title: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A big, bold, fruity wine, this has great tannins, ripe black-currant fruit and an attractive sense of structure. It has all the juiciness and freshness of 2010, but is a wine for aging over 3-4 years.
title: Château Fontenelle 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big, bold and juicy, with ripe black fruits that dominate the rich tannins. The power and concentration both promise a good future for this solid, full-bodied wine, so keep for 4-5 years.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firmly tannic yet with enough sense of juicy fruit to act as a balance, this is a fine, rich wine, showing power and concentration with a solid, ripe structure. Give this wine at least five years to soften and round out.
title: Château Gigault 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While it has sufficient tannin, the wine also has a feeling of generous black currant and berry fruits. It's dry with considerable concentration, but it's future looks good, so keep for 5-6 years.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2010 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This black-fruited effort is laced with a spicy wood note. It's surprisingly delicious now, considering the firm tannins that compose its core, but the wine also promises some aging. Drink now for fruit, and age for more complexity.
title: Bernard Magrez 2011 Château Baffort  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: New wood, mint and eucalyptus aromas lead to a palate that is dominated by wood. With the rich fruit underneath, the wine will come into balance, becoming warm and generous, typical of the vintage.
title: Château Glorit 2009  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Full of rich smoke and black currant fruits, there is already weight here as well as a juicy character. The immediately attractive wine has wood, spice and delicious red fruit acidity to finish.
title: Château Bertinerie 2010 Merlot/Cabernet  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine from a 14-acre family estate is ripe, soft and full of blackberries. It has a succulent character along with its fruit and acidity. Soft tannins and a ripe texture indicate this wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Moulin 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This perfumed wine is ripe with exuberant black fruit and hints of wood aging. It's juicy with spice and pepper notes as well as bold red fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is firm, with dry, smoky tannins that underscore its rich black fruit, promising good aging potential. It will develop slowly and be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Mayne Mazerolles 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This structured wine is firm with tannins and stalky black currant fruit. It's dry, with a bitter edge from high extraction. A smoky character indicates aggressive wood aging and the need to soften further. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Gatines 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This smoky wine is full of wood and spice notes. Ripe fruit is also there, with some solid tannins to back it up. It will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bourdieu 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A toasty, spicy aroma reveals the wood-aging flavors that are still firmly in place in this wine. Underneath, there is fine, juicy black currant fruit, crisp acidity and good potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Seguin 2015 Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This solid and dense wine is full of tannins as well as layers of wood and blackberry fruit. It has the potential to gain in richness as it develops. A smoky quality accents its black plum flavors. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Ricaud 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe and spicy wine has fine tannins and smoky wood flavors that balance its rich black fruit. That indicates it will age well-rich in both structure and fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château l'Espérance 2015 Les Origines  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe berry aromas set the scene for this balanced, juicy wine. Full of black currant and berry flavors, it's already delicious with its fruitiness. The tannins, though, need to calm down somewhat, and the wine will be better from 2019.
title: Haut Peyrefaure 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Great black fruit aromas and a perfumed palate give this fruity wine a fine start. It has some firm tannins as well as juicy black currant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Seguin 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is ripe, juicy and full of attractive red berry flavors. Its acidity is balanced by firm, still-young tannins. It will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Peyredoulle 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, with delicious red berry flavors, this wine is attractive now. It also has some firm tannins built for aging, giving structure to the juicy fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe, fruity and dense, this wine has weight and richness. Concentrated with solid tannins, it has smoky flavors and ripe blackberry fruit. Give it until 2020 before drinking.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This jammy wine has plenty of tannins, although they're already fully integrated with the ripe red fruit. Fruity, perfumed and spicy, it finishes with fine acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Jonqueyres 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is aromatic, spicy and likely to develop quickly. That shows in the fragrant black currant fruit and generous tannins. Its acidity should be fully integrated with the fruit and the wine ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Grelot 2015 Coteaux du Methez  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is firm with powerful surface tannins. Underneath, its blackberry-like fruit is developing, bringing out spice, acidity and plenty of weight. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2015 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A spearmint aroma give this wine a fresh character. That enhances its berry fruit, spice and perfumed acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Saint Germain 2015 Elégance  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full and rich, this wine has weight and good potential. The tannins are firm, solid and dense with a dry core, but surrounded by generous fruit and acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Dourthe 2016 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux)

description: This concentrated wine with dense tannins is powerful. It has big black fruits, a ripe structure as well as great fruitiness. Drink this already balanced wine from 2020.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle  (Bordeaux)

description: This rich wine that is smoothly structured with spice and smoky fruit shows excellent potential. Density, dusty tannins and bright acidity all point to readiness from 2021.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2016  Bordeaux

description: Ripe fruit and fine tannins are well balanced in this rich wine. With its acidity and juicy black-currant fruits, the wine is already delicious. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Château Baruaud  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is tannic and firm with concentration and rich black fruits. It has power and a strong sense of structure. The wine will need some time to develop, so will be best left until 2022.
title: Château Curton La Perriére 2016  Bordeaux

description: Eucalyptus aromas and juicy fruit come together in this harmonious, ripe wine. Its tannins and structure balance well with the blueberry flavors and acidity. The wine will develop slowly, so wait until 2022.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2016 Cuvée Michel  (Bordeaux)

description: This balanced wine has both firm tannins and rich fruit. They are beginning to come together to give a full, structured wine, packed with bold black flavors. Drink from 2021.
title: Producta Vignobles 2016 Château Moulin de Lagut  (Bordeaux)

description: Intense acidity and crisp red fruits are balanced by a core of dry tannins. This wine has structure and is firm at this stage, but the fresh, smoky fruitiness means it will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Thieuley 2016  Bordeaux

description: An attractively perfumed wine with soft ripe tannins, this is already balanced. Its wood flavors and black currant fruit are generous and rich. The wine should be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Tassin 2016  Bordeaux

description: Full of fruit as well as tannins, this Boissonneau wine is powerful and dense. Its ripeness and concentration come from the vintage and give a powerful wine that has good potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Moulin de Ferran 2016  Bordeaux

description: This balanced wine has fine tannins that go well with the juicy black fruits. Structured and full of bold fruits, it is likely to be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château le Sépe 2016 Cuvée Classique  (Bordeaux)

description: This spicy wine with black-currant fruits and acidity is produced by the team of Saint-Julien's Château Gloria. It needs until mid 2019 for the wood to calm down and then it will be a ripe, easy and deliciously open wine.
title: Château Gloria 2016 Bordeaux de Gloria  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine from Celliers de Bordeaux Benauge has firm tannins that lie over the ripe berry fruits. All this will develop into a ripe, structured wine with good acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château des Combes 2016  Bordeaux

description: This is an attractively nuanced wine, with good acidity giving way to red-berry flavors and then some firm tannins. The wine is set to develop well and should be drunk from 2020.
title: Château Thieuley 2016 Réserve Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux)

description: Spicy with layered wood flavors as well as the taste of black currants, this wine is full of the juicy fruitiness of the vintage. It is now maturing well. Wood aging has given an edge of warmth to the wine, balanced with acidity and a rich aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Léognan 2014 Renaissance  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe fruit vies with firm tannins to produce a wine that is structured and also rich. As the two elements develop, this will become a full and powerful wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Grand Champ 2016  Bordeaux

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is soft and generous, filled with ripe black fruits and juicy acidity. It offers berry flavors and a warm, rich structure, with tannins lifted by the backdrop of fresher fruit. The wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Bicou 2015  Bordeaux

description: From vines situated in the heart of the Entre-Deux-Mers region, this wine is structured and firmly tannic. The tannins just avoid bitterness through the potential of the ripe black-currant fruits and acidity. It's a wine to age; drink from 2020.
title: Château Fonfroide 2016  Bordeaux

description: The good quality of this vintage is very present in this ripe, juicy wine. Smooth, rich tannins are contained in warm, succulent Merlot fruitiness and acidity. This already enjoyable wine will be even better from 2019.
title: Château de Juge 2016  Bordeaux

description: Fine, dusty tannins give this wine a warm feel. Its rich structure is matched by the ripe blackberry fruits and given a lift by acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Costis 2016  Bordeaux

description: Produced by the team from Saint-Émilion classed-growth Château Beau-Séjour Bécot, this wine comes from selected old vines. It has weight and just the right concentration as well as poised blackberry fruits and acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Famille Bécot 2015 Instant Bécot  (Bordeaux)

description: This firm, structured wine will age well. It's still young, juicy with direct black-currant flavors. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Taussin 2017  Bordeaux

description: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this has some good density of structure. It's a firm, tannic wine but one that is sustained by some fresh red fruit flavors. A good example of a branded Bordeaux.
title: Ginestet 2004 Bordeaux  (Bordeaux)

description: A dense, concentrated fruit with a good balance of wood and fruit. There is a slight touch of stalkiness but the fruit is also rich, with flavors of fruitcake and good structure.
title: Château Thieuley 2000 Bordeaux Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: This solid Bordeaux achieves a nice balance between ripe fruit and a more austere earthiness. There's a solid core of blackberry flavor and firm, broad tannins that suggest it will develop more depth with near-term cellaring.
title: Barons Edmund Benjamin de Rothschild 1998  Bordeaux

description: Dating back to the early Middle Ages, the estate is based around an ancient chateau. The wine, from old vines, is structured and dense with firm tannins and ripe black-plum fruits. It shows fine acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Roustaing 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: While there are plenty of wood flavors here, the wine also has fine ripe blackberries. That gives potential balance and density. This fine wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lionne 2015 L'Envolée de Lionne  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine made good use of wood, giving mint flavors while not overtaking the black-currant fruitiness. Structured behind the fruit, it is balanced with an attractive burst of acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Médeville Collection 2015 8 Generation  (Bordeaux)

description: The rich fruit of this wine is supported by the ripe tannins. So blackberry flavors and acidity are given spice and a smoky character. The balance is already there. Drink from 2018.
title: Antonin Rodet 2015 Château Saint Seurin  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine has firm tannins and a dense texture that promises a good aging potential. Its ripe blackberry and black-plum fruits also show a solid wine with its richness and fine fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Rouquette 2016  Bordeaux

description: A solid wine with firm tannins, this has structure as well as black-currant acidity. It still has a dry core although this will certainly soften over the next few months. It has the potential to be a ripe fruity wine from early 2018.
title: Maison Bouey 2015 Bordeaux By Boyd-Cantenac  (Bordeaux)

description: Both tannins and ripe berry fruits are in juicy balance in this wine. It gives it density as well as a crisp character that is enhanced by the smoky flavor that comes through. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2015 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is young and with some firm tannins that suggest it needs to age before drinking. Along with the tannins, there are juicy black-currant fruits and a perfumed aftertaste. The wine comes from vineyards in the far east of the Bordeaux region. Drink from 2018.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2015 Château Peynaud-Bagnac  (Bordeaux)

description: The damson fruits of this wine are powerful and concentrated with wood tannins as well as dense fruitiness. The tannins are dry although integrated into the ripe fruits. Drink now.
title: Château Bel Air 2015  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine is ripe with black fruits and generous tannins. It has plenty of acidity to balance the fruit, giving a wine that is both crisp and packed with fruit. The structure is already just right. Drink from 2018.
title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2015 Château de Beauregard Ducourt  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine has plenty of structure as well as rich black fruit. It is dense, firm with tannins and ripe. Drink this fine fruity wine from early 2018.
title: Château Vieux Manoir 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Finely balanced with great black fruitiness as well as solid tannins, this is an attractive wine. Its blackberry flavors are filled out with the tannins and lifted by acidity. It should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine S&C Vignerons 2015 Château Grenet  (Bordeaux)

description: This is finely balanced wine. It has poise and bright red fruits. Underneath that are both tannins and crisp acidity. The wine is never heavy-it's well structured, finishing with swathes of fruits. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château la Croix Blanche 2015  Bordeaux

description: Stéphane Defraine's wine is rich with dark black fruits. The tannins with spice and a firm core give this wine density. It is already powerful and concentrated. It will be ready from 2018.
title: Château de Fontenille 2015  Bordeaux

description: Marked by its five months in wood, this warm, ripe and spicy wine is packed with rich black fruits and light generous tannins. It is a chunky wine, solid with its dry core while full and warm with its fruits. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Réserve Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: Wood aromas and flavors are happily balanced by the ripe berry fruits. So the firm structure is lifted by juicy acidity and fruit to give a wine that will be spicy, fruity and succulent. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Merlet 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is the branded Bordeaux from Jean-Luc Thunevin, so-called Bad Boy (Mauvais Garçon) of Saint-Émilion, now respected owner of Grand Cru Classé Château Valandraud. It is a richly smooth wine with touches of wood and generous blackberries. Concentrated and lightly tannic, it is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Mauvais Garçon  (Bordeaux)

description: A perfumed wine, this is fruity and with fine red cherry and berry flavors. The tight acidity is just filled with some firm smoky tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
title: Château Rougi 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe with some wood flavors that balance well with the black-currant fruit. It has spice, juicy fruits and a dry aftertaste that will certainly soften and integrate over the next few months. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2014 Damnation du Château Roques Mariac  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is ripe with attractive acidity. It has plenty of red fruit, a smoky tannic structure and a perfumed aftertaste. With the fruit ready to burst through the tannins, it will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château du Bernat 2014  Bordeaux

description: This has with some tannins but it is much more about the bright red fruits. It has crisp acidity that cuts through the structure to give some a fresh edge to this structured wine. Let it sit for a few months and drink from 2017.
title: Château de Fontenille 2014  Bordeaux

description: Vanilla aromas give this wine its warm wood character. The ripe fruits that are underneath are full of red berries, touches of spice and acidity. This is a full-bodied wine, likely to be ready from 2017.
title: Château Thieuley 2014  Bordeaux

description: A really juicy, fruity wine that has fine tannins in support. It is still young and needing some softening of the shocking acidity but its flavors and delicious future are mapped out. Drink from 2017.
title: Maison Sichel 2014 Sirius  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a spicy wine, with toasty wood flavors. Happily the fruit is also there, spreading its juicy acidity over the tannins. Let this wine fill out over the next few months and it will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a wine that will develop quickly. With black currant and red-berry fruits it is perfumed, crisp as well as allowing plenty of room for juicy acidity. The tannins are firm and well balanced. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Costis 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine has fine potential. While the wood flavors are dominant, as it develops the ripe red-berry flavors that are there will fill out and bring their fruity acidity along. It is going to be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Mission Saint Vincent 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe red-fruit wine with wood layers. A portion of this balanced Bordeaux is made from 35-year-old wines that were aged in wood. Tannins and acidity show the wine is still young. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Maroutine 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is fresh but developing well. It has spice, a richly fruity character and nice perfumed acidity at the end. With its juicy aftertaste it will be a fine wine to drink starting from 2017.
title: Château Buisson Reydon 2014  Bordeaux

description: Fine, new wood flavors mingle with acidity and ripe blackberry fruits to give a balanced wine. It has a fine texture, spice and juicy acidity that brings out the fruit of the vintage. It will be ready to drink soon, certainly by 2017.
title: Château de Cranne 2014  Bordeaux

description: A fully ripe wine, that has black-currant and blueberry fruit, fine acidity and balanced tannins. It is juicy, fruity although with a good structure that will allow it to age longer. Drink from 2017.
title: Clos des Justices 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is rich with black fruits and layers of wood. It is structured and dense while also having the attractive fruitiness of the vintage. The wine will be ready to drink by summer 2016.
title: Château Fontana 2014  Bordeaux

description: This Fontana family wine is concentrated and ripe. Blackberry and red fruits go with balanced acidity to give a wine that's already drinkable. Tannins support the ripe, full foreground. Drink now, or, better, from late 2016.
title: Château Le Clou du Pin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine, displaying black currant and spice notes. Still young, with grippy tannins and a dusty texture, this will develop quickly into a round and fruity wine. Drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Grand Marchand  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and juicy, this full-bodied wine has black plum and berry fruits that are well integrated into the juicy acidity and ripe tannins. The wine will develop quickly, so drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Arnaucosse  (Bordeaux)

description: This structured wine tastes young, showing considerable tannins at this stage. Its weight gives it potential, however, and the wine will show blackberry flavors and juicy acidity by 2017.
title: Producta Vignobles 2012 Arnozan Réserve des Chartrons  (Bordeaux)

description: This dense and solid wine comes from the eastern ends of the Entre-deux-Mers. It is full of black fruits that balance the firm, dry tannins. Juicy acidity bursts in at the end for a wine that's already delicious and will age well. Best to drink from 2017.
title: Château Grand Marchand 2012  Bordeaux

description: This bold, ripe wine is full of smoky tannins from the wood aging, plus blackberry jam flavors that are nicely cut by the acidity. The dry core and dark chocolate flavors are balanced by the fresher, richer fruit. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2012 1844 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This structured wine has 25-year old vines as its basis. It is concentrated and dense as well as bringing out the ripe berry fruits that are typical of 2012. With the structure and acidity well in place, this wine will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Arnaucosse 2012  Bordeaux

description: There is a good texture to this rich wine that has spice, wood aging and black fruits. With its firm texture and rich fruits, it will be a generous wine from late 2015.
title: Château Puy-Marceau 2012  Bordeaux

description: Rich and juicy, this is a luscious, full wine. It has layers of black currants fruitiness along with a solid structure that is still developing. The wine is ripe, packed with fruity Merlot and developing well. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Sours 2011  Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and full of fruit. The tannins act as a good foil to the generous fruitiness and bright acidity. The texture is dense, solid and full in the mouth. Drink this well-balanced wine from 2016.
title: Chateau Les Maurins 2012  Bordeaux

description: This ripe and smoky wine is full of black currant and spice. The tannins are firm while not taking away from the big, generous fruits and crisp acidity. It's a wine that will age, best drunk from 2016.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2012  Bordeaux

description: Rich and round, this attractive wine has generous tannins and equally generous fruit. Black currants shine with their acidity while the texture is firm and solid. This is a wine with a future; drink from 2016.
title: Château Roquefort 2012  Bordeaux

description: Mint perfumes show the wood aging of this structured wine. It does have plenty of red fruits along with juicy acidity and a lively bright aftertaste. Fresh and fruity at the end, this is ready to drink from 2015.
title: Château Julian 2012  Bordeaux

description: At this stage, the wine is dry and firm. However, the weight and richness are all there. Give it another year, and all the suppressed fruit will come through. Drink this solid wine from 2016.
title: Château du Pin Franc 2012  Bordeaux

description: While the wine is structured and firm at the moment, it also has a solid character with plenty of berry fruits that are waiting to come through. It is smoky, fruity and likely to be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Le Bord'eau du Clos des Moiselles 2012  Bordeaux
winery: Le Bord'eau du Clos des Moiselles

description: While the initial impression is of a tough wine, a soft heart of red fruits is developing well. The potential is for balance and juicy acidity while keeping good structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Thieuley 2012  Bordeaux

description: This dark wine shows the beneficial effects of the fine 2010 vintage. Immense blackberry fruits balance the ripe, dry tannins and refreshing acidity. It needs time to develop further; drink from 2016.
title: Château La Maroutine 2010  Bordeaux

description: The wine is full and ripe, generous both in its black fruits and its tannins. It's rich, juicy and packed with berry fruits, a touch of wood and a mineral texture showing at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2011  Bordeaux

description: A touch of mint aroma suggests a wine with wood aging. The wood influence is well balanced with crisp black currant flavors. It's a wine that could age, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Thieuley 2011  Bordeaux

description: Attractive and fruity, this wine is full of fresh red fruits as well as balanced wood flavors. The tannins are soft, already integrated, and have a warm feel to them. The wine will age, intensifying in fruitiness over the next two years.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2011 Léo de la Gaffeliére  (Bordeaux)

description: With dark tannins, this is a structured and solid wine. It has weight as well as fresh flavors of black currants. The fruitiness is underpinned by firm tannins that come from wood aging as well as fruit. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Pin 2011  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and generous with sweet berry flavors, but still very young, this wine has dark tannins and a dry core. Drink next year to enjoy its warm, full-bodied character.
title: Pezat 2011  Bordeaux

description: Richly textured and spicy, this is a finely integrated wine. It has ripe berry flavors and a palate that's textured with tannins from fruit as well as wood. The structure, held within a lacework of acidity, reflects the wine's potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château La Rame 2011  Bordeaux

description: Just the right amount of wood aging gives this ripe wine great style. It has juicy blackberry fruits to balance the spice and toast character, offering richness and a full, fruity character finished with acidity.
title: Château Haut Claribes 2012 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Very dry, this wine is firmly tannic, with the potential for great swathes of juicy fruitiness. It's currently developing beyond its youthful dryness and just beginning to reveal black-currant fruit. Give it another 2-3 years.
title: Château La Rame 2011  Bordeaux

description: Bright and fruity, this wine has fine acidity, which balances the firm tannins. The whole wine feels juicy, packed with forward fruit and having a lively character. Drink now.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2011  Bordeaux

description: A firm, still young wine, wearing its tannins right up front. The berry and black plum fruits are there in the background along with considerable weight. The wine, rich and full, will develop over the next 2-3 years.
title: Château les Ancres 2010  Bordeaux

description: Cherry and blackberry notes dominate this ripe, full wine. It has a smoky, toasty character that lends good balance and aging potential. The estate is planted with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2010  Bordeaux

description: Full and rich, this has flavors of spice, juicy black currant and mulberry, with a fine tannin backdrop and a dry core. The wood aging has smoothed the fruity finish.
title: Château de Sours 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a rich and rounded wine, and its tannins have already integrated into the soft, ripe black fruits. It has concentration and an attractive juiciness for drinking after 1-2 years.
title: Thunevin 2009 Domaine Virginie Thunevin  (Bordeaux)

description: Very dense and tannic, this wine is hiding its fruit behind its firm structure. It is solid, chunky and powerful, with plenty of weight that will always be dry. Needs to age for several years.
title: Thunevin 2009 Bad Boy  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe, rounded and firmly tannic wine. It has weight and a dense texture, with a black plum flavor. With its fruits, sweet tannins and solid structure, it's likely to age well over several years.
title: Château Larroque 2010  Bordeaux

description: Solidly structured, this features concentrated tannins and powerful, ripe fruits. It has weight, and its rich black fruits are layered with acidity. Age for at least three years.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2009  Bordeaux

description: Densely textured, this has firm and dark tannins. Powerful notes of rich berry and stone fruit give weight to this concentrated wine. This needs time to age.
title: Château Turcaud 2010  Bordeaux

description: Good structure, acidity and a black currant note give this wine a balanced feel. It shows a fresh character that's very fruity and attractive. Not very deep, but pleasant now.
title: Vignobles Meijer 2010 Château Auguste  (Bordeaux)

description: Dense and solid, this has dusty tannins that contrast firmly with the juicy blackberry note and the rich texture. The acidity laces through, providing freshness. This could well age for several years, but with its big fruit flavors, it is also ready to drink now.
title: Château les Arromans 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Smooth and luscious, this is full of chocolate and blackberry flavors. It has weight, richness and ripe fruit, with dark tannins creating the firm structure. With the depth of flavor and the structure, it is going to age, though it's also ready to drink now. A great improvement on past vintages from this estate.
title: Château de Virecourt 2010  Bordeaux

description: Dense and solid, this has dusty tannins that contrast firmly with the juicy blackberry note and the rich texture. The acidity laces through, providing freshness. This could well age for several years, but with its big fruit flavors, it is also ready to drink now.
title: Château les Arromans 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Good structure, acidity and a black currant note give this wine a balanced feel. It shows a fresh character that's very fruity and attractive. Not very deep, but pleasant now.
title: Vignobles Meijer 2010 Château Auguste  (Bordeaux)

description: Big and powerful tannins give this wine a dry, dense and extracted feel. Black fruits power through the structure, offering a rich experience. No shy violet, this is a wine with considerable concentration and aging potential.
title: Vignobles Chaigne et Fils 2010 Château Ballan-Larquette  (Bordeaux)

description: This smooth, rich wine brings a delicious red-fruit flavor right to the fore, piling on the structure of sweet tannins. There is a smoky character and fragrant acidity. It will be ready to drink in six months.
title: Château Haut Mondain 2010 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: With good density and some richness, here is a wine that offers fruit as well as structure. The spice, black fruits and dry tannins hang well together, the acidity showing through to underline the ripe fruit.
title: Château Beauregard-Ducourt 2008  Bordeaux

description: This wine is young, full of ripe berries and rich tannins. The blend of 80% Merlot with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon gives both smoky fruit and a firm tannic core. This wine could be drunk from late 2018 but will be better with an extra year.
title: Château la Croix du Grand Jard 2016  Bordeaux
winery: Château la Croix du Grand Jard

description: Ripe, structured and with great fruit, this wine is full, spicy and has good acidity. Black-currant flavors go right through this attractive wine, rich and rounded, but with a final cut of acidity to allow it to age further. Drink from late 2018.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2016 Château le Mayne Turon  (Bordeaux)

description: The black-currant fruit and firm, dry tannins come from the 52% of Cabernet Sauvignon in this blend. With its stylish structure and crisp fruit, the wine has good potential. Six months in wood has given it a light polish. Drink from 2021.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Monfort-Bellevue  (Bordeaux)

description: One of the properties owned by Cheval Quancard, this estate produces an attractive fruity style of wine. That is particularly true in this warm, ripe vintage. Drink this bright, black-currant-flavored wine from 2019.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is the equivalent of a second wine from this chateau in Lalande de Pomerol. It's an unusual blend with 20% Petit Verdot added to the Merlot, giving both the dark color of the wine and rich tannins. This full, fruity wine will be ready to drink from late 2019.
title: Château des Annereaux 2016 L'Ane Mort  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe, smoky wine with rich blackberry flavors and a firm texture. Already full of forward fruits, ripe tannins and balanced acidity, the wine will mature quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lhoste 2015  Bordeaux

description: This blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is soft, generous and fruity. It is an easy wine, with some wood aging to smooth the crisp black-currant flavors. The wine is all fruit, ready to drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Cuvée Hortense  (Bordeaux)

description: From vines close to Fronsac, this wine comes from Thunevin family vines. It is soft, with attractive black-currant fruit and spicy wood and tannins. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.
title: Domaine Virginie Thunevin 2015  Bordeaux

description: Taking its name from the Bordeaux estate owned by this negociant firm, this wine is soft, rich and ready to drink. Blackberries and damsons are laced with acidity and hint of spice from wood aging. Drink now.
title: Pierre Riviére 2015 Menuts Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)

description: Aged in oak for 12 months, this rich wine is supple, lightly toasty and full of ripe red fruit. With a background of tannins, it's ready to age for another year. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Laubés 2015  Bordeaux

description: Soft and fruity, this lightly structured wine is rich and dense. Its blackberry fruit is supported by balanced tannins and acidity. Made to be enjoyed young, so drink up.
title: Exem 2015  Bordeaux

description: This warm, ripe wine has spice notes, layers of wood and vivid blackberry fruit. Still young, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Magnol 2015 M de Magnol  (Bordeaux)

description: Made from 30-year old vines, this is a big, concentrated wine, where bitter chocolate and dark tannins dominate the blackberry fruits. It shows great richness without edging over the top. The balance continues right through to the finish.
title: Château Darzac 2004 Héritage  (Bordeaux)

description: A wine that aims to bring out the casual side of Bordeaux, this is friendly, accessible, without losing the essential dry tannins and fresh black currant flavors typical of the region. If only all branded Bordeaux was like this.
title: Barriére Fréres 2006 Jacques Sans Souci  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced by Xavier Copel of Primo Palatum, this is one of a series of wines made by different winemakers around the world in small quantities. This Bordeaux is smooth, polished, with highlights of fresh blackberry and sweet acidity over wood, with a juicy, ripe finish.
title: Oriel 2005 Iconic  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, pure fruit flavors follow spice and smoke aromas. This is a finely balanced wine, with excellent acidity as well as some dark, firm tannins. The red fruits are topped with some new wood spice and creaminess.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2005 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This is definitely a wine in the new ripe Bordeaux style, with rich black fruits and spicy tannins. Impressively dense, dusty fruit tannins are alongside smooth, polished new wood flavors. The acidity and black currants are the reminder that this is still Bordeaux, not New World.
title: Château Balestard 2004  Bordeaux

description: This is all about great fruit bursting out of the glass. Red fruits dominate, with smooth tannins in support. There is a density at the heart of the wine, layered with fresh acidity. Drink now, but will age over 2-3 years.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2005 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Lighter than a red and darker than Rosé, this food-friendly style wine is the original claret as known to the British. Great red fruits and a generous character have given this ripe, jammy wine an attractive, rich character. It has spice and tannins as well as the fruit, all coming together well. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Maison Noble 2017  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Food is an important partner to Clairet.Firm with fine tannins, this wine has weight as well as rich red fruits. It shows a good balance between the fruit and the structure of the wine. Try it from late 2018.
title: Château Turcaud 2017  Bordeaux Clairet

description: A balanced wine, this is full of black fruits as well as rich tannins. It is concentrated and dense, typical of the vintage. At this stage, it is a firm wine but one that will soften. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Parenchére 2016 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is all about fruit, with ripe tannins to complement the blackberry flavors and good acidity. It is a wine with potential, fruity and structured at the same time. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Tour de Gilet 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine comes from a small eight-acre estate at the heart of the Entre-Deux-Mers, It is ripe, juicy and full bodied, with dense fruit and sweet tannins that are typical of the vintage. It should age for a few years although it will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Lagrave Paran 2015 Coeur de Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A rich André Lurton wine, this offers tannins backed by black-currant flavors and acidity. The wine is developing relatively quickl, giving plenty of fruitiness as well as good acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Grossombre de Saint-Joseph 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This vineyard, close to Saint-Émilion, has been cultivated since the 15th century. The wine, with succulent young fruit, attractive tannins and black-currant flavors, is still developing. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Grand Français 2016 Cuvée Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Wood aging still shows in this wine, balanced by the red fruits and firm tannins. The acidity and potential richness mean it will be an attractive wine from 2021.
title: Château des Antonins 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This spicy wine with firm tannins is setting out well. Black-currant flavors are balanced with generous tannins and a rich character that will give the wine a full and juicy character. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Siran 2016 Saint Jacques de Siran  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Although there is initially too much wood, the black fruits are beginning to have their moment as they push through that dark structure. The wine is still firm with a dry core that needs to soften. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a soft, perfumed wine with mint aromas and spicy flavors. The wood aging shows strongly but so does the fruit. The wine should be attractive and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and spicy, this rich wine has layers of wood accents laid over red-berry flavors that are still developing. The wine has potential for aging, As it softens, it will be rich and delicious. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pabus 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Still closed but showing the potential of ripe black fruits, this big wine is concentrated, with a dry, firm core. Drink this powerful wine from 2022.
title: Château Landereau 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe, spicy wine offers fine tannins and a rich core of black fruits. It is concentrated, with some firm dryness and structure that indicate that it will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Laronde Desormes 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe, fruity wine has layers of smoky flavors and a firm core of tannins. At the same time, the black-currant fruit is attractive, with crisp acidity that promises a good future. Drink from 2019.
title: Château la Faviére 2015 Cuvée Muse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a lush wine, full of ripe fruit and tannins that are totally cushioned by the ripeness. Red-berry flavors, layers of wood aging and a full-bodied character give this wine the chance to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Seguin 2016 Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This firm wine is dark with tannins that need time to bring out the background black fruits. It is structured, dense and full of concentrated fruitiness, with spice and a fresher acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pertignas 2016 Cuvée Spéciale  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This concentrated wine has firm tannins as well as rich black-currant flavors. The structure gives space for the ripe fruitiness and acidity. This will be an appealing wine from 2022.
title: Château Le Bocage 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Richly fruity and perfumed, this is a generous, ripe wine. Full of black fruits, sculpted tannins and with plenty of acidity, the wine has a good future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château La Croix de Queynac 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich wine has hints of toasty wood coming through attractive black-currant flavors. Ripeness and fruit density cope with the tannins, turning this into a powerful, solid wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fresh wood flavors of mint mark this wine. To balance, it also offers black fruits and acidity that give freshness and a rich aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich, ripe wine with red-berry fruits comes from the southern part of the Entre-deux-Mers region near the town of Cadillac. Dominated by Merlot, the blend is full of juicy fruit, with plenty of acidity to balance the gentle tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-La-Péreyre 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This blend, supervised by the technical director of Château Pichon Baron in Pauillac, is firm and structured, with the ability to age. The rich berry fruits are already delicious, although the wine's tannins will need some time to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Cap Royal 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With the potential of a good structure and fruit, this is a warm ripe wine that has concentration and dense black fruits. The acidity at the end gives it a lift. Wait until 2019 to drink this Hervé Lhuillier wine.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a bold fruity wine that just allows its tannins to build a supporting structure. The black fruits are right up front, full of acidity and with a delicious potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Rich and with good fruit, this is a structured wine that has the density to age well. The dark-chocolate flavors mingle with the black-plum fruits, finishing with just a light lift of acidity.
title: Château la Verriére 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big tannins mask the fruit in this potentially ripe and fruity wine. It is structured and dark with a dry core of tannins. It means the wine needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is a caramel edge to this wine showing the wood-aging flavors. Luckily the fruit is all there as well, giving a balanced future to this structured wine. With plenty of tannins and juicy acidity combined, it will be a fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Saint Seurin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fragrant, smoky and juicy, this is a structured wine that also allows plenty of room for the fruit. With firm tannins as a background, its fruitiness is already shining out. The blackberry juiciness and acidity are balanced. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lescalle 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and full of fruit, this is developing into a black-currant-flavored wine with a good balance of tannins. It has a smoky background from wood aging, giving the wine extra complexity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lauduc 2015 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is smoky with plenty of toastiness. At the same time, the bright red fruits are right up-front to give the wine its crispness and acidity. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2015 Cuvée Sarah  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a densely ripe wine with firm tannins as well as the potential for opulent rich black fruits. With its acidity and concentration, the wine is packed with black fruits. It needs to soften, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Here's a good blend: a rich wine with fine tannins and attractive fruits. There is a jammy character to the ripe fruit and generous tannins. Give this wine until 2019.
title: Château Maréchaux 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With spice, ripe tannins and black currants, this is a dense wine with a good future. There is a firm background to this wine to set against the fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Malbat 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Packed with wood and spice flavors, the wine will also show plenty of fruit as it develops. The rich structure and toast are balanced by the juicy black-currant fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Maison Noble 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Romain Roux, the latest in the family to run the southern Bordeaux estate, has delivered a ripe spicy wine from this excellent vintage. At this stage, the wood-aging flavors are prominent, but they will certainly integrate into the ripe berry fruits. With final acidity, the wine has a good future. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Roux de Beauces 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has a fine smoky character lying over the blackberry fruits. It has the potential to be rich with generous fruits and balanced tannins. The aftertaste is juicy and crisp.
title: Château de Macard 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is structured and firm with considerable wood flavors. It also has the fruit weight that will develop as the wine matures. Give this wine, with its potential, until 2019.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2015 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a smoky wine, with ripe berry fruits and balanced wood flavors. The solid tannins lend structure and backbone to the palate, while the finish is rich. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Brande-Bergére 2015 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Some wood aging gives this wine its rich character. The tannins, black-currant fruits and good proportion (36%) of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend all contribute to the wine's structure and ripeness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Calvaire 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red-berry fruits and a core of tannins make up a wine that has structure and the potential of some fine fruits. It is juicy with plenty of acidity at the end to give the wine a lift.
title: Château Toudenac 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Juicy red fruit dominates this wine. It has some firm tannins underneath-just enough to support the delicious raspberry and red-currant flavors. It is maturing well and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Auguste 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is already attractively balanced with black currant and berry fruits well integrated into the firm tannins. As the wine develops, it will have spice and ripe fruits, topped with crisp acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Penin 2014 Grande Sélection  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
