description: Strawberry fruit aromas and flavors give this wine an almost sweet character. It is soft and juicy with the tannins in the background to the ripe fruit. The aftertaste has a fresh crisp feel. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is dense with some fine concentrated fruit. Blackberry flavors give richness and sweetness which are topped with spice and layers of wood. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château Lauduc 2014 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine. It has fine acidity, ripe wood flavors and spice. The weight of the fruit is enough to balance with the wood. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Malbat 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine that has fine red fruits and some firm tannins. It is spicy, concentrated and fully fruited, with well-balanced tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Crisp and fresh, this is a light wine that is dominated by red-currant fruits. It has considerable acidity as well as tannins. Fruity while lightly perfumed, it will be ready from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Gilet 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a fresh-faced wine with acidity and balanced tannins adding to the smoky aromas. It has the acidity typical of the vintage alongside the bright red-berry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beaulieu 2014 Comtes de Tastes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fresh and juicy, this is a wine where the fruit is already well in balance with the tannic core. It is structured and firm while allowing plenty of room for the red fruits and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Barreyre 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Structured and firm, this is a wine that is full of tannins. Luckily the fruitiness is there as well to show the wine's potential. With a couple of years of aging, it should do well. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château Argadens 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is firmly tannic and dry. It has ripe fruits and these should develop well. With its structure and fruitiness, it will become a generous, full wine from 2018.
title: Château Genlaire 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A crisp, red-fruit flavored wine that has sufficient structure to give it shape and density. It is fruity with spice from the wood aging. Acidity at the end keeps it fresh and bright. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Timberlay 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe wine that has red-berry fruits, slices of black plum and a full deck of tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, full of fruit and equally full of structure. Let the two soften and drink from 2018.
title: Château Tayet 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine has all the potential of ripe fruit and firm tannins. It should become a rich wine with blackberry flavors and a tannic structure. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Recougne 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a finely structured wine with the right amount of fruit. With black-currant flavors and plenty of the acidity that is typical of the year, the wine is perfumed, refreshing and likely to develop quickly. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Château la France 2014 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is an attractive 15% Cabernet Franc in this wine. That gives a strongly perfumed character and brings out firm tannins from both the fruit and the wood aging. The wine's blackberry fruits are ripe and juicy with a smooth, rounded aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Alta Gaïa 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This smoky wood-aged wine shows tannins as well as black fruits. It has a fine structure that balances with the fruitiness. Produced in the Entre-deux-Mers, the wine has a spicy, fresh aftertaste.
title: Château la Calvaire 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is structured, packed with tannins and acidity. Blackberry flavors come from behind to give some flesh to the structure. For a difficult vintage, this is attractive and will be drinkable after 2016.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and concentrated, this is a rich blackberry-flavored wine, with a dense texture lifted by acidity and a stalky edge. The wine, like many in this vintage, still has a firm side and could age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château le Calvaire 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Bold and fruity, this ripe, smoky wine has red berry and blackberry fruit flavors cut with acidity. This blend is smooth in texture, with a full, rich fruitiness on the palate. It will age further, although the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Close to the Dordogne river, this estate has produced a rich, dense wine. Dark plum fruit flavors give it great richness, supported by a solid background of firm tannins. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this structured and firm wine is still young. Solid tannins are cut by the black currant fruit and fresh acidity. The wine, though drinkable, needs to age for a few more months, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Montlau 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm fruits and structure give a dense, solid character that is rich and full. Plenty of black fruits are developing as the wine matures. Wait until 2017.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2012 La Croix  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich, full of black currant fruitiness and ripe tannins, this wine is solid, structured and foursquare in character. The Donjon of Bruignac, dating from 1300, has been owned by only two families since then. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2012 Bruignac Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Eric Meynaud runs this 233-acre family property, having taken over from his father in 1998. Ripe, bold and fruity, this solid, dense wine has layers of black fruits that go with the firmer structure. Excellent acidity gives a lift to the wine and leaves a fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red berry fruits are the dominant character of this full and ripe wine. The judicious wood aging gives a base for its generous character. Timberlay, dating back to the 14th century and family owned, is capable of producing a rich and juicy wine that is going to age well. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Timberlay 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While the wine has plenty of tannins, it also has juicy black fruits that more than balance the structure. It's a well-made, ripe wine that has a sweep of fruitiness. From 2018, the tannins will be fully integrated.
title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This fruity wine offers attractive acidity and light tannins. It's perfumed, hinting at mint and eucalyptus, a wine that is smooth and polished. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Landereau 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From a property owned by the Massé family since 1868, the 2012 Queyssard is big and juicy. Already attractive, it has plenty of fresh acidity as well as dark tannins that will mature. Ripe fruit contributes to a balanced wine that can age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Queyssard 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Stern and structured at this early stage, this wine is developing slowly. It is potentially powerful and ripe, with its layers of dark fruits and tannins ready to mature and integrate. Give this solid wine until 2017. Visitors to the vineyard will see a large metallic sculpture of a rooster, one of France's national symbols.
title: Château la France 2012 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe Merlot gives a juicy character to this rounded wine that comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region. The 18th-century chateau is named after one of the lieutenants who fought with the Emperor Charlemagne. With a touch of cinnamon and nutmeg, the wine is generous and attractive. The tannins form a solid layer without impeding the fruitiness. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Seguin 2012 Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firm and stalky, this wine has intense black currant fruitiness. A dry tannic core is balanced by the fresh fruits and acidity. It's almost too fruity at the moment and needs to soften, so wait until 2016.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smooth and rich, this wine is full of ripe plum and dried fruit flavors. It is rounded, the tannins an adjunct to the great fruitiness. Wood aging still gives a vanilla edge to the wine but it can be drunk in 2015.
title: Château Thuron 2009 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a wine that is ripe, fully formed and with great fruitiness. It has some soft tannic structure, along with blackberry juice flavors and a strong dose of acidity. It should soften and come together after a year, so drink from 2015.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich, dense and complex wine has good structure, dark tannins and bright black-currant fruitiness. It's a wine with a good future, and aging will allow the tannins to soften and add further lift to the fruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Saincrit 2011 Vieilles Vignes Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Blackberry flavors dominate this wine, but there's also good acidity, fragrant spice, and just a hint of wood. The wine, with its finely honed texture has a good future, so drink after 2015.
title: Château de Lavagnac 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While the wine has firm tannins, it also has great fruit. A rich structure is balanced by sweet black-plum and berry fruit to give a wine with fine aging potential.
title: Château Plaisance 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This bold, fruity wine is all red berries and ripe cherry flavors. It has good juiciness, soft tannins and it will be ready to drink soon. A bright wine, with great acidity at the end.
title: Château de Lisennes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is fine acidity here, black currant fruit and firm tannins. The combination works well, giving fruitiness and structure. The result is a wine with aging potential, freshness and an attractive, juicy aftertaste.
title: Chateau de Launay 2011 Château Dubory  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This finely tannic wine features an intensely smoky black-currant flavor. It has good depth of flavor, and as the wine ages further, the fruit will emerge from the tannins. Keep for 3-4 years.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2009 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With a significant proportion of Cabernet Franc, this is a perfumed and elegant wine. It has a serious edge of tannins in addition to juicy red-berry flavors. The finish is firm and dry.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2010 Château Lajarre  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Notes of sweet wood and ripe stone fruits blend together in this solid, smoky and bacon-flavored wine. It is soft, firm and generous, with a full texture.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2010 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a full, ripe wine, with tannins that are already well integrated into the red fruits. It's rich and full, packed with delicious ripeness. A wine for pleasure in the next few months, but it will also age well for 3-4 years.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This firm, fruity effort shows red berry flavors as well as an underlay of tannins. It is full and fruity at this stage, and it will likely show more toast and structured complexity as it ages.
title: Château Mirefleurs 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe fruits blend well with dark tannins in this firm, concentrated wine. It feels rich, with power coming both from the juicy fruit and the ripe tannic structure. Age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Lestrille Capmartin 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This balanced, ripe wine shows the richness of the year while offering enough structure for aging. It has weight and concentration, its black fruits an integral part of this dense wine.
title: Château Lescalle 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine takes a while to show its stuff, but when it opens, it reveals a warm and richly structured character. Flavors of wood and sweet-tasting fruits combine on the generous finish.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A dark-colored wine, this is layered with a wood note that shows strongly along with the mint flavor. Rich, well structured and concentrated, this has black jelly fruit, and is meant for drinking in two years.
title: Château de Cornemps 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Weighty with richness and good concentration. There are flavors of mint, black fruits, the tannins firmly embedded in the ripe texture. It seems so approachable now, but will also age-the acidity and drier finish show that.
title: Château Tayet 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A ripe wine, very Bordeaux in its dominant tannins and dry fruit skin character. It does show richness with an attractive smoky character to go with the firm structure. Drink now, but it could age 2-3 years.
title: Château Lacombe Cadiot 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A rich, ripe concentrated wine, packed with red plum and cherry fruits, lightly layered with tannins. The wine is immediately attractive, juicy, ready to drink.
title: Pezat 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A finely made wine with big tannins equalled by the rich fruits. The wine has balanced wood character, acidity, great berry fruits, damsons and a firm, dry core that promises aging.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2008 Réserve du Château  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Broad and ripe, this wine is still full of youthful tannins and needs to age. Dark and smoky, it has a core of dryness that will soften. The juicy black fruits are already right up front, giving a wine that will always be rich. Drink from 2020.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2016 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This rich, dense wood-aged wine comes from the home vineyard of the Aubert family. It is full of ripe black-plum and spice flavors. Dusty tannins are a sign of its aging potential. The wine is generous, full of rich Merlot. Drink from 2020.
title: Secret de Ribebon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Barrel aging has given this wine a polished texture along with mint aromas. Plenty of fruit balances the structure of the wine, promising a good future. Look for greater richness as the wine matures and drink from late 2019.
title: Château Grand Jean 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There are dramatic views from this estate's vineyards over the Garonne river. The setting gives the chance to produce a fine wine from a privileged location. Rich and juicy, this black-fruit-flavored wine is made from organically grown grapes. Drink this ripe wine from late 2018.
title: Château Lauretan 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is generous, with red-berry and red-currant fruitiness. Its tannins still show some firmness although they are integrating well with the fruit and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink by mid-2018.
title: Château L'Oiseau 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This estate in the northern vineyards of Bordeaux is planted to a blend of 75% Merlot and the two Cabernets. The wine has structure as well as rich berry fruits. Its tannins mark it out as still young, and this potentially ripe, warm wine should be drunk from 2019.
title: Château Dallau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This mature wine is ripe with both black fruits and secondary toast and rich mushrooms flavors. It is structured, with a dry core of tannins that gives strength to the generous character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Château Machorre 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wood-aged wine is smooth, with berry fruit flavors, solid tannins and a touch of mint. It should age well for the next few years, so drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lagarde 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The Baylet family has produced a rich wine in this vintage. With chocolate and spice flavors accenting its black plum fruit, it's ripe and smooth. The tannins are well integrated into the generous fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Landereau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Minty aromas reflect the new wood that was used to age this wine. Its red berry fruitiness recalls the vintage while its firm tannins will allow it to age for several years. It comes from the western end of the Entre-deux-Mers region. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Bel 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This warm and rich wine has bold red fruit and a background of tannins and wood-derived flavors. It's full of ripe fruit and balanced acidity and has an open character that makes it drinkable soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A classic Bordeaux with just that extra edge of ripe fruit. The tannins are dry, but fresh, with acidity that spreads across the black currant fruit flavors. It needs to age for two years, but is already drinkable.
title: Château Thieuley 2005 Réserve Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: From a small parcel of 12 acres, this 100% Merlot is soft, elegant, with dusty tannins, and great lifted acidity. The wood element-12 months-is well balanced, doing its proper job of underlying the delicious blackberry fruits.
title: Château Trocard 2004 Monrepos  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Spicy, smoky and with ripe 95% Merlot, this wine has potential. Its structure is still important while allowing room for the fruitiness and acidity that are developing. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Cros 2016 Les Coteaux de Lou  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Diverse soils in this part of the Cadillac slope give a rich wine with fine tannins and bold ripe fruit. It is concentrated and packed with smoky wood and berry flavors. The wine shows excellent potential for the tannins and acidity to come together. Drink from 2021.
designation: Grand Vin de Château de Ricaud
title: Château de Ricaud 2016 Grand Vin de Château de Ricaud  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and smoky, this concentrated wine offers fine tannins and rich acidity. It has density and layers of black fruits, including 5% Petit Verdot, and a rich potential. Let the wine mature and drink from 2021.
title: Château Baracan 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is dry, firm and has some dark concentration. It needs time for the tannins to balance with the rich blackberry fruits. Firm but with good potential, the wine from the Chombart family will be ready from 2021.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2016 Premiére Cuvée  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This Gonfrier Fréres wine is structured and firm, packed with tannins but with the fruit weight to balance. Black fruits and attractive acidity are the hallmarks of this rich wine. Let it age and drink from 2021.
title: Château de Lestiac 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Argentine Alejandro Bulgheroni bought Suau in 2017 but it has been under Michel Rolland's direction, and organic, since 2014. This vintage shows layers of delicious blackberry fruits and dark, smoky tannins. Its weight, spice and density show well against the fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Suau 2016 L'Artolie  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Juicy with attractive black-currant flavors, this Chobart family wine is rich with tannins and fruitiness. Still firm and darkly textured, it needs time. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2016 Traditionnelle  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Partially wood aged, this is already an approachable wine. It has plenty of red-berry fruits that are lifted by acidity. The tannic character provides a great support to the attractive fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Sadran 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is balanced and ripe with some firm tannins and spice. The blackberry fruit has a stalky character with plenty of acidity as well as a dry core of tannin. The wine will develop well over the next few years to create a ripe and gently structured wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Léon 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Grown on the slopes above the Garonne river, this is a crisp wine with attractive black-currant fruitiness. It has soft tannins that are well integrated into the fruitiness and acidity of the wine. The aftertaste is crisp and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe and rich wine that is structured with tannins and layers of wood. It has spice and black-fruit flavors that make it a rich wine with potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pilet 2014 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Packed with red fruits, this is a bright wine. It has fine tannins due to aging half in French oak and half in stainless steel to give a balance to a wine that is crisp and fresh. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Seuil 2014 Domaine du Seuil  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is an attractive, ripe and fruity wine made from Merlot and Cabernet Franc vines. With soft tannins, it is juicy and crisp. There is a tight edge that will soften to produce a generous wine. Yorick and Sophie Lavaud's 13 acres are Agrocert-certified organic. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Les Carmels 2014 Les Vendanges  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Although it seems lean at the moment, there is enough fruit in this wine produced by Eric Gonfrier to promise a good future. The texture is dense, packed with tannins as well as the fruit. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Baracan 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a spicy, ripe wine that has fine acidity as well as layers of tannins and a dense texture. It is developing fast, bringing out delicious freshness and red fruits. The vineyards are being converted to organic-a multi-year process. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bel-Air 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is dry and firm with solid tannins as well as blackberry fruit. It is structured, balanced by juicy acidity and oak-aging flavors. The wine comes from the slopes of the Cotes de Bordeaux about the small town of Cadillac.
title: Chateau de Sadran 2012 Prestige  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spicy wood gives this wine a smooth character. It also adds lift, allowing the rich black fruits to speak out. Acidity is well integrated into the tannins and balanced character of the wine. It's one of seven Bordeaux properties in the Yung family since 1962. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Hauts de Palette 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This no-herbicide, hand-picked, hilltop Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon-Petit Verdot blend is rich with attractive acidity and ripe strawberry fruits. Its tannins present a structure for fruity texture. A wine from Bordeaux wine guru Professor Denis Dubourdieu's stable, it has concentration and a dense dark aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Reynon 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Château du Cros began life in the 12th century, commanding a superb military vantage point over the Garonne river. The surrounding vineyards have produced a fresh and fruity Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon blend with a mineral bite that gives a strong sense of structure. Its weight and a firm texture act as a foil to the juicy red berries and attractive acidity. The wine is almost drinkable now but will be better from 2016.
title: Château du Cros 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A rich and rounded wine whose tannins are well buried in the ripe blackberry fruits. It's a dark wine, solidly dry at the core with great swathes of juicy fruit around. It's almost ready to drink so try it out in 2014.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and concentrated and still very young, the wine has ripe blackberry flavors, a sense of ripeness and a dry wood-and-tannin core. Give the wine at least 4-5 years.
title: Château Tanesse 2011  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity, structured wine, dense and dark-hued, its black currant fruits giving a sense of lighter acidity. It's just coming into balance, so it will likely age well over the medium term.
title: Château de Ricaud 2010 Réserve des Coteaux  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A full, rich wine, showing red fruits at their best. It has structure and layers of bright acidity. It's not a wine for long aging, likely to be at its best in three years time.
title: Château de Laville 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Powerful, ripe fruit, now beginning to open up, is the dominant character of this wine. It's full in the mouth, packed with black plums and ripe damsons and finished with soft tannins and a slight warmth.
title: Château Carignan 2009  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A firmly structured wine, dry to the core. The tannins feel extracted, giving some bitterness, yet the fruit shows potential juiciness. While it's always going to be a severe wine, it should be a great food partner.
title: Château Suau 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wood-laden wine is rich in toast. The fruit is there, blackberry and juicy flavors coming through to balance the enthusiastic wood aging. It will take a while to integrate before becoming a rich, full wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Saint-Nicolas 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This perfumed wine has firm tannins, a dry core and plenty of acidity. Its black currant fruit shows fine potential to give richness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 Dompter la Bête  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Although this seems initially austere, it has some fruit weight. Its tannins are dry and firm but will soften with time, showing potential for long, slow aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château des Mille Anges 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and smooth, with rich if still dry tannins. Its juicy black fruit and acidity are balanced with a structure that will allow it to age further. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Ducros 2015 Clos Bourbon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured and firm, with dense, dry tannins, this wine also has plenty of fruit. Black cherry flavors envelop its dry core, feeling rich and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château du Cros 2015  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, jammy wine is all about fruit. Its red berry flavors burst from the glass and are gently backed by tannins. It is already attractive, ripe and full. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine les Carmels 2015 Les Vendanges  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A ripe black-currant-flavored wine, this is smooth and dense. Maturing well with acidity and smoky wood flavors right up front, the wine is juicy, rich and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château de Monbadon 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big tannins come equally from ripe black fruits and from limestone rock in the Vignobles Gabriel vineyards. This wine has a good future but needs time. Drink Patricia Aroldi's powerful, dense biodynamic wine from 2022.
title: Château Rochers Bellevue 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The rich black fruits in this wine from property in the Monteil family since the 15th century are full of promise. Dark tannins, spice and licorice balance the fruitiness, suggesting aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Bréhat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From property in the Fauchey family since the 1880s, this wine is firm, tight with tannins at this stage. Hints of black fruits promise future balance. With a dense core, the wine will develop over the long term. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Paret 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This smoky wine is packed with spicy wood-aging flavors. The fruit weight and the ripe blackberry flavors are beginning to develop and will balance out this full, rich wine. Drink this Jean-François Meynard wine from 2022.
title: Château La Bourrée 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A richly textured wine full of black fruit and ripe tannins, this has power and a dense structure. It balances black-plum flavors laced with acidity with pepper and a juicy aftertaste. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2020.
title: Château le Peyrat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe black fruits and rich tannins show the potential of this wine. It has power, layers of berry flavors and acidity, and a core of dryness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Dina 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Marcel Petit wine offers ripe with black fruits balanced by structured, dense tannins. Made from 95% Merlot, it offers spice and a full texture that needs to soften. Drink this rich wine from 2022.
title: Château Pillebois 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Balanced and fruity, this wine is rich and structured, with plenty of tannins for its future. The sweet black fruits show the vintage well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château le Rey 2016 Les Argileuses  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Fruit and tannins come together well in this ripe wine. Its structure will allow it to age while the berry flavors bring a fresh edge. Juicy and fruity, it has fine potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Hyot 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Balanced and ripe, this is a rich wine. Its juicy black fruits and tannins are already well integrated to give a wine with concentration and a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Belcier 2016 Les Armoires de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Produced in the hills above the small town of Castillon, the wine is fruity with a stalky texture and some firm tannins. It is balanced, though, with its acidity and black-currant flavors and should mature well over the next few years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Roc 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a rich and full, especially for a wine from the lighter 2013 vintage. Smooth, generous black fruits with a hint of mint (from aging in new wood) are buoyed by dusty tannins and ripe acidity. The wine, made from organic grapes, is fruity, still ready to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Fongaban 2013  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a small estate of 12 acres dominated by its 95% Merlot. It is ripe and juicy with spice, dried fruits and crisp black currants. The tannins are already well integrated with the fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Lamour 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Taking its name from the Chevaliers d'Arce who guarded this land in the 12th and 13th centuries, the small property is now under the watchful eye of Sylviane Garcin-Cathiard. This wine is still young and just balancing out. Firm tannins are shot through with ripe berry fruits and with crisp acidity. It is a wine that is will mature well, so drink from 2019 and consider this property a rising star.
title: Château d'Arce 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With Philippe Ducourt tending the special Peyrou vineyard and Jérémy Ducourt in the winery, they produced a lively juicy wine that is full of red-fruit flavors. It is fresh, crisp and only lightly touched by wood and tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2014 Réserve de Famille  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Bridgitte and her husband Eric took over her family property in 2009, in 2014 producing a spicy and fruity wine. It has fine tannins and sweet red-berry fruit. The acidity and the balance are just right. Drink this attractive wine from 2018. They donate one percent of their turnover to an environmental charity and are (they say) one of only two wineries in the world who are members of "1% for the planet."
title: Château Guibeau 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: When vineyards or, at least, land is in the family since the 15th century, it is interesting to taste their wines trending back to "bio." This Baron de Montfort vineyard is certified organic. The result is fresh while also ripe, this is a lightly wood-tinted wine. It has a dry edge along with blackberry fruits and firm tannins. The acidity at the end acts as a counter-balance. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lagrange Monbadon 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Old vines and wood aging have given this wine rich concentration. It is smoky, spicy and still firm with tannins. The structure is filling out with the blackberry fruits and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Bellevue 2012 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is already attractively balanced with ripe red plum fruits giving weight. That is backed by the firm wood and fruit tannins that offer spice and a creamy texture. Drink from 2017. An Alain Aubert estate, it is run by daughter and oenologist Amélie Aubert.
title: Château Hyot 2013  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a perfumed wine full of attractive black currant and spice flavors. The wood aging has given a great fillip of richness to the stalky fruit as well as rounding it out. It could age further, so drink from 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all fruit initially and then the firmer tannins kick in. It has a strongly tannic core that leaves the wine dry and tough after 12 months in barrel. The fruit weight should broaden the wine out, giving black fruitiness in the future. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Roquevieille 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The Cabernet Franc in the blend gives an attractive perfumed character. Spice and pepper go with ripe black plum fruit flavors. It's dense and concentrated, the tannins prominent at this stage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Pitray 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold and ripe, this is packed with red fruits and fresh acidity from an 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc blend. While the tannins are present, they have a walk-on part, leaving the stage for the rich and juicy fruits. That makes it a wine to drink soon, from 2016.
title: Château le Peyrat 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a soft wine with attractive red fruits. With balanced acidity, it is round and fresh, with enough tannins to give support. Aged in one- and two-year-old barrels, it is quite ready to drink with a bright, red berry aftertaste. Consultant Michel Rolland works with Silvio Denz, who owns several Saint-Émilion-area properties and is a négociant elsewhere in Europe.
title: Château Cap de Faugéres 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solid, dry and very tannic, this is a firm 75% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Franc wine. Flavors of licorice and oak aging (40% new oak) point to a dense and tough wine that needs to soften. It has acidity and layers of black fruits at the back. Hold this wine, with its potential, until 2017.
title: Château La Croix Lartigue 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and spicy, this is developing into an attractive wine. Plenty of fresh raspberry and black currant flavors go with the dusty tannins that are at the center of the wine. It does need to age; drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut Dina 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine's strong toasty character is balanced by the potential of the ripe fruit and acidity. It's still showing as young, the wood aging covering the fruit. Wait until 2017 and the balance will be right there. This Cuvée is harvested from des Demoiselles plots, one of 13 chateaus in the Ducourt family.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2012 Grande Réserve  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine has remarkable density from fruit, a full-bodied feeling and a dry edge of extraction that all point to its aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Le Pin de Belcier 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While there is a strong element of new wood in this wine, it also has plenty of ripe black fruits. So it makes a wine that is powerful, potentially complex in 4-5 years with richness and a solid, serious final character.
title: Château Hyot 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A tough proposition at this young stage, but one which will definitely mature well, if slowly. There's power from tannins and fruit, both promising aging. Dark and dense, this hints at the juicy black fruits to come.
title: Château de Belcier 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dark tannins are sustained by juicy blackberry fruit flavors. While the wine is very dry and firm at this stage, it has a good, if long-term, future.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2010 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Using fruit sourced from a 20-acre vineyard in Castillon, this is dominated by Merlot, with a touch of perfumed Cabernet Franc. It has an age-worthy structure, showing good balance, firm tannins and ripe fruit.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Located to the west of Castillon-la-Bataille, this vineyard is close in geography and style to Saint-Émilion. It delivers a rich texture from the ripe Merlot as well as generous, warm berry fruits. At the same time, the wine has a light touch of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink this poised wine from 2021.
title: Château Hyot 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe, aromatic red berry notes mingle with the wood flavors in this rich wine. It's fruity yet backed by tannins and a dry core. All these elements mean it will need to age and will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Terrasson 2015 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is packed with crisp red currant fruit and plenty of acidity. Firm with tannins now, it will bring out more fruitiness as it develops. Ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château la Brande 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solid tannins and rich fruit come together in this ripe, still-young wine. It has good potential, with bold black fruit and a dense, mineral texture. It will need several years for those tannins to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This lightly structured wine is all fruit. Its red berry flavors are already well integrated with the smoky tannins that form its core. It will, however, age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solid tannins mark this out as a wine that will need to age. Its structure dominates its black fruit, hiding it beneath a smoky, spicy character. Give it until 2020 before opening.
title: Château Castegens 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Attractive berry flavors and a generous texture give weight and a ripe character to this wine. Blackberries and currants show well among the spice, with dense tannins carrying through the finish. Drink from 2021.
title: Château les Conseillans 2016  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Sisters Marie and Sylvie Courselle, whose family owns Château Thieuley in the Entre-Deux-Mers region have produced a fruity wine in 2014. Perhaps there is a little too much wood aging, but the black-currant flavors make a good balance and gives the wine a juicy character. Drink this crisp, fruity wine now.
title: Clos Sainte Anne 2014  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Named after King Henri IV, this is a powerful, ripe and still-structured wine. Big, rich tannins push the structure forward and boost the full black-plum flavors. It is complex, dense and still needing time. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Henry de France 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this attractive offering from winemaker Marie-Dominique Watrin has a rich seam of blackberry fruits and balanced acidity. The aftertaste with its fresh character shows that the wine is nearly ready to drink; enjoy from the end of 2016. The 20 acres of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc vines are hand picked; no herbicides are used.
title: Château le Doyenne 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold, ripe and fruity, this showcases black currant and berry flavors. A dry edge from the wood aging gives structure to this already deliciously drinkable wine. The new-wood aging has been controlled well to just hint at smoky, toasty flavors. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2012 Valentine par Valentine  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Although wood aging in this superior Cuvée is prominent, this wine has just enough juicy black fruits to allow it to develop well. Get past the wood, and the wine is rich enough and structured with fruit tannins. Allow the wine to integrate and drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2012 Premiére Cuvée  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich and full-bodied, this has ripe berry fruits that are already showing well. Fine tannins give structure without diminishing the natural fruitiness. It's a generous wine (with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc) that needs a little more time. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Nenine 2012  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and spicy, this is a smooth, wood-aged wine. It has ripe tannins and some concentrated fruits. With its acidity and dry aftertaste, it will certainly age.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2010  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Spicy, soft wine, full of sweet juicy fruit, the wood element more of feeling of roundness than taste. The wine has fresh blackberry fruits and a gentle core of tobacco and tannin.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2007  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Although 2011 has the reputation of being a naturally tannic vintage, this wine has reached the point where the tannins and black fruit have come into balance. The dry core of the wine marches along with the wine's fruitiness and impending maturity. Drink now.
title: Château de Potiron 2011 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This firm and structured wine is also warm and rich with blackberry and black currant fruit. Its structure lends weight while the juicy fruit and acidity show strongly. It will be a rich wine to drink from 2020.
title: Château Chatard 2015  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This dusty wine has weight and concentration. Fruit lies behind its firm facade, giving the potential for juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 7éme Génération  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Red fruit aromas show strongly in this wine. With its juicy acidity and soft tannins, it has fine fruitiness and will age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Rian 2015 Prestige  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A fruity, softly textured wine, this is made to be drunk young. Its black-currant flavors, soft tannins and ripe acidity have come together to give an approachable wine. Drink now.
title: Château Castel la Rose 2017 Tradition  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: With its youthful tannins intact, this structured wine will develop into one with juicy black-currant flavors. This balancing act will continue as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Macay 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: This soft, ripe wine is full of black-currant fruit with a rounded texture. It shows some of the tannins of the vintage, but the wine focuses on the ripe fruit with a warm character. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Mangaud 2016 Vieilli en Fût de Chêne  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This young wine is still showing the flavors of its 12 months of wood aging. As that integrates, it will become a ripe red-fruit and toast-flavored wine. The fruit has plenty of weight and concentration. This wine is rich with tannins and has the potential to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Genibon 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This is a selection of the best parcels of the estate on the east Gironde bank across from Margaux. The wood aging (50% new wood) is apparent and gives a dusty texture to the wine without dominating it. It is a structured and ripe wine, showing the fruit of the vintage while also keeping solid tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: Produced with organically grown grapes, the wine is firm, still tight and with ripe black fruits. It is full, structured with enough fruitiness to balance the tannins. As it ages, this wine will come together into a rich while fruity wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Lion des Aubrots 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: As with several wines from Bourg, this has Malbec (20%) in the blend, a continuation of a long tradition. It adds maybe some extra tannins to this firm wine that is the chateau's top wine. Solid and dense, it is still maturing with black fruits and crisp acidity still right up front. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Genibon 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Ripe, ready to drink and fruity, this is an attractive, balanced wine. Black-currant flavors are given structure by the tannins in this 94% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc blend from 15 acres. The fresh acidity of the vintage is still there, giving a lively juicy aftertaste. Drink now. An Alliance Bourg member.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: Showing the typical power and concentration of the 2010 vintage, this is a dense and structured wine. Good acidity and black plum flavors show through the big tannic texture and dry core. The wine still needs to age so drink from 2018. This is a 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc blend from Mallet Fréres.
title: Château Haut-Macô 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: While this is a rich wine, it also has a more fruity character that brings out acidity and a streak of freshness. It's firm at the moment, reflecting a need for aging. Dense and full of berry fruits, it will be best drunk from 2017.
title: Château Guerry 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This rich wine offers spice and black plum fruit flavors in equal measure. It's certainly ripe, but a fresher character adds lift. Tannins are already well-integrated into this velvet-textured wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Peugeais 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine is already soft, warm and attractive. With blackberry fruit, ripe tannins and a crisp acidity at the end, it shows a generous nature. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fleur de Plaisance 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: A concentrated wine, it's packed with both dark fruits and tannins. A dense structure contrasts with the fresher black currant fruitiness. Ripe and full-bodied, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Round and velvet smooth, it has blackberry fruits that are full in the mouth, giving freshness while also making the wine rich and generous. The tannins are already well-integrated into this soft wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fongalan 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine has both fruitiness and delicious, bright acidity. A subtle use of wood creates a firm structure under the black currant fruit flavors, giving a solid base on which to develop. Drink from 2017.
title: Etienne de Tauriac 2011  Cotes de Bourg

description: A big and ripe wine with tannins and fruitiness all well integrated. It has weight, a dense character and rich juicy black fruits. It's maturing nicely, giving a wine that is balanced and delicious.
title: Château de Genibon 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Still firmly tannic, the wine also promises rich black fruits. It has weight, a solid, firm structure and good balancing acidity. Complex and powerful, it's only spoiled by the show of pepper from the alcohol. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Brulescaille 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Structured wine with a severe edge from the dry, concentrated tannins. It's serious, stalky fruit layered with a more juicy element and tight acidity. The wine does need aging to soften its austere character.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2010 Excellence  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: A finely structured wine, this has a rich, juicy black-currant flavor and a solid, tannic core. It has weight and a dark, firm presence, and a smooth herbal character that highlights the wood aging. This should age for five years or more.
title: Château de Reynaud 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This hand-harvested wine is a blend of Merlot and Malbec, with firm tannins and ripe berry and cassis flavors. Solid and chunky, this has aging potential.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2010 Valades  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This densely structured wine is heavy on the oak aging, though it maintains layers of black currant and red plum flavors. It's currently ripe, with the potential to soften into a warm, rich character.
title: Château le Piat 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: This hand-harvested wine is a blend of Merlot and Malbec, with firm tannins and ripe berry and cassis flavors. Solid and chunky, this has aging potential.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2010 Valades  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: A solid effort, all tannins and dark texture at this stage. The acidity and dry tannins are firmly edged with black currant fruits. It will age and soften, but will always be on the dry, firm side.
title: Château le Paradis 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: Rich new wood and fruit combine well in this concentrated wine. Flavors go right through to give mint, blackberry and dark plum fruits. The tannins are already integrated to give a wine that will be ready to drink in two years.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: This is a soft and juicy wine with black currant fruitiness. Its wood aging is nicely judged, allowing its ripe character, acidity and black fruit to show through. The wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château les Aubastons 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: This estate, on the slopes above the city of Bourg has produced a firmly tannic wine. Structured and dense, its black currant fruit is juicy from acidity. A bitter coffee character gives it extra weight. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Noblet 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: Richly structured, this is a wine with style and balance. It has plenty of firm tannins to contrasted with its juicy blackberry fruit. It needs some time to fill out. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: This ripe and juicy wine is full of black currant fruit. The spice from wood aging is still upfront and needs to integrate. When it does, expect ripe fruit with a fine backdrop of structure and tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Perthus 2015  Cotes de Bourg

description: A ripe wine, with good red jelly fruits, sweet tannins and some new wood vanilla flavors. An attractive wine, fruity, with the acidity adding freshness. The dry core is there to hold it all together, but never dominant.
title: Château du Bousquet 2006  Cotes de Bourg

description: Showing some signs of mushroom-flavored maturity, this is still a finely structured wine. The fruit has turned into a more vegetal character with beetroot and firm tannins, spice and final acidity.
title: Château Roquevieille 2005  Cotes de Castillon

description: Firm and concentrated, this wine offers ripe blackberry fruits cut with acidity. The tannins and spice give extra complexity as well as weight. This is a wine for aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2016 Arbo Malbec  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured and balanced, this wine has great fruits that go with the tannins and rich texture. There is an unusually low amount of Merlot (60%) with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc for the area, yet there is a strongly juicy feel to the wine that gives a generous side. It is developing well; drink from 2016.
title: Château Godard Bellevue 2012  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is attractive, smooth and well balanced between spice and ripe berry fruit. With its acidity and toasty concentration, it's going to be delicious from 2020.
title: Château Godard Bellevue 2015  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a fine, smoky wine with great fruit and some firm tannins. It has a touch of minerality and a dry structure. Rich now, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Puyanché 2015  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: From an organic estate this offers ripe fruit hinting at maturity, balanced acidity and a core of tannin. There is some alcohol heat, so approach this wine with care, but there is plenty to enjoy. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de la Dauphine 2012  Fronsac

description: An entirely pleasing wine that is fun to drink. Dry and full of character, with requisite (for Bordeaux) dry, leafy flavors and smooth tannins. Plummy and smooth, with a smoky dry-wood element. Some sweetness, but hardly what you'd call lush. Overall it's tasty and lightly fruity.
title: Château La Vieille 1995 Cure  (Fronsac)

description: This rich wine is full of berry fruits that are smoothed out by wood aging. It is still young, with a structure of tannins that gives a dry edge. That will soften to reveal the fruitiness of the Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend with its fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2017. The d'Arfeuille family is now in its fifth century on Bordeaux's Right Bank.
title: Château Tessendey 2012  Fronsac

description: This ripe, Merlot-dominated wine offers bold tannins and black plum-skin fruitiness. It has spice, toastiness from wood aging and the potential of a ripe and generous character. It is firm at this stage and needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Magondeau 2012  Fronsac

description: Dark, dense and bold, this organic wine has the potential for richness as well as structure. The blackberry fruits are readying to come forward as the tannins soften. The wine should be ready from 2022.
title: Château l'Avocat 2016  Graves

description: This concentrated wine is firm with tannins and rich with black fruits and juicy acidity. The wine has great potential, but needs time. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Jouvente 2016 La Source de Jouvente  (Graves)

description: A soft style of wine, this benefits from the ripe vintage. Its red fruits are rich and warm, with a hint of tannic structure and crisp acidity. It is not a wine for long-term aging, but will be very ready from 2020.
title: Château la Tuilerie 2015  Graves

description: With the same winemaking team as Château Latour-Martillac, this Kressmann family-owned property has produced a ripe, wood-aged wine that has solid tannins at this stage. Smoky wood and black-plum fruits are still developing. The wine has potential and should be ready from 2020.
title: Château Langlet 2016  Graves

description: Sean and Nicola Allison's full-bodied, ripe, organic wine with fine tannins and dark black fruits will develop well. It is a big wine, packed with tannins and fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Château du Seuil 2016  Graves

description: This juicy, smoky wine from a chateau that's an historic monument has good potential. Its richness is balanced by the acidity and the firm tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2016  Graves

description: This ripe, delicious and fruity Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend has enough acidity and tannins to give it a good future. Densely structured now, its richness will allow it to develop well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château le Bonnat 2016  Graves

description: Structured and rich, this dense wine shows all the structure associated with this vintage. Ripe blackberries burst out from behind the tannins to give a full, juicy wine. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château les Clauzots 2016  Graves

description: Juicy, rich and with fine tannins, this promises to be a generous, balanced wine. Black fruits and acidity are coming together with the firm structure. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Lapinesse 2016  Graves

description: Rich red-berry flavors and acidity give this Jean Medeville wine a full-bodied nature. It has great fruitiness as well as tannins that are already integrated. This warm, spicy and ripe wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château du Mouret 2016  Graves

description: In effect, this is the second wine of Château de Cérons, produced from a dedicated parcel of vines. It has freshness, good acidity and some dense tannins that go through the fruit. It will age relatively quickly with its attractive fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Cérons 2016 Château Calvimont  (Graves)

description: This is a fruity wine with soft tannins and plenty of juicy acidity. It is bright, full of black-currant flavors with a perfumed character. Coming from the northern part of Graves, close to Pessac-Léognan, it shares some of the same structure. It is ready to drink.
title: Château la Tuilerie 2012  Graves

description: This comes from a part of the Château de Cérons vineyard in Bordeaux's Graves region. It is a fruity crisp wine, light in texture and with attractive black-currant fruits. The wood aging has smoothed the wine, opening up the stalky texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Calvimont 2015  Graves

description: Produced from vines an average of 24-years-old, the wine comes from an 86-acre vineyard to the south of Bordeaux. It is firm with tannins and with ripe, textured Merlot. There is a juicy character from the black-currant fruitiness. The wine with wood flavors needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Rahoul 2014  Graves

description: Named after the winemaker, Amélie Durand, this wood-aged wine is spicy and toasty without losing sight of the fruit. It has ripe blackberry fruit and acidity that will come to dominate the wood-aging flavors over the next few months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Doms 2012 Cuvée Amélie  (Graves)

description: A 24-acre vineyard at the southern end of the Graves region has produced a 2010 that is rich while still retaining an attractive light touch. There are firm tannins that are the background to the blackberry fruits and bold structure. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Andréa 2010  Graves

description: The six months wood aging shows in this spicy, toasty wine. It does nothing to dampen the black-currant fruit and acidity, while adding richness and smoothness to the exuberant fruitiness. The wine is still young and will be better from 2018.
title: Château de Respide 2012 Réserve  (Graves)

description: Ripe berry fruits and gentle, dusty tannins give this wine a rich character. Acidity keeps it fresh, although a good structure lies behind that crisp surface. With its juicy fruit, it is ready to drink, but will be better from late 2016.
title: Château Lapinesse 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Graves)

description: Aged for a year in wood, this dense, structured wine has serious tannins that are still very firm. Hints of juicy red currant fruits underneath promise a fresh, fruity wine with time. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Galés 2012  Graves

description: This is a well made, fruit and tannin wine. With delicious black currant fruits, juicy acidity and a supporting role of dry tannins, it has minerality, touches of wood aging and a more serious aftertaste, ready for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château le Bonnat 2011  Graves

description: Rich and structured, it is full of ripe berry fruits and dense tannins. It is solid and balanced, with concentration and a very ripe feel. It needs to age a few years, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Ducasse 2010  Graves

description: Cigar box and spice aromas lead to a wine with solid young tannins balancing black currant and berry fruits. This classic style of wine is still very structured and firm, although in four years, the ripe fruit will come through strongly. Drink from 2016.
title: Château du Seuil 2011  Graves

description: A dry style of wine that only slowly reveals its juicy character to bring out a warmer, richer side. It also does show considerable toast and spiciness along with firm tannins all of which still need to fully integrate. So don't drink until 2016.
title: Château d'Uza 2010  Graves

description: A finely structured wine with dusty tannins surrounded by attractive black currant fruits. Wood flavors give extra complexity to a wine that has fine juicy acidity and spice. Age for two years, but can be enjoyed now.
title: Château l'Avocat 2008  Graves

description: The top Cuvée from Château Saint-Robert, dominated by new wood covering the attractive fresh berry fruits underneath. The wood, with its attendant spice, needs to blow away and integrate for the wine to come into its own.
title: Château Saint-Robert 2006 Poncet-Deville  (Graves)

description: This has richness, structure, a very direct style of Bordeaux. It shows spice, berry acidity, some appetizing sweet juiciness and a firm layer of dark tannins. The wine has good balance and richness, but finishes with plenty of fresh acidity.
title: Château Haut Selve 2005  Graves

description: Dense fruit sets this wine off well. It has structure, ripe black plum juice and cranberry fruits, followed by sweet tannins as well as balancing acidity. The ensemble of fruit and tannins promises some aging-maybe 3 years, but with its richness it is drinkable now.
title: Château le Bonnat 2005  Graves

description: A smooth, creamy wine, rich in red fruits and rounded tannins. There's plenty of acidity but that just gives the delicious fruit character a good lift. Wood creeps in, playing a supporting role.
title: Château Saint-Robert 2005  Graves

description: Finesse is a wine created to exhibit elegance, showing restrained fruits, poised tannins and plenty of the trademark 2004 fresh acidity.
title: Château de Portets 2004 Finesse de Portets  (Graves)

description: This wine is fresh, with hints of ripe fruit and aromas of tobacco. It has some darkness, good black fruits and dark tannins, along with some good smoky wood.
title: Château Sociando-Mallet 2002  Haut-Médoc

description: This solid Bordeaux achieves a nice balance between ripe fruit and a more austere earthiness. There's a solid core of blackberry flavor and firm, broad tannins that suggest it will develop more depth with near-term cellaring.
title: Barons Edmund Benjamin de Rothschild 1998 Haut-Medoc  (Haut-Médoc)

description: One of the properties owned by Jean-Michel Lapalu, the wine comes from the far north of the Haut-Médoc appellation. It is tight with firm tannins and a dry core that will need time to soften. The fruit is going to become more generous as the wine fills out. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lieujean 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Under the same family ownership as Château Lamothe-Cissac, this estate has produced a broa rich wine, dominated by its 60% Cabernet Sauvignon. It is rounded already with juicy blackberry fruits and dark tannins. Drink this already fruity wine from 2019.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: In the south of the Médoc and away from the Gironde estuary, this vineyard has produced a wine that is half Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot. That blend gives the wine its structure as well as the juicy black-currant acidity. The wood aging has filled the wine out to give a bottle with good aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Because it is planted in clay and limestone soil, this wine is inevitably dominated by Merlot. The wood-aging flavor shows strongly with spice and toast while the fruit is just beginning to hint at a black-currant future. It is rich and full, needing time. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Doyac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the Margaux estate of Château Mongravey, this small property is located in Macau in the southern Médoc. The wine is soft and generous with ripe berry fruits and light tannins. It does have an edge of tannins that are there to give the wine its shape. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Braude Fellonneau 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: From one of the two properties owned by the Mulliez family of Château Belle-Vue, this wine is full of dense tannins as well as black currants. It is likely to develop into a rich although always firm wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Gironville 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This soft and generous wine gets its ripe fruity character from its 50% Merlot. There are tannins and a concentrated backbone to the wine. But it is dominated by its generous fruits and fine acidity. This is one of the chateaus owned by negociant Cheval Quancard. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated just north of Saint-Estéphe, the property has produced a generously structured wine that is already balanced. The hints of wood aging sustain the complex, ripe blackberry fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a spicy toasty wine, showing the wood-aging flavors strongly at this young stage. It has spice, dark tannins and bitter coffee flavors. That suggests the wine could remain firm and with a dry edge. The juicy acidity certainly needs time to fill out. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Raux 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: In the south of the Médoc, close to Bordeaux, this chateau has produced a ripe fruity wine. It has a fine balance between tannins and juicy black fruits. The blend, with its equal balance between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, gives richness along with firm structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Magnol 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: One of the group of vineyards that make up Domaines Lapalu, this wine is attractive and soft. It has generous black cherry and plum fruit along with gentle tannins that are already softening. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Liversan 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the Castel family, this chateau regularly produces attractive wines. This year, the wine is rich and still with its layers of dominant wood flavors. It also has a fine structure that will allow it to age. The finish brings in bright, juicy acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château d'Arcins 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Close to the Listrac vineyards and with the same ownership as Cap Léon Veyrin, this estate is on some of the same limestone soil as that appellation. The wine is structured and tight with firm tannins. The 55% of Merlot does suggest a juicy character although this will take time to develop and fill out. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bibian 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Bringing together the fruit of the vintage with some firm structure, this is going to be a ripe and balanced wine. It will also have plenty of juicy acidity and black currant fruits. Let this wine develop and don't drink before 2020.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Showing considerable new wood flavors, this is more vanilla and mint than fruit. That said, it does have the potential to bring out more of the black currant fruit of the vintage. As its juicy acidity softens, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The second wine of Château de Lamarque is named after the medieval tower of the castle. It is a densely tannic wine, firm and dense although also with plenty of black-plum fruits. The wood aging is still showing prominently, giving a tough, dry edge to the wine that needs to soften. Give this tight wine until 2018.
title: Château de Lamarque 2012 Donjon de Lamarque  (Haut-Médoc)

description: From the same ownership as Larose Trintaudon, this wine is firm while also having juicy red-currant fruit and intense acidity. The two characteristics are still working it out in this young wine. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Château Larose Perganson 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This easy, early-developing wine has balanced tannins that lift the black-currant fruitiness and the fresh acidity. It is developing fast, with its fruit right to the front and the tannins in the background. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is tough and structured, while still having plenty of weight and fruit for the future. As it integrates, ripe berry flavors will balance those tannins, giving a classic, structured Bordeaux. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: From a property owned by Château Mongravey in Margaux, this firmly structured wine is solid with dark tannins and blackberry fruits. It has the stalky texture typical of the vintage, although this will soften to leave a firm while ripe wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Braude 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is dry, full of tannins that mask the fruit and give the wine an austere character that will need time to soften out. The aftertaste contines the dry theme, but with hints of a more fruity future. Drink from 2018 when the fruit will have asserted itself.
title: Château Bibian 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Close to Margaux, this Château has produced a ripe, soft wine that brings out the fruitiness found in the best of 2013 wines. It is full of black-currant juiciness, with acidity and soft tannins. It should be ready to drink soon, certainly from 2017.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine has some richness, with ripe black currants and balanced acidity. The wood-aging just shows but, again, is balanced. With its fresh fruitiness, the wine will age quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Balac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine enjoys the fruitiness of the vintage with its black-currant flavors and light tannic structure. The blend is 50% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Cabernet Franc. The Cabernets, with ripe berry flavors that dominate here, give a firm core to the wine while not losing the potential of the fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Balac 2012 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This small 10-acre property has produced an attractively fruity wine with soft tannins and juicy black-fruit flavors. It is lightly structured-displaying more fruit than tannin-and has a fresh, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This rich, wood-aged wine has ripe plum fruits and dark tannins. It's still young, but it has a concentrated profile that's full bodied and dense. The fruity aftertaste is well integrated with the tannins. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2012 L'Enclos de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This wine has good potential. While for now, it is dry and cut with tannins, the fruit and rich blackberry flavors are promising a rounded, full future. Wood aging has smoothed the wine and added a touch of toast to the black currant fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Old vines from a 10-acre vineyard are the backbone of this wine. Ripe and concentrated, it offers aromas and flavors of mint from the wood aging along with a dominant Cabernet black currant and berry fruitiness. This is going to develop well, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: From vineyards in the heart of the Haut-Médoc, this is a firm wine with plenty toasty wood-aging flavors. It's also packed full of ripe black fruit that gives a rich, juicy character. Firm tannins at the end promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Retout 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: The clay and chalk soil of Château Sénilhac gives this second wine of the estate its smooth and rich character. It is generous, balanced and full of attractive berry fruits. With a preponderance of ripe Cabernet Savignon, this is packed with black currant, spice and fragrant acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Sénilhac 2011 La Prade  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Full of dry tannins and black currant fruit, this shows the fruity backbone of Bordeaux in 2012. It is structured while allowing the fresh fruitiness to shine. A firm core and signs of wood aging promise a future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a ripe and soft wine from the northern reaches of the Haut-Médoc. It has ripe berry fruits, balanced fresh acidity and just enough tannins to give structure and promise aging. With weight behind it, it will develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Doyac 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Vines close to the Gironde are the source of this structured wine. It has rich berry fruits and a good balance between the fruit acidity and the wood. At the moment, it is dry and firm. Give it until 2018 and it will be a powerful wine.
title: Château Charmail 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Belle-Vue changed its usual blend for 2012 to emphasize the ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. That gives a fresh black currant-flavored wine that is layered with ripe tannins and acidity. Fruity, it will develop quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: From one of the rare organic vineyards of the Médoc, this is a firm wine whose tannins are a fine sheen over the ripe fruits. Balancing Cabernet and Merlot, the wine has structure and juicy blackberry flavors, laced with acidity. It's a wine to age for some years, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Meyre 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is firmly structured while also supporting swathes of berry fruits. Tannins come from the Cabernet in the blend and from the wood aging that gives a toasty character. Black fruits and acidity shine at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: The 54-acre Landat vineyard, dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, has produced a powerful, wood-aged wine. The wood shows in the firm and dense tannic structure and gives the wine a dry perspective. Black currant and acidity provided a more juicy aspect to this concentrated wine.
title: Château Landat 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: A wine that is soft, rich in blackberry and currant fruitiness and with a fresh, jammy texture. Youthful acidity is prominent, giving a fresh, juicy character to the aftertaste. At the moment, it is all fruit, so wait until 2016.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2011 L'Enclos de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: With its dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured, juicy and black currant-flavored wine from the northern Haut-Médoc. Firm tannins, licorice and spice flavors are cut by acidity. It needs medium-term aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Château la Croix Margautot 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: While this is currently a tough proposition, the inherent fruitiness of this structured wine augurs well for its future. With berry fruits under the dark tannins and some slight bitterness from wood aging, it needs time. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint Ahon 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a wine with austerity and a dry, firm structure. It does have fruit to give weight to its tannins and texture. With spice as well as flavors of wood aging, it's likely to age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Moulin 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A ripe, smooth and fruity wine that is already delicious in its ripe berry and plum flavors. Touches of new wood show how it is still developing, a burst of vanilla followed by fruity acidity. It will be a full, ripe wine, but give it until 2016.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: It's certainly tannic and tough at the moment, the wine also has so much fruit. That will allow it to round out, bringing out the black currant fruitiness and resulting in a full, rich and perfumed wine. Wait until 2018.
title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A firmly tannic wine, dry and concentrated, it will require aging. The juicy red berry fruits and acidity will need time to show through the powerful structure. Give it until 2018.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A big, ripe and smoky wine, it displays a fruity, juicy undertow. It is developing well, giving great black currant fruitiness, some dense tannins and final acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Dasvin-Bel-Air 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a warm, soft and rich wine. Coming from vines close to Margaux, it has something of the light touch of that appellation. Fruity, with fresh berry fruits and already well-integrated tannins, it's likely to mature over the medium term. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A wood-laden wine, it still manages to bring out its inherent fruitiness. It's a ripe wine, showing spice from the wood and juicy blackberry flavors, well packaged and finished off with acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Château de Braude 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Big, rich and bold, this is a finely concentrated wine that's marked by the freshness of the year. It's likely to develop quickly and be ready next year.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2011 Haut-Médoc de Haut Bages Libéral  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Sweet fruit dominates this attractive, spicy wine. It has ample acidity, giving a fine, fresh black-currant character and tannins that are already melding into the wine. For medium-term aging of 3-5 years.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This tannic and extracted wine shows touches of burnt wood and solid, dry tannins. It misses the generously fruity feel of the vintage, replacing it with a firm, tight character. It needs several years.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Already deliciously fruity, this is a big, ripe, black-fruit-dominated wine. To balance the black currant flavor, there is a fine sense of structure, which offers a dry edge along with final acidity.
title: Château Belgrave 2009 Diane de Belgrave  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Now maturing, this retains its red fruits; its bright texture and acidity go with the firm tannins and dark structure. It is balanced and ready to drink.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: A very structured wine, its firm tannins sitting over the potential of rich blackberry fruits. It does need a year or two for the elements to come together. Spice from wood gives added interest, while the wine finishes with serious acidity.
title: Château la Croix Margautot 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: Balanced wine, with well-integrated red fruits and dry tannins, offering plenty of fruitiness. Structure is important here, but so are the red currant and spice flavors.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2008  Haut-Médoc
