title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2001 Kosher  (Saint-Julien)

description: This crus bourgeois has improved dramatically in recent years under the control of Jean-Louis Triaud. This 2002 is dense and dark, with solid spice and wood-driven fruit. At this stage, it is still tannic, but, for the year, is a powerful wine.
title: Château Gloria 2002  Saint-Julien

description: A very typical wine for the year, with its generous ripe fruit and blackberry jelly flavors. There is just a hint of animal on the palate, but this is overwhelmed by the rich texture.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2000  Saint-Julien

description: A ripe, fruity wine, it has tannins and structure as well, giving both richness and a solid, dense feel that will allow it to age. The aftertaste leaves juicy black fruits and soft tannins. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Glana 2011 Terre du Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: Dusty tannins and juicy fruit reveal the great freshness of the wine. While it does not have great density of flavor, it does have plenty of forward fruit, smoky flavors and black currant acidity. For the medium term.
title: Château les Ormes 2008  Saint-Julien

description: Soft, rounded, a wine that is both fresh and open. Red berry fruits are suffused with acidity, giving a light touch. This is a wine for drinking in 2-3 years.
title: Château Beychevelle 2007  Saint-Julien

description: It's rare to find a pure Cabernet Sauvignon wine in Bordeaux, so this wine is definitely an exception. It is full of ripe black-currant fruit as well as the tannic structure natural to the grape. The wine has intense acidity as well as structure. It should age further, so drink from 2020.
title: Château la Freynelle 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is rich with its fruit concentration and dense texture. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, it is packed with red-berry fruits that are balanced with soft tannins. From early 2018, it will be a delicious wine.
title: Groupe Clinet 2015 Ronan by Clinet 100% Cabernets  (Bordeaux)

description: A perfumed 100% Malbec wine, this has rounded tannins, rich flavors and plenty of potential. Bold, full of black fruitiness and firmly structured, the wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Tire Pé 2016 Les Malbecs  (Bordeaux)

description: Bordeaux has always had Malbec in its vineyards although it is rare. This unusual wine shows how, in a fruity year, the grape can work well. The tannins are soft, giving a juicy black-fruited wine that is forward and delicious to drink now for its succulent fruit.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2014 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

description: Malbec is on the list of allowed grapes in Bordeaux but is rarely found now because it used to be difficult to ripen. This rich, structured wine shows that the situation has changed. It's ripe, full of black fruit and likely to mature well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lagarde 2016 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a rich wine, full of juicy fruit and attractive acidity. A blend of 95% Malbec and 5% Merlot, it has touches of wood aging along with the tannins. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2018.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2014 Arbo Malbec  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a jammy wine, produced in a clay amphora. It is full of the extra-ripe fruit typical of the vintage. However the wine works because the tannins are not excessive, giving space to the red-berry flavors and just enough acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Bellevue 2016 Amphorae  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jean Lissague, one of Bordeaux wine's "new generation," produced the 100% Merlot with spice and firm tannins. It also has weight and richness from the generous fruitiness. Drink this structured wine starting from 2019.
title: Château Grand Secret 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This 100% Merlot produced by the Glemet family has spice and layers of wood-aging flavors that are still dominating the fruit. That fruit is there, waiting, with hints of red berry and black-currant flavors. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Chamaille 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe, rounded and with fine rich fruit. Its structure is balanced with the blackberry fruits, giving density as well as fine acidity. Drink this well-made wine from 2018.
title: Groupe Clinet 2015 Ronan by Clinet 100%  (Bordeaux)

description: Rich and structured, this shows the plushness of today's Bordeaux Merlot. Ripe berry fruits, dark plums and a touch of vanilla give spice and round off the texture. It's juicy, still developing and best from 2016.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2012 Merlot de Château Sainte-BarbeÂ   (Bordeaux)

description: A very rich, almost Port-like ripeness and dense black fruits give this wine powerful presence. It has weight and sweet fruitiness that is happily cut with acidity. Tannins provide a light reminder of the chance to age this wine. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Château les Arromans 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: Cailloux refers to the pebbles that are an essential part of the vineyard's makeup. They give the wine its mineral edge that adds an extra dimension and structure to the rich Merlot fruit.
title: Château Penin 2009 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Close to the Fronsac vineyards, the estate has produced a ripe, structured 2015. A light touch of acidity and poised black-currant fruit makes it both accessible and refreshing. Drink this attractive wine from 2020.
title: Château Tour d'Auron 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This pure Merlot is racy, ripe and ready to drink, with fruit that shows maturity. Tannins are well integrated into the structure, leaving plenty of room for the juicy fruit and mature, spicy flavors. Drink now.
title: Château l'Espérance 2011 Les Cédres  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Seriously structured, this wine is almost too rich. It is concentrated, with dense tannins, dark chocolate and cocoa flavors. The juicy, jammy black fruits come with the acidity to give the wine some welcome crispness and fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
title: Belliard Vins Selections 2012 Excellence de Belliard  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The second wine of Château le Prieuré, made from 100% pure juicy Merlot, is ripe and concentrated. It still has plenty of firm tannins although the rich fruits will balance out shortly. It is then going to be a generous wine with great final fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Prieuré 2014 Délice du Prieuré  (Saint-Émilion)

description: From vines on the plain of Saint-Émilion, close to the Dordogne river, this is a ripe fruity wine. The tannins are already well integrated into the berry fruits, leaving just a dry core that is typical of the year. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Château Abelyce 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Pure Merlot from the Barde-Haut vineyard gives a smooth and ripely fruited wine that is now on the way to maturity. It combines soft tannins, an elegant structure and juicy acidity. The aftertaste is fruity with a more mature edge.
title: Château Barde Haut 2008 Le Vallon de Barde-Haut  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine melds red berry and black currant flavors easily into its dry texture. A deliciously ripe wine, it feels soft and forward; it will likely be ready to drink in six months.
title: Schröder & Schí¿ler 2010 Chartron La Fleur  (Bordeaux)

description: This beautifully perfumed wine offers spicy Cabernet Franc notes and ripe red berry flavors. The tannins are still firm while not masking the spice, smokiness and blackberry fruit. For medium-term aging, from 2020.
title: Château Tour d'Horable 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This nine-acre estate lies in the flat land of Saint-Émilion below the famed slopes and plateau. It is in an open, fruity style with a dominance of 80% Merlot with 20% Cabernet Franc giving juicy acidity, red fruits and some concentration. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Dubourg 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has some richness. Full berry fruits are balanced by acidity and layers of tannins. The wine has good potential, exhibiting the ripe fruit of the vintage. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Rouquette 2015  Bordeaux

description: Jean Chanfreau's family, which owns Châteaux Fonréaud and Lestage in Listrac, produces this blend of 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot, giving a wine with plenty of Cabernet cassis flavors, but also a roundness and spiciness that sit well with firm tannins. Lovers of young Bordeaux will find it ready to drink now, but it has a good five years before complete maturity.
title: Château Fonréaud 1999  Listrac

description: This Jean-François Reaud property offers a Merlot-dominant juicy, ripe wine that's packed with black-currant flavors. Acidity and firm tannins back up the fruitiness to give a wine with plenty of freshness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Haut Sociondo 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Firm tannins don't mask the berry fruits and acidity in this wine. It has a juicy, forward character backed by tannins.Touches of wood aging from the 12 months in barrel give a dry core. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Cône-Taillasson Sabourin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Soft and fruity, this mainly Merlot wine is approachable already. Black-currant flavors and generous tannins work well together to give a juicy wine, full of acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Clairac 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A ripe and spicy wine, this has warm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft structure allows the red-berry flavors to speak strongly. As it develops this fruitiness will become even more pronounced. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Haut Peyrefaure  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This firmly structured, limited-production wine also has plenty of ripe, black fruits. Bold tannins and dark-chocolate flavors are balanced by black plum fruits that are developing underneath. Drink from 2022.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Closerie du Bailli Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Bold, ripe and rich, this is a concentrated wine. Its dark tannins have a smoky edge from the wood aging. It needs time. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2016 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Produced from 90% Merlot and 10% Malbec, this wine is made by two young brothers. It is ripe and structured, still young of course, but with delicious ripely fruity potential. Black-currant and berry flavors are lifted by acidity and held firmly by the structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Colombier 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine comes from a small estate in Blaye whose origins go back to the 18th century. The wine is still young with some lean fruit that needs to fill out the structure-a structure that is all there with firm tannins and a dry core. Drink this firm wine from 2019.
title: Château Loumelat 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While this Alliance Bourg wine is dry at the moment, this will be a rich and ripe wine with plenty of potential. It has tannins that are balanced by the spicy red-berry fruit and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Gatines 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While the wood flavors are prominent, they don't mask the ripe berry fruits in this Merlot-dominant blend. Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier produced a wine with a rich character. It is full of wood spice, hints of mint and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a firm wine, dry and with tight tannins. The fruit weight is still developing and the wine needs time to fully realize its potential. Given time, the fruit will become rich and full. Denis Noël and his kids run the estate, which has been in the family since 1800. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Noël Les Charmes 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is dense with tannins while not losing sight of the ripe berry fruits. The balance is coming together well, giving a structured wine that also has fine fresh black fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château Clairac Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The seventh generation of the Carreau family has produced this rich full-bodied and structured wine. It has dense tannins as well as plenty of ripe red fruits. The structure suggests the wine will continue to age, so drink this ripe wine from 2017.
title: Château la Croix St-Pierre 2014  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This certified organic wine from Damien Lorteau is juicy with attractive blackberry fruit. Spice and warm tannins (aged 12 months in barrel) give it a rich structure. It will have a fine future-a ripe wine with plenty of fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Vieux Moulins 2014 Cuvée les Hélices  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Vincent and Ludivine l'Amouller, the estate's fourth generation, named this wine after the sailboat of the ancestor who moored in Blaye and bought the vineyard. The 2014 vintage, certified organic, is firm while also rich with fruit. The wine is going to generous, ripe and full of concentration. Drink this attractive wine with its good potential from 2019.
title: Château Frédignac 2014 Favorite  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From one of the oldest estates in Blaye, this smooth wine is rich and packed with blackberry fruits. It has a mint character as well as spice. It is a juicy, powerful wine that will need to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Bourdieu 2014 No. 1  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich and concentrated, this blend is mainly Merlot, with a little Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. The alcohol shows in the weight of the wine, but the freshness is still very present. Powerful, dark and still young, the wine will be best from 2017.
title: Château l'Espérance 2010 Cuvée Trois Fréres  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm and with dark tannins, this wine has great potential. Ripe berry fruits and a concentrated structure are already well balanced with acidity cutting through. As it matures, this wine with its dense structure will develop well. Drink from 2017. Enologist Sebastien and vineyard manager Nicolas are the latest Carreau generation managing family estates.
title: Château Les Petits Arnaud 2012 Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, smoky wine is full of black fruits and soft, generous tannins. It is rich, juicy with black plum juice and berry jelly flavors that are still young and fresh. Age this wine until 2017.
title: Château Grand Moulin 2012 Collection Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine from a great year is rich in both fruit and structure, solid with tannins as well as ripe fruit. It is still youthful, dense and powerful. Wait and drink from 2018.
title: Château Garreau 2010 Cuvée Armande  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From selected parcels on the Bertinerie vineyard, this is still a young, firmly structured wine. Red berry fruits offer a contrast to the solid tannins and rich texture. The wood aging still shows, giving a spicy character that will integrate as the wine matures. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Bertinerie 2012 Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Here's a solid wine full of both tannins and dark fruits. New oak barrels give a spicy character while supporting the fruitiness. A blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon from only 10 acres, it is developing into a rich wine that still needs time. Drink this impressive wine from 2018.
title: Château des Matards 2012 Cuvée Nathan  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: High amounts of new wood hit both the aromas and the structure of the wine. It has firm weight, dry, smoky tannins and a bitter-chocolate character. It's very dense and very dry, although with the potential to soften and reveal more attractive, juicy fruit.
title: Château Glorit 2011  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A packed wine, its ripe fruits are a warm pleasure. It has all the structure of the year but in fine measure, lending density and richness to the palate. It's a wine for aging; give it at least five years.
title: Château Gauthier 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich, concentrated and fruity, this wine is ripe and full of blackberry fruits with hints of strawberry. Its tannins are a soft, round envelope for the fruit. Expect this wine to age relatively quickly over the next three years.
title: Château de Trousse 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine, which is polished by the wood influence, offering flavors of mint and eucalyptus. It is rich and spicy, with the weight of black fruits. This is already drinkable, so consume it now, or keep it for 3-4 years.
title: Château la Levrette 2009  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big, structured tannins lie over the ripe fruit. The wine has a dense character, the young tannins dominant. Given a year, the fine fruit will come through to give a sweeter blackberry character.
title: Château Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is structured and firm. Its tannins and solid texture promise both aging and show the potential of this rich wine. With intense youthful acidity at this stage, the wine's fruit is crisp and clear. This is one of three Cuvées from Bel Ormeau. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Bel Ormeau 2015 Les Hérits  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark and firm on the one hand, this wine is also full of fruit. Blackberry flavors dominate, but tannins lend support with concentration and density. They just need time to come together. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Clairac 2015 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From a Château that has vineyards in both Blaye and Bourg, this wine is redolent of black currant, both on the nose and on the palate. The wood and tannins lend support, giving plenty of space for the ripe fruitiness and juicy acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Juicy and rich, this is already developing quickly. Its blackberry fruit is supported by generous tannins, and its dry core offers smoky flavors. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Château Jussas 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine's red berry and mint aromas lead to a palate structurd with firm tannins and loaded with juicy fruits. Blackberry and black currant flavors give it great fruitiness. As it develops, they will integrate well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Sociondo 2015 Cuvée Prélude  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine is firm with tannins that gives a spicy character. It has a dry core, a juicy aftertaste and rich blackberry fruit that will certainly develop as it matures. Give it some time and drink from 2021.
title: Château Labrousse 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is soft and ripe, with juicy black fruit and fresh acidity over a background of firm tannins. A smoky edge adds to its attractiveness.
title: Château Berthenon 2015 Cuvée Henri  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big, bold and spicy, this wine is ripe with black fruit. Tannins and a rich texture confirm its upfront style. Likely to take its time to develop, it will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Glorit 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Smooth with polished new wood flavors and fine black fruit, this wine has good potential. Subtle tannins back up its black currant and berry fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Magdeleine Bouhou 2015 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This finely structured wine is ripe and full of blackberry flavors, with a soft, rich texture. That suggests it will age relatively quickly and be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château La Roche Bazin 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a powerful wood-aged wine. Spice and toast aromas give it a firm character that will need to soften. Its black plum and berry fruit is upfront, with a juicy element that will fill out. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Sociondo 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and fruity, with delicious red berry flavors, this is an attractive wine now. It also has some firm tannins that will allow it to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich, structured and generous, this wine has great potential. Its firm tannins don't mask the juicy black-currant and blueberry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Cordier 2016 Château d'Haurets  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine has dense fruit and structure. Tannins, black fruits and balanced acidity contrast with the smoky wood-aging flavors. The wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2016 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, smooth wine offers delicious black fruits. Wood aging shows in the spice and dark- chocolate flavors although it does not interfere with the wine's fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Château les Arromans 2016  Bordeaux

description: Wood aromas feature strongly in this wine. On the palate, they give it a strong spicy character with plenty of new-barrel flavors. The wine also has plenty of fruit and acidity to sustain the structure. Drink from 2022.
title: Château La Rame 2016  Bordeaux

description: A ripe, perfumed wine with fine tannins and a spicy structure, this is rich and offers good potential. Berry fruits go well with the tannic structure to create a balanced wine, ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château du Bernat 2016 L'Exception  (Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins and concentrated fruit make for a wine with a dense texture and a solid structure. The blackberry fruit is ripe, balanced by juicy acidity and a touch of spice from wood aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Motte Maucourt 2016  Bordeaux

description: This ripe, bold and generous Gonfrier Fréres wine is ready to drink. Some firm tannins and a ripe texture are balanced with the juicy black-currant fruits. Drink now, although even better from early 2018.
title: Château Tassin 2015  Bordeaux

description: A ripe perfumed wine with fine tannins as well as dense fruit. Blackberry flavors are up there along with the acidity and crisp aftertaste. It's a wine with a good future, ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2015 Château Jean de Bel Air  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a wine that punches above its simple appellation. With balanced structure and tannins, it is rich with generous fruit and acidity. The structure is still firm and the wine will need to age a little longer. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine from the Courselle sisters in honor of their dad is dense and firm. With ripe blackberry and damson fruits it is already generous. The juicy acidity and fruitiness show well through the structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Thieuley 2015 Réserve Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux)

description: Named after Jean-Luc Thunevin's reputation as being the bad boy of Saint-Emilion (because he broke into the hallowed aristocracy), the wine is produced from his own vines. It is a rich wine, full of great ripe fruits and dark tannins, concentrated and with some aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Mauvais Garçon  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a richly perfumed wine, full of ripe red fruits. It has a juicy background of acidity that is lifted with smoky tannins. The core of the wine is still dry and so needs to soften a little. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe with juicy black-currant fruits and balanced acidity. It has some spice from the wood aging, just enough to smooth out the bright fruitiness. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
title: Domaine de Valmengaux 2014  Bordeaux

description: This ripe wine fully expresses the fruitiness of the vintage while also having a firm, tannic structure. It does need to age, although juicy black currant is already showing through. Wait until 2017.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Peynaud-Bagnac  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a smooth, wood-aged wine. Ripe black fruits are soft, with a contrast of toast and spice. It's juicy, with just the right amount of tannin. Although it's almost ready to drink, the wine will also age because of its structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Peynaud-Bagnac 2012  Bordeaux

description: There is a good balance here between spicy wood and sweet berry fruit. The result is an attractive wine that's ripe and fruity with blackberry flavors and fine tannins. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2011 Petit Paveil  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a full-bodied, structured wine full of ripe berry fruits, delicate acidity and soft tannins. There is a juicy element that offers freshness to balance the firm texture. Wait a year to drink this wine.
title: Château de Costis 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a bright, ripe wine. It has a sense of lightness, attractive acidity and black currant flavors. This delicious, juicy wine will be ready to drink in another few months.
title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2011  Bordeaux

description: This ripe, concentrated wine is full of tannins and ripe blackberry fruit. It is still youthfully dry, but shows the potential to develop for 3-5 years.
title: Château la Chapelle Maillard 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is firm, smoky and fruity-a combination that offers a rich black-fruited experience. Wood flavors provide some density. Rich and perfumed, it needs to age over two years.
title: Château Sainte-Anne 2010 Domaine du Bourdieu  (Bordeaux)

description: An attractively balanced wine, this shows fruitiness that's supported by fine tannins. It's a ripe wine, ready to drink now, with black currant juice and red plum flavors giving pleasure.
title: Château Roustaing 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is rich and smooth, and the power of its tannins are already integrated into the complex plum and blackberry flavors. It has a solid structure, with weight and an open feel.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2009  Bordeaux

description: Based in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this vineyard has ancient monastic origins. The 2005 is a well-balanced wine, structured with Cabernet and rounded with Merlot. The fruit is rich, not complex, but very food friendly.
title: Bernard Magrez 2005 Château Haut Mouleyre  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine offers both structure from dense tannins and layers of ripe black-currant fruits. It is young, promising a fruity future as the tannins soften. It has a juicy aftertaste, the fruit laced with good acidity. Drink from 2019
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2016 Château Grand Marchand  (Bordeaux)

description: A 5-acre property well north of Saint-Emilion, which has been earmarked by Bernard Magrez for garage wine treatment. Aged in new barrels, this 2003 is rich, full of currants and raisin flavors. There is plenty of dry fruit, with spice and new wood flavors as part of the mix.
title: L'Egrégoire 2003  Bordeaux

description: Dark colored wine, with ripe black plum flavors that lie over solidly textured tannins. Structured to bring out the fruit, the wine also has a core of wood, spice, dark cocoa and black currant acidity to finish. An attractive wine that is worth aging for another two years.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2005  Bordeaux Cotes de Francs

description: This wine is certainly structured, but the ripe fruitiness is most prominent. Red-berry flavors and acidity are important elements in this full, rich wine with hints of wood aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Féret-Lambert 2016 Costes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This Boissonneau wine is all about up-front fruit. Blackberries, black currants and good acidity dominate the tannic structure and dry core. The wine is bold, ripe and fruity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: In the eastern Entre-Deux-Mers, this chateau sits on a hill above the Dordogne river. This wine is ripe and smoothly textured, with black fruits and generous tannins that have softened easily and gracefully. The wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: At this stage, this wine is all about tannins. That will change as the weight of the black fruits comes through to give a complex, rich wine with good potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Féret-Lambert 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While the wood flavors are prominent at this stage, this wine also has fruit weight. The blueberry fruitiness comes through, allowing this ripe wine to balance out. Drink from 2023.
title: Château du Claouset 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This luscious, ripe wine is full of blackberry flavors and rich tannins. It is still young, but its fruits and generous texture already give it a delicious character. With another year it will be ready to drink, so plan on late 2019.
title: Château de Ribebon 2015 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Black fruits and rich tannins give this wine power and its structure. It has concentration, with blackberry flavors coming together with dark tannins to give richness. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This structured wine is firm with tannins, with fruit weight in the background. Solid and firm, it's dense and full of blackberry flavors. Richness and concentration are setting it on a path for aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Parenchére 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This perfumed wine offers rich tannins and lush black fruits. It is full and packed with blackberry flavors. This will be a ripe wine as it develops. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Reynier 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big, spicy and bold, this is a rich wine. Its tannins and firm concentration are part of a complex whole that also includes ripe black and red berry fruits and acidity. Drink this generous wine from 2022.
title: Château Quinsac 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wood-aging flavor is strong in this wine with bold tannins and ripe black fruits. It is still very young and concentrated, but with plenty of fruitiness and acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château le Gardera 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This generous and ripe wine made from organically grown grapes is full of juicy berry flavors and integrated tannins. With its light touch of wood and dominant fruitiness, this rich wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Grand Français 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This perfumed wine is ripe with black fruits as well as strongly aromatic tannins and wood flavors. It is balanced, with a good poise between fruit and structure. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Ribebon 2016 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe, full and juicy, this is already a delicious wine. Firm tannins form a dry backdrop to the black-currant and berry fruits with their balanced acidity. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château Penin 2016 Grande Sélection  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This dense wine produced from organically grown grapes has a solid structure and is full of black fruits. It is big, with flavors of dark chocolate, licorice and dark plums. It's not a wine to approach lightly and will take some time to soften. Drink from 2021.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2016 Les Hauts de la Gaffeliére Sélection d'Excellence  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine comes from Château Vrai Caillou's 98-acre vineyard on a 220-acre plateau in the eastern Entre-deux-Mers. It is in a fruity style, just touched with wood and with some concentration from old vines. The wine has potential and will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has a deep purple color. The aromas are of attractive ripe fruit, wood and black fruits. To taste, there is sweet, juicy black fruit, with some wood, which is well in balance. A fine wine, still young, this will age well.
title: Château de Seguin 1999 Cuvee Carl  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The 2000 vintage is being lauded as one of the greats in Bordeaux, and wines like this are partly responsible. Sure it's possible to spend into the triple digits for a classified growth that won't be ready to drink for 15 years, but it's also possible to find steals like this-a soft, succulent blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc that has enough backbone to age gracefully for up to 10 years. Cassis, tobacco and chocolate flavors combine seamlessly like nowhere else in the world.
title: Château Au Grand Paris 2000  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Made by Jean-René Matignon, technical director of Château Pichon Baron in Pauillac, the wine is finely structured, showing polished wood aging. The velvet black fruits and fine acidity are already well integrated. Drink from 2018.
title: Cap Royal 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While this Ducourt wine does have wood-aging flavors, it also has plenty of black-currant fruitiness to bring out the crisp character. The ripe Merlot of the vintage is very evident in this potentially delicious wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Larroque 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a juicy wine with its red fruits and attractive acidity. The wood aging still shows, perhaps too strongly, but that fruit is already a major factor in the success of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a structured wine that is full of tannins. Its fruitiness is masked at this stage, although it is certainly there. Fine black fruits are edged with the structure and finished with the ripe aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2015 Bruignac Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a spicy wine that is also full of fruit. It has a fine juicy red-fruit character that is balanced by the tannins and the touches of wood aging. It will be a delicious wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2015 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While this Fournier wine has plenty of firm tannins, it also has swathes of ripe fruit. It is juicy and rich at the same time, a fine balancing act that will allow it to develop well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fruity and ripe, the wine also has some solid structure to give it a core of dark tannins. The black-currant fruits are developing well, bringing their crispness to the party. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Bois Chantant 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is ripe and perfumed. Mint and sweet eucalyptus aromas are followed on the palate by ripe tannins and strawberry fruits. This is an attractive wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Auguste 2014 L'Audacieux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: All the elements are present in this young wine. It has plenty of red fruit, touches of plum and spice. The tannins are firm while leaving plenty of room for the fruit. A wine that will be comfortably drinkable from 2018.
title: Château de Parenchére 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a smoky wine, full of rich strawberry flavors. Its tannins come from the wood aging that cuts through the fruit. With acidity as well, the wine is developing well and should be ready from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014 Le Grand Rossignol  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a ripe generous wine that has solid tannins as well as red-plum flavors. It is concentrated and full of flavor. As the tannins soften, it is likely to be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2014 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While there are plenty of firm tannins, there is also some fine red-berry fruit and layers of spice. The wine is structured as well, bringing the whole into balance. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Château Lescalle 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Mint aromas and spice give this wine a good start. It is full in the mouth with spice, toast as well as black-currant fruits. The acidity and the crisper aftertaste give the wine a fine lift. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The top wine from this estate is this release from the powerful 2010 vintage. It has a dense structure, dark tannins and rich texture. Ripe black plum and dark fig flavors along with the dry core means the wine is still developing. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2010 Cuvée Jean  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Concentrated and spicy, this is full of generous tannins and delicious black plum fruits. Spice goes with the toasty wood-aging flavors that enhance the opulent texture of this delicious, ready-to-drink wine. The aftertaste, with its acidity, introduces some freshness.
title: Château Roc de Levraut 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is no question about the richness and structure of this powerful wine. The 2010 vintage has brought that out in every Bordeaux. Here is shows in the rich blackberry fruits, the dense tannins and the general ripeness of the wine. Wait until late 2015 to drink.
title: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur
winery: Château Les Graviéres de la Brandille

description: Plenty of ripe berry fruit gives a wine that's generous. It has a firmer tannic structure, a dry character that needs to soften. Bold and rich, it will be at its best from 2017.
title: Château du Lort 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Very spicy, this wine is just on the edge of being too toasty. Luckily, the fruit is there as well, a rich medley of blackberry and currant flavors that counterpoint the wood. Wait and drink from 2018.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While the wood aging and toast do show, this wine is also rich. Black fruits give a juicy, flavorsome character, an opulence that is finished with some acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Saincrit 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While the alcohol is high and the wine powerful, it has managed to retain its linear, structured character. The result is a concentrated wine that also has acidity and a juicy blackberry fruit character. It does need to age, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This balanced, solid wine is dark with tannins and rich fruits. The juicy, fruity element will take time to manifest itself. Give this complete wine until 2017.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From the best parcels in the La Mothe du Barry vineyard, this firm and structured wine shows an obvious wood-aging character. Dominated by Merlot, it is rich and dense, solid tannins balanced against juicy black fruits and fresh acidity. It needs to age; drink after 2016.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2012 Cuvée le Barry  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The top wine from this Château is a solid, textured effort. It has a full-bodied feel with very ripe black fruits. With its tarry texture, firm structure and generous fruits, it merits medium-term aging, although it could be drunk now.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2011 Cuvée Leah Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While this wine has firm structure, it also has enough fruit weight to balance. On the palate, blackberry juiciness emerges from dark tannins, along with a touch of smokiness and fine acidity on the finish. Drink from 2015.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is aromatic and fruity with ripe red-berry flavors and spiciness from wood aging. Mint and soft tannins show well, making the palate rich as well as gently structured. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Landereau 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has good spiciness, ripe fruits and firm tannins. There is a good balance between acidity from red berry fruits and a dense, tannic character. It is solid and concentrated, and needing to age longer. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves de Rauzan 2011 Château Villotte  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Solid and textured, this is a firm wine with a bright future. It has weight from its tannins as well as ripe berry fruits that shine through. Delicate acidity lightens the load. It does need to age, so drink from 2016.
title: Maison Bouey 2011 Château Belrose  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Dark and dense, here is a wine that shows just as much hard-edged dryness as it does juicy red fruits. Once the components come together, the wine will be concentrated and powerful. This wine has lots of potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Mongeat 2011 Cuvée Isabelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has weight and concentration, heavy on the tannins at this stage. Wild strawberry and dark plum fruits are taking their time to show through the structure. Dark tannins from firm wood aging and extracted fruit can also be found here. Drink from 2015.
title: Château la Faviére 2010 Muse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a wine made for drinking soon. It has ripe black-plum fruit, structured tannins and a juicy and smoky character that is already delicious.
title: Château de Nardon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This solid, chunky wine expresses dry tannins as much as ripe fruit. The structure is present, but the black currant note is still waiting for its chance to shine. Give it 4-5 years.
title: Château de Goëlane 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A balanced wine that brings together flavors of wood, smoke and ripe black currant, it's elegant, forward and structured. Drink soon, or age for several years.
title: Château Beaulieu Comtes de Tastes 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rounded, wood-aged wine has just the right amount of structure and delicious acidity to accompany the full red- and black-berry notes. It's refreshing, while still concentrated and age worthy.
title: Château Grand Jean 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A solid and dense wine, this is full of firm tannins, plus black currant and berry flavors. It is well structured and concentrated, a benefit from using fruit sourced from low-yield old vines. With its dark, dense texture, it will age for several years.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A wine with good depth of flavor, this is uses fruit that was selected from the best parcels of Le Grand Verdus. It has firm tannins, along with flavors of rich black fruits and wood-derived spices. With its weight and concentration, it's a wine that should age over several years.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2009 Génération  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firm and solid, this features chunky tannins and strong structure. It shows its wood aging strongly at the moment, which covers some of the ripe blackberry flavor. It has weight and power from its dry core and fruit, which promises aging.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big and fruity, this has generous tannins and ripe black fruits. With its full fruits bursting out of the glass, it is already suitable for drinking. Delicious, full bodied and a great testament to the vintage's quality.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While there is plenty of new wood influence in this wine, it also has delicious fruit. The combination results in a juicy flavor of black stone fruit, with good acidity to accompany the toast and smoked meat flavors. Age for 3-4 years.
title: Château Pierrail 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a firmly textured wine, with tannins pushing through the black currant fruit. It is beginning to show a balanced structure and a smooth, smoky character that's leavened by acidity and juicy fruit.
title: Château Plaisance 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Dominated by new wood, this top Cuvée from Château de Parenchére is certainly too young to drink at this stage. Its black, brooding character is very extracted and tough, although there are good hints of juiciness and sweet berry fruits.
title: Château de Parenchére 2009 Esprit de Parenchére  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, and without wood aging, this wine is ripe, packed with black fruits and some firm tannins. It has weight, rich blackberry flavors along with acidity. The wine is still young, needing to age, and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château du Ballandreau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe wine, with its rich Merlot and perfumed Cabernet Franc, is full of black fruit flavors which give the wine great lift. Tannins and acidity add to the aging prospects of this wine from a 160-acre vineyard close to Libourne. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Jalousie 2015 Duporge  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This bold, dense wine is powerful and concentrated. The result is some bitterness and chocolate flavors from the high extraction. It has weight, spice and a smoky character that comes from the wood aging. Drink the wine from 2021.
title: Château Roseet-Caillau 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe wine is structured, with some solid tannins as well as blackberry fruits. It has a dry core, allied to juicy acidity, bursting with fruit that needs to soften and age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château le Calvaire 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe wine with red-berry aromas and firm structure is dominated by its 75% Merlot. It is ripe with jammy fruits and a core of tannins. Wood aging has added another attractive dimension to this rich wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lavagnac 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This top Cuvée from Château Cadillac has great fresh black currant fruits, dark plum skins and sweet tannins. It is also very obviously aged in wood, and this element needs to calm down. Wait another year, or decant now.
title: Château Cadillac 2006 Cuvée J.J. Lesgourgues  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich, solid, with ripe spice and black plum flavors. The considerable richness is balanced with dark tannins, which give a sense of fine-grained texture to this solid wine.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: At this stage, the wine just hints at a structured, firm future. Showing the power of the vintage and a dense texture, the black fruits should develop into a powerful wine. It needs to age, so wait until 2022.
title: Château de Birot 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The black fruits of this wine are embedded in the dark, dense tannins and concentrated structure. With its weight and firm backdrop, the wine has aging potential. It started its maturing process in the Chombart family's unusual troglodytic cellars. Drink this rich wine from 2022.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2016 Valentine  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Guided by consultant Michel Rolland, this property has delivered a structured wine full of tannins. It also has piles of black fruits from its organic vineyard. Black currants, spice from wood aging and a core of dryness all point up the aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Suau 2016 Cadillac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Full of red fruits as well as spicy wood flavors, this is a rich wine that has a fine concentrated texture. It is firm at the moment, showing layers of toast and wood from a year in oak barrels. Allow the ripe fruit to come through and drink from 2019.
title: Château La Caussade 2014  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and spicy tannins and red-berry flavors, this is a generous organic wine that will develop quickly. It has new wood as well as red-berry fruit flavors, under the direction of consultant Michel Rolland. Let the wine come together and drink from 2019. Suau is part of an international group of family wineries.
title: Château Suau 2014 Cuvée Cadillac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: With attractive juiciness, this ripe wine has plenty of room for both tannins and black fruits. It is fruity, acidity topping the berry flavors and bringing in toast and final spice. Heather van Ekris, owner of this estate that began as a Middle Ages convent, brought in Hubert de Brouard of Château Angelus in Saint-Émilion as consultant beginning with this vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château des Mille Anges 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Certified French organic with this vintage, this 100% Merlot is ripe, full-bodied and already showing its potential richness. Terroir-driven black fruits and generous tannins give a warm character to the wine that is then backed by black fruits and final acidity. This is a generous wine from the Verdier family, ready to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Brethous 2012  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Solidly tannic, this is a firm wine with juicy fruit that adds balance to the structure. It has a refreshing quality with black currant flavors that are full and dense in the mouth. Give this fine wine time. Drink after 2016.
title: Château Brethous 2011 The Classic  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a solid, chunky wine, rich in dark blackberry and and red plum flavors. Maybe the tannins are too hard at this stage, but its weight and rich fruit suggest aging potential. Drink from 2016..
title: Château du Cros 2011 Clos Bourbon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A complex wine, showing full, ripe fruit flavors as well as dense tannic character. It's a big wine, touched by some bitterness yet also showing good aging potential.
title: Château du Biac 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: At the start, this is a firmly extracted wine that then reveals ripe fruit flavors and attractive acidity. There's some weight here, along with a good depth of rich flavors. Age for 2-3 years.
title: Château Bourbon 2010 La Rose Bourbon  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: New-wood flavors abound in this firmly structured, dry wine. With its tannins at the fore, plus its heavy toast and sweet-tasting black-fruit flavors, it has weight and density. This is likely to age well over 3-4 years.
title: Château Tanesse 2010  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine, produced from a small parcel, is still very firm, young and tight. Its tannins dominate, leaving only hints of the red berries that should be there. It has weight and should open up over the next few years. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Gaby 2012 Cuvée Gaby  (Canon-Fronsac)

description: A full, structured wine, showing attractive damson and blackberry flavors along with a strong element of wood aging. The wine is rich, its juicy Merlot character joined with final acidity.
title: Château Haut-Francarney 2010  Canon-Fronsac

description: It's appropriate that this wine is served at the Crazy Horse saloon in Paris. Made from a selection of old vines, La Horse is in the modern, polished idiom, a super-ripe wine, very concentrated, packed with blackberry jelly and bitter chocolate flavors. Give it 3-4 years, but its considerable power and intensity is already there.
title: Château Coustolle 2005 La Horse  (Canon-Fronsac)

description: This wine named for a Santiago de Compostela pilgrim route is ripe and spicy. Its solid, dry core is balanced by the black fruit and concentration. With time, the wine will lighten up to showcase the rich fruits and good supporting structure. Wait until the wine matures, in 2022.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2016 Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This rich wine has spice, black fruits and plenty of tannins. Its density and weight are coming together well with the fruit and acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Les Charmes Godard 2016 Château Alcée  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark and dense, this wine has a serious amount of tannins. The fruit shows slowly but will come through over the next two or three years. Then, this will be a rich, concentrated wine with a bold structure and ripe fruit. Wait to drink this Palatin Guibert family wine until 2023.
title: Château Roquevieille 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich, structured and fruity, this second wine of Belcier is dense. Black fruits and acidity balance with the firm tannins and dry core. Drink this already balanced wine from 2021.
title: Château de Belcier 2016 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a wood-aged wine from a vineyard that is well situated on the ridge that runs east of Saint-Émilion. It is structured with firm tannins as well as perfumes from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. The needs time to develop more, so drink from 2020.
title: Château de Belcier 2014  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Chosen from a selection of parcels, this dense and complex wine has layers of firm tannins that a give a dry, tough core. Underneath, the juicy, currant and berry fruits need to spring to life. Give this concentrated wine until 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2011 Les Armoiries de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Layered with toasty wood, this rich wine delivers blackberry fruits, a strong sense of tannins that enrich the fruit, and a concentrated aftertaste. From one of several small properties tended by owners Christophe and Marie Jo Lavau, it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Terrasson 2012 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Packed with wood and fruit, this rich wine needs time. A juicy blend of 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, it's full of attractive acidity and blackberry fruits. The tannins do need to soften and round out, so drink from 2017.
title: Chateau Brisson 2012  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With attractive mint aromas, this polished wine balances structure and fruit. New wood shows through but it doesn't dominate the black fruits that give weight and ripeness. It shows the typical juiciness of the vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Moya 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a jammy, ripe wine that smells of the south of France. That gives warmth, richness and a full-bodied character. Black plums, luscious berries and light tannins all make for a wine ?that can be drunk now.
title: Château Cap de Faugéres 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: There is tough concentration here that suggests a wine that needs aging; there's also fruit that hints at richness to come. A wine that has a good future.
title: Château Monbadon 2010  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big, brooding and ripe, this is packed with a blackberry flavor that is laced through the bitter chocolate and mocha notes and dark tannins. It is powerful and concentrated, smooth and dark tasting.
title: Château Lamour 2009 Réserve  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured wine, the smoky, juicy fruit flavors right up front with the dry tannins. It has good aging potential, its powerful density offering a firm, solid character. It is certainly young at this stage, the smoky wood character showing right through. Keep for 3-4 years.
title: Château les Martinelles 2009 Cuvée des Cerisiers  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Mint and tannins feature in the initial flavor, then it opens out to show delicious blackberry juice fruit. The tannins are dry but integrate with acidity to give more serious aspect to this balanced wine.
title: Château Bellevue 2009 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Both ripe fruit and tannins come through strongly in this wine. It's dense and richly layered, with black fruit and a firm texture. It shows fine potential now and is likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Belcier 2015 Les Armoires de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is very dry, dense and tough, the black fruit and acidity just peeping through. However, it should all come together from 2020.
title: Château de Belcier 2015 B de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Named after the pilgrim route to Santiago de Compostella in Spain, this is a structured, firm wine with strong signs of wood aging. That gives it a dry core of tannins that contrast with its rich black fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2014 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Some firm tannins give this wine a good structure. They're balanced by ripe, juicy fruit and acidity-two elements that are coming together well to bring it into its drinking window. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Ampélia 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm and closed. However, its tough tannins don't completely mask the rich black fruits that are developing well. Give this concentrated wine, full of potential, until 2021.
title: Château Brisson 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Big, bold tannins set this wine up with fine potential. It has structure and good concentration. Richly endowed with black fruit, it will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Pillebois 2015 Tradition  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is soft, open and full of fruit. It has a tang of acidity as well as rich berry flavors and a supporting layer of tannin. Fine, smoky and structured, it will be easy to drink from 2019.
title: Château d'Arce 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Produced by a group of 12 investors-six from Bordeaux and six from Burgundy-but certainly tasting more Bordeaux than Burgundy, the wine is structured and with layers of new wood as well as black fruit. It has tannins and ripe fruitiness. It needs to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Réaut 2014  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A top Cuvée from Lamothe de Haux, Valentine has serious amounts of wood aging as well as intense blackberry fruits. It's from fruit selected at harvest, named after a daughter of the family called Valentine. This wine needs to develop to bring up the juicy fruits that are right there. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2011 Valentine par ValentineÂ Réserve  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This big, ripe wine is smoothly textured with soft tannins in the backdrop for structure. It has spice, judicious wood aging and a firm texture. The wine has weight, ripe black fruits and a good future. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Pilet 2011  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and tannic, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. It has ripe plum and damson fruits that dominate the firm tannins to give a juicy wine that's full of fruitiness with the structure to match.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2010 Le Moulin  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured wine, with juicy black currant and red berry fruits, layered with important tannins. It's balanced, pierced with great fresh acidity as well as a more mineral texture. Finely made, it needs another two years aging.
title: Château Suau 2008  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A wine that shows its wood aging strongly at this young stage. However, there is plenty of ripe blackberry flavor to boost the fruity side of the wine. The core is dry, surrounded by ripe fruits and a touch of sweetness.
title: Château Hyot 2009  Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm and structured. It also has fine black fruit and balanced acidity. Full bodied, fruity and backed by solid tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 6éme Génération  (Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, rounded wine is just setting out on the aging process. Still showing its wood-aging spice, it also has black-currant fruits and balanced acidity. It will develop well over the next few years and should be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Brûle Sécaille 2015 Grande Réserve  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: This serious wine is young and still has prominent wood-aging flavors. That toastiness masks the ripe blackberry fruits that are underneath the tannins and wood. The wine will be fine as it matures, giving richness and dense fruits. Wait to drink until 2019.
title: Château l'Espérance 2014 Les Cédres  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Dark in color, this is a bold, spicy wine. It has firm tannins that contrast well with the dense black fruits and acidity. The combination makes for a wine that promises to age well-rich and with a fine smoky aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Peychaud 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: This wine has so much of the structure of the vintage. At the same time, it offers rich fruit, black plum flavors and fragrant acidity. It is powerful and concentrated, needing to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vieux Ligat 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This dense wine features dark tannins and rich blackberry and plum fruits that convey a solid character. The wine is developing well, with tannins merging into the general fruitiness. Age for a few months more and drink from late 2015.
title: Château Tour de Cazelle 2012  Cotes de Bourg

description: Showing some maturity, this wine offers a typical Bordeaux blend dominated by Merlot, along with some Malbec to give color and tannin. It's rich, fruity and ripe. Black fruits and aromatic acidity are supplemented by the light wood aging and smoky character apparent in the aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Macay 2011 Classic  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: The wine is rich and still shows firm tannins, along with full-bodied blackberry fruitiness and a tight, crisp texture. It's solid and concentrated, full of juiciness at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Fongalan 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: Ripe and smooth, it has a rich wood taste that has rounded the berry fruits, giving a mint touch along with fresh, juicy acidity. Only towards the end do the tannins show more strongly. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Prince de Tabourg 2010  Cotes de Bourg

description: This is a toasty wine, with flavors of eucalyptus and new wood, along with dry tannins. This combination indicates how young the wine still is, because it has a background weight of fruit and a rich blackberry-jelly flavor. It needs aging over 4-5 years.
title: Château Haut-Pradier 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: The 20% Malbec in the blend helps to produce the spicy tannins and dark color of this wine. The other grapes in the blend add richness and firm structure, plus a blackberry-driven juiciness. With its bright acidity added to the mix, this is a serious wine with good aging potential.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château Guerry  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Firmly structured, dense and concentrated, this special selection is dominated by Merlot, though the perfumes from Cabernet Franc are evident. It has weight and a tight, tannic texture; age for at least five years.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2010 Cuvée Spéciale  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: A ripe, smoky wine, full of very juicy fruit. Black plums and berries are complemented by a core of firm tannins and bright acidity. Sweet, rich and attractive.
title: Château Tertre de Viaud 2009  Cotes de Bourg

description: A solid, foursquare wine, flaunting its tannins but not forgetting the rich weight of fruit underneath. Mint flavors go with the chocolate and dark plums.
title: Château de la Grave 2006 Caractére  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: With 14 months' new wood aging, this wine is still all wood and toast. The wine does have weight, with the promise of blackberry fruits under the firm tannins. It is finely structured and should mature well.
title: Château Haut-Guiraud 2006 Péché du Roy  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: While this wine is still young, it has good potential.Rich tannins that support firm, ripe black fruits promise a generous wine, but one that will take time. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Perthus 2016  Cotes de Bourg

description: Packed with red fruits, this wine is bright and crisp, while also having a firm, tannic background. The dense, dusty texture promises a ripe, juicy wine as it ages. Drink this generous wine from 2019.
title: Château Martinat 2014  Cotes de Bourg

description: This concentrated wine is dry and dense, its blackberry fruit still dominated by dry, solid tannins. It's built to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Peugeais 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: A lively, fresh wine, packed with red berry fruits and a vibrant acidity. The tannins come as much from the fruit as the new wood. It will age, probably 3-4 years.
title: Château Plaisance 2005  Cotes de Bourg

description: This is the Castillon wine from the Saint-Émilion estate of Faugéres, which is split in half by commune boundaries. The same care goes into this great value wine as into the Saint-Émilion, and this is a fine wine, full of superripe fruit and blackberry flavors.
title: Château Cap de Faugéres 2002  Cotes de Castillon

description: Structured and firm, this wine has excellent potential. Black fruits, solid tannins and plenty of acidity come through, underlining spice and a dark core. Drink from 2021.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2016 Château Godard Bellevue  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a spicy ripe wine. Its berry flavors are shot through with acidity and generous tannins. It is still dry and still young although its future is assured. This estate is Bordeaux producer and négociant Nicolas Thienpont's family home. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Puygueraud 2014  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is a young and structured wine. Juicy black-currant flavors are still firmly backed up by tannins. Produced from old vines, it is dense although also with a fresh acidity that is already attractive. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Nardou 2012  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine comes from a family-owned 19-acre property on the slopes of the Fronsac hill. The wine is still young and full of tannins. But it also offers classic stalky fruit, juicy acidity and plenty of black-currant flavors. Drink this wine with aging potential from 2022.
title: Château Belugue 2015  Fronsac

description: Produced from a 17-acre vineyard, dominated by Merlot, this is the top wine of Château Renard. It is structured and firm with tannins and dense concentration that will probably remain with this rich wine as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Renard Mondesir 2011  Fronsac

description: Mint aromas and ripe berry fruit set the scene for an attractive, ageworthy wine. It is still structured with firm tannins and a dense texture, while the blackberry fruitiness is beginning to show well. It will be worth keeping this wine, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2013  Fronsac

description: This structured wine has a severe aspect, with dry wood and fruit tannins. The fruit is there, smoky and with considerable acidity. It's a wine that will remain serious as it ages. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Château Beauséjour 2013  Fronsac

description: Still very young, this is a complex and powerful wine. Its tannins and firm structure dominate at the moment, muting the juicy fruit that's underneath. With aging potential, the wine will develop slowly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2012  Fronsac

description: This is a warm and ripe Merlot-dominated wine. The chateau's position on the hill of Fronsac gives the wine structure and a mineral texture that does promise aging. With blackberry fruitiness developing well, drink from 2016.
title: Château Tessendey 2010  Fronsac

description: Dominated by Merlot at 90%, this is a smooth, rich and generous wine. It does have a tannic core, but that is surrounded by these velvet, ripe berry fruits and opulent texture. The wine is developing well and should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Jeandeman 2009 La Chêneraie  (Fronsac)

description: Very dark in color, this supercharged Merlot offers soft ripe berry fruits, with plum skin and toast, followed through with pepper and spice. It is powerful, concentrated, the acidity offering some contrasting relief.
title: Clos du Roy 2009  Fronsac

description: A dense, elegant wine, the berry fruits full of juice and fresh plums. The layer of tannins is firm, a clenched fist in the heart of the softer, riper fruit flavors. There is final fruit gum acidity.
title: Château la Longua 2006  Fronsac

description: This is the second wine of Vieille Cure, one of the leading Fronsac estates. It is aging well, moving from fruit to mature, secondary flavors, softening in the process. Wood aging has balanced the blackberry fruit with spice and made it ready to drink.
title: Château la Vieille Cure 2012 Sacristie de la Vieille Cure  (Fronsac)

description: While this wine is dry, it already shows the potential balance from ripe black-currant flavors, generous acidity and fruit tannins. It will develop well, if slowly, and should be ready from 2022.
title: Château des Places 2016 Grand Vin  (Graves)

description: This Lesgourgues family wine has a structure that is right up front at this stage. Behind, though, are plenty of black fruits, warm tannins and acidity. It already shows signs of being a balanced wine and will be ready from 2022.
title: Château Haut Selve 2016  Graves

description: Owned since 1999 by the Kressman family of Latour-Martillac in Pessac-Léognan, this wine reflects fine winemaking thanks to its ripe tannins and the fruitiness of the vintage. It is juicy, rich with blackberry fruits and already shows a fine balance. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Langlet 2014  Graves

description: A smooth, perfumed wine that has softened just in time for its fifth year. It has black-currant and berry fruits that are ripe while still showing fresh acidity. The tannic structure is there, well integrated into the polished structure. Drinkable now.
title: Château de Callac 2011  Graves

description: With an equal blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this firm wine has a juicy background, nurtured by consultant Hubert de Boüard (of Château Angelus). Chocolate and spice notes mix with the dry wood-aging character, while black currant flavors develop in the background. Give this wine until 2017.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2011  Graves

description: This is a mineral, textured wine that has fine tannins and balanced ripe black fruits. It's dry, although with an undertow of richness, acidity and weight. It could age, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Doms 2011  Graves

description: The aromas are of new wood and toast as much as fruit, and this follows on the palate. It has strong burnt-toast flavors along with a full textured palate. Blackberry fruits are under this weight of wood, and need several years to emerge, although the wine will always have a strong wood component. Drink from 2017
title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2009  Graves

description: Now maturing well, this is a wine that reflects much of the freshness of 2008, with firm tannins and solid structure. A black currant flavor dominates this elegant offering, providing acidity as well as freshness. It could age for another few years, but is ready to drink now.
title: Château du Seuil 2008  Graves

description: Chocolate and licorice flavors dominate this solid, foursquare yet austere wine. Its offers firm fruit, with a dense texture of black currant and red plum. Acidity and a spice note set off the finish.
title: Château Rahoul 2008  Graves

description: This spicy, full-bodied effort shows the generosity of 2009. It has firm tannins, but they are matched by the full blackberry and black currant flavors. The dry core from wood aging is likely to soften over the next 2-3 years.
title: Château l'Avocat 2009  Graves

description: Ripe wine, full of rounded juicy black currant fruits, this has a core of tannins, dry and laced with wood toast. There is a black chocolate bitterness which goes with the acidity on the finish.
title: Château Haut Selve 2008  Graves

description: A powerful, dense and still youthful wine. It balances a fresh blackberry fruit character with smoky tannins and delicious, bright and juicy acidity.
title: Château Haut-Peyrous 2008 Retour des Palombiéres  (Graves)

description: Dense, rich with black fruits and lifted by acidity, this wood-aged wine comes from the northern part of the Graves appellation. It shows both the ripe fruit of 2015 and a black-currant character from the Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink from 2023.
title: Château le Bonnat 2015  Graves

description: A big, ripe powerful wine, rich with black berry and sweet plum flavors. The wine shows density and tight, dark tannins that promise some good aging. The balance is finished with sweet and sour acidity and a concentrated finish.
title: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons 2005  Graves
winery: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons

description: A firm, balanced wine, typical of the slightly austere mineral side of the Graves. The tannins are tight, binding a core of fresh berry fruits to bright and fresh acidity. The wine is balanced, finishing with spice and dark chocolate.
title: Château Lusseau 2006  Graves

description: It takes a while to get beyond the dry structure of this wine. But underneath that initially forbidding exterior, there is a solid core of ripe, sweet black fruits and an elegant balance with the acidity coming through to finish well. A wine for some aging-maybe 3-4 years.
title: Château du Seuil 2006  Graves

description: Big, rounded and fruity, very appropriate for the vintage, this is a smoothly polished style of wine, with mint and wood layers over the ripe blackberry fruits. It is dense, the tannins dusty rather than tight, the structure still very much to the front. It needs another year of aging.
title: Château Lusseau 2005  Graves

description: A smooth, ripe wine, with eucalyptus aromas and layers of new wood. At the same time, it doesn't lose its origins, the structure of Cabernet and the ripeness of Merlot showing through well in a wine that has benefited from the 2005 conditions.
title: Château Haut Selve 2005 Réserve  (Graves)

description: A wine that is showing signs of maturity, emphasizing the sweetness of the rich vintage. It offers juicy spice, firm but sweet tannins and flavors of licorice and dark chocolate. It is ready to drink.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2003  Graves

description: The low yields behind this wine have given it concentration as well as a firm tannic structure. It is dense and will take time for the fruit to shine. There are hints of the black-currant fruitiness that will arrive in time along with a crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Villambis 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a bold and rich wine, a blend totally dominated by 90% Merlot. It is fruity, structured and with fine juicy black fruits and acidity. The 12 months of wood aging have given the wine an edge of spice that is attractive now. Final tannins will allow it to age. Drink from 2021
title: Château Reysson 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The Nony-Borie family owns this vineyard whose history goes back to the 17th century. In this vintage, they have produced a ripely structured wine with some firm tannins and black currant fruits. With 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, it is firm with a dark core and concentrated acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is the second wine of Listrac's Chateau Fonréaud. A blend of half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is rich and juicy. Blackberry fruits are shot through with acidity and balanced with generous tannins that are softening well. With its juicy acidity and fruity aftertaste, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Château Fonréaud 2014 La Légende  (Haut-Médoc)

description: With its high percentage of Merlot (65%), this wine is ripe and full-bodied. It has red-berry fruits that are rich and are already smoothing out. Concentrated and juicy, the wine is going to be ready to drink in the medium term. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Cartillon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated at the western end of the Pauillac plateau, this estate has produced a fresh and fruity wine that takes advantage of the year's black-currant flavors and doesn't have too much of a tannic structure. It will develop more and will be best from 2018.
title: Château Devise d'Ardilley 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Part of the large Grand Chais de France group, this estate has been thoroughly renovated. It has produced a ripe, smooth and full-bodied wine with juicy black fruits that overlie the firmer tannic character. With its already attractive fruitiness, it's not a wine for long-term aging Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Run by the Nony family who also own Château Caronne Ste Gemme, this well-made wine has taken advantage of the fruitiness of the vintage. Ripe fruit is the hallmark here, juicy blackberry and soft tannins rounded by some wood aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Labat 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is ripe, with dusty tannins and blackberry fruits. It is balanced, fresh with acidity while keeping a good layer of fruitiness. The tannins and structure will allow it to age although it should develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maurac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Located just south of Margaux, this estate has produced an attractive wine that plays on the fruit of the vintage. The fresh black-currant character is enhanced by light flavors of wood aging. It will age for a few years, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Cambon la Pelousse 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated close to the city of Bordeaux, this estate has produced a Cabernet-dominated wine that has some firm tannins and a dry core. The black-currant fruit shows well, with fresh acidity giving a juicy character. It will soften quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a dense wine, full of blackberries and ripe tannins. Juiciness gives the wine the fruitiness that's typical of the best of the vintage. Acidity at the end emphasizes the freshness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Trois Moulins 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: From one of a pair of Châteaux, both with Braude in the name and both owned by Château Mongravey in Margaux, this perfumed and fruity wine has ripe fruits that are now becoming mature. Soft tannins and juicy berry fruits are still fresh. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château Braude Fellonneau 2012  Haut-Médoc
