description: With smoky aromas, sweet fruit and soft tannins, this is a wine that is developing well, but quickly. It offers juicy black berry fruits, rounded texture and bright finishing acidity.
title: Château Talbot 2007  Saint-Julien

description: 88-90. Barrel Sample. The intense use of wood is in danger of smothering the fruit in this wine. There is a hint of juicy acidity and black currants on the finish.  Although the fruit should develop, it is likely to remain tough.
title: Château Lagrange 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: This is a rare wine: 100% Cabernet Franc doesn't normally happen in Bordeaux. Attractive and perfumed, it is still young, with ripe smoky fruit and layers of wood aging that will easily integrate as the wine ages. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château du Vrai Caillou 2016 L'Optimé Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A lieu-dit in French is a place historically recognized for what was there, a hazelnut (coudrat) tree. This wine comes from a single vineyard named after the trees grew there. It is a rich wine, packed with the bright fruit of the vintage as well as some firm tannins. Aged in wood, it has spice and toast as well as the black-currant fruits. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: There's ripe fruit, flavors of dried fruits and black plums and some solid tannins. This is an attractively balanced wine, which will offer some great pleasure in another year. The finish is all about vivid fruit and acidity.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2005 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Juicy, rich and with layers of wood and tannins, this is a concentrated wine. The toasty wood-aging flavors are still prominent, giving the wine a bitter edge at this stage. That will blow off as the wine matures and black-currant flavors takes center stage. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Bellevue Claribes 2016 Prestige Merlot  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This pure Merlot special Cuvée is intense, rich and extracted. It has serious layers of spice and toast from wood aging. That lies over a solid structure that is concentrated and dense. The fruit is more masked and the bitter licorice character of the wine means it will take several years to come together. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Léon 2014 Prima  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine, from selected vineyards owned by the Carrille family, is rich and now mature. Its tannins are merging with the secondary flavors of the fruit as it softens and develops a spice and tobacco character. Drink this wine now.
title: Poupille 2011  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This 100% Merlot wine from 30-year-old vines is one of the producer's limited productions. The wine is superrich in the plump, generous style. Its black-plum fruits give it the weight and ripeness as well as the smooth texture. There is a bite of pepper from the alcohol that spoils the opulent full aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Egregore Cuvée d'Exception  (Cotes de Bourg)

description: Made entierly from Merlot, this wine is smoothly textured, with tannins cushioned by the ample black fruits. With its blackberry flavors and dense texture, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Renard 2015  Fronsac

description: With 20-year-old vines, this estate has the ability to produce open fruity wines like this. This wine, that is now almost mature, has black-currant fruit, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins to allow it to age further. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
title: Château Renard 2012  Fronsac

description: Ripe and fruity, this has sweet black-currant and plum fruits, a layer of rounded tannins and a juicy, full-in-the-mouth character. It will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Château Tour du Moulin 2009 Les Terres Rouges  (Fronsac)

description: From one of the properties owned by the Ducourt family, this wine is structured and firm. It also has juicy fruit, rich tannins and plenty of crisp acidity, with a touch of spice from wood aging. With its firm tannins, it needs to age, so drink from 2021.
title: Château Jacques Noir 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Unusual for Bordeaux, this chateau's plantings contain 20% Malbec, imparting a strong blackberry character to the wine. There's smoky oak, too, and intriguing spice and juiciness on the finish. Imported by Bernard Magrez.
title: Bernard Magrez 2003 Château Guerry  (Cotes de Bourg)
